On first glance, our room looked comparable to a Best Western or Days Inn. Everything looked fairly clean and was decorated in the generic motif that you expect a midrange hotel to have.  

I wish I could end this review on such a positive note....

We were given a small room with 2 double beds. It was just my boyfriend and I, so we picked the bed farthest from the door in which to take a nap before the nights festivities. We pulled back the blankets and immediately noticed spots of what appeared to be blood on the sheets. Disgusting. We checked out the other bed which was clean and decided to call the front desk to inform them of what we had found. We were put on hold in excess of 20 minutes and the system eventually hung up on us.  Luckily, we had the second bed or I would have flipped out on someone.

Later in the same evening we each went to take a shower and noticed that there was still smears of makeup on one of our towels. Really? We called down to housekeeping to ask for more. Again, it took about 15 minutes to be connected and the woman who answered was very unpleasant. I asked to have towels sent up and informed her of our room number and she literally said "Fine." And slammed down the phone. Surprise, surprise....I waited for 45 minutes before giving up on the towels and getting ready to go. The towels never came and we were almost late to our dinner reservations.

The next day our bathroom\/vanity lights went out. I had my boyfriend call this time. Same result. Put on hold forever and hung up on. While showering in the dark may seem like an adventure, it is not. It's incredibly annoying and our experience at this hotel had been ruined.  It was probably something as simple as a blown fuse, but apparently no one was willing to take the time to find out.

The toilet seat was also broken, if you didn't hold it firmly against the tank while sitting down or peeing it would snap closed. 

At this point we decided to spend as little time at this hotel as possible. We spent as much time as we could out on the strip (which is NO WHERE NEAR the hotel....20-30 min. Deuce ride or a $15-$20 cab ride depending on traffic). It was closer to the Fremont Street area, but not by much. 

If you need a place to rest your head and watch the room spin, this may be the place for you. If you don't mind taking long drunken bus rides in the middle of the night, you just might like this place. I, for one, will NEVER go back to this hotel and will tell everyone I know to avoid it at all costs.  Lesson learned: I will fork out the cash for a nice room on the strip next time and spend my money elsewhere.

Crooked dealings are happening here.  

I checked in expecting to pay a $30 resort fee for two days, and they tried to charge me $92 at checkout.  I complained, and they said they would "waive" the fee.

Because the balance was supposed to be zero, they didn't issue me a receipt.  After getting home, what do I see on my credit card?  You guessed it, $92.

Now I have to waste an hour of my life to fight their charges.  

Do not stay here. Save yourself the headache and pick a property that will not try to screw you over.

The Casino is very smoky, and the local food is second rate.  One of the 3 rides on the tower was out of order, but they won't tell that you when you are buying your ticket. 

Did I say don't stay here?

The employees are great and friendly. The room we had could have been updated tho. I feel like I've stayed at nicer motels in the middle if nowhere. Showerhead was erratic. No fridge. No style. The fitness room was OK. All of the stores& restaurants are nice tho. We'll prob stay elsewhere next time. Disappointed.

Not high end and kind of crappy. Rooms are standard. The restaurant selection is ok - nothing special. The main pool is not douchy and has great views - which is good. Will not return. 

Pros - cheap, free parking, non-douchebag pool scene, service of food and drink 

Cons - McDonalds of hotels. Cheap and unfulfilling. Lower quality amenities and casino. Casino floor stinks.

Sadly there is no zero star. We stayed here for a volleyball tournament, the hotel choice was not ours, but I thought it would be nice. Arrived to a HUGE line to check in, finally got our room. It was FILTHY. Literally disgusting. Called front desk and were told no other rooms were available. Tried to deal with it but found more filth in the bathroom... Called and got a manger. After a very long wait were given another room. Not a clean room, just another dirty one, not as bad but not good. So awful. Had to sleep in it and then complained the next day to hotel manager. Was moved to the newer tower. Was clean. No comps no flowers, nothing to apologize. Will NEVER stay there again!!

We booked a basic room on hotels.com. check in took a bit and it was late at night,  but reading other reviews,  we were already prepared for this.  There were no non smoking queen rooms available.  We declined an upgraded room for 20 dollars a night.  However,  upon entering the outdated, smelly room, we realized our 2 year old with asthma could not tolerate the smoke smell. We went back to registration and agreed on the upgrade. Only because it affected our daughter,  we did not get charged the upgrade fee. We were very impressed with such courtesy. They also didn't charge for a fridge because my husband needed it for his insulin. Great deal,  clean room. Just do yourself a favor and get the upgraded room to begin with!

You get what you pay for, seriously. This isn't some luxury, posh hotel, if it was do you think they'd be charging 30 bucks a night? Probably not. yes its at the end of the strip a good 2 miles. there's a monorail nearby at the sahara, but you can always cab it. 

Let's face it, when in Vegas you're not there to sleep or stay in your hotel room. You're here to eat buffets, drink, drink a lot, gamble, throw dice, pull slots, watch shows, go sky diving, go to the strip clubs. hell there's so much to do there, you'd be in your hotel room, to shower, change clothes! You can sleep on the plane back.

The dealers here are pretty funny and friendly. They have $5 tables. hell why not? My friend got a bunch of stuff compted there. It was pretty awesome. Pulled the giant slot machine, won money, and walked out. 

They also have a bottomless drink thing going on at the c-bar. Its only valid on draft, margaritas and martini's, 19.99 and you just keep drinking.

We booked this room on priceline. it was pretty good. if you're going to vegas to stay in the hotel then go elsewhere. then again if you're going ot vegas to stay in the hotel then just stay home.

Great value, view and a great location - perhaps a few small touches would bring this place up a star or two but overall happy with my 3 night stay here.

Being my first time in Las Vegas I wanted to see the strip both uptown and downtown so this hotel is idea as it's smack bang in the middle of both with Deuce bus stops just outside. 

The hotel is nice and the rooms were comfortable (although we did pay a little extra to upgrade to the more modern floors of the hotel) and it is very reasonably priced (at least a 3rd of any hotel on the strip). But there really were no extras apart from a discount on in - house shows and access to the huge tower where you have amazing views of all of Vegas.

I'd possibly stay here again although having seen a few of the other hotels now The Stratosphere really does seem very plain. 

Staff were friendly and helpful and there are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants inside and all hotels guest have free access to all the thrill rides at the top of the tower.

for my first time to las vegas with some friends we decided to stay at the sratosphere hotel and casino. out of all the places to stay i think we just picked the stratosphere because it was a pretty darn good deal for the 8 of us. you have to remember at the time it had just opened and so everything was really new. can't say anything really stood out about the place it was nice and new but nothing special.

my highlight of the entire stay at the hotel was while gambling with my friends we were asked if we wanted to be in a commercial and of course we jumped at the idea. we were given about $20 in chips to pump away into slot machines as kari wuhrer walked by each of us and went on about everything the stratosphere has to offer. well i was totally excited about all of this because i actually knew kari from mtv as a vj, the co host on mtv's remote control and she was in anaconda just to name a few. well he hung out with her and i later was lucky enough to go out for drinks with her outside the stratosphere. i'll stop there!! lol

well turns out the commercial was gonna be ran in the rooms so it was for those damn things you can watch about the hotel your in from your room! woo hoo i'm a friggin star!!! i do wish i could find that somewhere. come on you tube, hook me up!
http:\/\/images.yelp.com\/photo?id=wLBceoTXLzxS020dnX_bnQ&s=l

My room had a used washcloth in it when I checked-in.
When I asked an employee a basic question about the hotel, the person gave me incorrect information.
There was a heavy smoke smell.

The view from the top of the tower is pretty cool.

Not worth it, don't stay here.  I was given keys that didn't unlock the doors after walking probably a half a mile.  Hallways are nasty, very smoky in the casino.  Not the 4 star rating Hotwire  gave it at all.  Far from everything you want to do.

No Stars to give other than the view was amazing!! The food was not good at all.. But the services was actually good. The hotel looks like a dump.. The only reason we went cause family and friends recommended from there visit years ago..

This hotel isn't as bad as I thought it would be. It's pretty decent. Walked in, had a quick and friendly check-in! Walked into a clean room, beds nicely made, and bathroom also clean. It would be nice if there was a coffee maker in the room. But other than that had an awesome stay! 

Definitely check out the view from the observation tower when you stay. The view is amazing! :)

Never Again.  I got this place on Priceline last minute because hotels were so expensive and I just needed a place to crash.  

BAD MOVE.  This place is terrible.

It is super ghetto (interpret as you will) people roaming the halls extremely drunk.  Some guy was banging on my door in the middle of the night to come in.  I kept telling him to leave he was screaming.  I called security and they never came.  Then on the ride down the elevator in the morning there was puke on the floor and it wreaked. 

I have stayed at many hotels in vegas but this has to be the worst run ever.  Maybe someone else has a better experience to tell but my experience was so terrible I had to write a negative review.

An ok hotel. Comparatively speaking, I think I could have done better. I wasted an extra $20 plus taxes to get a strip view. The strip view consisted of a couple building lights and a street. Would rather have placed the $25 on black jack and see how that went. I tried getting out of the service fee by telling them I was betting big on the games but that wasn't happening. Didn't use one worthless thing on the service fee and they make it difficult to get the $5 off the buffet. You have to charge it to your room so that you keep your credit card open (and can charge other stuff). That didn't seem right to me. AND...the service fee's do not include internet. That is an extra $12.

Wow.. I smell a bankruptcy happening here soon. This place is amazingly outdated. I mean REALLY old school. Dirty, dingy, and just plain silly. The attractions at the top are more for gimick sake, than any real excitement. 

I did enjoy the view from the observation deck though. I mean it was cool and you didn't have to splurge for a helicopter tour. Other than that, this place is easily skippable.

It's worth a stay at least once.

Morning Poker Tournament room is $45 w a $20 addon in the first hour. Weekdays it was 3-4 tables of decent players.

Hotel is decent. The included observation deck pass with hotel key is AWESOME! That view from the 107-109th floors is great. See Vegas for all its glory, eh hem, glamour and filth.

Avoid the daily buffet. Food is mediocre at best. The plus side is that for $30 a day there is unlimited eating if you are tight on cash. I'd still go elsewhere.

Roxys Diner is a great Dennys like joint.

OH NO!!! No vent in the bathroom! The architect had no nose?? Out of his mind perhaps. Bring matches to be kind to your roommates!

My company sent me to Las Vegas in summer 2007 for a trade show. Stratosphere was the hotel that my company chose. Nice staff, the room was okay. The bed was not super comfy, but I only slept total of 7 hours anyway when I was there.

The Polly Esther club was a bit cheesy. I used the free drink coupon and the atmosphere of the club was a bit weird. 

The slot machines were pretty awesome. I won $200 from Wheel of Fortune and spent it right away when I got back to Portland.

Stratosphere is a good deal for an affordable lodging in Vegas.

I'm not really impressed with The Stratosphere and here's why:

1) Location: it's way south on the Strip and away from all the mayhem & fun.

2) The room: I requested a room with two Queens and got one King with a view of a massive blank wall right outside my only window.

3) Dirty: Once I checked into the room, I found a crusty dirty dried face towel tucked above the shower curtain rod. Don't know what it was but I don't want to know either! Plus there was some dried fluid in one of the drawers which left this stained outline. Yuck! I requested a non-smoking room but there was some funky smell throughout my stay.

4) Plumbing: The bath tub drain got clogged on the second night.  Initially I thought it was a slow drain but when I got up the next morning to check, the tub of water was still there.  None of the water moved.

5) Room amenities: I got the typical cheap no-name shampoo, conditioner, body gel, and a bar of soap.  Nothing extra but when the Kleenex box became empty, it was not replenished.

6) "Resort fees": I guess this is the norm with hotel rooms these days (yet I still don't understand) but exactly what the hell am I paying $7.50 per day for?  It certainly wasn't Wi-fi ($12 per day if you must know).  The gal at the counter said it's charged for pool & gym access (who exercises while on vacation anyway?), newspaper (which I never received), and hotel amenities (which I only got one small bar of soap for two nights).  I do get unlimited access to the Tower above but once was enough.  I can't imagine going up more than once.  Tower access was posted as $60...really?  Seriously...?  Going up an elevator costs $60??

I must admit that I got rather a good deal for the room here but that was where it ended.  The room itself wasn't too bad but it wasn't what I requested and I put in my request over a month in advance. Tower access was nice especially during the evening hours.

The Stratosphere is good if you're on a budget yet still want to be physically on The Strip.

First time going to the top for the view and rides. For the price, it's not worth it. The rides look scary at first, but once you are on them they aren't scary at all. The views of the city are great, but you can get a better view of the strip from the ghost bar at the Palms. Definitely a one time type of activity, I did it and never have to again.

I would give them no stars if possible. Getting here they did not have the room that was originally booked. Tried to give us a suite for 700$. Then said come back tomorrow to see if anything is available. Mind you, we are from SF. WE WILL have no where to sleep w our bags. Then wen we were put back to two beds smoking. The cigarette smell here is horrendous. To add me an my best friend got ate up by bed bugs. Super swollen we called the front desk and they said one night would be free , and said we would be upgraded to a suite. This is by far the worst experience for Vegas. I won't be coming back out here period. They suck here and to add there was NO REFRIGERATOR.....
It's cool. No doubt, its amazing to be up that high! The view at night is spectacular.

I booked an excellent deal with Priceline and got a 3 nights hotel stay at the Stratosphere for about $167 total. I just recently got back from the trip. This place is cool, I can't believe so many negative reviews on here. 

1\/ It's a 3 or 3 1\/2 stars resort hotel, My mom and I got 2 queen size beds in North Tower Non-Smoking 16th floor. Room is cool, clean and spacious. 

2\/ Being a guest here, you have - free admission to the tower, free use of pool and the gym, discounted tickets for shows. 

3\/ Very easy check out, just click on the tv screen. 

4\/ 6 levels of parking, I drove over from Cali so I'm not bitching about the cab\/location being far from the strip. 

5\/ $7.50 a night resort fees, cheap comparing to other places. 

6\/ It's in the northside, between the strip and downtown. 

The only reason why I don't give this place a 5 stars is because 1\/ the cleaning lady forgot to give us soap for 1 day and 2\/ the check in lady said no coupons for free drinks unless I join some ace club or something which I don't want to do since I don't gamble that much. Otherwise, it's cool, I'd stay here for a good deal again.

Bom Hotel, fácil e rápido Check Inn e Check Out, amplo estacionamento coberto, ótimo Casino com banda ao vivo todos os dias, tem Starbucks e MC Donalds aberto 24 horas para matar a fome. Ficamos em um quarto Select, boa decoração, boa cama, bom chuveiro (coisa rara nos EUA), só tivemos problemas com o ar condicionado, não conseguimos desligá-lo para dormirmos a noite. Quem é hospede do Hotel tem direito a conhecer a torre grátis. Dou 3 estrelas pois fica um pouco afastado da Strip e não é possível ir para o point de Vegas apé. Também tivemos que pagar a taxa de Resort no Inverno, o que não ocorreu em outros hotéis. Também não há café da manhã ou desconto em alguma cafeteria do Hotel. 

Good Hotel , easy and fast Check Inn and Check Out , ample covered parking, great casino with live band every day , has Starbucks and MC Donalds open 24 hours to kill hunger. We stayed in a Select room, good decor, good bed, good shower ( rare in the US) , only had problems with the air conditioning , we can not turn it off for the night we sleep . Who is host of the Hotel is entitled to know the free tower. I give 3 stars because it is a bit away from the strip and you can not go to the point of loveto Vegas . We also had to pay the resort fee in winter, which did not occur in other hotels. There is also no breakfast or discount on some cafeteria Hotel.

It's cheaper compared to other hotels, but I think the quality of the hotel is the reason why. Staff are nice, but the rooms hardly looked clean, even the air felt dirty. Not to mention they placed us on a smoking floor and someone was smoking a lot of weed. Didn't want my daughter around that, I went back to the Rio for my stay.

My husband and I spent a weekend in Las Vegas 2 weeks ago. Before booking with travelocity i went to the stratosphere's website and looked at all the pictures. i was very impressed and excited about our relaxing stay. unfortunately when we got there it was a different story. our room looked worse than something form a motel 6. in fact i have stayed at nicer motels. Our room was old and disgusting, the shower didn't work. and it make the stay very uncomfortable. We go to las vegas every year to get away, we will never stay in this hotel again. we were very unsatisfied.

I really have nothing bad to say about this place. It surely isnt a 4 star establishment and I wasn't expecting it to be as such. I've never stayed here before and I will definitely consider staying here again. 
They were very accommodating to a disabled person in my party. They provided a room with a shower that you can ride a wheelchair right up into.
 The complimentary WiFi totally kicks ass in the hotel tower.
 The casino is very well laid out. The slot machines are true penny slot machines. There are plenty of kiosks to redeem your tickets.
 The swimming pool is of decent size but the water looked just a little bit murky.
 All in all, I would recommend this place to anyone who is not expecting lavish accommodations.

Affordable hotel to stay in if staying with your college friends, but if you can afford to go to another one, go for it.
I stayed with three of my friends in a room of four (with two king-sized beds).
The service is unprofessional, especially the housekeeping department.
Doing just one of the two beds and forgetting to change the sheets? Shameful.
But stealing items and denying it cause "we don't have proof"? Unacceptable.
Just an honest review from an honest girl!

We (group of 7) stayed at The Stratosphere for a girls' weekend and had a really nice time. The room was clean and well-stocked, the check-in staff were friendly and the casino wasn't overly smoky or outdated. The neighborhood it's in (very end of the strip) isn't fabulous - we were cautioned by both the cab driver and random residents not to go out walking after dark, but frankly I've been more nervous in my own city than there.
There are multiple restaurants, two pools (one topless!) and more slot machines than one can fathom. 
We ate at the buffet, mainly - make sure to get the all-day rate if you're going to eat three meals there - you get unlimited access from 7am to 9pm for $30.00. Even if you're just getting one meal there, get the Player Card from the casino and get a discount at the buffet.
Hotel guests receive unlimited access to the tower (non-guests pay a huge amount to get up there) and your room key gets you admission for 4. The view is amazing, but they do try to sell you souvenier photos (which we bought, haha).
I had no negative experiences, but it wasn't a fabulous resort getaway either - it was nice to be slightly off of the main drag, but I kind of wish they hadn't billed it on their website as being "centrally located on the strip" because it's not - centrally located, that is. It's the last hotel on the north end.

Great hotel. Away from the strip, but let's face it, ur gonna take an uber everywhere anyway. The slots were limited, and the pool was crowded. The restaurants were great and the views were spectacular. I especially liked the bathtub in my room. I took off stars for a bad experience with the rides on the spire. They said nothing about my glasses when i purchased tickets, but i was made to remove them in the rides. So i couldn't see anything and it made the whole experience, that cost me 2 hours in line, a bit pointless. Could have been avoided by telling me when i purchased tickets to put in contacts or purchase a strap. I definitely wasn't going to go back down to my room and wait in line another 2 hours through security.

I have never had an experience with a hotel as bad as the one I had this past weekend at the Stratosphere in Las Vegas.

This week is my 36th birthday; so to celebrate, I decided, on the spur of the moment, to make a trip to Vegas to go to one of my favorite clubs last weekend.  I mean, why not? This past year, I received a kidney transplant. No more dialysis, so now I could travel freely. I had the money.  No reason not to, right?

I originally wanted to just go and book whatever hotel room I could find while I was in Vegas itself, but at the urging of a close friend, I chose to go online and see if I could find a deal.  I used a third party website, and found a room at the Statosphere for $67 per night.  Since I was traveling late, and would not get there until after midnight, I booked it for Saturday, figuring I would stay overnight and come back to LA on Sunday. No problem, right?

Apparently, in Las Vegas, days do not begin at midnight like they do everywhere else in the U.S.  They begin at 3pm, which was naturally not indicated on my confirmation.  So when I got to the Statosphere, and tried to check in at midnight itself, I was told that I would have to buy two days, because this was still considered Friday. No attempt to make good, just to charge me more money, a pattern I would later learn was typical for the Stratosphere.

Across the street was a sleazy motel, so I figured I could just crash there for the night, and check into my room the next day. Since I did not have the much vaunted Statosphere for internet access, I searched for a wireless connection. As luck would have it, the city provides $5 wireless per day through Las Vegas.net. I bought two days, figured I would check in to the Statosphere the next day and all would be well.

When I got to there, I learned why my room had been such a "bargain": it came with a glorious view of some storage area where apparently the hotel keeps scrap metal. Two windows worth, no less.  But that wasn't as bad as learning that the Stratosphere BLOCKS wireless providers so you have to buy theirs... at $11 a day.

Flabbergasted that a ritzy (cough!) hotel would be this cheap, I realized that I would have to use the phone to make my plans for the night. Not a big deal, I have a phone card, and their phone's display said local calls were free, except that, well, they're not.  When I just got a rapid dialtone whenever I dialed nine, I tried calling the front desk for a solution. They put me on hold FOREVER.  I tried other numbers - the concierge, the operator, SOMETHING - to find out what was wrong with my phone so I didn;t have to sit on hold, but to no avail.  The Statosphere wanted me to hold on for five minutes, no matter what. So I did, only to learn that local calls are A DOLLAR each. What's on the phone, I guess, was put there by the manufacturer, because no one in their right mind would believe a luxury hotel would charge a buck each for LOCAL calls. But the Statosphere is not like other hotels.  It's far worse.

So I used the cell, got to where I needed to go, and got the Hell out of there, discovering my favorite thing about the Statosphere - check out is easy and fast. I'm sure they had to do that because they get so many.

Bottom line, unless you're part of the 1%, stay at Circus Circus if you're going to Las Vegas on a budget. And stay as far from the Statosphere as you can. The tower, I now believe, was put in to distract you from how horrible this place is. Never again.

First time I came to Vegas I stayed here and was pleased. But, I think I was mostly happy to be in Vegas in general. The third time I went to Vegas I stayed here again based on fond memories, but was rather displeased. This is for old people and rednecks, and those of us trying to save 100 bucks a night. On the plus side, they comp drinks like there is no tomorrow, and they had an all you can drink night at the club. No pressure to wear your Gucci here, but you may not want to wear Levis either (dirty).

You get what you pay for!

Also, worth noting this isn't really on the strip. Need to cab or bus anywhere you go. 

Rides are semi fun to do at least once. Bite was a reasonable show considering the place.

With the help of Orbitz and the idea to travel, we found ourselves at the Stratosphere.  It was inexpensive and awesome.  Some big tower shooting up out of nowhere, it's lovely isn't it?   A little bit away from the main drag of the strip, about a mile and a half from the major stuff, two from TI and so forth. Not bad, so let me tell you how it went.

We land at McCarran and what do we see waiting for the cabs, the needle! Land ho, here we go.  We arrive with jitters and practically fall out of the cab with excitement, grab our luggage and in we go to the magical world of a casino.  Nice.  We probably got into the hotel about midnight and we had to check in and drop our things off before we could explore.  The wait time wasn't long, maybe a little less than 20 minutes and the line was fairly long, there were maybe 5 people working behind the counter so it moved pretty fast.

We headed to the elevators through the casino which wasn't that far away but there was no direct route for us to go and headed up to our rooms.  My issue with this is that right when you walk into the hotel lobby POW there it is, the casino which is great yeah sure but to travel with luggage for actual guests of the hotel with now actual path to hit the elevators bothers me a bit.  I can't pin point a finger on exactly why this is but I feel the lay out should be different.   OH and that C-Bar right smack in the middle, awkward moment right there.  It's like it doesn't want to be there but it is.   Maybe I will and add it to the photos?  Anybody?

So I'll go on about the room, awesome except for no fridge! Uh whattheheck?!  Yeah you want us out of the room we get it but really?!  We had 2 queen room, lots of space, huge bathroom only one sink but plenty of counter space for three young ladies.  Closet space, draw space (which didn't really get utilized but it's available!), lamps and lights and a big ass mirror.  Huge flat screen, unsure of the stations available we didn't really flip through much.  The colors were pretty and there was a pillow that could probably knock someone out on the beds, when it hit the wall I thought someone fell into our door!  That is how thick and large and heavy this thing is.  Yup I sound like I just described something else didn't I? I won't change it, I can't it's what this pillow-majigy was.

I'm adding a business listing for the shops inside the Stratosphere, so check that out (The Shops at the Stratosphere).

The bus stop was right outside a little bit away across from Carls Junior (PS. When I was a kid living in Burbank.. best ever! I didn't return though I wanted to keep the magic alive in my head).  Check out The Deuce listing on Yelp so you can read my review of their transit system and I guess some other peoples too.

The casino itself is in a fight with me, I refused to give up my money but when I did it would just eat it, damn you casino.  Damn you.

There are some okay bars in here like the Back Alley Bar, Roxy has one, Level 107\/108, C-Bar, Level 8, the Italian place we never checked out and the Buffet I'm sure too although we didn't get there either.  The drink service at tables\/machines isn't that steady, I rarely saw someone coming around and when I did, she never stopped at us and yes we were playing. There is Top of the World, I will be reviewing as well separately like I've already done a few other things in the hotel.

Oh the Starbucks in here is a rip off, they're rude too and charge extras up the wazoo for things free at any other Starbucks I've been too. Great service ladies, faaaaaantastic.  Yup! 

The observation deck is something to definitely check out.  It's free with your room key and outsiders have to pay.  I am not sure of all the pricing and we didn't do any rides so I'm sorry I can't be of help to that.

Room service was alright we only had them come once in the four days we were there and it was so we could replenish the towels.   Check out, damn they were banging on the door five minutes of the time we had to bounce so that was a little eek! Relax let us get out the door before storming in.  Check out was flawless though and the bell desk held our bags for a bit till we had to catch our flight out of there.  Great guys, great service overall at the Stratosphere, I would definitely return if I was thinking of going back to Las Vegas again.

Disclaimer! For some reason I feel like I may have forgotten something, I've had this drafted for a week and I just want to keep adding to it.  Please tell me if I bored you.

Second time that me and my boyfriend have came here in the last year. Reason for only the 3-star is because its exactly as its called a-ok we probably will come back, its reasonably priced and the casino is pretty nice. It is located on the south end of the strip so if your looking for somewhere near the "heart" of the strip this isn't the place but it is only a 10-12 dollar ish cab ride depending on the traffic. The beds were fairly comfortable, and it had its only "sitting area" if you will with a tv and mini fridge. The bathroom is very very small, but the sink is outside so that does help. Overall like I said in the beginning chances are we will return because it is cheap and is "a ok
Terrible rooms! Don't book this place. Resort fee is a waste and WiFi doesn't work. Rooms are not like the pictures you see.

My brother gets a great deal because he has a players card from here. For $30\/day it was cheap enough for my lean pockets. We get adjoining rooms on the 19th floor, non-smoking. The rooms were clean enough, although I could still smell the cigarette smoke wafting from the elevators just a few steps away. It's one of my pet peeves of hotels with casinos, you can never get the smell of cigarettes out. Plus you have to go through the casino to get to the hotel anyways so there's really no escaping that. Anyhoo this time we get the room with a view of the mountains and old town Vegas. It was cool too, but last time we were here we had a view of the strip. That was super nice. 

With the room key you get a free pass to the observation deck ($18 value) and with the players card you get 10% off at the buffet and Roxy's diner. I'm not sure if they offer it at the Italian restaurant. They have Top of The World restaurant here (reviewed separate on its business site).

The restrooms are clean and maintained well, frequently stocked with supplies. 

Parking is adequate but if you're like me I love to park on the 3rd floor, coz that's where the bridge to the casino is. I don't mind driving around and around until I get one close by =P.

It's a motel 6 experience, though not as clean. 

If you're considering staying here, make sure you're paying SIGNIFICANTLY less than any other strip hotel (except maybe circus circus... They're on about the same level)  If you can save some money to use somewhere else, it might be worth it. If you're looking for a clean, well-appointed resort hotel to relax at, this isn't it. 

Check in was fairly fast though they did try to pressure us into paying $15 a day more for remodeled rooms. I'm sure they're nicer, as our room needed some TLC, but don't ask me to subsidize your remodel! 

We stayed in the central tower and as others have noted, it's not great. The room was surprisingly large. We were in 23-099 which is right next to the stairs and I think because of that we got a little bonus section comprised of the space behind the stairs. So I'd recommend asking for room 99 on any floor if you can. The view of the mountains was nice! So long as you didn't look down at the air conditioning plant. There were some gross stains on the curtains and the shower head sucks. Also there's no vent fan in the bathroom, and the shower is really dark. 

If you don't mind waking 4 blocks, you can get to the monorail through the SLS casino. It's a pretty convenient way to get down to the rest of the strip. 

The main pool is ok. Not huge like at the newer casinos. Lots of kids. 

The biggest perk of staying here is free tower access. That's worth $20. We liked having it available at all times because we could ride up and read books on the couches, grab a drink, etc. The rides are pretty cool, and reasonably priced.

First Time in Vegas and I stayed here. I liked it. Not quite Five Stars but with no disrespect. In comparison to the rest of the places on the Strip, I think this is a fair review.

Basically: The Stratosphere is located at the upper end of the Vegas Strip. It's a bit removed from the main area where most people (tourists) are. This is both a plus and a minus. Plus because it's unique in being on something of an island in an otherwise sketchy surrounding area. If you're OK with being a bit removed from the full Vegas experience, you'll be fine, esp. if you can deal with said surroundings. Negative are those surrounding. Not the greatest. I didn't feel at harm, but it sure wasn't as "pleasant" as some place more centrally-located.

But this is a great place. The tower is, of course, it's highlighted feature. You can go up and get great views of the surrounds of Vegas. Def a plus. The hotel-casino environment is a little more subdued...Not quite the glitz, pomp, and circumstance as the other Vegas locales on the Strip. The casino was relatively small and less-populated. But it makes up for this, or is enhanced because it's less congested and overwhelming. A plus. The hotel has two pools, a small mall, convenient parking, and all the requisite things you'll want in a hotel in Vegas. The staff was friendly and the place stylish enough. My room was great (for me). It had a small living area with a wall that separated the sleeping area. The bathroom was small but OK. A full-length mirror was a nice touch and the frig. was a great thing to have. The bed was soft and I liked the plastic signature cups provided. Even the toiletries were nice. This for $34\/night on a weekday in July. Slower time for sure but very much a bargain and worth it and more! 

Even though it's a bit away from things you can still get around, which is huge. You can walk to the monorail, take the Strip bus to the other areas and even get a bus that goes directly to the airport ( The #108...make a note of it !). There's a large souvenir shop down the street and nearby Circle K and Walgreen's for anything you might want (for that frig.)

Overall, I imagine there are nicer, more convenient options, but this place is not bad at all. In fact, because it's a bit removed, it makes being in Vegas a bit less overwhelming....while still being convenient enough to get around and do whatever you want. Plus the Tower...very much a bonus. I'll be back to Vegas and I'm sure I'll probably stay here. I will be happy to do so !

Oh....watching people do the SkyJump is an extra added plus. Listening to them scream and seeing figures drop from the sky, day and night were something interesting and fun to experience...Surely not what someone may have expected when planning the place, but a unique feature to the place.

A couple things that were not-so-great was the long check-in\/check-out line (but you can express check out). I also didn't like having the elevator make so many stops, up and down almost every ride. Don't think there's anything that can be done about the elevator rides but the check in line? Yeah, you need a couple more people working for that...

Milissa you don't look to high roller yourself, why are you going to roadside motels.  Anyway i have been to vegas 6 times and am going to be their this month.  2 trips ago i stayed at the statosphere and it was a nice stay.  I won 2500$ on a elvis slot, the dealers were nice and had a good time here.  The room was clean and the place was out of date but not dirty.  What the fuck you want for 50 bucks a night.  I stayed at the MGM and the pool was the thing i liked better, but i don;t come here to swim, its to party and gamble.  Both start at the stratosphere, i would not hang out here after 10pm but will stay here any day.

not bad for a cheap off the strip hotel.

PRO's-the best pro about this hotel is the hotel quests get free admission to the top of the stratosphere which does cost non hotel quests $15 each to get up to the top.  I paid $210 for 4 days (thur-mon) and room was nice, big, comfy beds, comfy pillows, room service cheap and fast, valet was awesome, casino was super big and clean, the cocktail girls were very attentive and strong with their drink pore's.

CON's-the bathroom in the rooms were tiny, the sinks are on the outside wall of the room, and the bathroom is a toilet and small shower with no fan.  window to the room is small, and the wall ac was a dinosaur and loud when left on for a long time.  no free wife, fridge, no free upgrade, and the location is in the ghettos.

First time staying in this place, was not the experience I was hoping for.
1. They got all of our block of rooms wrong, we had to move out and check back in a few hours after the fact, we asked for double beds, they gave us single
2. House keeping seemed to forget what the sign need service means, we did not get our room services until 10:30pm, 
3. The rooms in the Central section tower might be straight out of the 60's
4. The shower heads reminded me of the Motel 6 showers back in the early 80's
Positives- valet parking was good

Sorry so negative, just not a great place to stay
it's off the strip but an ultimate location to have a top view from the high end restaurant. Loved the place. food was amazing . I ordered blackened salmon and it was good.

I just went to Vegas this past week and stood here. I really liked the room I stood in, I was really expecting a crappy room because of the bad reviews it has but I liked it I'm guessing they remodeled ,  and got a great view. And OMG! The food here! AWSOME! I ate at Roxys dinner and it was really good! And the buffet was even better!. As of the drinks! Highly suggest the sky high lounge in the tower! Great drinks!. I do have to say two bad things about this place, the slots are ehhhhhh not so great and its way too far from the main strip! Other than that its a good place!

Most of the staff we have interacted with have been polite and helpful. So no complaints there. As it goes with hotels, condition of many is hit or miss. I was displeased with the low income housing directly across the street. (I swear that is what the sign outside their little apartment complex says.) there were quite a few guys kinda hanging out on the streets there, which made me question parking our car in the parking structure which they were hanging around the entrance to. Then as I was reading reviews and overheard someone working here, saying don't go out and walk down the strip after dark from this hotel, I am kinda nervous. So we will Uber for sure. We upgraded to stay in one of the large suites. The room is HUGE. THE DOWN SIDE: The furniture is quite dated, everything from the 90s light wash entertainment stand, to the dark brown industrial wetbar cabinets. The backsplash caulk was sorta gross. The couch and chair looked to be from the 90s as well. Some of the draperies have paint on them, most likely from a touch up to the wall. The doors (around the handles) didn't appear clean. The large dining table was very old and the top of the table was lifting and peeling. The matching end tables on our 'non-smoking' floor had cigarette burns on them. The carpet needs to be stretched or replaced in the hall outside our door. THE UP SIDE: The imported tiles in the entry, vanity room and restroom is beautiful. The size of the room is great. A couple roll aways and it is plenty large for a few people to stay in. There are tons of plugs for chargers and devices. THE MINOR INCONVENIENCE, the hotel had to send someone up to open our safe for us, because it was left locked. Probably something housekeeping should have on their list to check at each checkout cleaning, but not a huge deal. OVERALL, if you need a place to sleep at night, go for it, but in our particular room it would probably not be a place I'd bring friends to entertain etc. I'd also probably not bring young kids. Super (cigarette) smokey downstairs, and the complex directly across the street is questionable at best. If it weren't for $75\/3 nights through a promo, I'd probably not stay. In the future, we will stay at the other end of the strip for sure.
Bad bad bad. You couldn't pay me to go back. I won't opt for a bargain next time. Tweakers, gangs and ghetto crowd. Off the strip in bad area. Pay more and do it right.

The service sucks! The waiter left mid-sentence to attend to another customer! Food is average, if you are a vegetarian ( god forbid) you will be looked down upon! The view on the other hand is spectacular. People order coffee and dessert, no need to pay for worthless yet exorbitantly priced food served with absolutely zero love! Save yourselves the indignation!

Awful service at bars. They hate their jobs  & it shows. 
Will never stay here again for more than this one reason.  Is our 3rd stay here.  3 strikes your out..

We booked through Expedia. Crazy good deal with the flight, hotel, and shuttle. So points for price. Obviously given the deal, I wasn't expecting the best of the best, but honestly we had a good experience overall.

The main issue was that they didn't have our reservation, which I think was more of an Expedia issue versus hotel issue. The Strat was very nice about it, put us in the same room type in the same wing. I had to put the first night and the fees in my card and then I was to call the front desk the next day as they would contact Expedia and confirm the reservation and agreed price. They made copies of my paper work as well. So key is to print everything and bring it with!

I did as they asked, the front desk said they found the reservation with Expedia and the price on my card was adjusted accordingly. I checked on the TV (you can look up you bill\/fees on it) and yup, it was all handled. No worries.

The check in process does suck. It is a long wait. I don't think this is unique to the Strat as all the hotels we walked through had the same lines.

The casino itself is older and less happening than the bigger ones down the strip, but honestly I preferred this.  It is a walk if you want to get into the heart of the strip. We loved the monorail that picked up by SLS and bought a pass for that. Way less busy than the bus. The hood around the casino isn't the best - true, but I never once felt threatened or worried. Walk with a buddy and don't be a moron and you are fine. Stay on the main road, which is true for anywhere in Vegas really. 

We renewed our vows at the chapel across the street (the Little Vegas Chapel) which was great. We had a fancy dinner at the top of the Strat in the Top of the World, and overall had a great time staying there.

The only issue with the room was that our sink drain was terrible. Very slow. We weren't in our room enough to give a crap. The room was very clean, updated, and didn't stink of smoke at all. No real issues.

Overall, I'd stay here again. I enjoyed being at the Stratosphere and would recommend.

Well for my review I let places earn stars.  Stars are earned for overall atmosphere, room accommodations, Service, 

We should have moved hotels, when we first got here.  Our nice super shuttle driver WARNED us about the "HOOD' directly behind the hotel.  OK been Police for 35 years and when a local says STAY out of the HOOD, or naked city as he called it STAY out.  We should have moved.  Noticed on the news too, someone got shot near the stratosphere one night during our stay.  

Well the first thing is the atmosphere, the casino and lobby REEKS of smoking.  Now it is a casino, BUT all the other places we visited the smoke smell was not as nearly overwhelming.  We stayed on the 17th floor, a no smoking floor and once on the elevator BAM stench of smoking in the elevator shaft. We waited for a shuttle to be pick us up for a tour and the smoke smell was so bad near the doors we held the door open to get fresh air in the doorway.   

Housekeeping, very slow one day NO housekeeping at all, one day very late nearly 5pm to get our towels.  We did get room service and I assumed that the housekeeper would take the tray out, maybe my bad. The sink was slow in the room and we left a note thinking the housekeeper would be able to help.  NOPE so gotta call maintenance at night.  Took him about 10 mins to unclogged the drain.  He said he would call housekeeping to clean the sink, NO housekeeping ever cleaned that sink, Next time we'll stay somewhere else. 

The one star is earned from the room service food, pretty good breakfasts we had during our stay.  We were later told the Trump Hotel is Non Smoking, politics aside I would look there if smoking is an issue as it was at the Strastophere.  The Trump is a little for central located to the strip if that is important too.  
  

So when we get home our clothes will REEK of smoke, goes to show you "what goes on in VEGAS doesn't stay in VEGAS, our clothes will reek with VEGAS smokers.
Old. Needs update. Refurbish. Smells like cigarettes. Not crowded casino floor. All this and yet, comfortable.

We went on bookit.com and decided to be a little spontaneous so we did the Mystery Booking where for $22 you don't know what hotel you'll get to you actually pay\/book the hotel.  But they guarantee it's off the strip and at least a 3.5 star hotel.  We got the Stratosphere.  I thought ok, I never been here before, should be fun.  My husband didn't seem that excited though.

The hotel was nice, we upgraded for an extra $20\/night for the hot tub\/wide screen room (originally we got a standard room).  The room was nice, nothing too different than what I seen before.  The hot tub was in the bathroom which also served as a shower too.  It fits two people comfortable side by side.  It felt nice after a 3 hr car ride the first night.  The 2nd night, I was over it maybe because my husband had turned it up so hot.  I couldn't breathe.  

The bed was hard that it made my back hurt.  Somebody took our "Do Not Disturb" sign off of door on the 2nd day.  I didn't like the shady looking apartment\/hotel across the street.  It looked scary like we had taken a wrong turn somewhere.  

I don't know if I would come back here again especially when there are so many other hotels that we would still like to try on the strip.  But not too bad for $44\/night Mystery Booking.

Stayed here on my recent Vegas Trip, and it the hotel was ok, nothing to write home about, but nothing terrible.  The resort fee is stupid, it should include internet, if it did, it'd be worth it.  The casino was fairly decent, the sportsbook was small but serviceable, I made some bets there and it was pretty easy.  I played some craps, which was ok except at one point the stickman didn't like how I was rolling, and would slam the stick in the middle of the table to try and change my roll.  That was ridiculous, so I colored up and left, and wouldn't play if he was there again.  That detracted from my stay, but all in all, not bad.  Add internet to the resort fee, and this wouldn't be half bad.

Nickel and dimed.

That's how I describe my experience at this hotel.  They immediately upsold me to an upgraded "premium" room at check in for an additional $10 (down from $30, so they said) a night. 

On top of that, there was an additional "resort fee" of $7.50 a night.  Both were total shams - if I got a premium room, I'd hate to see the regular room.  Also, resort fee for what?  This is not a resort.  

Put a daily (optional) WiFi fee of $12\/daily on top of that and I checked out with over $100 of additional charges for my stay.  Poor form for a hotel that doesn't necessarily have much going for it.

It may not be the best casino & hotel to stay in Vegas, but at $37 and some change per night, it's amazing. Considering I paid 59.99 for crappy Days inn... I am going here again, and again and again.... and may be one of these times, I'd hide from my wife and goto the Pool :-) or watch Bite with her or even go on the rides.

And you also get unlimited free rides on the tower.

The real novelty of this place is the tower, do not expect your room to have a great view. That being said the casino has recently been redone and is not bad. When I stayed there my room was a bit small and the window looked like it belonged on a submarine. But it was only 19.95 a night! You should check it out and go to the observation deck. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I spent a week here for $25 a night. My goal was not to have a crazy time of gambling and partying- rather it was to enjoy soaking in the sun, having some peace and quiet, and alone time. For the price I paid, I was extremely satisfied. The smell of smoke in the casino was fairly strong, but I didn't spend any time there. The drinks were cheap, the McDonald's kept me within my budget. The gym was adequate and open 24 hours a day. As a guest you can go up to top and see the gorgeous view at night, for free and as often as you like. You can't beat the price. The bed was very comfortable- I mean its not the W- but its about a million times better then Comfort Inn.

This is the best place to stay if you are on a budget, or didn't book a hotel far out enough and don't want to pay $1,000,000 a night. They definitely revamped this place.

PROS: The hallways are clean; the carpet looks new; the walls look redone; the rooms are clean and more modern than expected. The non-smoking DOES NOT SMELL LIKE CIGARETTES! The bathroom isn't as big, but for this price, I'll shut up. They even have flat screens TV! The people @ the check-in were really sweet.

CONS: This place is kind of far from the center of the strip. Because it is one of the older hotels, it is not as fancy or hyped as the new hotels on the strip. You don't get the pretty, well-decorated check in area like the other big hotels. This place is a lot smaller.

If you want to stay at a hotel on the strip stay away from the Stratosphere. It is the last hotel on the strip and too far walk to and from. Sure the place is cheaper then the rest but its not worth it.

The facilities could use a serious upgrade. It's quite confusing to walk around to look for the event facilities. Even though we already had purchased our tickets ahead of time we still had to wait in line with people that were just looking for information,first world problems I know. Ido believe they could remedy the line ups.

Not much else to add.

Pros: Starbucks and Mc Donald's, pretty views, cheap rates. 
Cons: Bad service. NEVER got towels the entire weekend after calling repeatedly. Off the strip. Cost for a taxi is $20! Save the taxi money and put it towards a better hotel. The entire hotel smells of weed. To the point it gave me a headache.

I and my friends went to the Stratosphere Hotel, but there is not a lot of people inside the casino around like cheap. I like upstairs long to the top thrills pretty cool. Guess what a scary...if you like it or not. There is a nice small place.

The casino itself is very generic mid-Strip tier for slots and strip mall sites.  If you didn't know you were in the Stratosphere, you'd just assume you were in Ballys or Harrahs.  It's the new top anchor for the Strip now that Sahara is closing doors, so stop here tourists lest ye enter Scarytown.  (As if the Strip doesn't seem scary enough outside the tower.)

The tower itself is amazingly beautiful, but pricey to go up into unless you're a NV resident or veteran.

Our original flight to Vegas was cancelled so we weren't able to check in to Stratosphere until 11pm. Although we made a reservation for a smoke free room (I have asthma), they only had a smoking room available with the assurance that we could probably change rooms the following day. Our room was on the 10th floor and upon exiting the elevator you can tell that this was a smoking floor. We walked into our room and the stink continued so we decided to head over to the nearby Walgreens to buy some candles and Febreze. The next day we went to the front desk to request the room change.  The guy at the counter told us to check back when we return from breakfast and hopefully by then they would have a room available. We checked back at 10 and they told us to call at 11am. We start packing our stuff and at 11 am I call the front desk and after a brief hold we were told they were not able to honor our request to change rooms after all because they were already booked. They said that they could send a person over to our room with an ozone machine to clear out the smell.  30 min later,  no machine.  So I called housekeeping and they said they'll contact the front desk. They called me back and told me that someone will be there with the machine but I would have to vacate the room for half an hour. I waited and 20 min later someone finally shows up with a machine and the top of her t-shirt covering her mouth. I asked her if she was ok and she replied, "It's a lot of smoke on this floor." Duh! After this ozone treatment the room smelled a little better but we kept the candles burning and used the spray often. The upside of this hotel include the $5 tables and the free admissions to the top of the stratosphere. I probably would never stay here again. I guess you get what you pay for!

This is one of the worse places you can stay at while visiting Las Vegas. It is about two miles from old Vegas and the strip so you have to drive or pay for taxi\/bus. The hotel itself is not very nice and they have a lot of hidden fees that raise the price. I paid 150 for one night here and it would have cost me only 170 at treasure island which was in the middle of the strip and within walking distance to everything. When I asked about the hidden fees which were not mentioned on the phone at the time I paid for the room they said they can't do anything about it and if I cancelled I would have to the pay for the first night. In the end the hotel was bad and the customer service was worse. DON'T STAY HERE

We stayed here about two weeks ago. We were in town for a tournament at the convention center. Having our three young children with us, we wanted to stay somewhere off of the Strip, yet close to the convention center. The Stratosphere provided both!

The rooms were typical. There are many nicer rooms in Las Vegas, but they were clean and functioned properly. 

We did not eat, gamble, nor shop there. I cannot comment on those activities. 

My kids enjoyed the pool. We went up to the viewing deck, which was spectacular. Even if you are not staying with this hotel, definitely make the trip up there! It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. 

I am glad that we drove to Vegas. When I asked the vallet how far down the Strip the shuttle went, he replied that it wouldn't take us much further than Treasure Island. Disappointing, but we had our car, so we drove ourselves to see the sights. 

If you are looking for an affordable hotel that is just minutes from the heart of the Strip, then this is it. If you are looking for luxury, try elsewhere.

It's affordable, has the basics amenities  and has good customer service.

However,

it's a good 2 miles from the strip and the neighborhood is pretty dark and shady. After spending to much money on the cab rides back and forth from the strip it would actually be cheaper to stay at treasure island and flamingo then the stratosphere.

This was my first time ever staying at the Stratosphere hotel (6\/7-6\/8), and this was on the tail end of our family's Las Vegas\/Grand Canyon vacation.  We only stayed overnight in the Select Tower, and it was booked through Expedia, which had a very low advertised price.

The room that we stayed in was good, the beds looked nice and the furniture\/decor was modern, too.  I read some of the other reviews which said that their room looked outdated and worn.  I'm not sure if this depended upon which tower they stayed in, but I was satisfied with the room I stayed in.

However, I do have to comment on a few things:  1)  the bathroom lighting is dim - there is only one light and it's on the vanity over the sink area.  The rest of the bathroom looked and seemed dark,  2)  The closet is rather tall and narrow, so there wasn't a lot of space to stow stuff if you have more than two people in the room, 3)  my sleep was marred by the presence of unruly and inconsiderate young twentysomethings who seemed to think that it was okay to be noisy and boisterous at 3:00 a.m. in the morning.

It is on this item that I am going to hit upon and expand upon.

The hotel, given its positioning on the strip, seemed to be dominated by the younger crowd, although everybody was represented there.  The casino area seemed to be lacking in energy like the other casinos I'd seen closer to the center of the strip.  However, the young crowd that I encountered probably chose the Stratosphere hotel because it was what they could afford.

If that really was the case, I shouldn't have been surprised that they would act in a way that was consistent with their self-centered personalities.  At 3:00 a.m. in the morning, a small group of people came down the hallway from the elevator bank and were talking very loudly.  So loud that they woke me up - not a wise thing to do.  I actually went to my room's front door, opened it up, and told them to pipe down or I'd call security.  Since they didn't seem to listen or care, I called for security to come up and check out my noise complaint.  Things quieted down shortly after I made the call.

Given that I could clearly hear them through the door, the doors must be hollow-core or made of something else that allows sound to be transmitted through fairly easily.  Regardless, because of the crowd that seemed to be drawn to this hotel, I probably am not going to come again.  I don't want to have to deal with obnoxious, immature people, and they were everywhere!  I encountered them in the elevator, in the halls, at the shops, and on the casino floor.  It was more painfully evident to me when I saw the crowd gathered at the Starbucks Coffee area outside of the elevators to the Select Tower.

The only real draw of this hotel is probably the observation deck in the tower, which paid guests can visit for free by swiping their cardkey.  Otherwise, you'd have to pay a hefty price for the privilege to go up there.

So, I give Stratosphere a low mark because of the clientele it attracts.  Knowing what I know now, I'm not going to subject myself or my family to the boisterous antics of immature adults.

Oh, and the adjacent neighborhood surrounding the hotel?  It seemed very ghettoish.  It felt like East St. Louis - depressed, dark, and run-down.  Even the motel across the street from the taxi drop-off area is closed and dilapidated.  A heavy atmosphere hung over the area as I drove around the hotel property.

this was our second time staying at the Stratosphere and we spent a week there from the 11th-16th of September 2011. overall we like the Stratosphere and for the price its not that bad. had an upgraded room on the 17th floor with views of the beautiful parking structure (yes, that's sarcasm). paid $399 for the whole week. 
we enjoyed Roxys diner, the grill cheese is amazing but consider sharing a plate if you're not very hungry because the portions are huge. also, if you have the ace playing card you get a 10-25% discount in almost all the stores\/restaurants in the hotel. 
the buffet was pretty good. cost about $21 (with the discount) and it had a lot of different choices. for the price it wasn't that bad.
we liked our room had a nice comfortable and clean king size bed. 42 inch plasma TV and great working AC. bathroom was big but it did have a faint unpleasant urine odor. if you really looked you could see where the cheap upgrades were made but you get what you pay for. 
the hotel is far from everything and unless you're wearing super comfy sneakers and even then we strongly suggest you get a deuce deuce pass depending on how long you're going to stay. we purchased two 3 day pass for $20 each.we did however see an advertisement where you could get a 5 day pass at any Albertson for the same amount as the 3 day one. 
checking in was a complete hassle. our credit card has the visa logo that debit cards usually have. why my credit union does this I do not know but I do know that that specific card only works as a credit card and if we try to run it as a debit it gets declined. well, when checking in I wanted to leave the card open b\/c we knew we were going to get Internet at some point in our stay ($11.99 for 24 hrs). the receptionist who had a very pleasant attitude told me that she would get in trouble if she left it open b\/c it was a debit card not a credit card. I explained to her the way my credit union works and the way the card works but i asked if i could speak to a manager to see if he could give her the OK because i also didn't want the girl to get in trouble. he came over and from the beginning gave me attitude as if It was a great inconvenience to have to get up off his a**. I explained to him the situation and he told me that he helped develop the software therefor he knew that my card would not work as a credit card. after about 10 min of arguing and asking him to just try it he did and guess what? it went through as a credit card like i told him it would. I didn't even get an apology from him. the week went on without any other unpleasant incidents. we decided to check out a day early because we had done and experienced everything we wanted to. I was told that we would be charged a late check out fee of $20 and be reimbursed the rest which was about $60 plus tax. when we went to check out  the reservation clerk was the most genuine and friendly person in that hotel. he didn't charge us the late check out fee and refunded the whole extra day which turned out to be $97. 

overall this hotel is good for the price. too far if you want to be at the center of the strip.

Price was ok I guess.... But that's about it. 
Resort fee was a joke.. 
Cockroaches were literally riding up the elevator with me.. 

Also make sure u avoid self parking at all costs. Because when your tires get slashed they will literally do nothing to help you.. Asking them to file a report is useless because they didn't get pictures of the slashed tires while they were on the car (sorry not trying to have the tires go flat while I wait on the Parking garage "security" to come take pics) spent $400 on new tires and the hotel said they can't do anything to reimburse us because it was self park.. Which is understandable... But then they state that they can't even look at the cameras and no one in the hotel has the authority to do so.

We were not provided with a do not disturb sign (apparently just the top floors have those) so the maids walked in on us twice.. Luckily we were dressed. 

Started pouring rain....... And the ceiling in the hotel started leaking... Definently will spend the extra money to stay somewhere closer to the strip next time.

Me and my family came here for a couple days to celebrate Mothers Day . The hotel staff was very helpful and nice to me and my family . The rooms was average nothing special about them. The view wasn't good . But other then that we had no complaints.

Our room on the 23 floor, room 90 is exceptionally clean. The room is spacious enough. Floor, bed and bathroom are clean. The view isn't great because it's obstructed by the tall Stratosphere beside the hotel but I can look on one side and see the strip and the other side and see the mountains.

Review #248 - 2016

I booked two rooms during our stay from 12\/18-12\/20.  I needed the extra room because Owen snores and I can't sleep with a snorer and a 9-month old baby in the same room.

The happiest person about this whole arrangement was our 14-year old son since he feels that his mom is controlling and I won't let him play his loud music and do whatever he wants so he got to spend the entire trip in a room with his 13-year old cousin.  I guess that was money well spent.  NOT!  Teenagers aren't supposed to be overly happy...not on my watch.  LOL

I've stayed here often enough to know what to expect, but the newest addition is the customer service text messaging.  I love that feature, now that I got my iPhone 5s set up, that is.  It's so nice and convenient.  I sent them a text to ask for a playpen for my daughter and they showed up about 10-15 minutes later.

I even texted them asking if we could move to another room because the high school kids in the room next door, who were there for their hockey league, were playing their music super loud and I couldn't sleep.  However, they didn't have any rooms available and offered to send security up, but I told them that wasn't necessary.

The second day of our stay, I managed to deactivate my key and sent them another text, 10 minutes later the bellman brings up another set of keys.  I couldn't be happier with the convenience and super quick response time.  Love this place!

I liked this place... Even the ride on the very top is beyond scary... 

The Big Shot but I had to try it...! Its an experience beyond words..!
The Air Bar- is awesome, you get to see the entire city from above--from floor 108 I believe...! 
My friends Bachlorette Party was at the 15th floor suite. 
The suite was fantastic, very roomy and super clean.

Gotta agree with Sarah E.'s opinion.  You are in Vegas baby, get outta the room!  I stayed at the Stratosphere during my very first trip to Vegas a couple of years ago with a group of 5.  I had no idea how the place was laid out, so I was surprised to learn how far down the strip the hotel was.  We'd rented a car so the distance from the action was manageable.  From what I remember the rooms were fairly clean and large.  The restaurant downstairs was okay when you wanted something after staying out late.  And the restaurant at the top was nice as well at least for ambience's sake.  All in all I just think it wasn't bad for the money.  If you are looking for luxury then there are plenty of better choices for that in LV.  But for a clean, reasonably priced hotel room....I'd recommend the Stratosphere.

I am late in writing my review as my stay was in October of 2010 - but I wanted to share my experiences with the staff in regards to the lack of customer service I had received while there.

We flew in from Portland in the late afternoon and took a cab to the hotel where we checked in and were given our room.  We were not offered any assistance with our bags which but I didn't take notice of it at that point but it is strange due to the fact that most most hotels offer that right away.  I would have refused it however it was the start of our glorious stay at the Stratosphere!

We went to our room on the 7th floor and plopped our suitcases and duffle's up on the bed for unpacking when I promptly took my shoes off to walk around the room, scope the place out and get ready to shower.  I came across a 12 inch diameter wet spot on the floor next to the bed and my socks were soaked right away.  

I hopped out of the wet spot and stripped off my socks and looked around the room for more wet spots - nothing.  I wasn't about to put my face down to smell the floor but the first thing that came to mind was someone else was unhappy with the hotel and decided to take a whiz before they left or they were drunk from the nightlife and spilled their stomach contents on the floor prior to checking out - and I just got it all over my socks and feet.  

The front desk was called and informed of the issue, we were told not to do anything, standby and that someone (the manager) would be right up.  30 minutes go by and another call is made to the front desk - "someone is on the way" they say.  20 minutes go by and we are wondering where this person might be?  We discuss how quite the casino was and the front desk\/lobby was not busy at all.  Someone should be here any moment.   Give them a bit longer, perhaps another group of planes came in and they got busy - however we want to get this resolved so we can unpack and go see Vegas, it is our first time here.

We waited another 20 minutes and we call again and are told the same thing - someone is on the way.  We tell them to please hurry up as we have been waiting over an hour and we are hungry, want to unpack and shower and go eat as we have been flying all day.  No problem we are told, just a few more minutes.

Total time waited at this point before I call - 1.5 hours and I call the front desk and ask for the manager (who is supposed to be on the way to our room) and they pick up the phone and proclaim "Service Manager can I help you".  Hello, do you know which room number I am in?  "Yes sir".  Do you know of the complaint we called about previously?  "Yes sir".  Are you aware that for the past HOUR AND A HALF you were supposed to have been on the way to our room to get this resolved and we have been sitting here patiently waiting for you?  "I will be right there sir".

He knocked on our door within 5 minutes and looked at the spot then told us that they just cleaned the carpets, it is nothing.  I asked him why is this one spot soaking wet and not the entire carpet then if the carpet was cleaned?  if it were cleaned, the entire carpet would be damp.  If he is so sure that the spot is from the carpet cleaning, perhaps smelling the spot wouldn't be out of the question?

The manager said absolutely out of the question, I had a valid point and he would move us to a different room immediately and have someone else come in and "clean these carpets again".

We were moved to a new room on the 19th floor I think it was where indeed the entire carpet was damp and smelled of a fragrant soap.  The manager stated that this one was obviously cleaned and apologized and left.  That was it, nothing about leaving us sitting in the piss\/puke room or about putting us in a room with a completely damp carpet.  We called downstairs again and asked them to bring up fans to dry out this carpet and they did.  They offered NOTHING for the hassle and no apologies for the wait.

The entire stay construction was going on throughout the day and night, you could hear hammering through the walls and ceiling in the elevator as you came and went.  The food in this hotel\/casino was pretty crappy.

For 9 bucks more a night you can stay at the Luxor which is a cool place and in a safer location.  This hotel is also at the bad end of town and if you walk down to the strip you have to walk through the ghetto and there are some suspect people standing outside the t-shirt stores and liquor stores begging for money and scoping out the passers by.

Spend your money elsewhere.

I wouldn't go back based on its location. Too far from the main stuff. But the room was okay. 

The GOOD:
1. Comfortable beds
2. Large drawers
3. Nice Flat screen TV
4. Modern design
5. Deep bathtub


The BAD: 
1. Small bathroom, it was very uneasy to get in and out. The sink is separated.
2. Air conditioning unit too close to the bed, very cold at night with thin blankets.
3. Small closet
4. no free coffee?
5. No Monorail station.

Stayed here when we took a weekend getaway (Thur - Sun) in April 2011. We were looking for an inexpensive place to stay in Vegas that was still on the strip. We choose the stratosphere. The hotel itself is really nice (seems a bit old), but in general it is nice. We tried one of the restaurants - Roxy's Diner, just for a quick easy meal after a late flight. The food was really good! We also went to a show which was a lot of fun, and nicely priced. 

And of course the stratosphere has an amazing view of the strip that you don't want to miss. We got some wonderful pictures there. 

Didn't do any rides because they were expensive and we'd rather have spent that money doing other attractions in Vegas. 

If you are looking for something conveniently located on the strip - this is not the place. It is quite a walk from the main part of the strip, and this is coming from a couple who usually walks everywhere on vacation because it is the cheapest way - and we like to save money! But even for us, especially after a night in heels, it was a bit far! However, if you are willing to buy a bus pass for the days you are there, then it would be just fine. Do keep in mind though that riding the bus on the strip can take a decent amount of time. 

That in mind it is nice that is is far enough away from the action on the strip that it doesn't always seem to frantic! It is also a quick and easy getting to Fremont St.

This is my first time in Vegas and my experience at this hotel was far from stellar. The surrounding neighborhood is downright scary. Run down buildings and aggressive pan handlers surround the hotel. We were asked to participate in a timeshare presentation everytime we walked in the front of the hotel. We felt as though we were being pan handled inside the hotel. We lost count of how many times the same salesperson approached my husband and I. The decor is ancient, housekeeping is sketchy, towels were like sandpaper, and the shower was a deathtrap. The food in the diner was good, bartenders were always friendly and helpful, and the  waitresses on the floor were always great. We had booked a room at planet hollywood for the last 3 nights and we were happy to move on.
Worst hotel ever. There was mold in our shower and it took them over an hour to come and clean it. Didn't offer any sort of compensation or anything. I will never stay here again.

Place is a cluster. Couple screaming at each other, loud noises, possible physical violence, from 2 Am until after 3. I made 4 calls to security, no action. They didn't resolve the issue until I threatened to call 911 after 3 AM. The offenders were more important than other guests. Never coming back. Very poor handling of the situation.

I enjoy the stratosphere hotel. This is honestly my go to location when I visit Vegas. This year will be going on my third time not only visiting Vegas but staying at this hotel. I love the restaurants they have especially Roxy's Diner and I love that for a week I can pay between 5-7 hundred dollars. 
I like how they have rides at the hotel, and an arcade in the hotel. 

The only downfall is the location of the hotel is the end of the strip but if you like to walk like me then it's fine. Also the pool is always cold. Granted its 115 degrees everyday the water is still too cold.

Definitely an older side of the strip however they look like they have revamped a lot inside. Did not feel old and dated felt more like new and contemporary. I would not take this off your checklist people! It is definitely worth a visit

The A\/C in our room didn't work, necessitating repairs that kept us awake until 1 am. That, coupled with the 7 am construction meant that not a lot of sleep occurred in our room. I contacted the organization several days ago, and I was informed that they would be contacting me regarding the issues that occurred, but I've yet to receive a phone call. This hotel is horrible. Stay away at any cost. They don't care about their patrons, and the hotel is located in an area that looks like you could score drugs on any corner and\/or get stabbed. Do not stay in this hotel for any reason. You're better off sleeping in your car.

Many of these reviews discuss how expensive the Meal is. Yes, it's in the higher range. But you're paying for VEGAS and the view. Any good steakhouse is pricey. If you don't eat then you have to pay to get into the tower. It's worth it. The dinner was superb. The manager came over to make sure I knew which wine I wanted. As it turned out I chose something different after he described it, so kudos to him! I would absolutely go back. Budget yourself in other areas if you want to go here, that's all.

I came here on my first trip to Vegas when in college still and on a very tight budget.  A group of 7 of us paid $190 for nonstop air and hotel so for the price we couldn't beat it but it is pretty run down and not really on the best part of the strip.  I have been back to Vegas several times since and unless your on a very tight budget I wouldn't suggest it.  If you are though Imperial Palace is the same price range with a better location.

As for the tower that was pretty cool going to the top and going on one of the three rides that overhangs off the 1000 ft ledge was very neat.
