Took forever to check in. Half the front desk staff must have been on vacation. Not a great location. Slow room service. Mediocre rooms. Then again, it was only $40 per night; I wasn't expecting much.

Comfy beds, nicely cleaned, big room and big tub. Very cheap on groupon. Me and my fiancé loved everything. Even the machines were paying out. Sure it's not the venetian but we were always happy with it. I would definitely go back.

Stayed for one night. I got one of the new rooms. Rooms are nice and clean. Hotel is clean and the staff was nice. Here is the bad- There was about a one inch gap between the door and the door frame. As a result, the hallway light shined into my room all night. I could hear everything going on in the hallway. Doors slamming all night, people putting their key cards into the machine to open the door, people using the ice machine and talking. it was one of the worse nights of my life. I will never stay at this hotel again. They paid to update the rooms but did not do anything to keep out the noise. I have been to Vegas over twenty times and have stayed in a lot of hotels. I have never had an experience like this.

We had an excellent time here! I had to book this hotel after Dee in reservations gave me 5 star treatment and showed much passion and enthusiasm for this hotel, you could genuinely hear the love and warmth in her voice for her hotel, so I was all in! After hanging up I went to yelp and was saddened by the negative reviews and expected to be disappointed!
It was super easy to get to this hotel, right off the freeway and then one turn and you're there, that's a bonus after a long drive! 
Our check in was fast, and Ron was super nice and efficient! 
Our room was clean and nice, sheets super soft and cozy and we had a good view for a great price! 
Perfect location at the halfway point between stuff on the upper strip and downtown, because it's way more fun to explore the vibe in both places rather than just staying in one location!
We loved that you can go up to the tower free of charge as a hotel guest! We loved the pool on the 24th floor and couldn't believe how small that pool looked from the actual tower, when we were on the 24th floor it looked like the tallest building ever, then from the tower it's a speck, so high!
Casino was fun and we enjoyed video poker at the C bar with Abel as our rad and helpful bartender!
We liked the Buffett here, and Nadia our server was a total sweetheart!
Check out was all of 2 minutes with Glenn helping us with a few jokes and understanding as I was near tears from our vacation ending!
Valet took 10 minutes!
We loved this place and will definitely go back, it just makes sense with a good location and the best price, and not to mention the rush of the tower and it's rides, the easy freeway access and friendly staff!
I'm ready to come back already!

I ended up booking last minute and found a deal in the Stratosphere. We've stayed at many different hotels on the strip over the years and found this to be at the bottom of our list. We ended up in the North Tower. The room itself was an okay size, but the bathroom was tiny - the door barely opened without hitting the toilet and the sink was located in the room. Every time a toilet was flushed in the surrounding area it sounded like an airplane taking off. Woke me up the first night when the room above us used their bathroom. The showers were equally as noisy. The pillows were also small. They looked like postage stamps on the bed and were useless if you wanted to use the to prop up and watch TV. 

The Casino was fine, but the drinks were terrible. We ordered cranberry juice and vodka. The bartender wanted to make sure we saw him over pour the vodka. I'm assuming he did this for a larger tip. We ended up paying $20 for two watered down drinks. Not sure if the cranberry or the vodka was culprit. 

Luckily this was not a vacation trip for us and we spent little time in the room.
Look for the money you cant beat it!  The rooms are clean, functional and spacious.  The view!  you just cant beat the view from the top of the world!
The location is not good at all. However, its a great value for the budget traveler who wants a clean room to stay in. Get the newly updated rooms in the new tower. Super clean super value.

My boyfriend and I travel to Las Vegas about three times a year.  We found a hotel we liked early on and never ventured out to staying at another.  Thanks to the Stratosphere, I was reminded why.  I will start with the check in.  Upon arriving I went to the reservation line and waited to be assisted.  I was given my room along with two keys.  Since we were staying for 7 days, I had two pieces of luggage plus what I was carrying in my backpack and purse.  I was offered no help getting the luggage up to my room, but I was reluctant to manage to find my room before my arms gave out.  I tried the key given and it did not work; I tried the other key and had no luck.  Finally, someone came and let me in my room, and about an hour later I was brought two more keys which didn't work.  I accumulated six room keys before having one that worked.  That night, we tried to order room service, no answer.  We called multiple times but never got an answer.  I thought there could be a technical problem so called the bell desk.  Finally, someone answered and I was basically told there was nothing they could do.  The next day I went to workout and when I got back to the room the sheets were being changed by housekeeping. It must have been apparent that I wanted to take a shower so the maid asked if I would like her to come back in a couple hours and I gratefully accepted.  Hours later, the bed was still half way unmade with clean sheets sitting nearby.  I called housekeeping to ask if someone could come up and they assured me that someone would be up to finish changing the sheets shortly.  Two hours went by and no one had came by or called.  I changed my own sheets and made my own bed.  I would also suggest that if you need towels, toiletries, etc., call hours before you run out because that's how long it takes to get them brought to your room.  I am a frequent traveler and I have never had such a horrible experience.  There is a reason that their rates are lower than most in Las Vegas.  You get whatyou pay for- this hotel is a disgrace to Las Vegas.  I wouldn't step foot in this hotel again if I were paid.  Lastly, if you are looking to stay on the Strip, this is not the place.  It barely qualifies as being on the Strip and the surroundings are not classy, for lack of better words.  Horrible experience.  I only gave it one star because they did not have zero or negative.

Partner and I were  in town for a conference at the Sands Convention center and ended up staying here for one nite.  Hotel Registrar Ms Kentberlint was very accommodating to our needs and happily upgraded both of us to full suites  for our stay at no extra cost ... She also gave us the full gamut of coupons and drink specials of which we used several and there were no hidden tricks or any other type of up sale ... the rooms were spacious, clean, and very comfortable and they were much appreciated... I have stayed here many times over the years and I have read many recent negative reviews about this place so I was a little concerned... Happy to report that good old Stratosphere hospitality is still alive and well it seems ... thanks again!

I've never spent the night or thought about it.  I even had a free night & passed.  Mostly because of the smell & location, but what do you expect from an old casino.

I give a four star because it's about time to clean, remodel, change the easy valet parking back to how it was & just do some kind of upgrades!  However, I love the Top of the World, the caricaturist on the way, the Uggs store, Cleo's fine jewelry & my friends on vacation are highly entertained by the rides.  (I don't do rides lol I admit I'm scared!)

The food at the Top of the World is fantastic, along w\/ the Bloody Mary's, also can't wait to go back & try McCalls.  Those are two different reviews in itself.  No plan on staying the night so will have to base my review on being a Las Vegas resident tourist in this great city & appreciate the 'oldness' lol.  Also it's a great part of our skyline & helps you find your way if your lost.  If you don't know North of the strip, now you do & Mandalay Bay is South lol just in case your traveling & need help these are great locators.  Cheers!

Viiiiiiiva Las Vegas!

Okay, first, I would've given this place a 5 if it were closer to either the strip or old las vegas. Unfortunately, since the recent closing of several casinos near stratosphere leading to the strip, the walk is mostly long and very dark - sometimes it feels a little risky (though it isn't).

The room was nice (and the cheapest we could find during xmas season - most places hike up prices during holiday season). We were on the 21st floor, which gave us a beautiful view of the mountains and strip. 

I will say that unfortunately the "gym" wasn't worth much, which is mostly the reason why we decided to stay here (most "gyms" in hotels\/resorts are not included). It was mostly just a small concrete room with almost no equipment, of which was very worn out and not the best. Something is something though.

There is an RTC stop outside, which is convenient and customer service is great here.

Go to the Buffet downstairs.

Just spent 4 nights here the room was nice we were asked if we would like to be upgraded for a additional fee of $25 a night and ended up paying OVER $200 additional! So don't be taking in like we were thinking it's a great deal! I did enjoy the suite ;) Just not the prices! And skip the Buffet it's gross but Roxys Dinner has excellent food!

In my opinion the Stratophere tower has the best views on the strip. The Stratophere Tower was a Restuarant on top and if you feel like a daredevil check out the rides on top! A little pricey but its worth it. If you like Michael Jackson, you must see MJ live.

Stayed at stratosphere with my family. It was ok. Small room. Hard bed. Has all your basic amenities Check in was average. for a Saturday about 20mins. Our room was far. I think it was one of the last towers like 4 or 5 or something. There was no way to get to that tower quick no matter where you park. I suggest getting a bell hopper if you have a lot of luggage. Besides how far the hotel room is from the car I love the view. You get to go up the tower free. It is normally like 18 something a person to go to the top. More if you want to ride roller coasters. The view is great especially being at the end of the strip. But besides the top of the tower the hotel is just average.  I would recommend going to the top, but not staying at the hotel. There are just better places to stay on the strip for a similar price.

I gave the Stratosphere 5 stars because it truly deserves it! My boyfriend and I stayed there for 4 nights and it was EXCEPTIONAL! 

At first I was worried that our hotel was going to suck because we got a direct flight out of Chicago to Las Vegas with a 4 night stay at the Stratosphere for $324. So I figured we'd have to give and take, but the Stratosphere was  phenomenal! 

When we arrived to check in we waited no more than two minutes to get checked in. It was very speedy and the people at the check in desks were extremely kind. Our room was exactly how I saw the example online which was WONDERFUL! 

The only flaw we had was the same day we checked in we went and saw some  of the Las Vegas strip. When we returned at 11:30 pm Vegas time to call it a night we discovered that not only did we not have cold water, but our sink didn't drain and the toilet didn't flush. We gave it 15 min. and still nothing worked. So I called the front desk and told them, what was happening. They offered to give us another room with two beds in it, which was equivalent to the price of our room that we were currently in. I didn't think that was fair and asked that they upgrade us for free because we had already unpacked our things, gotten ready for bed, and right before getting ready to call it a night they asked us to move to another room. To me that wasn't fair and the desk worker agreed. She talked to her manager and we were upgraded. It was the easiest conversation I've ever had. There wasn't an argument about upgrading us or anything. They even offered to send someone up to give us the key to the new room. The room they upgraded us to was MASSIVE! It was like two rooms in one. I must say we were very excited!

We left a $2 tip for the room service people and they did an EXCELLENT JOB in cleaning our room the whole time we were there. One lady actually left us a note to thank us. I really appreciated that and I actually put it in the scrapbook. 

The hotels location was really nice. I consider it to be the half way point between downtown Vegas and the strip. If you stay here buy the Monorail pass because the monorail stop is within walking distance from the hotel. It'll get you to MGM within 15 min. It was truly a GREAT investment!

The casino is very nice as well. The machines were nicely spread out and I really enjoyed how often the ladies taking beverage orders came around. It didn't matter where you sat they all always made sure you weren't thirsty. This hotels casino set up was the best I saw on the entire strip. It was so well organized. Not to mention the exits were easy to find. 

Overall the hotel was PHENOMINAL & I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT! The service is WONDERFUL! In all honesty I am thrilled that I picked this hotel because it was everything I wanted and so much more! Not only did we get an AMAZING price on it, but we got an AMAZINGLY MEMORABLE STAY! The hotel truly helped build the memories that made our vacation unforgettable!

 THANK YOU STRATOSPHERE! YOU ALL WERE WONDERFUL!

Stayed at the hotel twice and the first time was when the rooms were newly remodeled so the rooms were very clean for the price. Second time around wanted a clean room for a good price so decided to stay here again and the room was just ok not as clean as before. Access to the tower was nice and enjoyed the view from up there.

We stayed here since I booked everything through Travelocity.  It was only $45 a night so I couldn't say no.  If I was in Vegas for vacay I'd recommend staying at the Bellagio or Mandalay Bay but I was ust cruising through and only gambled until 5:30am.  Ha.  Stratosphere wasn't that bad it just had a cheesy Casino and I didn't feel lucky there so we went to gamble at the Mandalay.  Still not very much luck but didn't really lose anything either.  The front desk sai that depening on how busy the rest of the strip is the same hotel room can go from $40\/night to $400\/night.  Glad it was a random Wednesday wit not much going on in town.  

Our room came with free ticket rides and a ride to the top of the tower but we didn't have the time to mess around.  It was back on the road and another 9 hours to CA.  

Oh one nice thing was that there is a parking lot across the street afiliated with the Stratosphere and there is always a security guard on the premises.  Although I couldn't park my car in the parking garage since I had a baby Uhaul (5' by 8') attached to my hip I had to park at the other lot.  Glad they had that option though, otherwise it would have been stuck in a bioch parking situation since they wouldn't let me valet.

The stratosphere markets beautiful rooms, but the reality is far from what they promote. Stained carpets, horribly outdated carpeting and decor, uncomfortable beds, black mold in bathroom. This place is a joke. Workers were nice but it's in need of a major upstate and major repairs. And the resort fee is a joke, motel 6 offers better lodging than this place. Will not ever go back or recommend. Is good for someone who doesn't care about a nice, clean or updated hotel.

The Stratosphere is a decent hotel, the pool was nice but over all...not my favorite. My fiancé and I stayed here for 3 days. The hotel isn't as large as other hotels on the strip, there aren't many shops or shows, and if you're not looking to ride the crazy rides you might want to avoid this hotel. The fact that it lacks all those amenities and is so far from every other hotel on the strip, but was a decor t hotel and wasn't bad as far as the room goes, and the view from the top is beautiful, that's my reason for the 3 stars

Was speaking with the kid behind the ticket counter and told him I had a Groupon to exchange for an actual ticket to mj live. He told me too bad I had a Groupon because he was about to give me a cheaper price. I asked how much cheaper, he said $10 each. I told him I would cancel my Groupon to buy his tickets and he told me "no don't. you'll need a good reason.  You're not even saving that much." Seriously? Why did you even bring it up if it isn't that much? Um... 20 dollars is a lot when the ticket is 25 dollars. Get real kid. 

So as I'm discussing this with him we heard a huge crash behind me and a man started screaming hysterically for security! Another worker at the booth said she saw someone fall over the edge by the escalators, from the second floor to the first floor. I was so upset and shocked. I was shaking and crying. The man continued screaming, they stared roping off he area... and this kid wanted to continue talking about prices with me! I mean really, people are screaming about a woman possibly falling to her doom and this kid wants to talk to me about Michael Jackson tickets. 

We had to leave the opposite way we came in, as we were not allowed to go back down the escalators where a woman was probably laying on the ground. So we had to walk past all kinds of abandoned and empty stores, sex shops, a smoke shop, a completely empty McDonald's... it was so depressing. When we finally got outside someone was doing a snot rocket into the grass. This place gives me a terrible vibe and I do not like it. My experience was incredibly upsetting. Do not recommend!!!!

First off, ask for the upgrade to the remodeled rooms. It is an extra $10 a night and from what I understand, worth the price. The room we had was remodeled and clean. The only issue was a crack in the tub but I think it was more cosmetic. The other larger issue was that the doors needed to be soundproofed! Every time people walked by you heard them. One group was so loud I thought they were in front of our door. I went in the hall and they were six doors away but I could clearly hear their conversation before I opened the door.  Apparently it was a 4:00 am therapy session for cougars.  The price includes the pool (over crowded with families) and visits up the top of the stratosphere. The Stratosphere was amazing with inside and outside viewing area.  We went at sunset for a great view. The bar up there is great too.
Great comfortable place for the price. I don't care about jacuzi and swimming but I do care about the service here which is decent.

The room was really nice and really updated. You get what you pay for but I mean it was decent. It wasn't extravagant but it was clean and had a nice pool. The rides at the top are really expensive but you should at least try it once cuz they are fun!
Pretty awesome view, not cool that you have to get searched before going up. Atmosphere up top is amazing and views are grand
If you don't want to get eaten up by bed bugs, then avoid this place like the plague. The hotel will not take responsibility for anything.
just settled in this hotel is a horror !!! room number 5.099 tap water hardly flows shower awful and we refused to change the number. I beg you not populated in this hotel

The only good thing about this place is the stunning view. You get to go all the way up the tower for free if you have a room. It makes for great pictures. 

The service was bad and the food wasn't good. When we got there, our room wasn't even ready. The casino was medium sized. Their pillows smell funny.

Yuk! Yuk! Yuk!--First room had bugs, ring around the toilet, rust and a cracked tub. Second room was an upgrade but it was very dusty and there were blood stains around the jacuzzi. Couldn't run the jacuzzi because of a default that automatically turn the shower on. Oh, did I mention the hair and stains on the washcloths? Uber nasty!! 

There's a huge language barrier with housekeeping and it's clear they only spot clean the rooms. Management doesn't care. You can really tell that the staff is there to get a paycheck and they don't care about making your experience a great one. The restaurants and nightlife are the only thing that's happening for the Stratosphere. With so many bad reviews for this and other hotels in Las Vegas, it's becoming clear that Vegas is going downhill. It definitely isn't the same from 4 years ago and beyond. I hardly saw people gambling at this hotel. Really? I think it's time for other cities like Atlanta to create a little Las Vegas. You'll get much better service, better recourse for problems that you may incur and an overall better experience!!

I work in Vegas often and try to stay here for a couple reasons. Competitive prices, cleanliness and convenience. On my last stay I booked thru expedia an hour before I got there. After waiting in the registration line a bit and reaching the counter, the girl told me the reservation hadn't gone thru and to hang out for an hour. But she said to walk up to the last register without standing in line. 
I came back and the manager, Chris I believe, upgraded me to a suite for the inconvenience.  I like to call that great customer service. 
The area is not necessarily the best. I wouldn't walk north, but I would walk south on lvb. 
Cab it to the main part of the strip or Fremont for sure.
The extra resort fee I see some reviewers complaining about is pretty standard anywhere in Vegas. 
I will definitely be coming back to stay here again.

Went up for the "Insanity" ride & the vew! To be honest,  If the ride had been on the ground it would have been pretty lame but because it is like a thousand feet in the air it was pretty intense & awesome! However, even if for those who aren't into thrill rides, the 360 viewing deck is worth the ride up to the stratosphere. There is a bar & food options up there to hang out & enjoy the view! I recommend!
Decent rooms, nice pool area. Dated and could use better quality products in bath for guests. Too expensive for what you get. And it's located in the WORST neighborhood\/ ghetto

Enjoyed my 3-day stay on the 21st floor of this place.  I didn't realize it was at the end of the strip when I made a reservation.  Great view from the 108th floor of the tower.  There is a revolving restaurant at the top where you have to make reservations for a table 1 day earlier.  The swimming pool on the 8th floor is fun.  Wasn't too happy with the food court though.  There was a Mexican restaurant, a Mc Donald's, Krispy Kreme and a Starbucks.   Our flight was early in the morning so we checked out around 3 am.  There was no water coming out of the taps because of some repairs so we had to put up with that :(  
The casino is huge and I got lost on my way at times.  The assistants over there won't be of any help if you ask them questions about how those gaming machines work.

I wanted to splurge on the Wynn Buffet and other site seeing + a bit on gambling. 

So I chose to cut back on the hotel cost.  I am very happy about my decision. It was a good stay. 

Our fligh arrived in LV at 7.30am. I took a cab ride fro $18 to the hotel from the Airport. Checked our luggages to the bell desk and walked like 2min to the bus stop took the day pass for $7 for the Deuce (the 2 story bus) - very comfy , but  very crowded but well ariconditioned. 

Check in - took a while but I didn't mind. The lady at the desk offered to upgreade me for $10 more per night or strip view for $20 per night extra. I convinced her and got a room on the tower 3 - 23rd floor with a view of the mountains + nonstrip but good view with lights etc at night. Paid $7.50 per nigh resort fee for free access for tower tour + rides + coupon book (REMEMBER TO GO OVER IT NOTE IT DON'T TEAR IT BEFORE USING IT) 


Check - out -  a breeze. just give your check in paper work \/ fill out a form. 
               You get to keep your room keys as a souvenir. 

What I liked ----

Bell Desk 
very helpful - My stuff were in one piece. great!! we left our stuff from 9am till check in and after check out from 11am - 8pm. for free but with tip.

LUCKYS  24 HOUR restaurant
Check free coupons at check in 
10% off 2 entress...
Great service, major portions, tasty too.

Starbucks
Coffee in the hotel itself..loved it

The Bar- 
With live bands- music was great and we danced..No cover..Yay!!
Just a plain bar\/ dance floor. The even played to requests..Thanks guys!

CASINO 
was ok...not much luck on slots but has more luck than the Encore..

Tower - awesome view  FREE for hotel guests. 
We got the picture taken too. it was nice. At nigh this is must see attraction.

8th floor Pool 
Great...was not so croweded..it is out door -


Room -
beds were very comfy , toilet\/ shower is too small but managable.Maid service, very clean. No frigdge(can addd for $10  per night)

Concierge-
Helpful..

FAT TUESDAY-
Yay!! Frozen Margarita 


For the price and all the above metioned I would go again. I got a good deal through orbits with air tickets. 

If you need a fancy hotel and have a lot of dough then go else where but if your on budget and looking to stretch your $$$ then this is the place.

My fiance and I stayed here in September for our vacation.  All the staff were very helpful and nice.  The casino is not bad, and the free admission to the tower is a definate plus!!  The pool is a decent size and family friendly.  Location in my opinion was great because it was off the strip, and had several convinient locations to grab cheap eats and drinks.  The monorail station was only a little walk away.  We got the 3 day pass monorail ticket.  I recommend that to anybody staying here because it is a very long walkdown the strip.  Overall great experience and we will stay here again soon.

I booked a room at the Stratosphere for Yelp Spring Break, they offered a decent promotion for the yelpers during peak vacation time in May! By the time we checked in on an EARLY Friday morning (1:00am), our room choices were limited. We settled for a room with two beds which gave use more choices for which floor to be on. 

Ended up on the 8th floor, which is pool level. It's a bad choice if you want to sleep in because you'll hear constant chatter and slamming doors. The room itself was fine, I only had a few quirks. One was that the location for the towels and the towel holders were in really awkward places (not practical). Another problem was the hairdryer short circuited and we didn't another one in time to use that same morning. 

Other than those minor quirks, the hotel was practical. Admission to the Stratosphere tower is free for hotel guests, just bring your room key! The elevator travels at a speed of 35 mph, faster elevator!!! 

I will say that I was impressed by a minor power outage on the day we left. Even though the power went out, it remembered how much money was just inserted into the machine before it shut off!

Room was spacious and clean.  Three stars was earned when they "upgraded" us to a suite on the 7th floor with a view of a wall.  I had terrible night sleep due the thin, un-insulated walls that screamed when someone turned the shower on in their room.  Won't stay there again & won't refer anyone to the hotel.  Lounge was very nice & food\/drinks were terrific.  Call ahead for dinner reservations, they were booked solid for the evening.  Staff at the lounge won't book you dinner reservations, and don't expect to find an open table when you drop down from the lounge to the restaurant.  FYI - it is a very long walk to the tower from the hotel.

This place has one of the worst security guards ever.  While walking through the casino area from the parking lot to the tower, I stopped to use the bathroom.  

When I come out my wife and kids are being harassed by one of security guards.  This is what happens, he sees a lady waiting outside the restroom with two preschool aged kids, he then points to a part of the carpet area and says "stand over here" , and then keeps asking where is your husband, then he goes into the bathroom to make sure I really am there.  This guy (an African-American fellow between 40-50 y.o., and if I recall correctly named Darryl) really needs some better people skills.  

People are coming from all over the world to spend their hard earned money and enjoy themselves, not to be treated like some enemy combatant at Gitmo.

Because of the economy, great deals are to be found. We usually stay downtown, but opted for the strip this time. The stratosphere sounded like a great place to stay to visit the tower and the rides above. Our rate was $59 for one room on the 17th floor which was a great deal. The day before we left I, of course, had to check the rates again and they were $30. I was afraid to cancel and get new reservations in case they were booked. When we arrived we asked if we could have the lower rate and were told we should have cancelled our original one and got a new one. sigh ... Anyway the accommidations were nice. The view was spectacular especially at night. The staff was friendly. The only bummer was the advertised special for the players club. Signs were all over indicating that joining the club gave you $200 on the card and chances to rack up points for free items. Well, you give your email and you get $5 and almost one week later we still could not figure out why we didn't get $200. We asked several times and the answers were so tangential that we never got an answer. Aside from that, we really enjoyed our stay.

The big draws @ The Stratosphere seem to be the Entertainment, the Tower, the Rides, & its attractiveness as a Wedding venue.  

I saw Cher live for the 1st time, & the Park Theater was 5*****   CHER was 10**********   But that's another Review!

However, Uber did not work from here, & a cab ride was $30.  Ouch.  

Everyone who loves  Thrill Rides can't wait to get up to the Tower.  I'm an observer.  

I can appreciate attempting to "sequester" a Wedding Party here away from the Strip until after the nuptials are over, for obvious reasons.  

Can't see a reason to stay here, since Check-in lines looked ridiculous on a Wednesday night, I'm not interested in the Outlets, & the Neighborhood was definitely sketchy.   One visit & done.  2** are for Cher & the Park Theater & its friendly ushers.

It all started well. A surprise I had planned for weeks. My wife and I had not been on a trip since the wedding. I had saved up for this two-day vacation on her birthday. I had thought of everything: renting a nice car to make the trip more comfortable, buying tickets to her favorite shows... and booking a nice room in a hotel I had stayed in TWICE before.

Well, it was all ruined THE SECOND we arrived. After calling them the day before to warn them we were going to leave after work and thus arrive late, we drove about 5 hours from LA and arrived at 10:30pm. "Sorry, we are out of non-smoking rooms, you're gonna have to take a smoking room". Um, excuse me? We are not talking about the color of the bedsheets here. This is a matter of health & safety. I do not want to spend my weekend breathing someone else's bad habits. We asked for a manager. After all, it was our honeymoon. ROME KING did nothing. Barely even apologizing, he had a stern face, repeating that he cannot do anything. I was speechless. I had stayed at the Stratosphere twice and always talked highly of it. No commercial gesture, no upgrading, nothing. 

So here I was - at 11pm, trying to find another hotel I could stay at, after a 5-hour road trip - btw, I would still have to pay for this room since we couldn't cancel at that point. None. It was slightly after Christmas therefore everything is packed (or too expensive). It was only the beginning of our surprise. Once there, we found (besides the horrible smell) the crappiest room I've ever seen. Paint peeling off the walls, no hand soap, and even CRUMBS on the table from the previous guests! The light was coming from a lamp miserably hung on the wall from a chain, just as if we were in a dungeon. Sorry, but I did not sign up for a BDSM trip. 

You would think that at this point they couldn't lose any more decency. Well, you would be wrong. Even after trying hard to raise the temperature of the room (it was 48 outside), it was still cold. Was I too dumb to understand how the heater works? Maybe. But my wife couldn't find out either. We have to call maintenance who sends out a technician at freaking ONE in the morning. He spends 20mins with tools and noise to find out that it was not working because they had blocked the heater in that room. GREAT!

I will skip on the lack of basic amenities such as providing slippers to guests or toothpaste. They referred us to a gift shop where we could find anything for $$$. On top of that, the only reason I liked to stay there was for the tower privilege which have also become extremely pricy. We ended up having to pay $28 for a wristband to go on the rides where some were not even open and others had over 1h30 wait. 

Oh and by the way, everybody in that hotel is amazingly rude.

My honeymoon turned into a nightmare. Thankfully, everything outside the hotel was still fine. But I swore I was NEVER coming back again and that I would DETER anybody from ever stepping into their nasty-smelling casino. 

Oh and so will my wife with her 50k+ followers on Instagram and Twitter.

Horrible experience..

I booked 3 rooms in November for my wedding (February) I talked to the staff many times before I flew there, asking if we could have all 3 rooms on the same floor.  Each time they said that is fine and can make it happen. when we checked in I upgraded one to a suite and they said we could still get all 3 on the same floor, but the suite was the only one available at the time. the suite was on floor 16, at 3 they called and said the other rooms were ready. come to find out only one was.. and that was on level 21. then at 530 (an hour and a half after check in time) they said my third room was ready.  when we went down they said it wasn't ready and wouldn't be until 7, and it would be on floor 15.  so paying for a room that wasn't ready until 3 hours after check out.  Then I called the manager about my issue, and he was NO help what so ever. I explained I spoke to the staff many times and they said we would be on the same level. he was completely rude and then said he would move our other 2 rooms to "upgraded" rooms for free. the upgraded rooms were the exact same, except they didn't have a strip view. which we paid extra for, so there is lost money there.

Everytime I would drain the tub, the sink in the living room area would fill up and the whole room would smell like sewer. 

The first night there I called for room service and they told me they weren't doing room service that night, but yet the menu said "room service 24\/7, 7 days a week.

All in all this was a horrible experience. I came to Vegas for my wedding, and this hotel made my stay more stressful than it should have been. 

The wedding chapel is extremely beautiful and the top of the world restaurant was amazing, with a great staff. As for the hotel I will never book at the Stratosphere again, nor ever recommend this hotel.

This hotel is a total bait and switch the worst check in experience of my life!  Charged a room online and paid for it then when I went to check in they did not have the room.  They wanted me to pay extra money for the room I had calling it a upgrade.  The upgrade charge was more then the room charge initially.  Then I listened to the person next to me on both sides they gave them the same bull story to "upgrade".  I will never stay here or recommend to anyone again!

WAY TO FAR FROM ALL THE GOOD CASINOS! I would not stay here again. the casino and rooms are decent and the price is good...but with the amount of money you spend on cabs you might as well just pay the extra 50 to stay at mgm. 

the bathroom is super tiny and needs an update. 
the hair dryer in my room didnt work. 
the view from my room sucked! (5th floor, room 120) all i could see was a parking garage. 

and the air quality outside the casino is so horrible. my eyes, nose and throat were killing me after like 20 minutes. 

the end of the srip where statosphere is was sooo ghetto. tons of cracked out bums and garbage everywhere.

Hotel prices don't lie. For $50 a night, Stratosphere gives you a room to sleep. The room size is quite large but it doesn't come with a lot of amenities. Well, you don't expect a lot with that price anyway. 

If you book a room here, make sure you're a heavy sleeper because the walls between the rooms are very thin. The last time I stayed there, I had to call the front desk to send security people to warn my next door neighbor because they were blaring the TV at 2AM.

Thankfully my neighbor this time was very considerate.

All in all, good value for the money. Considering how high the prices on newer hotel rooms are, I prefer to stay here and spend my money on trying nice restaurants and shopping (I don't gamble) After all, that's why you go to Vegas, isn't it?

what can i say about this place but, one hell of a time. went there when i got married. really affordable place to stay. far from the strip but seriously who cares. take the duece or a cab. i stayed there for 3 nights and four days. buffet was really good aswell the sat dinner was awesome a lot of seafood crab legs and oyesters were my fav. strongly recomend for those that have budget
A big dissapointment.   it is far from the rest of the casinos and in a bad area.  looks to be on its last leg.

When in Vegas you are going to want to go up in it at least once and look out from the top.   Yet I have a complaint, and a very possible good tip; 

I've been here three times, and my main complaint is that they charge $13 per person.  So it was $52 for our family of four.  I don't think that's right as they force you to walk past a whole bunch of little stores, loaded with hot dogs (if hungry), corn syrup laden sodas and about 150 million different varieties of Stratosphere key chains and refrigerator magnets.   I've never found -anything- that I had to have, nor would want to carry around with me after making a purchase.   

So here is my suggestion, I have heard this works but was not told about it until after paying for the elevator ride up each time.  Just tell them you are going to the restaurant and I don't believe you have to buy a ticket to do that.   And just so you are telling the truth, you know, not commiting fraud, do go in the restaurant, order a free glass of water and look at the menu.   I don't think you are at that point obligated to order food..   Hehehe   :)

The view is excellent and can be a little scary if you are scared of heights.   I do have a fear of heights some of the time, not always, not sure what the deciding factor is.   But up here we discovered that my Dad and Brother have a fear of heights as well.   My Dad grabbed the chain link fence and would not let go, and my Brother froze, refusing to go near the edge.   And when the roller coaster went by just above our heads, he refused to look up at it!  Hahah!    

One thing I found quite interesting, something now fixed, is that when on the inside floor (you don't have to go outside, but that's the best with the wind and all) the inside floor had glass windows that looked down.   While there were multiple signs saying "DO NOT STAND ON GLASS" (DUH!) surprisingly many people would, and look down.    Now I have no idea how much weight those were designed to handle (or if anyone fell through), they certainly didn't look real thick, as if designed to stand on.   But the last time I was there they had wooden boards covering all of those...   Hmmm.   

When up on top, outside looking out of Las Vegas and the endless deserts and distant mountains, I wondered what it would be like to base jump (skydive) off of here.   That would be a real rush.   

If you never had a chance to go in the World Trade Center, aside from the Sears Tower, this is one of the only places you can get up this high and the view is similar to that from the World Trade Center and Sears Tower as the cars look like ants and people are hard to even make out.   Pretty cool.   They just shouldn't charge so much if anything to go up and look....

Rude managers. No hot tub as advertised. Pool is closed on the 8th floor. The rooftop pool is crowded and full of kids. I want to relax... Not swim in piss water. False advertising. Won't refund and I've only been here for an hour!!! Location is far from everything. Rooms are nothing special. No fridge or anything. Bare minimum basics. Waste of 5 days and hard earned money. Considering just flying back early just to get out of here.

For the price, this hotel was great, clean, and had great customer service. Little far from the main attractions of the strip, but you get your money's worth. Get the remodeled room. Oh and they give you coupons for the ride and half off one of their shows.
Clean and reasonably priced. The registration line is extremely slow.

This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel. My first experience was flawless however, this 2nd time our door jammed the 2nd night which caused us to have to move all our things to another room. Although this wasted several hours of our time the hotel did comp several things off our bill. Through all of this ANTHONY at front desk was wonderful and explained everything at the hotel perfectly. His customer service definitely made the stay more enjoyable. Thanks Stratosphere (:

This place is a huge lawsuit waiting to happen.  With all of the issues they've been having with the operations of the rides, to the stability of the structure (which will rock and sway when the winds are 15MPH, which is considered to be light wind to Las Vegans), I'm surprised no one's been killed in this deathtrap.

We recently (5\/19\/2011 thru 5\/24\/2011)  stayed at the Strat, and enjoyed ourselves. The hotel was clean, the casino was fun and the food at the buffet was fine. Roxy's was good, but not great, the wait staff was slow. 

Our room (a 2 queen bed on the 21st floor) was very comfortable, though the pillows were a bit too soft. It was clean, and they changed the linens every day. The decor of the entire hotel is pretty outdated and not pretty, but who goes to Vegas to be wowed by the rooms?

The staff was friendly, helpful, and very accommodating. The observation deck was just about the coolest thing we did while there, and you can go up as many times for free as you'd like when you stay there. The rides looked terrifying, and I'm not sure why anyone would go on them, but those that did seemed to have a great time. The shops in the little mall part were good, the very last gift shop all the way at the top was cheap and fun, and the alcohol was super cheap as well! Some of the pricing was outrageous, but that's to be expected in Vegas. 

Complaints:
- There was little to no pressure from the shower head in the room. It made taking a shower tedious and long. 
- The pool closed at 6pm during the week, 7pm during the weekend. This is just ridiculous in my opinion. 
- Not only did the pool close early, but the hot tub jets didn't work. Kind of pointless. 
- The lifeguards paid no attention, and the little kids running around unsupervised were just awful. 
- Table games had high minimums 
- Far from the rest of the strip, a cab to Treasure island was about $10 (not to mention the $3 fee just to use a cc), and to Mandalay Bay it was $20! To freemont it was about $9.

That's all though, and those were all things I could live with. Overall, it was a good experience, but next time I think we'll stay on the actual strip.

This last trip to Vegas was definitely fun. As us girls were not looking to spend much time in the hotel room we decided to go for cheap rather than extravagant. So we booked a room at Stratosphere via hotels.com. 

Upon arrival to the hotel we went straight to the registration counter, lines were not long at all and I was taken care of right away. As the girl was new she had management assisting her which I didn't mind. She got us our keys, gave me the details of the pool, restaurant, and things in the casino. We went upstairs to our room and it was a simple two queen bed room. I was satisfied. All we did in our room was sleep (which wasn't much)! Unfortunately we did not check out anything in the hotel except the Starbucks because we weren't there that often.

My only gripe was the towels, they were so linty that when I dried off all the lint from the towels were stuck all over my body. Yuck!

I was quite pleased for the price and if I needed to I would come back eventhough this would not be my first choice.

Hotel is at the very end of the strip which is good or bad depending on what kind of experience toy want. It's definitely nice to get away from the craziness and just be a long walk or CHEAP bus ride away. All the hotels in the middle of the strip are so packed, so I'm glad I didn't stay there. But there was no fridge, coffee maker, or fan in the bathroom.. the bathtub had some stains at the bottom. The room service comes from Roxys Diner that's down stairs so just get your butt up instead of paying more; I say this, because I wish I did. The staff of the hotel was super friendly and helpful.
This place smells disgusting, wasn't really clean rooms are old looking I did not enjoy my stay here.

I finally made it here after going to vegas about a billion times. I'm reviewing the top of the stratosphere part only so, beware. Anyhow, my wife and u finally made it to the top and it was incredible!  I started to get the willys,  something I didn't expect! Helicopters were flying at our level,  insane!

I stayed here for my birthday weekend (4\/01-4\/03) and was amazed how this hotel was simple to check in, they even let me check in two hours early for one of my rooms (I booked the oasis suite and a room attached). The rooms were renovated nicely for the price they offer it's a good stay.
I had a nice view of the tower and would see when anyone would bungee jump off. The service was great also, no constant hassle or bother like other hotels.
What I like abt my suite was that it had a pull out couch, king size bed, two plasmas, a spacious bathroom with a big shower and a jacuzzi bathtub, his & her sinks and the floors were marble. Great for those hot Vegas days!
Valet was always less than a 5 min wait, always were friendly and courteous.
I like this place because its budget friendly, it may be a little off the strip but it is simple, hassle free and really decent to spend a last minute vacation. Plus if you plan to go out and take a taxi, the line is not horrendous as the other major hotels are!
I would recommend staying here for a simple stay, this place is getting better :-)

I wouldn't stay here again, and I don't like that I had to in the first place.
Bed was hard and uncomfortable and I had trouble sleeping.  
Buffet made me sick.
Doors were paper thin and I could hear every breath in the hallway it seemed.  (I hear the walls are also thin, but our room didn't share any walls in common with other rooms)
"non-smoking room" leaked smoke smell through the bathroom vent.
The hotel is really far away from anything else and you spend a forture taking taxis to where stuff is actually happening which ends up making up for whatever you saved in booking a cheap room.

The room was clean and the staff seemed nice so that's a plus.  Also, our room had a very nice mountain view which was relaxing.

Die vorherigen Bewertungen haben sehr gut gepasst und deshalb schließe ich mich an.beim Check Inn hilft ein kleines 20,- Dollar Augenzwinkern und das Zimmer wird gleich etwas schöner.das Hotel ist ruhig.die Sauberkeit geht so und man sollte nicht zu pingelig sein.aber recht günstig.die beiden Busse fahren vor dem Hotel und man kommt gut auf den neuen und den alten Strip und zu den outlets.also überall! 
Ansonsten ist das Hotel recht einfach und wir waren hauptsächlich außerhalb.da bieten  viele Hotels bessere Infrastruktur.
Kleiner Tipp:Hawaian Burger aufs Zimmer ;-)

There are those times in life when you know you're getting the deal that is sold to you. www.takevegasback.com is not one of them!
I had the feeling from the beginning, when they lured me in. I gave them my details, and signed up for the Ace Rewards program, in order to get the advertised Unlimited Thrill Rides promotion.
Thinking the deal was too good to be true, I called and spoke with a Stratosphere representative, who assured me that I could cash in.
Please be warned: www.takevegasback.com is a scam that the dated property is using to get you in the door. 
Arriving at the Rewards desk and the Ticketing desk were completely unsavory experiences, as they are both staffed by some of the worst customer service employees in the business.
They are uninformed and unhelpful. The best deal they are able to offer is an $8.00 discount. 
I walked away without a penny spent in that dump.

This was my first time to Vegas and my first time at this hotel and it was a bad experience. This hotel is on the opposite side of "fun."  When we walked into the hotel they try to get you to sign up for this 2.5 hour tour to take you and show you their other hotels that they just opened - which sure they offer you a free stay at any of their resorts for doing this tour but seriously who wants to be bribed right when they walk in? We did put our names down with a $20 refundable deposit just in case we did want to do this, but in the end we wanted a refund - which took them 30 minutes to even find our name on their list and we had to come back 2 hours later to get our $20 back and they STILL tried to sell us ANOTHER deal - VERY disorganized and annoying! We were able to check in 4 hours before our check in time, which was very nice and for a VERY reasonable price, but we had to ask the front desk ourselves -  NO ONE told us we were able to do that, everyone acted like that wasn't even possible. The room was OK, I've gotten cheaper hotels that at least had a microwave and fridge in it. Unfortunately, within the first 30 minutes of settling into our room my fiance and I were trying to rest and a lady seriously knocked on our door TWICE and RIGHT AFTER she walked in!!! The pool was nice, but the Jacuzzi was dirty. I was not able to check out the rides- the lines for the ride were super long!If anything good came out of this experience it was the floor with the food and shopping area, it was pretty nice- the Mexican food place was on point; VERY fresh and yummy with a for sure reasonable price! I would NOT come back here again.

Best part of this place is of course the view. All else like the food & the politeness of the staff was lacking. What WAS the highlight was I had the opportunity to celebrate the wedding of a great guy & woman! I'm proud to have been a part of their wedding!

There were bed bugs when I stayed there! I was itching and had a rash the next day. I took a close look and there were black little bugs crawling!!! I had informed the manager at the front desk. They had housekeeping inspect it and they caught several!! I told them it was digusting and they said they could only offer me to move into another bed. I asked for an upgrade to a nicer room and they said they couldn't do it without me having to pay another $30 a night. I was so unhappy with their service especially when the bed bugs are in their hotel! It was gross and their service was worse. DO NOT GO THERE! It's also  far apart from the strip. What's the point of going! I learned to not repeat this mistake!

Decent experience. Room was a good deal on priceline. A little outdated, a ton of rooms, no window to open and a lot of walking. Nothing to write home about, nothing to really complain about. There was an old bag of chips that was opened still in the room and that was a bit of a turn off.

This is the shabbiest hotel I've stayed in, in quite a long time.
For starters, there's no shuttle service from the airport. I guess the Taxi Cab Lobby is strong, here.
The check-in at midnight took forever! Can't imagine why there was a line twenty people long to check in at that hour.
The room is nasty. The fan in the bathroom sounds like a B-17 ready for take-off. One of the previous occupants scratched his name into the window glass. There is a big flat-screen tv that doesn't fit into the old entertainment center, so they just put it on the desk. And the entertainment center is tragic and would be at home in any Thrift Shop.
I booked this place through Priceline.com Not worth even the cheapest price to stay here.Would not do it again.

I was SO AMAZED with my stay here. When trying to make my accommodations I had a few problems and was given false information from some of the staff. I then was transferred to Gene at Reservations and he was amazing. He got everything cleared up and made my stay the absolute best it could be. Fast service when needed and the room was beautiful. I will definitely be back in the future because of this helpful man. Thank you again Gene!

$39 on Hotwire, $49.68 with tax, for a Thursday night. Hard to beat for a decent hotel on the Strip.

Solid three-star class room. No major complaints.

I recommend staying here if you can get a room under $50 (Sun-Thurs).

When we checked into our room it reeked of marijuana, there were multiple dirty towels behind the dresser and a disgusting bloody looking carpet stain in the closet. We had to run to a show, but when we got back later that night we asked to be moved to a different room. When we went back in that first room to grab our bags, the smell was even stronger.

When we asked to be moved to a different room we were given a room with a toilet that barely flushed (sometimes it wouldn't at all), mold on the shower curtain, dust and filth on every surface in the room, and a room view of a wall\/building (so a view of nothing at all). We also found a camera battery charger and phone charging cable with a nice layer of dust on them behind the dresser. The vent of the air conditioning unit was full of dust (we decided to sweat instead of use that), and there was a thick dirty layer of dirt, dust and lint on the fire sprinklers as well. We were too grossed out after that and didn't look any further for fear of what else we would find. 

The Buy One Get One Free drink coupons you get at check-in sounded great until we tried to use them for the 20 oz. drinks we ordered at the Elation Pool. Apparently the coupons are only good for drinks 16 oz. and smaller, but you won't find that printed on the coupon or posted anywhere. You just have to know, or else you end up paying for both drinks at full price like we did.

The area around the hotel is sketchy. We only walked 2-3 blocks away from the hotel and were approached no less than 4 times by people asking for money or trying to sell us crap (like perfume, that some man at a gas station ran after us trying to sell.)

Do yourself a favor and do NOT stay here. There is a reason it is cheap, and you will not be pleasantly surprised. The only perks were the free admission into the tower, the BOGO drink coupons (on qualifying drinks), and the fact that I won $12 with the slot machines.

If I could give the stratosphere negative stars, I would! 
You have to cross the entire casino to attempt to check in!
Notice that I said attempt to check in, because there were 200 people trying to check in and Only 3 YES 3 Employees!!!

The Stratosphere has got to be one of the best values in Vegas. On the real. I booked a trip through Expedia, and my round trip cost for three nights and airfare was approximately $270 a person. Seriously, you can't beat that.

It's true, the Strat is on the far end of the Strip and quite the walk to all the true draws of Vegas. But, it has a great many benefits that I think make it a worthwhile hotel stay - not just including the price. The rooms are fairly basic, which might be a drawback to some, but I think it's to be expected considering its cost. Everything was clean, well maintained, and up to snuff. Really, if you're coming to Vegas to spend all your time in the room and you need frills and opulence, you've got different priorities than me. 

While it's true that it is not in the best looking part of town, I never felt unsafe or at risk in any way, even while walking my way to the main part of the Strip. Having said that, I wouldn't recommend making that walk because it's a LOT further than you think it is. Get a bus pass. 

Hotel staff were all friendly, courteous, and seemed to know their stuff. They had plenty of recommendations on restaurants, other non-gambling\/show things to do, and were very willing to accommodate any requests I had. They even watched my bags for the majority of the day on which I left as my flight didn't take off until 10pm and checkout was at 11am. For a small fee of $30, I was able to get a late check out of 3pm, but that still left me 7 hours to burn and I didn't want to lug my small backpack around.

The casino is definitely not as large as those further down the Strip, but the table games can be found with LOW minimums. I'm talking $5 blackjack. As someone who is not a huge gambler, I found this to be awesome and a great way to break yourself in. Plenty of slots too and more than enough eating options right in the hotel (although they may not be everyone's bag... I'll try to do separate reviews for those that I visited).

One additional perk of being a guest of the Stratosphere is being able to get to the top of the tower at no additional cost. The rides are definitely not my kind of thing, I don't even do rollercoaster that are on the ground let alone hundreds of feet off the ground on top of a tower, but the views from the observation deck and atop the tower are killer and can't be beat. Even if you're not staying here, I'd say it's worth the trip to get to the top at night and scope out the Strip from above. It might be even better on mind altering substances... not that I would know anything about that or those.

Yes, there are plenty of nicer, more expensive, more recently updated options in Vegas. But the Stratosphere suits me just fine and I had a great time there. For the cost, it can't be beat and I am sure I'll find myself staying here again in the not so distant future.

I stayed at the Stratosphere during a business trip.

The hotel is conveniently located right in between the strip and downtown, so you don't get the traffic and madness of either one. The neighborhood and hotel itself are kind of sketchy. I didn't feel unsafe or anything, but I wouldn't walk around at night either.

I stayed at the "renovated rooms" which are much nicer than the regular ones. They are at least updated.

The size of the room was fine, the beds are comfortable but I have a huge issue with housekeeping. I stayed there for 10 nights and even though they came and made my bed and replenish toiletries everyday, they NEVER, not EVEN ONCE changed my sheets or scrubbed the tub, they didn't sweep or mop the tile or anything. 

If I have a choice in the matter I would much rather stayed somewhere else. 
I also ate at all the restaurants in there and all of them are from mediocre to nasty. 

They say that you get what you pay for, this is totally true at this hotel.
If you are on a budget, I recommend the Golden Nugget (downtown)

We were in Vegas for 4 days and got this hotel to save some dinero. It's okay, it's away from the strip, but it's soo cheap! The first night was $30 including tax and everything! My boyfriend also won over $200 here which was pretty sweet, but of course lost it all. They have this cool restaurant on top, it's called Top of the World and you can see the panoramic view of Las Vegas..very pretty. The fitness center was a joke here, so please, don't bother working out. I say you make friends with people that are staying in fancier hotels, like Wynn, so you can get in :) I didnt check out the pool, but I heard it was renovated. The restaurants here were okay and room service was pretty good. We got the salmon omelette and the denver... Delish! :)

The view from the top of the Stratosphere tower at night can't be beat.  I could have spent hours up there just gazing across the valley.  You really get an idea of just how  big the Las Vegas metropolitan area is.  There's much more than just the strip and downtown that most of us are familiar with.

After the trip to the top of the tower, we caught the show "Bite".  It's a topless vampire show, and it was actually quite good.  It was much, much better than Crazy Girls as the Rivera.  Had a good time there.

Afterwards, we got something to eat at a 50's themed diner (but don't remember the name).  It was just so=so.  

Grabbed a fun book and played video poker for about an hour and a half.  Then a couple of drinks at the main bar before heading back South.  Not sure I'd want to stay here, but only because of the location.  It's way North on the strip and no monorail stop.   The nearest hotel\/casino is the Sahara, which is about two blocks away, but you encounter panhandlers along the way with their hands out harassing you and wanting money.  That can make a short walk pretty unpleasant.

Smelly, old rooms.....

My friend's friend told us we could bunk with him since we were taking a super last minute trip to sin city.  We were under the impression it would be somewhere cheap, but decent like Tropicana or TI.  Apparently he got the cheap part down, but def. bombed on the decent part when he told us it was the stratosphere.  It was too late to book a room somewhere else without putting a dent in our wallets, so thought ok how bad can this place be?  Now I can see why I always see cheap deals as low as 40 bucks for these rooms..

Room smelled like a mixture of stale cigarettes, mold, and funky butt.   The sheets were all pilled and I don't even want to think about if they were clean or not.  The decor is old and outdated, carpet looked nasty.  The hotel and casino in general is really old. Our view sucked, yay the parking garage.   Located on the BFE part of the strip, so far from anything good.  

Stratosphere would be promising if they at least revamped it.  Even Imperial palace is much better since they cleaned up that place and did some remodeling.

We had an awesome room, everything was super clean. Parking was easy to find but if you have a large truck careful pulling into the parking structure. The only bad thing about this place is the sketchy abandoned hotel\/apts that are right outside the guest parking structure. We only stayed for one night so didn't really get to see much in the hotel but they have a Starbucks in the casino and the skylounge was supper cool at night. It has the best view in all of Las Vegas and was free to get in. The happy hour was two for the price of one on drinks so that awesome  The pool on the 8th floor was cool too, and it's very family oriented.

I've stayed here for SEMA, I don't mind staying here but it is a step up from Sahara. The rooms here are usually one of the cheapest on the strip. And they give you a coupon book for places around the hotel and casino. 

They also have a club that is pretty good and if you're staying here, you get in for free. Any club that has a delorean inside is an awesome club. Don't forget the topless pool...

I wouldn't mind staying here again, if the price is right.

Ehh... not a flashy or super nice hotel or casino. Paid for the "upgraded" room but it was really what you'd expect of any hotel room these days. I'd hate to see what the basic room was. No breakfast. Poor wifi. No fridge or microwave. It's off the strip so you save some money- but overall, over priced.

This was the worst hotel and\/or customer service experience I have had in as long as I can remember. 

I did not like all of the add on fees. Early check-in, renovated room, boarding pass printout, one hour late checkout. Two bath towels for a 2-person King room. No coffee in the room. 

The hotel's location is terrible.  It is too far removed from the main action of the Strip and also far from Fremont St. That should make them more accommodating not less. We paid $20 for a newer room and immediate check in (on a slow Wednesday in mid-December). There was an electrical problem with the only light in our bathroom and we were told a maintenance person was in their way. 15 minutes tops I was told. We had time to look out at the worst possible view...9th floor staring at heating\/AC\/lighting for a great expanse ahead of us. Called down and the front desk said it had been 5 minutes when I said we had been waiting exactly 12 minutes. After 20 minutes we went back to registration. What's the point of paying to check in early if you cannot use the bathroom?  I was at a different person to change our room and he challenged me that we paid the extra $20 for a newer room until I got out our receipt. The housekeeper should have had the light fixed before it was made available. 

Our our new floor, there were many rooms being remodeled close to the elevator. There was plaster all over the hall carpets during our stay because there was nothing down to protect the floors. 

Our stay was, thankfully, one night only. At 8am there was very loud yelling. I popped my head of of our door and heard a woman across the hall, several rooms down with the doors closed to both her room and our room. The noise traveled as clear as a bell. 

Took the elevator to the top of the tower and waited where the sign said the elevator would come automatically. We waited 15 minutes for the elevator. Dozens of people were waiting and we could hear the elevator chime but had no idea where else we might go as there were no employees anywhere nearby to ask. After 15 minutes our door opened. It was an elevator that opened at both the front and back. The elevator operator did not open both sides. I asked what the delay was about and he just shrugged without a word despite being from the US. 

The service across the board was nonexistent and the practice of charging a la carts for everything is like nothing I have ever experienced. 

This was my 10th trip to Vegas in 9 years and I have visited many resorts both high and low end. 

The Stratosphere sets a new low.

If I could do zero stars I would!!!!! After a long drive to vegas we check in and we walk into a hot room with no AC! But not only that, we have a flooded bathroom with a blood stained sheet! It took the hotel over ONE HOUR to do anything and the assistant manager was no help what so ever!!!! I WILL NEVER EVER COME TO THIS HOTEL EITHER!!!!! I highly recommend not booking here!!!!!

This hotel\/casino has really become a dump. The rooms are dirty, security and the casino staff is very rude. The rooms are very dirty, dust everywhere, holes in the walls in the bathroom. The bath tub was 3 feet off the ground and you actually had to climb into it. Multiple times a day people in the casino attempted to sell us drugs. When we told security, the response was  "that's what happens in Vegas". Overall you feel unsafe and miserable staying or playing here. I feel bad for the guest who have children staying here. Will never stay here or visit again.

We made a reservation for the Stratosphere as part of a vacation package through expedia, and we requested a non-smoking room with a king sized bed. When we got there, the only thing they had left with king sized beds were smoking rooms, so we decided to upgrade to the newly renovated rooms, and we got a room on the top floor with a jacuzzi tub. The room was nice, and the tub was big. You do have to pay a resort fee, but it does not include free wifi, so for that you have to pay extra. The resort fee does include unlimited trips to the tower, but you do have to go through security to get up there, and you cannot take tripods up with you. 

I was unimpressed by the bars and the restaurants in the hotel and casino. There is a Starbucks right by the elevators, which was good. There are some shops on the upper level of the casino, but they looked very empty. The casino itself was not very smoky, which is nice since neither one of us smokes. 

The pool is nice. It wasn't very busy the entire time we were there. It's more of a lounging pool, so I think the deepest it got was 3 1\/2 feet. Unfortunately, it closed at 7pm, which seemed a little early to me. 

I would say the worst part of staying here, were the ladies at the information desk. Every single time you walked by, they hassled you. I'm guessing they were trying to sell the casino members club deal, but I never stopped to find out because they were so pushy and rude. I really think the casino should reconsider having their employees do that. 

Overall, we had a decent stay at the Stratosphere, but it would be a lot better if they fixed some minor issues.

We got a great deal at this hotel, or so we thought. The location of the hotel is not in a great part of town, a bit on the scary side. Parking is free and there is plenty. The check in was okay but we waited awhile. The room was out dated and not very clean. I was a bit grossed out but tolerated it as long as I could. We had booked for a 2 night stay but ended up leaving a day early because the room was pretty gross. The A\/c was loud and so were our neighbors. This was by far the worst stay in Vegas! 
There was one great part of our stay which is why I gave 2 stars. I really enjoyed the tower. You are able to visit the top of the tower for free as a guest and it was a lot of fun. They have rides on top of the hotel and there is also an amazing Vegas view. There are a couple of places to eat and enjoy the view. The pool was nice and not crowded. You can also bungee jump off of the top of the hotel for about $100 and it looks like fun. I just enjoyed watching other people do the jump. 
I would definitely recommend visiting for fun but maybe stay elsewhere.

Only stayed one night, staff was friendly, and very helpful! The room was very clean, ac worked great! My only complaint is the shower head was full of hard water deposits. So no flow through the head.

I'm a big Vegas fan and have stayed at plenty hotels both old and new.  We decided to try the new select rooms and we are pleasantly surprised how decent they were. We had a big a group of people both old skool and kids so we thought this was a good choice hotel because of its history. We know the Stratosphere is bit of a hike from the strip but it has its pluses. You can either eat in the hotel or walk a block or 2 to several fast food chains.  There are also several convenience & liquor stores as well within a block. Everyone in our group got a high level room (19th or 24th floor) and real non smoking.  All have views of the strip, the tower & sky jump and free unlimited passes to Tower with hotel key card. Check in was breeze, got there at 11am and there were 8 people at registration working.  Plenty of parking and unlike some other big hotels, the garage is close by to the elevators. Had lunch at Top Of The World and the food was pretty darn good. Yes, this is not a $300 plus range hotel with the snooty crowd.  Its a casual hotel with a mixture of friendly old and young crowd. It is a little bit noisy because its a crowded busy hotel but we loved our stay cause we knew what to expect!  Check out some pictures of the select room and give this iconic hotel a try :)

This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in here in Vegas or possibly ANYWHERE. 

The Room:  We paid for a room with a strip view. The first room we were given was comparable to Motel 6. The room was old, small, and outdated. The website only shows their newly remodeled rooms even though that is not what you get. Our strip view? Blocked completely by the legs of the stratosphere tower. After complaining we were moved to another room with a "view" and we're told we wouldn't be charged the view fee but still needed to pay $20 a day more for the nicer room. This room? View of the SLUMS and freeway and during our first shower, the shower head flew off and hit my husband in the back. Had to complain again. This time I was told we would be upgraded to a king spa room and it would be ready at 2pm the next day. Room #3 wasnt ready until 4:30 and we had to leave all of our belongings at the bell hop desk all day long until we could move. This room finally had a view of the strip. 

General Complaints:  The house keepers and people who work here are EXTREMELY LOUD. This is Vegas. People are trying to sleep around 8 am to 11 am. The maids and maintenance guys stand in the hallways yelling and laughing and doing everything they can to wake up the entire hotel. Want to sleep off that hangover? Hold on. Let me run the vacuum every 15 seconds while kackling like a witch outside of your door right next to your "Do Not Disturb" sign. 

The AC only goes down to 68 and the room NEVER reached 68 degrees. Also, the unit is virtually silent so it doesn't even help to block out the sounds from outside of the room. 

The ice machines are located on either end of each floor. The floors are HUGE. If you have a room anywhere in between, be prepared to have to hike for ice. Also, the ice bucket will allow for enough ice to make 4 drinks and it's metal, so your ice will melt within 30 mins. 

The ONLY positive things we can say about the hotel is the about the view from the top of the Stratosphere and the food at their restaurant, McCall's. 

DO NOT STAY HERE. PAY THE LITTLE MONEY MORE TO STAY ON THE STRIP AND TO GET A NICER HOTEL. IT'S NOT WORTH IT, HERE.

Not the best of neighborhoods around the Stratosphere. If you have to come or stay here, make sure you have direct transportation to\/from the hotel. Don't walk outside the hotel, especially at night.

Stayed here for the weekend on a Staycation with my husband. Great rooms. Lots of resturaunts to choose from with great variety. All the resturaunts give u A LOT of food. Great price plus gift shops and free tower admission. Would definetly recommend and be staying again.

This is my first time on to this venue. It was a suggestion from a buddy to get some great photos. It cost $20.00 to get into the observation deck. Once you get your ticket from the kiosk, you get into the line and they scan all you items. Cameras are allowed for photos. The staff will get you lined up for a photo and if you don't want one just tell them and you can get in the elevator to go to the 108th floor. This floor is enclosed and you can walk all around the floor and see Las Vegas like never before.   They also have the spot where the the people make the bungee jump down to the street level. You can watch as the are strapped in and make the jump. They also have a bar and a gift shop on this floor. If you want to get back in the elevator and go to the 109th floor and step out into the open air observation deck. On this deck you can feel the air and the site are amazing. You can walk around about three quarters of the top deck. The sites is amazing and the open area will make your heart beat a little faster. They also have three rides on this floor. One ride is a seated ride that takes you to the highest point and drops you down a few times. The second ride is a coaster car that sends you out past the tower and then brings you back and forth a few times. The third ride is two seats side by side and it looks like a large claw that opens up and spins you around. All the rides a about $15.00 each , but they do have a package deal for all three. The view is worth the price even you don't venture out to the open deck area. I would recommend this experience to everyone.

Went the weekend of 3\/21\/14 Friday and Saturday.. They told me... I was being upgraded it would only be $15-$20 more... which I thought okay not bad.... get there.... the room was on the 7th floor.... and it was just similar to a MOTEL 6... No Upgrades what so ever....     I don't mind... but my Daily Rate was $200\/night...which is Super Expensive for a random not upgraded room...also the sink clogged. 
. went to the Pool area...... on 8th floor.... it took us...in a Big Long Hallway thru a bunch of rooms...... took us almost 10 minutes to get there........ and no biggie...... 

Will not consider staying here again.... very disappointed.

I think this hotel is awesome and had the most comfortable beds. You get coupons well we did when we stayed and I really liked that. I thought it was really a great hotel because it has more to offer than just a casino. It was clean

We didn't stay at the hotel.
Just a quick tour of the casino floor and up the tower.

The casino floor was just too bleh for me. It didn't inspire or make you want to hang around.

When we got closer to the top they had a large look a like contest and that was amusing in itself. There were some impressive doppelgangers.

The hotel also isn't that close to anything, whether it be the main strip or the downtown area. That's a downer to say the least.

I have had no problems with this Hotel. They have done allot of remodeling the past couple years which has turned this place around., If you haven't been lately it's worth another try.

 If  your looking to party stay closer to the strip  because this is the last hotel on the strip costing about $15 for a cab to get where all the action is. But if that's not a concern and all you need is a nice room,pool, nicely ventilated casino, bars,and good restaurants then your golden here.

Lastly if you want to be a big fish in a small pond this is the place to gamble. I spent around $500 at the tables and the pit boss asked if I wanted comped tickets to the show, My whole trip I spent around $2000 and moved to V.I.P. status on the players club card, Which is good enough to get my business at least if  there going to get my money I might as well get treated like a king. I f you spend that kind of money at the larger hotels you can't get a cup of water.

I've stayed here a total of 3 times, and I'm not staying here again.
The first time I was 19 and I had a travel agent for my trip. The Stratosphere would not let me check in with out her presence...(after speaking to the manager) I was able to stay. The view was awful, and smelled of nasty smoke. The next time I stayed I was 22, and it was in January. I was pleasantly surprised and thought maybe the first time was just a bad night. Little did I know I just got Lucky. The 3rd (def. not a charm) I came back March 12, 2012 for my 23rd birthday get away. I ordered the deluxe strip view king bed.  I arrived on time at 3 pm. The clerk was acting weird, and really quiet.He says to himself the room is dirty, and walks off. He doesn't say anything else but hands us the keys. I go to the room, and it's a crap view with 2 queens.  Of course, I called the hotel manager, and yelped. She offered me an upgrade to the select suites, she says it has a nice view. I go down to wait in line another 20 minutes to get my new keys, I get to the room still NO STRIP VIEW even though I first bought that. Then I called to yelp again, and they said I could either pay an extra 20 or 50 to get the view in an upgraded suite. NEVER STAY HERE.
