Yes, she replies...then what is the upgrade if it is a standard room?  Is the upgrade the renovation?  The hotel at this point is on my get the hell out like in a horror film.  I ask for a non smoking room the room she gives me smells worse then the hallway.  The rooms are old and dingy, while housekeeping does a good job at keeping the room clean because it is so old is looks dirty.  This hotel should not be given such a high rating on any hotel search site.  It lacks luster and over charging for basically the same room at the hotel 6.  Other people Yelp are much to kind to rate the hotel at a 3-star....It really is worse.

When I vacation, I love going to the Stratosphere. I go to Vegas about 8 times a year (don't judge me) and each time I always pay a visit to the Stratosphere each time. I have stayed here in their hotel which is beautiful! The service is amazing however I did have a negative experience here with my boyfriend at the tower bar one time.

My boyfriend and I are an interracial couple so we decided to go up to the tower and check out the bar before we checked out the view. As we went to the bar the blonde Caucasian woman ask what we wanted since I wasn't feeling well I just requested water and my boyfriend requested Grey Goose and Cranberry. This woman gave me the most dirtiest look ever and made a snide comment towards me. Since I didn't order alcohol she ask to see my ID. She didn't ask the 20+ people there for their IDs but I'm okay that's weird. Then she looks at my ID and gives me another dirty look -_- and mad dogging me. My boyfriend ask me if I knew this bartender because she was giving me death stares...I'm like I have never seen this rude woman in my life so I was confused why she was treating a paying customer so rudely. She would smile at other patrons and didn't tend to us anymore after that. I vowed I wouldn't come back to the stratosphere and I haven't for over a year but since I loved this place I decided to give it another shot.

Recently my boyfriend and I went back to check out the view, bands and shows then we headed down to listen to live music and lord and behold it was the same blonde female bartender that was rude to us....however it appeared she managed to get the stick out her but and treat hard paying customers right. My boyfriend instantly remembered her and he usually leaves BIG tips but didn't leave her a penny but her service has increased for the better. 

I will continue to come back. Each experience has been phenomenal except one time but it got better :) I can't rate the Stratosphere nothing less than 5 stars!

Not worth the $84 extra it costs for 3 people to do the tram to the strip 3 days. I would save that money and pay extra to stay on the stripe especially if you have kids. Pool was gross with sunscreen! Cloudy ! Small rooms, no fridge .

Ok so I stayed here for the weekend and I really feel like I should've rolled around town with my luggage. I got there early and had to pay an additional $30 for early check in and resort fees. Ok I get that but $30 is a bit extreme when people check in early all the time. I got to the "only" room available and instantly started praying because I felt it would ruin my weekend. They gave me a smoking room and it smelled so bad I got sick and couldn't breath. I went to my friends room and stayed there until it was time for us to go to dinner. When I went to the front desk I was told "Well ma'am that's what you paid for when you checked in early". I couldn't believe that. I only was able to be in my room a total of 2 hours a day. I spent $345 for a room I simply could not stay in. I had 3 other friends who stayed here and after going to their rooms I felt punked!! My room conditions were embarrassing to my friends. By the way I never got my room cleaned the whole three days so I went to cvs to buy towels and face towels. I was very surprised by this experience.
Horrible Smokey place with smokey rooms for the price. The hotel is nice in appearance just the smoke!

This is the first place booked by my company to which I would voluntarily return. The rooms are clean and there's decent, cheap food above the casino on the 'R' level. I didn't try the italian resturant or 'upscale' resturants so can't say much there. The 50's style diner is decent, and has a graveyard special for $7 that looks like it could stop a heart.

The Strat is a little far from the strip, but the location isn't horrible and near downtown if you prefer the downtown Vegas scene over the strip. Plus if you're into it, there's the rides at the top, or you could just sit and enjoy the view up there with a drink.

The only bad thing on my visit was that tge pool cafe was closed at 3pm, and no where were the hours posted so I got all my stuff ready and went to the 8th floor to be very disappointed. Other than that, I would actually go back if I just needed a place in Vegas to crash.

We stayed here from the 22-24 of November. I paid roughly about $150 for two nights. I was unsatisfied with the bathroom, as the counter space was extremely limited, as well as the maid service. I didn't get asked to upgrade at the front desk upon check in like everyone around me. After seeing our families select room I was very disappointed with our room. HOWEVER I BELIEVE WE GOT WHAT WE PAID FOR. All the staff of the hotel were extremely friendly. The shops are fun and the food is good. If you don't mind being a little far from the strip I would stay here. The rides are really fun but buy your pictures during the day because they raise prices for pictures at night.

When arriving the entire casino smelled of heavy cigarette smoke.  The woman with a bad attitude at the check in desk pressured us on getting the $35.00 per night increase for a newly refurbished room that we were not interested in.  She then told us there was $47.00 a night resort fee that was never disclosed to us when booking the reservation that everyone is  charged whether you use it or not.  We asked to speak to a manager who was sarcastic, arrogant and condescending who just repeated the same thing over and over again and just charged us a resort fee we were never going to use.  He then purposely gave us a room with a window next to loud large outdoor mechanical equipment.  We asked to be moved and were given a room that we found out the next morning had a burned out hair dryer that didn't work and broken plumbing that would not allow the sink to drain at all.  We asked for another room and were told maintenance must be allowed to fix it first before we could be moved and would be there quickly.  After waiting more than an hour and a half they did not come, so we gave up and left.

The only reason this place is getting 2 stars is becuase if I ever reveiew Circus Circus, it would get one.  

This place seems dirtier than most other Casinos on the strip. If you are just looking for Cheap, then during the week this place may be what you are looking for.

If you want any comfort, I'd rather stay at the Hampton Inn or a Motel 6 if you are budget constrained.

It looks like they remodelled some of the Hotel so it also is not as bad as it used to be.

You get what you pay for kids. My friends and I booked a room here for CHEAP (for 5 days we only spent $300) and we weren't expecting much. They don't have free internet, the casino has a crap ventilation system so even though I was smoking (it goes well with my alcohol) even I was sick of always reeking like an ashtray. The smoking floors stink like it as well and none of the windows open for fresh air, which is disappointing. 

The food options are limited, it's at the north end of the strip away from everything, and the garbage on the street reminds you that the surrounding neighborhood isn't that great. 

Our first night some drunken idiots next door came back to their room and made one hell of a racket. The hotel handled them quickly and we didn't really have any problem with them after that. I will say that I felt like one of the more uppity individuals on our floor. There were several drunken fights between couples and one even had their kid in the room (all class baby) that we had to contend with. 

For what we paid I didn't expect much, however, the next time I visit I'll spend more to be in the middle of the strip and away from the toothless wonders I was surround by here.

Let me preface my review by stating we requested and paid additional for an updated room because we heard the older ones were pretty dumpy. The updated room was great. Very clean, pretty view and the staff was fine. The hotel is far from everything which sucks because the money you're saving by staying there you make up by taking cabs. By being a guest it gives you free access to the top which is cool. The view is great. Again, the 107th floor bar is ridiculously over priced, but that's Vegas. The casino is pretty boring, and so are the casino bars. If I could do it over, I'd stay somewhere closer, but overall not a horrible hotel.

We try to go Vegas every few years.  In 2005 we stayed at the Stardust and liked it. (I know, the Stardust, awww, and I'm only in my 40's)  For our trip in August 2011, we stayed at the Strat, mainly because it was the best deal we could find.  

Here's what I like about the Strat.  It's on the Strip, but less crowded and not as hectic.  You can park in the garage, walk to the the entrance, go down the escalator and around the corner to the elevator and up to your room.  It has all the penny and nickle slots we like to play, and you can usually get on a game and not have to wait.  The Hangover Game is AWESOME, and I won the progressive jackpot (ok, it was $408, but still....) The buffet is quite good,  a nice selection and there is an omelette station.  We like to go and explore, sometimes on the Strip, sometimes downtown at Fremont Street, so the location is central to both.  The pool is also awesome and quite a bit of fun.  The crowd is more laid back and easy going, not pretentious at all.  The tower is free when you stay there.  Go on a windy day and feel it sway and see how fast you want to go back down!

The surrounding area is a bit scary, and has deteriorated.  We paid $7 and took a cab to Circus Circus just to play it safe.  Many of the surrounding buildings are vacant or worn down.  More a factor of how the economy has hit Vegas than anything else.  I must say though that I always felt safe, especially in the parking lot and surrounding  area.  

The accomodations were ok in August.  A bit dated, but clean and comfortable.  And again, we paid about $48 a night.  I didn't notice a smoke smell like others have noted and  I didn't think that the casino was very smoky.  I'm a former smoker and I do notice and it does bother me, so for me it was fine.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The wait staff at the buffet are amazing.  Pedro was attentive and the one morning I wasn't feeling too well (too much time at the bar), and he made sure I had plenty of coffee to get me back to speed.  

We returned in October 2011, to meet with some friends.  I had recieved a couple free nights and was able to get a third free night  from my friend staying with me attached to my two free nights.  They gave us the more expensive weekend nights for free and added two more nights for $39 each.  A great bargain!  I requested the newly remodeled Central Tower and my room was very nice, with a view of the pool and a partial strip view.   The staff at the players club desk and at one of the bars remembered us from August (not sure if that was good or bad), but again very friendly and helpful.     

All in all, I think who you are with matters more than where you stay.  And with the right company, you can have a fun time anywhere.!!  Will definately be going back!

Stayed here recently for my boyfriends birthday trip and I had a really great experience! Lovely front desk girl named Maria (pretty hot too) was very helpful and even upgrade our room since it was my boyfriend's birthday! The room was clean and well taken care of. Furniture was a little on the dated side but for the price we got who cares! Clean hotel, great service, even won a little money at the Casino! All in all I will absolutely be staying there my next time in Vegas. Also they have a Starbucks and this AMAZING roof top bar. You can see the whole city and all of the strip with panoramic views and its free! I cannot say enough good things about my experience there so I hope someone from the hotel see's it, you guys rock! :D

Pros:
* Tower is pretty cool and must have for climbing. Good see on the city from it. Hotel give a $5 coupon for climb on the top. $15-20 cost for sky lounge attractions for one ride. 
* Buffet $17-20 per person. Good food choices: crabs, salads, fruits, deserts.
* Walgreens and cheap souvenir shops are near by the hotel.
* Big TV in the room.

Cons:
* Very small bathroom.
* Good AC but blows right on the bed, so not comfortable for sleep with it.
* Checkout was at 12am. But because of was lot of people on reception and works only 4 receptionist from 12. We've aware to late to the airport. So did checkout via checkout form pun dropped it in dropbox express checkout. Scared that could make some mistakes while filled out form, but seems was all good. Also as we known later we can do express checkout via TV in room.
* 2 swimming pools. But both of them are open and it's not good when over 100 degrees outside. So didn't get it.
* Water bottles in hotel are very expensive. You can buy it in Walgreens more cheaper.
* Internet in the room is not fast. On the 2nd we've got lot of connection troubles with it.

This hotel wasn't that bad. From what I remember it wasn't such a dud. It's a pretty decent size and the beds weren't uncomfortable to sleep in. The AC was pretty loud though and the interior design looked a little out dated but it's tolerable and not much of an eye sore. The buffet was okay, nothing outstanding but enough to choose from. I would say my stay here wasn't bad, great, or exciting. But it's a good place to stay and crash in for a few nights so you can check out Vegas, at least for the price.

Went to see the show Pin Ups at The Stratosphere, what a phenomenal waste of time. Claire St Claire cannot walk and chew gum at the same time. Also implants are so passe. The costumes were not even top of the line lingers. The dancers were adequate but nothing special. Every cliche was used, nothing original at all.
What really bothers me is that people that see this show are going to think this is Burlesque. Could not be further from Burlesque.
Do not waste your time and money on this show.
I am scared for Life. I have seen some bad shows in my travels around the world on a g string and this one was the worst!!!?
There's nothing really wrong with the place. It's clean and the pool is big, but it just seems so old and it's so far from everything. Only if it's really cheap.

I would give this 3.5 stars if I could. We stayed on the 19th floor, which had a nice view, but unfortunately the window was TINY! It was lots of fun going up to the restaurant and bar that they call "club 107." The menu was crazy expensive, $90 per person! So we left and went to eat at Roxy's Diner, which was a lot of fun. 

Overall, I enjoyed my stay a lot, the king bed was HUGE! I just wish the window had been bigger, but the tube was a pretty good size.

My husband and I stayed on an impulse last minute night in Vegas March 2012.  The rate was $15 a night plus tax.  Yes, you read that right, last minute rate of $15! So when we checked in, the sweetie at the counter - very friendly and helpful - was instinctively doing everything in her power to get us a free upgrade for our insanely low price.  We paid an extra $20 for a late check out so we could sleep in.  We had asked for a smoking room but as some sort of Nascar convention had taken all their smoking rooms she put us in a smoking room.  She told us if we smoked in the room nobody would do anything.  We did smoke in the room, and it was fine. We had a very nice room with an amazingly comfortable king size bed and an incredible view of the city.  The bathroom was immaculate with a jetted tub big enough for my husband and I to enjoy a night of romance.  As hotel guests we were able to attend the Stratosphere show "Bite" at a two for one price with a discount on drinks.  The drinks were yummy, (the bartender was incredibly friendly and helpful) the show was awesome if you are into vampires, tits, and classic rock (which my husband and I are, very much.) Included in our room were tickets to the top of the tower.  They take your picture before going up and later try to sell you overpriced photos of you in front of a green screen.  We did buy one 8x10 as a souvenier.  My husband isnt into heights, so we didnt stay at the top very long - but I loved it. After the show and a night out on the town, we enjoyed sleeping in, ordering room service, and watching Jerry Springer, and giggling over the "escort" section of the yellow pages.  (Affordable Asians, haha!) The room service wasn't the best or worst food, but it was affordable and timely, and allowed us a lesuirely morning in our room.  The stratosphere is affordable, the customer service is stellar, the show room is intimate and the production was surprisingly good for the price. The cons: location.  The hotel is located at the seedy end of the strip that smells like urine, surrounded by suspect people.  When you go anywhere I recommend taking a limo or cab closer to where the action is.  Don't try to walk anywhere outside near the stratosphere, especially late at night.

Ghetto?? Need I say more.. So when we first got checked in, we went to our room...We laid on the bed to relax after being on the road...after about 30 minutes of relaxing, we hear a knock at the door..but before my husband could open the door, a Mexican lady BUSTS into our room !! She started waving her hands around in the air and was speaking Spanish to us. We were in utter disbelief! So..if that wasn't bad enough, she picks up our phone, makes a phone call (to who, I don't know), she is speaking Spanish to whoever it is she is speaking to on the phone..She got off of the phone, said something to us in Spanish and LEFT! Me and my husband were really STUNNED.. So, once we got our bearings together, we called the front desk to complain. The girl that I spoke to apologized and said that she'd talk to the maid that came in our room. Ok..so the room...it was minimally clean..the porcelain in the tub was not sparkling..the decor was meh.. the room smelled musty. The price of the room was high IMO compared to other hotels in the area considering the quality of the room. So, to make matters worse..their were teenagers running up and down the halls ALL NIGHT..So, I finally call security (which I've never done in my life while staying at a hotel, I can bare some noise, after all it's Vegas, but this was ridamndiculous) they FINALLY responded to my call and when they did, they knocked on their door. (I can hear them) and they said "The folks next to you called and complained and said you were too loud. Please keep it quiet",  so all I could think is GREAT.. This dummy has now told these people who outed them! I would have preferred to be anonymous, especially me knowing nothing about who I am next to.  It truly could have been anyone that complained because they were just that loud...So  I asked if I could switch rooms after this, they told me that I couldn't.. I was like.."WONDERFUL" .  So we bared with it.. We had also asked for an extra blanket for our bed at one point...I kid you not, it took about 2hrs for them to bring it.. They woke us out of our sleep by the time they finally brought  it up... Also, the area surrounding the casino is SUPER shady..make sure you carry your switchblade with you if you plan to walk the streets in that area!!! The casino floor is nice here and the Level 7 club is classy, the breakfast buffet was decent. (We got free passes)  But I definitely wouldn't stay here again. I've stayed at less pricey places and had a much better experience. I'd go to one of the hotels downtown before I'd stay here again!

A great hotel for the money, and just minutes away from some of the flashier attractions Vegas has to offer. (Or, if you're like me and enjoy some old-school Vegas charm, it's very close to The Peppermill and Frankie's Tiki Room!) Clean rooms, extremely comfortable beds, and the hotel itself is nice and offers several lounges and bars. The view from Lounge 107 on the top of the hotel is amazing. I've been to Ghostbar at Palms and the Voodoo Lounge at Rio and their views don't even begin to compare! My only complaint is that the bartenders at C-Bar are EXTREMELY rude, especially if you take advantage of their "bottomless" happy hour. Watch out for the guy from La Puente, especially. He is on a major power trip. Expect attitude when you ask for anything, and to be barked at to bring your glasses back to the bar! Other than that, though, I've always enjoyed my stays at this hotel and would come again!

The staff is horrendous.  Not only are the bartenders unfriendly with zero social skills (and trust me, we tried every bar at the hotel), the security and managerial staff are completely incompetent.  My friend and I drove 12+ hours for our spring break adventure here after planning for over a month.  After enjoying ourselves at one of the bars, the bartender spilled 2 beers on both of us - soaking our clothes and our purses in the process.  Not a big deal. Accidents happen. But he then handed us a towel and asked us to wipe off the bar for him.  He also still charged us for the beers.  Confused at the level of customer service, we asked a waitress to speak to a bar manager.  In the process of waiting over 20 minutes, a drunk customer old enough to be our grandfather came over to us and began to tell us the the most disgusting and disturbing remarks I have ever heard.  This is happening while he has his arm around my friend, breathing down her neck.  Anyone with eyes, ears, or a brain could undoubtedly tell this was not okay.  But not the stratosphere staff.  Even as my friend made eye contact with the bartender and worded "help", he looked the other way.  It took 10+ minutes of this sexual harassment before a security guard finally intervened.  And even then, the security guard never spoke to either of us to make sure we were okay upon asking the man to step away.

After being traumatized to the core, the manager finally made an appearance.  Speaking to him was the biggest waste of time of our trip. As 2 young college girls with money to spend, you would think we are exactly the clientele this hotel would jump at the chance of having. Instead, he made us feel like we were the problem, and we were wasting his time.  He had the audacity to tell us that we should check out a night club, because that's just how it is, and we should get used to it.

At this point, we could not care less about spilled beer.  Accidents happen.  And even employees make mistakes on how to handle situations.  And in this sad world we live in, I acknowledge that disgusting people are undoubtedly going to appear from time to time.  But to have a manager make us feel like we were the problem of something so morbid instead of making our safety and comfort a priority is absolutely unacceptable. As a manager, the most basic of their duties is to at least validate their guest's opinion and experience.  After spending less than 9 hours in Vegas, my friend and I made the decision to jump back in the car and try to salvage the rest of our spring break back home - another 12+ hours away. 

If you have a daughter, sister, mother, or friend and are concerned about their safety at any level, do not allow them to stay at the Stratosphere.  

The only saving grace I can offer to the hotel is Brandon, the night manager.  He is quite literally the only employee that offered us the recognition and validation of what we went through with promises of further action.  He actually understands the role of a manager, and deserves to work at a better location than this nightmare of an establishment.

I wrote a review of The Stratosphere tower where I got married but I never wrote about the 2 weeks of heaven hotel experience I had with Chong. If it wasn't obvious already, Chong is not only my best friend for life but she is my secret lesbian lover. A secret so well kept even she doesn't know I refer to her as my secret lesbian lover.

We planned a trip to Vegas together as a very, very, VERY late combined birthday, New Years and bachelorette party. Since both of us had bank accounts with numbers that would convince any patron we made up the cast of the sitcom 2 broke girls, we chose to stay at the Stratosphere hotel for $40 a night.

First of all $40 a night my ass. The prices were in constant flux and it ranged from $80 to $125 explained as "convention rates". Like the rest of mankind, I for one, hate places that wrongfully advertise with fine print left for interpretation so I was no fucking happy pappi. 

It would have been one thing if the following events didn't transpire. But seeing as I'm writing about them, they did. It would have been another thing if the following events involved Chong and I hooking up, but seeing as I'm not writing about them, there is no saving grace.

We pay for our first night and my heart sank to my toes and out the horny layer (yes that`s a real layer) of my epidermis when she uttered the dreadful words "Can we get a room with 2 beds"? But hey, the fact that getting a big room with 2 beds for a low price didn't sound so bad so I had but one thing irrelevant to the hotel experience to complain about. 

We got a smoking room. Not just for smoking cigarettes but potato tomato hello ITS CHEECH AND CHONG in Vegas no fucking brainer what we were going to do. Everyone IN LIFE clearly had the same idea because we were only in the hallway and the whole floor smelled like pot. Awesome! 

There is no ventilation. The windows are sealed shut and the rooms are dusty even though I'm sure house keeping does a thorough job cleaning, at least I expect them to but then again, maybe they're just kind enough to replace the sheets and do a quick rundown with an old hoover. I became very ill and actually ruined our whole vacation. This didn't stop us from doing hawaiian smoke outs. 

At one point Chong was too lazy to leave and I was too sick to leave also so we ordered room service almost every night and watched Law and Order. It was heaven for me. The food is surprisingly good and affordable and convenient, but it's the same stuff as the restaurants in the casino of Stratosphere.... so that says something, but je ne sais quois. 

Deciding our room was bad luck we asked to switch rooms. We go downstairs, get new key cards and walk in. There are ruffled sheets and someone else's porn subscription playing on the t.v. still. Part of me wanted to stay in hopes she'd get turned on and jump on me but she did the opposite and screamed "ew" about a million times, ran out to the elevators screaming "come on cheech, we're not staying in a room that might have someone else's JiZz on the bed" 

=( "ok" I muttered and followed her to ANOTHER LONG trip to the lobby. Told em what happened and actually got a brand new amazing room that was part of the newly constructed wing.

So all in all. That newly constructed wing is the only thing keeping this four star review afloat. Oh, that and the room service. OH and also....my memories with Chong *sigh*

The absolute worst hotel where we have stayed. Checking with Cory from Long Beach couldn't be any ruder. Claimed the room we booked and paid for 10 months in advance was not available. Would not appologize and appeared to care less. We spoke with a manager who accomodated us but why couldn't Cory?
The room looks like something out of 1970 without any updates at all. There is a hanging light with a chain down the wall-seriously! No room safe and plastic cups wrapped in more plastic makes me start looking for the hookers. Motel 6 has better rooms and free wifi.
Avoid this hotel at all costs!

What a bummer! Going to Vegas in a few weeks and was hoping to stay at the Stratosphere again. I've reached out to them multiple times over the last few days to get some questions answered and have had NO RESPONSE. I stayed here a long time ago and enjoyed it, but if their customer service is this poor before booking a room, I cant imagine what it will be like after.

Earth to Stratosphere, Earth to Stratosphere, Come in Stratosphere, Do you read me? Over...

We stayed here for labor day weekend 2015. I had one great experience here i.e. casino table games were cheaper  than most other casinos.  Besides that, it was a nightmare dealing with the staff. 

1. We checked In at 2 am and since they were already fully booked, seemed like the manager (Brenda) and the reception lady (Courtney) had forgotten their manners and didn't care too much for their guests. Rudest customer service EVER. except for Barry, all both these women left us fuming and frustrated. 
2. We had an advanced booking via Expedia for FOUR people, but were given one Queen bed and were asked to  cancel the reservation if we couldn't adjust by Brenda. So BEWARE when you book a room with them.
3. Because we booked via expedia.. we were treated like some cheapsters who were there begging for a room.. apparently third party booking isn't classy enough. 
3. They (starbucks) in the casino charges for water. 
4. The housekeeping lady said we would only get one extra twin blanket (as they allow only one blanket per room) so the fourth person would have to do without one. But then another woman there sent us a queen blanket when we continued to BEG.

The trip started with hiccups and left a sour taste in our mouth but Vegas obviously has a lot to offer. Three stars are only for Anthony on the black Jack table. BEST dealer ever!! For everyone else I would give negative rating if I could.

I hate to say that if it were not for a hosted event, I would not have stayed here.  The location is very limited in options outside the hotel.  I was given a room in the "newly renovated" area.  It was nicer than other areas of the hotel but I don't think they know how to use a mop in the bathroom.  This is one of those hotels where you ask for extra towels for the floor so you can walk barefoot.

I would not recommend this hotel unless you had no other option.

This was the first hotel we stayed at in Vegas and we were such rookies to the Vegas game. However I will always have a special place in my heart for Stratosphere because they were so accommodating and the rooms were so great. Really the main detraction from the place as most people will tell you is its location. It is so so so so so far away from the main attractions of the strip. Really if you can get anyone even a few blocks closer it's a better experience. To top it off we thought it was a good idea to walk to all the clubs from where we were staying here. 

It's not worth it. Yes we were younger then and you are college students or can deal with walking a mile and half in club attire then go for it. We always see a brave duo or group making that trek from the desolate location of Stratosphere to the strip and we always wish them luck because we never know if we will see them again. And when you are making that walk it just seems like the hotel is getting further and further away. 

The stratosphere is itself is really nice though and they usually have availability all year so if you are in a pinch and need a place to stay in Vegas on short notice it's not bad. Their staff was really nice and they have constant taxis there because they know people are trying to get to the strip. However be prepare for about 20 to 30 dollar taxi ride each way because they won't take the strip for good reason so you are going to be paying for that convenience of getting there. Also since UBER hasn't survived in Vegas you really don't have an option 

The revolving area near the top is also really amazing and breathtaking views so if you are staying there you should make time to go up and see it as well. If you are deciding to stay here you might as well get your moneys worth. 
So really the stratosphere is a great hotel that is located in an unfortunate spot. IF the strip was down there it would be a top option but until that area grows or something miraculous happens it is just too far to be a top choice for anyone coming to Vegas.

Is it the same 5 stars as a Bellagio or Venetian review? Perhaps not but its 5 stars because of the quality, value and experience...

I am the first person to be able to find a reason to complain or find a fault in service, quality or just experience overall but I cannot with this place. 

The stratosphere is amazing and I'd come back in a heartbeat 

I spent Friday thru Monday and had the best time ever in Vegas. It's located exactly in the prefect spot. 

Service was amazing, room was everything I expected the price was spectacular and the fun was non stop

Go to the tower, top of the world restaurant, level 107, Radius... Really the Stratosphere has so many hidden gems and amazing attractions it's hard to beat. 

No overpriced trap like strip hotel, but close enough that you can get to the strip in less than 12 minutes even in traffic. 

I LOVE THIS PLACE I can't get over how happy I am, I've had nonstop fun and good meals and deals everywhere. My gf is super happy (it was her first time) 

If you stay here eat at El Nopal Mexican restaurant for breakfast and late night, it's a money saver that will satisfy you craving every time, staff is fun and friendly.

We never gamble but had luck at their slots ( we betted $20 and made $50) it was fun and my gf definitely had a rush even though she tried to get me to cash out every time I hit a bonus haha the place across the street had pretty decent Pho if you're into Vietnamese food. 

Overall this place is a winner!!!

I'll start with the good: 
Clean rooms, friendly registration staff, pretty quiet, and not as smokey in comparison to other strip casinos! 
The bad: 
It's frustrating that at the rate  you pay you don't even get free wifi. This could be the only hotel on the strip that doesn't have it! Ridiculous. 
No coffee maker in the room, a lot of vegas hotels are the same, but it would be a nice perk.
Far from the main casinos on the strip, so if you plan on walking, wear comfortable shoes. 
The advertise free entrance to the tower. It is a bit misleading, because everyone thinks that includes the attractions, it does not!!! 

For a $16 resort fee, they can at least pay for your WiFi. Instead they give you cheap shampoo. (you're paying for that).

First of all, I will say I would not be staying here ever again and anyone I accociate with will know of this horrible experience. I arrived here and before even checking in my girlfriend and I hit the casino floor. We gambled for about 3-4 hours, after we checked in and got our assigned room. They told me rooms were pretty full and over booked so I couldn't have my king size bed which I booked a month in advance and had to be on a low floor far from elevators. I accepted this and figured ok I can live with it. I was wrong!! When we got the the room both of us were exhausted from the flight and the gambling, drinking. We entered the room and the A\/c was on full blast, the room was an icebox, so immediately switched the heater to full because I was freezing. Come to find out the heater blows nothing but more cold air and loud as can be. I went downstairs again to registration and notified them. They said probably nothing could be done until the morning they could see about repairing it and if not switching out to a different room. I said to forget it, I want a different room tomorrow, I'll pay extra. The concierge obliged my request and charged me more money, said to come back at 11am the room should be ready be then. So we hunkered down for the night, used every blanket we could find, which unfortunately all smelled moldy, and the entire non smoking room smelled like smoke, and slept. Next morning work up with a headache and sneezing from the terrible night. Dying of thirst in the night from the mildew, dry freezing air, Hit the vending machine, there was not even one bottle of anything to select, the ice machine output nothing, had to go to a different floor. Next morning wanted to get a workout and power through the sickness, come to find the gym was a joke. Most machines out of order and the one working treadmill had a line out the door, so that was a no go.

Then finally went to the registration again at 2pm and asked to speak to the manager to give feedback, get my new room and hopefully reach some resolution and found none of that. I spoke this whole story to the manager about how they are a Las Vegas resort on the strip and this is my experience, she didn't even have the slightest empathy or not even a sorry. She just looked down on me like I was bothering her and she tells me "oh well I've refunded you the resort fee for the first night" that's all I'm going to do. Oh and the room you reserved is not ready yet until 3pm, when I asked why she said the guest staying here asked for a late checkout and we can kick him out. I said well the guy yesterday should have told me it could be until 4-5 pm after cleaning. Whatever. This place is far from a resort, I think the motel next door probably has better accommodations. Coming from someone who works in customer service. This is a horrible way to do business and expect repeat customers. I hope more people will read this and think twice before staying here.
Kinda grungy. Some very questionable outside and inside patrons. Center bar was very affordable. Bartender very friendly. Not a lot of options other than gambling.

Awful. Dirty tiny room. Charges a hidden resort fee. I just wanted a cheap place to sleep for a few hours while i passed through. They ran out of rooms and "upgraded" us... Instead of the king size bed we got two queens.... Not an upgrade.

Its so lame that everytime I go in here, pass by it, talk about it...I think of the old British lady that I played w\/ in a poker tournament there where she flat called a raise and big reraise by me when I held QdQh and her Kc2c.  She obv flopped trips to knock me out.  So yeah...Stratosphere = K2.  This happened a jillion years ago and I connect the place w\/ that hand! I'm so lame.

HORRIBLE!!!  I thought that because it advertises on the "strip" it would be stylish and fun!  HORRIBLE mistake Filthy rooms, looks like a motel.  Our TV didn't work, the bathroom was disgusting.  The furniture looked like it had been there since the place was built in the 90s.

Very bad part of the strip, which I didn't even know there was a bad part of the strip!  I would rate this place on a scale of 1 to 10 and 10 the best, this is a BIG MINUS 5!!!!

Please don't waste your time.....and don't believe that this is a "special price" for a resort.  Really is more like the worst type of run down MOTEL, I would not even say it is Motel 6 standard......

My first time staying here, first of all we were told that the rooms were remodeled which it didn't seem like it. They were clean, however there was no fridge nor coffee pot! Just your average motel 6! Over priced, $430 for a weekend....too much!! The beds were so uncomfortable, the pillows were very small and uncomfortable as well. The casino smelled a lot like smoke, allergies kicked in quick! 

Will I stay here again?.....NO!

I can say, I need to give this a negative star.  No fridge in vegas hot 100+ degree weather.  No coffee maker.  Water pressure was horrible.  Toilet flushes too loud and wakes up everyone in the room.  Shower head is from ancient 50s.  Customer service at the front desk never picks up any of our calls.  House keeping is rude.  "We don't provide coffee maker or no mug here!"  Quote in quote from house keeping.  

I have never been in a hotel with such negative experience.

I like it at Stratosphere. I definitely think that if you are on a budget, this is probably one of the best options for you. I really have to say for $50 to $70 per night, it really is very well worth it. It has tons of things to do within the building. 

+ Quick check in during the afternoon. The agent was very nice, helpful, gave me good advice, and I had a very pleasant experience. 
+ The buffet was surprising good. Not extremely extensive but just the right amount of food for me to feel very satisfied, happy, and full. The man in the front gave me a tip to use a certain coupon and I got All You Can Eat for the entire day for just $20!! (Make sure to look in your coupon book they give you when you check in, its the last coupon in the back of the book).
+ Included fitness center, which was exactly what I needed. Machines were a little old but they worked well. I loved having free weights as well. (At the Wynn, its $30 per day to use their fitness center- go figure!)
+ As a guest, I had unlimited free access to the top of the Stratosphere Tower, while everyone is charged $16 per visit! 
+ Beautiful 360 view of Las Vegas, mountains, etc. I loved it!
+ Starbucks in the lobby. 
+ Very accommodating staff in all parts of the hotel. 
+ Cool little arcade in the mall area. 
+Comfortable room, very basic. 

- Surprising, what I didn't like the most was that the bathroom products. They are made by a company called ECOFRESH Naturals. The claim to be natural but all the products are filled with tons of harmful and synthetic chemicals. All the products felt super cheap and were really drying on the skin.  

It seems like it is quite far from the other main hotels on the strip, but I am staying at the Wynn for the next 2 days so I do not mind. I will be closer then.

I booked 2 roundtrips flights, and 2 nights at the Stratosphere on Expedia before really knowing anything about Vegas, or the strip, or the location. It was a super good deal so I went for it. 

I did some research afterwards and saw mixed reviews so of course I was a little nervous going in. I was pleasantly suprised! Obviously this isn't a fancy, luxurious resort type place. BUT - the employees were all really friendly and welcoming and helpful. We checked in a the front desk after waiting in a line for maybe 10 minutes (not a big deal - to be expected at any big hotel) and the man who helped up was great. I was suprising my friend with balloons and champagne in the room when we walked in and he saw that I had an alert on my account about it, and called room service right away to get them to deliver the goodies to our room. Unfortunately we walked too fast and got to the room before room service did (they showed up 5 minutes after we did - oh well).

We gambled at the slot machines a little bit which was fun. The space is big and slightly confusing but there's multiple bars throughout so that's a good distraction. I won $25 at a machine and we were offered complimentary drinks while we were playing. 

The room itself was simple but clean. The beds were comfortable and clean. The bathroom fan was loud but oh well, it didn't bother me. The shower had amazing pressure and got really hot. It was small but what do you need really? Just a toilet and shower, right? There's a seperate sink\/mirror area where we got ready, brushed teeth, etc. Just enough room for 2 people.

We went to the rooftop pool\/lounge area on Saturday afternoon and Sunday afternoon. We snagged the round padded lounge beds and enjoyed the people watching. There were all sorts of people there - kids, seniors, dressed up girls, middle aged couples, etc. Fun to watch. The drinks were good - I got a pina colada and mango daquiri and my friend got a vodka tonic with sugar and lime. They offer free towels and the bathrooms are nice.

My only problem is how far away from the other stuff I planned. This may have been my fault since it was my first time to Vegas but everything is at least a 20 minute $20 taxi ride away. I wish it was slightly more central but overall, it was a great experience.

I'm giving 4stars considering how cheap it is. We stayed for one night only. The room was quiet, clean and spacious. The tower has magnificent views, I wish they allowed tripods up there though. It's not in walking distance to the strip hotels but you can't walk everywhere anyway. We drove to caesars and parked there and then walked the strip. I haven't checked the pool

My husband and I have stayed at the stratosphere many times over the last 15 years. We don't particularly like being in the craziness of the strip so for us it's nice to be a little away. This was the first time we had so many issues with our room. To start off we never get a basic room, we always upgrade to suites since it's so much cheaper than other hotels. Let's start off with the first room we were in, we walked in to stained carpet, then then bathtub had black mold all over the caulking, and finish off with a toilet that didn't flush. After calling downstairs it took about 3 hours to get another room and that was only after they sent housekeeping in to see if our complains were legit...took 45 minutes for them to show up! So now we lugged all of our luggage back down to the lobby to exchange keys for the new room key. Walking into the second room we were once again greeted by that horribly stained carpet. This time there was no mold in the tub thank god and the toilet worked. The bathroom however didn't seem to be cleaned as there were pubic hairs on the wall of the tub and the floor had gel or something on the floor. It was clear it wasn't going to make any difference if we changed rooms yet again so I cleaned the tub myself and just dealt with it.

Not really worth the money. It was $50+ 17.99 resort fee. AC was really bad and loud. I can hear when my neighbor uses the restroom. Didn't get help from their staff. When I check in, the staff didn't give a professional smile what so ever. With the booking of the room, I receive unlimited tower admission. However, no one said anything about this until I found out myself when I check out. Wow! Btw there is no coffee maker in the room so no hot water or hot tea during this kind of cold season. Wifi is stable but there is no signal in my room. I couldn't even make a phone call in my room. Will never come back, worst than a motel.

This review is only for going up the main attraction, the Stratosphere tower.  We did not stay here.

Definitely worth paying the money to go up in the tower.  You can see all of Las Vegas.  We went during the day, but I bet it would be even neater at night. The bar up there makes delicious mango margaritas.  Try a frozen one with salt, totally worth it.

Worst hotel ever!!! Stand in check-in line for more than 1 hour at 12 in midnight then they will behave they are doing favors by giving you a room although you have paid for the room already. We booked a Deluxe room for a night. After spending a night in that shitty room I forgot what is the meaning of deluxe ? The carpet was dirty, the room seems to be a storehouse some how beds, cupboards and a tv were given so that guests don't complain. The worst was washroom .. Smelly and shitty .. Dustbin was not cleaned also .. It had hairs and others' shit.  It was a complete fucked up room. While checking out if you ask them they will smile and say while booking you should have read the description. 

What the fuck !!!  Simply CHEATED.. What an heights of Attitude... Don't recommend to anyone.. Please sack those crew n managers who think they are god n customers are beggars.. I have paid bloody $120.00 for that room n expect to get decent behavior n a clean room.. Am I asking more ??? Please correct me or correct them.

We were looking for a large arcade that we heard about by word of mouth.  We thought it would be at the Stratosphere because they boast about a 17,000 sq foot gaming center.  But their wording online is really misleading.  They have a large mall and casino in their facility that they are counting toward their 17k sq footage.  The actual arcade portion is only about 900 sq feet and they have about 15 different arcade games.  It was a total let down.  Plus most of their boring games cost $1 per play.  Don't come here if you're looking for an arcade.

I stayed at the Strat and was pretty pleased.

POSITIVES
- Low table minimums
- Easy to get comped (I got a free buffet super-fast betting minimum bets at a $5 table.)
- Nice staff

NEGATIVES
- I got a hot tub suite, which was great, but there was mold underneath the soap dish, and excessive dust in the air vent.  How does housekeeping not clean\/replace these things, especially in a suite?
- The casino floor has a distinctive smell that you may not love.  (It's better than, say, the Riviera, but not as good as the Venetian.)
- No great dining options onsite.

The mix of people at the strat was just that, a mix.  There were straight-up ghetto people, well-off people, and a surprising number of foreigners.  There were also what seemed like roving groups of foreign men hoping to hook up, but no ladies to reciprocate (that I could see).  I felt bad for the dudes; hopefully they took a cab to a location with better odds.  (I think the Strat is not a great place to meet women...)
Ein Starbucks zwar wie jeder andere allerdings der erste ohne Sitzplätze und ohne W-Lan und ohne Restrooms. Daher nur 2 Sterne.

Check in was painful over 1 hr wait.  7 open wickets,  no staff. 
Room looking tired with holes in carpet and paper thin Walls. 
Bed is hard.  Not firm...  Hard. 
Housekeeping socks.  Left room at 9:00 am came back at 6:00 pm on a Tuesday.  Room not cleaned.  Called  Housekeeping and was told the clean the rooms 24 hrs a day.  Talked to front desk manager and was told they may not even clean your room every day and that is normal for Las Vegas hotels.  I've only been coming here for 30 yrs so what do I know. Btw it's 9:30 and still no maid. 
I will never stay here again.

This January me and a hfew friends stayed at this pile and i have to tell u it wasnt the best.  For starters the area the "resort" is in makes you feel as though u could be involved in a drive by at any moment.  Second the food was gar-bage.  A bonus for this place though was Polly Esthers.  This was a fun club witha hell of a 40 all u can drink deal whick worked well for all the alky's i was with.
Overall cough up the extra coin and stay elsewhere

On my Las Vegas Trip the Stratosphere was on my list of landmarks. As we arrived I noticed its one of the older buildings at the end of the strip. Once inside it was confirmed, still a nice place to visit however it's not too modern. I would definitely check out the top of the tower and get on the roller coasters. (I recommend the Big Shot!) The shopping Venues aren't too interesting nor visually appealing. I'd definitely check it out for the views!!!

Smokey hotel.

The hotel rooms are nice and value for money.
Located adjacent tobtje bulk of the Vegas strip hotels, however not close enough to travel by foot.

The big minus is the awfus smell of smoking everywhere.. not for non-smokers.
Observation deck an amazing view of Vegas, especially at night. And the rides terrifying especially the rollercoaster but fun

I just stayed in the Stratosphere and it was definitely worth it! The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. We had drinks in the lounge at the top of the tower during happy hour and the martinis were really good. It was also fun to watch the sky jumpers and the view was amazing. We also ate at the buffet downstairs which is a really good deal. They have a really nice spread of food and even the coffee was good. Overall I had a good experience and will be going back.

Well let me tell you. We  have stayed here twice before and had a very nice stay. This time was so different!   We got here no problem with check in. Got a good deal for staying here before. Paid a low price for one night, second night free. When we got to our room...very nice until I smelled smoke. I called the front desk to complain that I specifically asked for a non smoking room and there was an obvious smoke odor. She told me no problem will send someone to spray room to purify smell. That took 1 1\/2 hours for someone to do that who was spraying for 5 seconds then leaves. It did help but we could still smell faint odors of smoke. At this point I didn't want them to come back to use an air purifier if the sprays didn't help. Had a great evening with my husband eating out and having fun...here in town to celebrate our 22nd anniversary.  Next morning,  left the room at 10 am, went out for the day, come back @4pm so we could get some rest then get ready to go to the top of the world restaurant and celebrate our anniversary.  We notice the need service sign we put on the door when we left was still there. We walk in and no one has come to clean our room! Very upset at this point.  I call and complain again...seriously  we were gone 6 hours and our room wasn't even cleaned? ???? I feel that is more than enough time for some one to clean up our room. I told them..forget it! Just bring me towels and toiletries...and someone actually came by in 10 minutes. What upsets me the most is that no one showed any care or concern. .they were just so matter of fact. No one said Sorry!!! I ended up canceling our reservation at the top of the world restaurant.  I spoke with Will who was the only one who gave me his name without asking,  offered to give me a later reservation and actually cared! I just said no thanks just need to cancel. I have been to the top of the world restaurant twice before and the staff and food were fabulous!  After all is said and done. ...what matters most is that I'm here in Las Vegas with my best friend and hubby of 22 years....just have to make the best of it. One thing for sure, will never stay at the Stratosphere again!

Hotels are the opposite of people in that you can take the ghetto out of a hotel, but you can't take the hotel out of the ghetto.  Alright, that's a little harsh, but let me explain: my first stay here was in 2006 and the changes that I noticed during my recent stay were substantial.  

Yea, I know changes would take place during a 6 year gap, duh, but the hotel rooms are significantly better, much nicer than I expected for the price.  The guest services are also terrific: fast\/friendly check-in and they even helped me get an electric-scooter rental.

The casino is okay, not a bad place to get in some low-to-moderate stakes gaming, but your experience, particularly at tables will be dependent on other guests and customers.  And that's where my ghetto comment comes in, the Stratosphere neighborhood (technically on the strip, but not really) isn't the nicest and you will see a lot of ghetto folks walking around the casino.  BUT you'll never feel unsafe, and that's a big credit to Stratosphere.

The biggest drawback to the Stratosphere is that, again, its not really on the strip and you can't really go other places without taking a cab, which will run you about $15-$20 per ride to the strip hotels.  Doesn't sound like much, but if you take a cab during the day, come back and change and go back out at night, that can be up to $80\/day and cut into the good value of the hotel.

I'm surprised at all these terrible reviews, Stratosphere is a wonderful hotel at an amazing price! We stayed in one of their suites and I have to say my expectations were exceeded. Masheika our check in agent was phenomenal and made the process so easy at 2am. I ordered room service and it was delivered within 15 minutes. Overall I will certainly stay here on my next visit to Vegas! I'm super high maintenance so you can feel at ease trusting my review :) I can only speak for the suites though not sure what the regular rooms are like.
ventilation is not so good. you will smoke a pack of cigarettes before u get to the elevator. Also the rooms are not refurbished

A review for the tower and the casino itself. The Casino itself is ok, an older casino that is screaming for a remodel! The games inside are ok, payout seemed so so.
In regards going up to the top, that is well worth the money, and if you get the American Casino Guide book they have a 2 for one coupon in the book that will save you money there!
Personally, I would NEVER EVER EVER go on any of the rides on top of the Strat, but to each their own! They have a Bungee Jumping experience, a thing that circles around while there is thousands of feet below you lol, and a roller coaster as will as the extreme scream which will shoot you even higher up- Umm OH HELL NO THANKS! lol

Room was okay except for the a\/c got hot every night after 12pm local time like it was on a timer. 
You have to walk through the the casino lobby to get to the select elevators that were really quick. The casino and lobby was like putting your head in a huge ash tray. Don't let the coupons they give you at check in fool you. They're good for nothing but trash. The vending machine on the 12th floor took my money but the machine was replaced the next day and it took a week to get my $$ back. Other than that it was a place to rest my head. It's a good idea to buy public transportation tickets right outside the casino lobby to get anywhere or you'll be walking. A good 30 minute walk to the fashion show mall, the central strip location. Try Roxy's diner, it was good bang for the buck. Enjoyed it. The McDonald's on the "r" floor above the casino was very convenient but it's 2 1\/2 times a normal McDonald's prices. They have a few shopping stores on the "r" floor but nothing to get excited about unless you like head shops and cigarettes. I wouldn't stay there again because I'm use to higher standards like the Venetian, Bellagio or Luxor.

Wir waren im August 2014 dort.
Ausschlaggebend war der Preis, der unglaublich günstig war. Da ich im April 2013 bereits 2 Tage in diesem Hotel verbracht hatte, kannte ich die Zimmer und die verschiedenen Kategorien.
Durch den "20 Dollar-Trick" erhielten wir ein Top -Zimmer, das vor kurzer Zeit frisch renoviert worden war. Dieses Zimmer war super.
Das Casino selbst ist ziemlich unspektakulär, aber zum Spielen gar nicht so schlecht. Super ist, dass der Eintrittspreis für den unbegrenzten Zugang zum Turm im Zimmerpreis inbegriffen ist.
Im Casino gibt es unterschiedliche Gastronomie, vom Buffet über ein 24 Stunden-Diner-Restaurant bis zu Starbucks etc. Sicherlich gibt es tollere Hotels in Vegas, aber für eine Familie mit Kindern ist dieses sicherlich eine gute Wahl.
Die Parkgarage ist, wie in Vegas allgemein üblich, kostenlos. 
Den Poolbereich hatten wir uns vorher im Internet bereits angeschaut und hatten leichte Bedenken, da dieser auf den Fotos im Allgemeinen nicht so schön aussieht. Diese Sorge war jedoch unbegründet, da wir im Nachhinein den Pool sehr nett fanden. Im 8. Stock gelegen, gibt es dort natürlich nicht viele Bäume etc. Aber es war während unserer Zeit niemals überfüllt, sondern man fand immer eine ruhige Liege, was ich selbst in deutlich teureren Hotels in Vegas bereits wesentlich anders (überfüllt, dadurch ungemütlich) erlebt habe.

I had made a reservation specifically for a strip view room. When I got here I was offered a smoking room. I said that's not possible due to health issues. Then they offered me 1 bed despite there being a total of 3 people. 

Now I'm in a craptasric room "premiere"? Premiere what? Premiere Vegas a$$hole view? 

The least they could have done was upgraded my room. I would have accepted whatever view I had to take with a better room. 

Will never ever stay here again based off the crap customer service alone. The only reason I am staying is cause I had my credit card already on file and paid for some of my stay when I booked.

ND - August 12 2014

This is probably the most messed up booking I have ever done. This was supposed to be a relaxing honeymoon instead it's been one issue after another. A romantic situation of ordering champagne and strawberries became a nightmare and after three attempt, I gave up.. Rude staff and total uncaring management. Do not book here if you want an enjoyable long weekend.

Far off the strip and the neighborhood behind the stratosphere is pretty scary. The registration desk\/lobby was modern and neatly set up, but the line was extremely long and moving slow. Service sucked- needed more training. If only the rooms were as modern as the registration area! Really old, needs some deep cleaning  and updating!! Yuck!! Rather pay the extra $20-30 a night to stay somewhere else!

Ended up at the Statosphere last weekend as I had dinner at their Top of the World restaurant. (see separate review).

It's out of the way - not close to the downtown or the other strip properties. It's also near a pretty sketchy area though things are being done to try to improve the area. 

The interior isn't too bad considering the age of the property and with the things to do high up in the tower, it's too bad you have to pay to get up otherwise it would probably be busier. The tower that is.

I didn't stay in the rooms so from what I was able to see from the parking structure to the tower, management is doing a decent job of drawing people there. Gaming, lounges and dining - all reasons to go. 

Anyway - the place is ok. Been to better. Been to worse.

I used the Hotel Tonight app to book the stratosphere, 
I was trying to book Planet Hollywood but that sold out in less than 5 minutes. 

We didn't check in until 5:30 am so there wasn't a line or anything.  
Check in took less than 5 minutes, and we were able to upgrade to the newer upgraded rooms. 

The rooms are very basic, there isn't even a coffee maker.. but I guess that's ok since they have a Starbucks downstairs.  The rooms are also pretty small, there is not that much room for much else other than your luggage.  The restrooms are pretty small, and the shower curtain didn't cover the shower fully.
Rooms are clean enough, the carpet isn't that clean, but it's really not that big of a deal since we weren't staying there very long. 

Rooms were pretty affordable at $80 a night on the weekend, and if you find some coupons on hotel tonight only $65!, they do charge a resort fee of $16.

I regret not checking out the view on the top, but you must check it out if you end up staying here !

Longest check in process ever, the line was so long and the service was extremely slow. The guy manager(?!) was pacing and was nervous due to not knowing how to prioritize. Some receptionists were so stressed with helping customers checking in and forgot to greet and smile. Very rude.

The first floor casino was okay, nothing GRAND or special like it should in LV. Second floor retailers were overpriced and nothing stood out.

The room has nothing but a one star level hotel. Very old and beaten up. Not clean. The bathtub was so gross and still had hair... Carpet smelled terrible with moldy air. Also, don't pay for the view, not worth it. All you could see were bunch of houses.

I would not recommend this place. Spend a little extra to stay at the strip where everything is close. At the end, you don't have to waste gas, money or time to try to drive thru the traffic or find a cab.

Before I even start this review, I'm just gonna say I'm biased towards Stratosphere. A good biased might I add..

This has been our go-to hotel\/resort for my family and I ever since I was like....in elementary school.

From years ago until the present time, all our stays here have been nothing but pleasant. From the parking garage to our rooms....everything was quick, easy and hassle free. 

Great rates can always be found here. I mean, what more do you really need in a hotel room? You're in Vegas. I'm sure most of you are out of your rooms during the day (and even night.) As long as the room you're staying in is fully functional and clean...that should be enough. If you're a tourist that's looking for "oh mai gawd, I want to live the luxurious lifestyle with a fancy check in area" and blah blah blah...take your ass to the Venetian, Cosmopolitan, Bellagio, or Wynn. 

But seriously...the Strat has everything you can possible need while on a Vegas vaca. You got your casino floor with endless amounts of slot machines and table games. You got your restaurants (affordable ones AND your $$$$$ ones). You got 2+ bars. A small souvneir shopping area. Sportsbook. A pretty decent pool. What more do you really need!?!

Stayed in Stratosphere last year. Comparatively, better inside than Excalibur which I selected this year (the same price range).

But would not probably go there again, simply because of the location. Advertised as north of the Strip, but I think officially speaking it is downtown already. Quoting  a Vegas comedian "Las Vegas rule number 3 : Depth Perception. Just because you can see the Stratosphere, it does not mean that it is a block away." It is not. After Sahara closed, Stratosphere became also somewhat isolated as there is practically nothing between it and Circus Circus (which is again, not a block or two). I have uploaded a photo of Las Vegas Blvd. at the Stratosphere. Does this look like the Strip? So, forget enjoying a walk if in no hurry, it is always a cab or a bus.

Went to the tower a couple of times (was in the package). But again, you see the central part of the Strip in the distance, and between it and you there are almost no lights. So the question that comes to mind is "Why I am here, not there?

We got a great deal to stay at the Stratosphere over the Christmas holiday so we took it.  We had a couple of tweens with us so we thought it would be a great place to stay with them and it was.  If you can get past the outdated interior, you'll have a great time at the Stratosphere because there's something for everyone.  Of course, for those who like to play, the casino is relatively large with a few bars spread out within and many new and up to date slots.  For the thrill seekers, there are a few extreme rides at the top of the tower, which look dangerously exciting.  For the show and music lovers, you can catch Michael Jackson Live in the theater and if you stick around after the show, you can even take a selfie with MJ himself.  For the foodies, they have a steakhouse, a pizza joint, and everything in between.  There's also a row of shops if you're looking for the perfect souvenir to take home.  And the rooms were great for the price as well.  After a couple of days at the Stratosphere, you'll definitely leave feeling like you experienced a little bit of Vegas.

We stayed in the "Strip View Room-Unlimited Tower Admission" room. Booked it from Hotels.com. 
The deal was good at 50$\/night but the facility is not what you would expect. Here are the things which we did not find worth.
1) The hotel is far from strip.
2) The strip view is not that great. You can only see upto Sahara and few others. Definitely not worth strip view.
3) Internet is not included and we had to pay another 11$ extra\/day for usage. Unlike , circus circus where it was included.
4) Room inside was big but facility wise no better than any other lodges.
5) TV channels are limited. Circus circus offered better options.

Net net comparing with circus circus where we paid the same amount, we got less for our money.
However only plus point been, since tower admission was free, it saved as $16\/person. 
Also the buffet is good where hotel guest get 25% off.

I found this place through Expedia. I booked it way to fast without doing my research. This hotel is the first hotel on the strip which is to far from the action. You need a cab or bus its a good 3 mile walk from anything. There is a ihop and a dennys within walking distance tho. The casino was not to busy. The cocktail waitresses were very rude. Trying to get a drink from them is like pulling a tooth. I would have tipped better if they did better. 

The Buffett is Meh. Better on a weekend. "McCalls Grill" best resteraunt they have here. Best service, best quality of food and a good scenery. Please skip Roxy's in my opinion it is the worst. Service was ok but the food was horrible. 

We booked a king spa. The bathroom itself was so dark. It only had 1 light over the sink. And, the bathroom especially the tub could have been cleaned a lot better. 

The rooftop resteraunt is overpriced. So is the bar but the views are amazing. We were so high up my ears were popping.

They have a mall. The shops are outdated tho. The arcade was so creepy from the outside we didnt go in. 

Overall, this place is ok if you like to be secluded and away from everything.

Very pleasant stay at the Stratosphere. We showed up and there was a bag of towels in our room that were dirty and the sink wouldnt drain... BUT we called to tell them and the instantly upgraded our room to the new tower. It was modern and lovely next time i go i will absolutley rent a tower room... its worth the extra. Happy we got it comp'd but next time i will pay the difference. Staff was friendly. ROXY's was yummy and quick. the hotel all around was a great experience

THIS was hands down one of the worst places I have ever stayed I was there for 5 nights and 6 days, my bathroom sink was filling with sewage, it wasn't until the last night maintenance came up and the second they can tap into my room they call down to the front desk saying how terrible the smell was, and how the whole sink was full of feces. I complain 3 days in a row only to HAve manager lie to me to pacify me telling me they were going to refund me two of the nights that I had stayed there that's my credit card I received $46.22 out of the $1,200 bill do yourself a favor spend the extra $100 and stay somewhere else THEY ARE LIARS AND THIEVES, ALSO 2 OTHER IDIVIDUAL PEOPLE I TRAVELEd with ad a horrible experience there as well
GET YOUR SHIT TOGETHER YOUR MAKING VEGAS LOOK BAD PROBABLY BEST YPUR AT THE END OF THE END OF THE STRIP

The stratoshpere creates mixed feelings in me....  The good: It's mellow, away from the crazy business of the strip, and it's inexpensive.   The bad:  The dealers are RUDE for the most part, they have a very small selection of beer - which does not include ANY ales or quality beers, and the hotel is quite a distance from the strip.  For the price, it was a pretty good deal.  It was about a mile to the strip, which we walked.  Overall, not bad - if you are not going to be spending much time in your casino or hotel, I would stay here.  Rooms were very nice and comfortable.  Cheap prices!  You gotta give up some luxuries if you want an inexpensive room!

I stayed here because the prices were cheap, totally NOT worth it. The room was not clean, to begin with, and then it was never cleaned during our stay, they simply dumped towels inside. There was old fast food behind the night stand. The shower was clogged with hair. Everything in the room looked super old. Stay far away from this gross hotel.

Review based solely on the enervation deck, which I believe is something you need to put on your Vegas visit list. We didn't stay at the hotel, ride the rides, eat, nor dine here. We went at night to see all the sparking lights. It is relatively far from most of the happening things on the downtown Las Vegas strip, so we saved ourselves a trip and stopped at the Stratosphere on our way back from Fremont Street (the old strip). Do not walk there, especially at night. The surrounding area is sketchy. I wouldn't stay at the Stratosphere based off the location alone. I prefer to be in the heart of the strip. The view is gorgeous at night. The observation deck is so high and there are so many lights, that it takes some time to locate the Vegas strip. Don't leave the observation deck until you continued your experience by going outside. We almost missed out. Despite it being cold and windy, the view was magical. Take a moment to take it in.

Machines:  tight. 
Cocktail service:  really really slow. Especially on graveyard. 
Fun:  not very. Can't even get a fair shake on these machines. 

Taking my red card and moving on.

I didn't stay here but I did enjoy the sky bar lounge. They have a pretty nice happy hour with drink specials and small plates for $5-8. Love that. If you want to come here for the view skip the $15 ticket to the top and go to the bar. Your pictures might not be as great but the bar has the same 360 view as the deck just with windows. The bar is also dark and sexy.

The room smelled like smoke (non-smoking room) ac barely worked. Tv didnt work. Outlet in bathroom kept blowing the fuse. Hair drier started smoking. The room was $100 & only stayed one night...to much money & too long in this hotel.  And don't walk by yourself outside at night. I heard the pool was nice but didn't stay around to check it out!

Can't speak for the hotel itself because I have never stayed here. But the observation lookout tower is a great view of the city. Didn't have the nerve to try all the rides, but did try the Big Shot. That was a bit terrifying and exhilarating all at the same time. Add that dropping ride to a 700 ft building and you got one hell of a ride. If you are afraid of heights, this is not the ride for you.

I was getting married in Vegas. I was getting married in the Chapel in the Clouds at Stratosphere so I decided to stay in the hotel for convenience sake.

The rooms were inexpensive and clean. I don't have high expectations given the price. The toilets are scary. Don't do a courtesy flush unless you want to risk having your insides sucked out through your bumhole.

The unlimited tower admission seems like a pretty good perk for staying here.

The pool was adequate but they really should have built this on the ground floor so that the buildings shield you from the wind.

Cleaning staff were excellent. They were careful not to bung up or throw out your stuff and they did an overall good job.

The casino is ok. I wish they opened the tables in the pit near McCall's on more than just the weekends. Younger dealers tend to be more fun to play with. They're also friendlier than some of the old-fogeys running the tables on the other side.

Wifi access wasn't too bad but I disliked having to re-authenticate every 24 hours.

The tower shops are kind of a ghost town. Food, like McDonald's, is about the only thing you go there for.

Like almost every hotel in Vegas, they have the dreaded resort fees. You get charged this whether you use their amenities or not. $15\/day for this one.

Because of the location, you lose most of your savings by taking extra cab rides. If you have a car or don't mind public transportation, then it's not too bad.

If you're on a bit of a budget, stay here. If you're not, then don't.

We stayed in the un-renovated part of the hotel that we got on an Expedia special. It was super cheap... But you get what you pay for.

The clerk upgraded our room, but I'm not sure what the upgrade was. We were on the 23rd floor in a non-smoking room at the end of the hall with no view.

Key points:
1. The water that came out of the sink and shower smelled and tasted really bad. I don't know if that's just Vegas or if it was the hotel, but I didn't smell that odor anywhere else in the city.
2. The (tiny) window didn't open and there was no ventilation, so the air was oppressive, humid and hot. I'm not sure if the air conditioner made it better or worse.
3. The hotel is on the opposite end of the parking garage\/entrance... But you should expect to walk your ass off in Vegas anyway.
4. The casino is tiny and the machines are a bit older. If you want to gamble at your hotel a lot, this might not be the place for you. They have $5 blackjack tables so I'd play those, but the slots have little variety and are really tight. Max bets were capped at around $2.50 so when you do get a bonus, it's small. 
5. This place is off-strip. There is nothing fun within walking distance and not enough to do at the hotel to keep you occupied for more than a day.

In sum, I would say this: I will not stay here again, ever. I will come back for their top of the world restaurant (5 star good!) and maybe their rides, which I didn't get a chance to go on. 

This is probably a good place to stay if you're young, energetic and want to stay for cheap.

When I go to vegas, I don't spend that much time in my hotel room.  I stay here almost every time due to the great prices I get.  My most recent visit we got a corner room that was huge!  It was not a suite, but it was very large.  We even had a fridge, I have never had a fridge in my room at the stratosphere before.  The best part? I only paid $19 a night.  My rental car cost more than my room.  I drive everywhere we need to go.  Parking is free and abundant at every hotel on the strip.  The customer service has always been great.  The coupon book you get has a lot of great values.  We saw American Superstars and Bite 2 for 1.  Your dollar goes real far at the Stratosphere.

The Stratosphere's TV ads act like they're doing something totally different with the "Take Vegas Back" promotion.  

Just like the rest of Vegas, the hotel \/ casino has a resort fee and rooms comparably priced with some Strip hotels. Plus, guests will be staying in a s-l-e-a-z-y area of Vegas. If you disagree with my assessment, will someone in management please enlighten me as too what's different or what I might be missing?

Unfortunately, in my opinion, the Stratosphere's "Take Vegas Back" promotion is just another gimmick to sucker in potential customers.

John Howard
Oxnard, Calif.

Maybe I'm just easy to please. I've stayed here twice now and will likely be back again. The rooms are cheaper than anything else on the boulevard, and the deuce gives you easy access to the strip. Personally, I don't spend a lot of time at the hotel when I'm in Vegas. I just want a place to sleep and a pool to relax in at the end of the day (the Radius pool and wet lounge has fantastic views of the tower and decent drinks). During my first stay I had to harass housecleaning to actually do their jobs and bring fresh towels. That's my only real complaint. 

This is definitely located in a sketchy area of town, which can be a plus if you're the sort of person who finds it morbidly fascinating to stumble on a pair of crackheads fighting over a slot machine in the 7\/11 during your 3am beer run. If you really must walk anywhere it should only be south on the boulevard toward the IHOP or liquor store.

This is not a "Vegas hotel". That said, there are lots of things to love about this property. It has the typical enticing slot machines, games, etc but definitely not as bold and flashy as other hotels. I really enjoyed having a Starbucks on the lower level and even a McDonald's for those tipsy nights. I stayed in the older tower which features all 90's amenities. I think I would spring next time for the upgrade to the newer tower. We were kept up all night by the loud HVAC unit and the shower was less than steller. That said, I loved the feel of both pools (25th floor and 8th floor) and we loved the 2 for 1 drinks on the 107th floor at 1 AM to take in the city. I'd stay here again, but either spend more or expect less.

Also wanted to say a big thank you to the food and beverage asst manager chad fisher.   Even after a small mis understanding he owned the mix up. Fixed it and then made it happen for me.  Well above and beyond.   Stratosphere is lucky to have people like these working for them.  Thank u chad
