what a lovely hotel... reminded me of the auckland city new zealand.. ! we had the best time in vegas.. this place has so many drunk memories attached..i can never forget this place ever.the rooms were great neat and tidy,the rides on top are not at all scary,its a cool place.. :) over all... very GOOD!

This hotel was pitiful. I've stayed at nicer college dorm rooms than what we were offered on Friday 7\/31\/15. The hallway leading to the room (which was in the north tower) looked very modern and well kept, but once we opened the door, we were shocked. The interior looked like a mobile home. It appeared as though, other than the flat screen television, nothing had been updated since the hotel was built. The bathroom was tiny, there were no doors on the closet area, there were no lounge chairs, only crappy dining room chairs, and the A\/C didn't cool very well. We also went to have dinner at Fellini's Italian Restaurant at the base of the north tower. I've had better Italian food at high school cafeterias. The antipasti meats and cheeses were of poor quality, and the app sampler was just a bunch of random fried foods, with nothing freshly prepared. The parking garage felt very unsafe, and we tried to valet, but there was a 45 minute wait and no special line for hotel guests. The only good thing about our stay was having free access to the Stratosphere tower. Overall, though, a terrible experience.

Loved my stay here my room was clean and decent not the prettiest room but hey you get what you pay for. It was definietly worth the $25 a night. Basic needs, comfy king bed, flat screen tv, closet, and a deep tub small bathroom tho. I didn't like that there was a door that connected to the room next to me I could walk in on the person or vice versa plus I could hear him snoring.
Casion is very clean and giving(; .. but some corners are really dark at night and scary if you're alone I didn't see security near that area. It doesn't smell like smoke like other casinos on the strip. So ventilation is GOOD.
Hotel service is good. Was able to check in early even tho booked through an agency. Fast check out. 
But the buffet here sucks I'd rather walk to jack in the box down the road.

Where do I start??? The staff is rude, inconsiderate, and gives terrible directions as to where you need or want to go. It took us almost an hour to check in. There were 15 check in terminals at the counter,  and three attendants manning the counters...  After checking in, we decided we would further patronize the facility, and eat at their buffet (which was a BIG mistake!) After spending $50 for two to eat at their "magnificent" buffet, we discovered we could've had better food at McDonald's for a fraction of the price. The food was aged, no sea food to speak of, and what food we did end up eating- was very sub - par in quality.  VERY DISAPPOINTED! If you want a good Vegas experience,  stay and eat elsewhere!  They likely do have the best views around Vegas, but that's ALL the Stratosphere has going for it! HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!

The area isn't the best. It's at the end of the strip. Rooms are fairly new. The food inside was very lackluster. But for the price I would recommend this place. However the customer service is really hit and miss, I would agree with previous reviews mentioning about really rude staff. In particular a young gentleman called Anthony was hardly a saint. He had a really bad attitude to both me and the customer before me, and he had my reservation wrong. Thankfully another member of the front desk crew helped me resolved the issue. Overall a pleasant stay. If it weren't for the rude encounter I would gladly give this place a 5 stars.

Pros: Stratosphere Tower and Rides
Cons: Room decor and lighting. Towels and pillows.

It was a very frustrating experience overall. The rooms are old, damp and need a face lift. To begin with check-in --`We had to be queueing up in a long queue for about 1.5hrs after a long long flight from east coast. Despite of having paid extra for rooms on higher floors, we were given a room on just 8th floor. It was only after a lot of argument that the staff agreed to give us a room on higher floor from 2nd day. Rooms are dark and carpets were dirty and damp. The wash basins are outside the bathroom (inside the bedroom)!! Beds were good though the pillows were crumpled and very small size. Towels were rough and smallest by every standards. In-house dining has almost nothing for vegans!! My room was split into two rooms separated by blocked door..and it did nothing to stop the noise coming from the other room!! We opted for this hotel being attracted by the Tower and its rides. Tower is good and the views were spectacular. Overall, I would recommend this hotel only for visit to Tower but not to stay. I would have rather pad a little more and went to a better hotel.
Lindsey the best customer rep... 5 stars for her..told u Lindsey I yelp you..thank you

The hotel was alright. I really don't mind that It was at the end of the strip. The room was alright in my opinion, though felt a little...cheap? Almost like a motel. I would have honestly rather stayed at a different hotel. Oh well.

We stayed here for a week with my family. ! We tried to enjoy our vacations as much as I could beside the bad experience with hotel !

I don't know about the management of this hotel what are they thinking !?
- There is no customer appreciation  at all !  .. They make you feel that u need to punished because you may got a deal on the room rate!
- They try to rip you off as much as they could inside their premises ( For instance :  
 * 12$ for the internet per day per wireless device !!! no way around it !
 * They have starbucks in the hotel, but they asked them not to offer wireless internet to force the gust to buy their subscription ! Even though all starbucks I have been in offers free internet !
 * We asked for beer opener they told us it's 6$ to borrow them as a room service !
 * We needed the internet so we asked them to charge us when we check out, but they refused and asked us to come down to front desk to pay them !

-- Also the area is not very safe if you have family and you want them walk up to the strip.. !

For us no way we will be back !

Meh.  For a hotel that advertises as the best value on the strip, it certainly is not.  Bf and I got the impression of nickel-and-diming of this place.  We did get a fabulous rate for the two days that we were there (Sunday night and Monday night), and the rooms were clean and well kept.

1.  Reservations of a specific room type are not guaranteed.  Bf and I wanted a non-smoking room with a King size bed.  We checked in at about 11PM on a SUNDAY night, and all they had were Queen non-smoking.  For us at least, room type is non-negotiable.  I didn't request something if I didn't want it.  We stayed one night in a crappy tower in a not as nice room with two queen beds, then we switched.

2.  They charge for internet access.  Lame.  Should be included in the price of the room.

3.  They charged to use the pool and fitness center.  We didn't use either during our stay, but would've been nice.

4.  Their casino floor is small and smells like nasty smoke.  Ventilation here is awful.  

5.  The layout is extremely confusing.  We got lost almost every single time we walked downstairs to either go to the parking garage or the front desk.  Stuff is not laid out here very well, and not labeled appropriately.  They want you to get lost so you gamble, but it's not appealing to either me or my bf.

6.  $10 charge per person for hotel guests to see your view, plus another $12 for each ride?!  We didn't have a chance to utilize either, but seriously, if we're staying in the hotel, you should include that in the price of the room.

Clean, very north end of the Strip. $10 cab to old Vegas $15 to new Veas. The top of the tower is cool, but you don't need the package where it is included, because let's be real, you're only going to go up once. 

I stayed in the "newly remodeled" Select Tower. The rooms were pretty small. No bathroom ventilation, and the lighting in the bathroom, where you need good lighting the most, really sucked. The walls are very thin. So unless you are a heavy sleeper, you WILL hear everyone walking by your room at all hours of the day and night. Forget sleeping in, the maids will wake you in the morning regardless of if you have your do not disturb sign up. You can hear them cleaning the other rooms on your floor. You also pay a $7.50\/day resort fee and $12 Internet fee per day while staying at this hotel. 

Bottom line, I wouldn't stay here again. I'd get closer I the newer scene for the same price.
This place will take every opportunity to screw you at the tables. Don't hit the wall in craps on a good roll? No roll.. Don't hit the wall on a 7? Out!
Good value for the price. Staff was friendly. Housekeeping needs some training but we stayed in one of the newly remodeled rooms so it was nice.

Stayed here on 5\/28\/16 to 5\/29\/16 and was pleasantly surprised with how nice and clean this hotel was. The nice lady that checked us in upgraded us to a suite for free since we were only staying the one night. It was so nice! I loved it I had a good nights and rest and gambled a little bit. I will definitely be coming back.

If this were a motor lodge I'd probably give it two stars, but you wouldn't be aware of the Stratosphere's sub-par quality by perusing the hotel's website.   The rooms don't even have a real closet.  There's a wardrobe cabinet, that's it   The walls are paper thin, and the casino, smells like stale cigarette smoke from the 1970's.  The building itself feels horribly sick...  The "fitness center" is poorly maintained, and everything about his place, screams that no stay here will be a good stay.  Its only advantages are the price (it's a pay for what you get lesson) and its proximity to the convention center... However, don't go walking anywhere in the area near the hotel; it's incredibly seedy.  The Stratosphere is located at the far end of the strip... It's the last hotel resting on the edge of what perhaps could be considered Vegas' inner city.  My advice is find a way to afford something better on the strip... You'll have a more pleasant stay and it will be safer.

I stayed here for 2 nights over the weekend, I expected better. Unfortunately the room wasn't what I thought it would be. When I arrived to check in they offered either 2 queen beds or 1 king bed in a smoking room. I should've just chosen the 2 queen beds because my room reeked of smoke! Just like the whole casino. The room is so outdated and the bed wasn't even as comfortable either. 

To begin their lamps have this string hanging from the ceiling with a switch. Talk about ancient, what is this S%$#! The bathrooms were kind of gross and they limit the amount of towels that they put in the bathrooms.

I reserved through travelocity and paid a deposit and the paid the remaining balance through cash. For some reason they asked for a mastercard to have on their account if anything happens? The only mastercard I had was my debit card and I usually don't like using that one for hotels, but I did anyways since the man who got my information at check-in said there wouldn't be any hold on it. I paid the remaining balance of $230 in cash at the hotel so I don't understand why there's a $116.00 balance charged on my debit card. I called them up right away  on Saturday and they said it should be back on my account in 24 hrs. It is now Tuesday and I still don't have my money back!!

My best friend came from Florida to visit me in summer of 2012. We planned on going to Vegas and we choose the Stratosphere. What a mistake we made, the shower got clog and when we call maintenance they didn't came to check the shower until 2 hours later and when they did it got clog again. When we returned to our room from the pool the bedroom was not clean, so we call the cleaning people and again 30 min later they showed up. I will never stay at this place again. I'm placing this review now because back then I didn't join Yelp.

I will say this hotel is an older one. Our room was one of the upgraded ones and it's really nice only downfall is there isn't a fan in the bathroom (not for that purpose) just something my husband and I noticed. Overall the staff is friendly and it's a nice place to stay if you're ever in Vegas. Well after I posted this I discovered my room had BED BUGS (epic fail) I contacted the supervisor and we were moved to a new room IMMEDIATELY! I've never experienced bed bugs and hope I never do again. Here I go back again I've been gone all day and my room wasn't cleaned at all dirty towels still in the corner where I left them. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!! Please don't stay at this place they got shit fucked up. I'm writing a letter to the BBB and to the hotel. This isn't how I like to spend my hard earned money.

This is one of the cheapest hotels on the strip along with Circus Circus. It's also one of the hotels the furthest down on the strip. Don't dare try walking the strip from this hotel unless you have really good shoes and a day pack. My sister and I learned our lesson the 1st time we went and stayed at Circus Circus. We had never been to Vegas before and I guess the Strip looks a lot shorter than you think when you're driving down it. So like the naives we were we walked from Circus Circus to the MGM Grand and my sister nearly died. Then we found out there is a trolley that you can get an all day pass for going up and down the strip. Ai ya!

So the 2nd time we went and stayed at the Stratosphere. The Stratosphere is not that bad of a hotel. I didn't feel unsafe walking around outside and the casino is quite nice as well. The first night we got there after 6 hours of travelling we went and bought tickets to the attractions on the top of the Stratosphere. You take the elevator up what seems like 200 floors and step out on a platform. This is not for people afraid of heights at all. The fearless daredevils that we were we jumped on the ride that is like The Superman at Six Flags that shoots you up in the air at like Mach 6000. I admit, my palms were a little sweaty and my heart was palpitating slightly. So the ride shot us up in the air and stops just short of shooting you off the top of the Stratosphere to fall several hundred feet to your death. Everything was fine...then I look over and see my sister's head slumped to the side. I had noticed that she had stopped screaming mid way up. I have never been so scared in my life. I thought she had died. There is no way to get off the ride until they bring you back down. But they shot us up twice....which I guess was good for the money. So after they brought us back down, her little head popped up and I began breathing again. She was screaming so hard that she couldn't catch her breath and just blacked out. HAHA! 

Then we got on the roller coaster that takes you over the edge of the Stratosphere. Again...not for chumps. This one wasn't as fun since they had to put the breaks on like every 3 seconds to prevent you from going too fast and flying off the Stratosphere...again falling several hundred feet to your death. But they really have you locked in up there so I felt really secure. 

After that adventure we went down the elevator, gambled a little and went out in search of some trouble on the Strip (it wasn't that hard to find)

The hotel itself is nice too. It was a place to lay our heads down. They have a pool on one of the higher levels, if not the roof, so it makes you feel all posh that you get to strut around in your 'kinis and flip flops with a dranky drank in your hand...thong & heels and a fur coat if yer classy. Haaaaa!

We just went to see the Stratosphere...sadly to say this place seen better days. The view is awesome and that's where it ends. On a Saturday afternoon, no lines & no bustling crowds quite different scene from the other end of the strip.  I could never imagine staying here for a night the neighborhood looks a bit sketchy...

I would've rated this an excellent experience,  however I paid for a premier room which are the higher level rooms with a view. I wanted a nice room for my wedding anniversary.  They gave us a cruddy handicap room on the 6th floor with a view of nothing. I was outraged, bc it was not a premier room that I had paid extra money for and then they told me all the premier rooms are booked and I could have a premier room tomorrow. I was only staying Vegas 2 nights. So half my trip I spent in a subpar room. And how were all the rooms booked even though I booked one. They reimbursed me a resort fee for one of the days. I felt that wasn't enough, but I didn't complain. I wanted to make the best of my trip. My husband and I were both disappointed and will not be staying there anymore. I felt that because we are young they felt that we weren't going to look into it or complain about it. When I first complained all she kept saying  was that I don't think you booked a premier room and there's none available. I have the receipt to prove it.  The other lady tried to say that it says subject to availability on the rooms on the receipt, but once again she was wrong. It said king or queen bed subject to availability. The first thing I did was read the fine print. They should just own up to their mistake or whatever it was instead of trying to make some lame excuse. I did end up getting the premier room on the 23rd floor the next day and it was way better than the level 6 room. It just would have been better if they would have have is the correct room that I paid for in the beginning. Good thing we had good food on the strip to make up for the crappy room. Our anniversary was saved by pampas Chusscaria. Oh and the tower was nice I can't deny it.

Got the Grand room. So disappointing, the room is outdated, the couch are torn at the bottom, edges are dirty with dust. At night, we can hear the elevator cable. I don't recommend this hotel. The service when I called room service needs a little improvement also.

I will never stay there again. It's ghetto big time!  The service is poor and the quality in the hotel is awful. The phone service was out of date and didn't correspond with the correct departments. The elevators were malfunctioning and there was a power outage. Most of the bell hops were nice but most of the service is very poor. The room quality is like staying at a Motel 6.  They need to adjust the oxygen because with all a the smoke you can barely breathe while ingesting 2nd hand smoke 24hrs a day. No mini bar, fridge or even a friggin coffee pot!  The window is the size of a car door and you barely have a view to look at. Oh and don't try to check out on your TV. It's close to impossible as they force you to do it downstairs with a long wait to understaffed people. It took 30 minutes to check out with 2 people behind the desk working.  Also beware of the fees you get charged for on your card like the BS resort fee. What resort? Pool was "out of order" and I wouldn't dare risk a jacuzzi dip.  I'd rather stay at a retirement home than this flea bag poor excuse of a hotel.  There was no one gambling but the losers who look like they have arrest records. Do yourself a favor and do not stay here. If you want to save money and are desperate then do so at your own risk. You've been warned.
This guys have good affordable rates. Happy hour! All different rages of buy in on their casino tables and not too far from all the craziness of the scrip

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. 

Ok so the bathroom sink got clogged and started leaking from the bottom during our night here when my sister was just washing her socks for that she didn't have enough for the following trip. Called the front desk and was told that they'll arrange a service guy right away. We waited for almost an hour and no one showed up. Called the front desk again to see if we can switch a room, as we needed to leave early tomorrow and it has passed 2am already, we really needed to sleep. The front desk said they could do nothing unless the service guy confirmed the situation. Hello? It's 2am already AND I FREAKING NEED TO SLEEP FOR MY NEXT DAY OF DRIVING. I felt like they just didn't want to deal with the situation and they prefer to have their guests waiting tiredly without doing anything to solve the problem. If your guests were just using the sink normally and your defective room was having problems, and you can't schedule a repair, JUST FREAKING LET THEM SWITCH TO ANOTHER ROOM AND REST! What's so difficult of that? It's just a normal Thursday night! Don't tell me you're fully booked cuz you're not. 
Now we've been waiting for more than 2 hours. Nothing was done and no one came to fix the problem. Again the front desk said she can't move us to another room. F*** you. I paid for my stay and I had no sink to use. What a "great" hotel with "awesome" services!

Won't book with Stratosphere again. And I will post this on all my social media as well as tell this story to every single family member and friend of mine to have them stay away from here. Worst.

okay we stayed here during the week. The smell off smoke in  North section was overwhelming still i had hopes when we get to our room it was like a cheap motel room the light flickered a good minute before fully turning on. The bathroom was so tiny the sink was outside the bathroom! (weird) the toilet had pubic hair from a previous customer!! ..(yuk) .. We came equipped with a bottle of Lysol though. The drawers had hair in them ! My boyfriend had a fit.. I took photos with my camera and showed the front desk who gave us an upgrade to the select section which was way better the room came with spa bathtub ! :) and it was clean and the hallways smelled good. The pool was a nice experience you see a little bit of everything. The last time we came to Las Vegas we stayed at the D Las Vegas and we liked that hotel better they had direct TV Chanel's and the stratosphere only had 7 Chanel's. We did enjoy Roxy's dinner though and the Top of the world restaurant, the view from the up their is breath taking.

Rooms are clean, intro staff polite but not worth the money to bother the upgrade. Supposedly a hold friendly hotel but no kids tv channels, really lame view for base price and really no in room amenities, wish I would have gotten a different hotel

We stayed in the "Romance Suite" during out stay. It was large, clean, had a two person jacuzzi tub, coffee maker and fridge. It also had 2 large flat screen tv's. It was a great room and a great deal. 

Yes it is Vegas so you get charged extra for everything like internet and yes they like every other hotel in Vegas have a resort fee that no one really knows what it covers.

They have two pools. The 8th floor is open seasonally and was not open during out stay. The 25th floor beach club has a dj and during the summer months it is adult only and topless. We where the only people there, the lifeguard was friendly and it was really warm!

We are not gamblers but we got a free trip to Vegas for listening to a time share talk so we figured we would go and we had a blast. We did not gamble at their casino which is large and very smokey. 

The top of the tower views are amazing we went up twice. They have thrill rides but I am not brave enough but hey if jumping off a huge tower is your thing you can find it here. On your way to the observation area you walk through a ghetto mall. But many of the major hotels have them.  

Lastly, it is on the strip but it is all the way at the north end. We rented a car so we had no issues getting around but if you are staying here carless you may be in a little trouble. It is not near the monorail and the cab rides to Mirage area where about 12 bucks each way according to people who took cabs.

Overall it was nice but if I return to Vegas I would probably stay in the main strip area so we could walk from casino to casino. If you are looking for a quieter hotel  not in the middle of the action this may be your place.

Oh my gosh!!!!! My husband and I came here to this hotel to celebrate my 60th birthday and we just had one of the worst experiences in all my 60 years of earth.  Even though MOST reviews of this hotel are dismal at best -- everyone warning of terrible hotel manners at best, we decided still to come here because of price.  At checkin, they tried to charge us $10 for an early check-in at Noon, but did not because we took an upgrade of $20 per night - that should have been my first clue to run and not walk away from this hotel.  But sadly I did not listen to my instincts that were telling me to run - we stayed - our mistake.

Here is what happened after deciding to stay.  We went to dinner outside the hotel - and returned after dinner.  My husband played the ponies at the sports bar and I was with him until I decided to play the slots.  He joined me for a while at the slots and then he returned to the sports bar.  I played a few different machines and then saw a machine on an end aisle and decided to go there.  

I sat down and put a twenty into the machine and played a couple of max bets and won a little over $6 when all of a sudden an extremely drunk man came up on my left side with a beer in hand and started screaming at me that was his machine and that was his money.  I explained to him that the machine was vacant and there was no money in the machine when I sat down and that was my money in the machine.  He would not reason in his condition, so I cashed out and got up from the machine.  I was searching for security and there was none!  I walked around with this drunk following me screaming that was his voucher and finally saw a bar and went over to the barmaid and bartender to call security.  I stayed there for "help" to arrive.

It was well over 10 minutes before security and they went over to the drunk who was now at my machine.  Security never came over to me and eventually I had to go over to them.

The drunk was Hispanic and the security guard was Hispanic and the security guard started screaming at me that it was the drunk's money and that I had to give him my voucher of $26 and some change.  I told the security guard that it was my money as I put $20 in the machine and won a little - big deal - a little over $6.  But he would not hear any of it and continued to scream at me.  I told him I wanted the hotel manager and instead of helping me, he kept demanding that I give the drunk my voucher.  In front of the drunk, the security guard demanded that I give him my room number and ID.  

I refused and walked away to find the front desk where we checked in to find the hotel manager.  At the reception desk, the woman at the counter asked my room number, which I gave her, and she showed me where to stand to wait for the manager,

When the manager (Julio) came, I explained what was going on and he escorted me to a private room by the front desk.  He said they would review the cameras and he asked me what I did with the voucher.  I told him I ripped it up and threw it in the air and he said he would have done the same thing,

Then the most appalling thing of all happened!!! The Hispanic security officer came to the front room where we were and screamed at me and my husband that we were going to be evicted from the hotel immediately!  It asked him why when I did nothing wrong.  He repeatedly screamed at me that we were going to be escorted to our room to get our belongings and we would be escorted out of the hotel immediately!!!! I kept asking why.  No answer.  Julio the front desk manager heard all of this and said this was now out of his hands with security's decision and he threw his hands in the air and walked away.  I never saw Julio again.  We were shocked!!!!!

Then all of a sudden everything changed.  They apparently took time to review the tapes and Steve the head security officer showed up as well as a woman who determined that this was my money as I told them from the beginning and they reconstructed my voucher and paid me my money $26.00 plus change as they finally determined I was telling the truth as I told them from the beginning.  Steve said his security guard was wrong and had acted inappropriately towards me.  Yeah, you think?  I am a 60 year old woman celebrating my birthday with my husband and I am treated like a criminal.  Security kept saying that what I did was criminal.  I kept asking what did i do wrong?  Picking the Stratosphere for my hotel stay in Vegas was wrong.  They did nothing to help me and they did nothing to the drunk who attacked me!!!

Steve the head security officer found Brandon the head floor manager and offered us some complimentary buffets, which we refused.  The was another slap in our faces!!  I am still in shock.  What happens in Vegas is a warning not to stay here!

UPDATE:  When I got home. I contacted the Chairman of the Board and this office responded with an apology.  They also comped our hotel stay that weekend and sent me a check for our airfare.

Rust in the bathrooms, phone didn't have a phone cord, electricity went out for hours. When technician made his way to the room he was rude. Then when we told him of the phone not working he radioed that we needed one but none was ever brought up. No fridge in room. Old out dated television that won't turn off without a remote. The only thing enjoyable was that they had 5$ tables.

Needs a lot of clean-up and rehab. We went here for the rides! The wait for the rides? Lines were short but takes forever to board and actually ride. They were pretty GREAT though! Location is not good if you want to be on the strip. It is a ways away from City attractions\/lights. A+ on bathrooms being clean. If you are staying on the main strip and want to hit the rides here, suggest the bus pass. Super cheap and gets you to where you need to go. Also, if you have the time, the unlimited ride pass is good. Military discount is accepted!

I will not post my opinion, only facts, you make the call:

1.  1 Hour check in line on Saturday (not Friday).  Concierge response: "Thats how it always is, I suggest if you want your room, you stand in it."

2.  $20 Resort Fee hidden upon booking and levied on Check-In.  Resort fee includes free valet.  (A feature offered by ALL hotels in Vegas.)

3.  Room reservation stated a view of the strip.  Room had view of the parking lot.  Stratosphere refused to correct the error.

4.  Room had no closet or room safe.

5.  12 Seats in Race-Book.  9 Seats reserved for VIPs.

6.  $20 Minimum sports bet to recieve 1 free well drink.

7.  Cafe levied $1 surcharge per menu item ordered for take-out.  TAKE-OUT, not delivery, TAKE-OUT.

8.  Timeshare salesmen swarm at all entrances\/exits.

9.  Requested 2 pillows from room service.  Informed that hotel has "...run out of pillows.

You can't complain if the price was cheap, right?  The casino isn't the best, but they have a little bit of everything. The dealers are definitely from their own world.  The walls between rooms are thin - you hear EVERYTHING!  And if they put you in a smoking room, believe me, it will be smoky. It was gross.  The poker room was small compared to all the other casino's, but there is definitely money to be made there.

the room was spacious though and they have your Starbuck's and a cafe that is open all night. 

I would just say, you get what you pay for...

Horrible experience ever, stay here if you are ready to stay for several nights in a room that never gets serviced (and when you bring this up to the supervisor they lie to you by saying it indeed was serviced) and you go up to get a view from the tower only to realize they have a private party going on which blocks most of the observatory section. Even 1 star is too much though unfortunately I can't give them lower than 1* here

Vegas was amazingggggg!!! The Stratosphere itself was just ok. Hardly spent any time there so nothing great to say or not to say. Had to call twice for towels which was a pain. Room service was stupid expensive. The room itself wasn't terrible, but the bathroom was crazy small which really sucked. Overall, its cheap, its close to the Wynn and Encore and we all slept just fine, at least the very few hours we actually got any sleep! Party like a ROCKSTAR BABY!

Me and my husband stayed at the stratosphere hotel in 2011 from May 3rd-May 6th because I got a great deal thru travelocity. They have three really cool rides and bungy jumping on the top of the tower. There hotel is the tallest in Las Vegas and has the best view. There's also a bar, and you can just chill relax on the couches, have a drink , take pictures of the strip. Inside the casino they have nice little gift shops, good hot dogs, dollar jello shots. We ate a restraunt where they sang old 70's songs and dresses up, it was really cool and different. And everytime I gambled at cesars palace or any other casino I lost quick , but when I played at stratosphere I won. The room was nice. A little far from the main strip , but kinda good because not too much traffic. I really enjoyed. Would and will recommened and go again.
I stayed here for the view and the rides at the top.   Rooms are standard.   Parking is free.   I like that it's kind of at the end of the Strip.  Really cool place to stay.

My first stay here and also my last stay here! Literally just checked in after waiting in line for registration check in for about 30-40 mins. I unload some stuff and go to the bell desk and the lady claimed I gave her a wrong room under a fake name and wouldn't help me! She told me get my room key holder so now I'm going all the way back upstairs! Thanks!

Been awhile since I've been to this casino. We visited at night to kill some time and head up to the tower. The place still seems the same and has been kept up pretty well.

I haven't stayed the night at this place, just usually play on the casino floor.

Arriving at the Stratosphere, we immediately smelled the old smoke smell and were not impressed with the over 30 minute wait to register after being on airplanes and shuttles, only to get to the room and NO Wifi! So we decided to call the front desk whereby we were on hold for another 10mins (?!!!Seriously?) At first glance the room isn't bad, but when you actually look - it is. The air conditioner worked but looked all busted up. Half of it was hanging off! The bathroom linoleum was peeling away from the wall & oh ---if you want to turn on the light in the bathroom it would flicker for a few seconds like in a Horror film, then it gave off this eerie yellow glow....ick. You can't sit on the toilet & open the door, it's one or the other.

As for the area of town - yes, it's on the bad end, yes there are pawn shops and bums around but I never felt unsafe. There's a Denny's right behind it and the service and staff there were TERRIFIC and the food was affordable! 

Too bad the Stratosphere staff never mentioned to us that there is a mall upstairs that includes a McDonalds....but then how would they make their money on their buffet. Oh that brings me to the buffet - we got scolded for not sitting and waiting for the non-existent server to bring us drinks before we ate. (This was the first night after arriving from flights, shuttles, the 30min registration lineup, now we were supposed to wait to eat, so that you get around to serving us? Me thinks not!)

Stratosphere gets 1 star because the water in the shower is HOT and when you take a bath it's HOT and my sore muscles loved it.

That's the only good thing I can say about that place, good luck!!

We stayed at the Stratosphere for two nights. We dropped our stuff off and left the room, returning several hours later after a late night concert. We noticed that the sink was full of something that looked like vomit and smelled like raw sewage. There was also a large amount of mold in the bathroom and filth all over the door leading to the next room, ceiling and frame around bathroom door. I wanted to immediately change rooms but my husband was exhausted and basically passed out on the bed. The next morning he got up before me and went to the front desk. Where he was told that the filth and mold where acceptable and not room changing....they would however drain the sink.... the catch they wanted to do it right then. He told them that wouldn't work as I was still sleeping. She said ok... I'll just make a note that YOU REFUSED to have the sink drained. She was rude and didn't even apologize for the state of the room. He waited a few hours until I was awake and called the front desk. Again they considered the mold and filth a non-issue...but offered to have the sink drained. We left the room and came back several hours later to change for dinner...the sink had been drained but all the crude inside it was left there to dry. It was so disgusting! Even with the sink drained the room still smelled of sewage. We both became extremely nauseous and instantly exhausted... skipped dinner and just went to sleep. We left early the next morning. I am so disappointed by this experience.  We are locals and are often asked by friends and family where they should stay, I would NOT recommend staying at the Stratosphere.

My room was not great but it was adequate. Didn't spend much time there anyway. The location was great, between the strip and Fremont. Also there were a few restaurants in the hotel and it was nice to get a small bite at McDonald's before we began our day. The hotel is right on the bus line which was really great!

Das ist bestimmt der höchste Starbucks Coffee der USA. Ganz oben im Tower des Stratosphere Hotels in Las Vegas gibt es eine Filiale des berühmten Kaffees. Hier kann man sich auf die vielen weissen Sofas mit seinem Pappbecher und seinem Muffin hinsetzen und den wunderbaren Ausblick auf ganz Las Vegas und Nevada betrachten...oder auch die "Verrückten" die sich über einem in die Fahrgeschäfte trauen! 
Für mich eines der Besten Starbucksfilialen!
Video link: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=-1YfnGLpevo

Stayed here for our vacation. Casino was great, very clean and not that crowded, I guess it's because it's far away from the strip. Our room wasn't as big as we thought it would be, but the price for it was great. Made service is great also, always gave us extra toilet paper and towels and threw away our trash. Honestly if you're in vegas to have a real vegas experience you should book a hotel in the strip, but I was here just to catch up with friends and I'm not a party person so I'm glad my friend booked this place. The arcade needs touch up, I don't think the parents can keep their Kids distracted in their very long since theirs limited game options and there isn't prizes you can win after playing a game. The pool table needs a lot of TLC. Parking lot is free to park and lots of stalls always open. They also have great dinner deals and returning to their hotel deals for people 25 and over. Sadly I was only 24  till next time.... overall I'd probably come back if I needed a get away trip.

Just wanted to write a quick review. Stayed in this hotel in September of last year (2011). It is SO hot in vegas in september. Also, if you take a shuttle from the airport to this htoel it is SOOO FAR from EVERYTHING , that you have to pay EXTRA for "downtown" and not the "Strip" so its about a $3 difference.

The pool isn't on the ground its somewhere in the middle. It was NOT Fun, or NIce. The tropicana has a WAY better pool and is only a little bit more at the other end of the strip.

If you miss the bus, and have to wait in the heat to get back to the stupid stratosphere its miserable. OR if you have the bright idea to WALK, it takes forever.

The food is ok. The views at the top were nice, but at night there was wind and we could feel the tower MOVING. It literally made me sick to my stomach!

SO far, if you are young dont stay here. I would suggest The Flamingo or somewhere closer to the middle of the strip. it's very depressing, the stratosphere isn't close to ANYTHING!  Also, one of the closest hotels the Sahara has shut down (I believe just a few months before we got there), so the monorail doesn't go this far out .

DONT STAY HERE!

I don't even want to give a star but i have to so i am.. Our room light was blacked out for 3-4hours and I called front dest.   when I talked on the phone with a manager named Eileen, she said she will just call a facility over us and she didnt even say sorry because it was blocked out for only two hours.  And she did not try to solve the problem other than calling a facility over us.  Also, she treated us like we were toxicated.  She was trying to a call a police over us by saying that we were drug addict. However, we were very adffended by her saying that because we have not try to smoke a weed at once.
Because she didnt say sorry a word I was very upset and I do not understand her being in that position when she cannot even understand in customer's position at all. We couldn't even take a shaower or use the restroom because it was blocked out three to four hours.

I have been staying at the Stratosphere for 4 consecutive years all different dates but every year in October the same weekend which is this Friday the 16th-18th. We received our 2 free nights voucher, which we get every year and called and they are saying they cant honor it due to a convention. I called and spoke with a Donna and she was very rude and told me I only played 4 hours a day so she wont do anything for me then HUNG UP ON ME ! Can you believe this ! I will be taking mine and my friends business to another casino and WILL NEVER enter this place again ! Horrible to do that to somebody. We are higher up player card holders also.

Overall it was a pretty good stay. Ate at Roxy's and Top of the World and both were very good. The only problem we had was our bathtub was backed up. Maintenance was called and they unclogged it, but they left a huge mess in the bathroom. You really shouldn't have to clean a bathroom when you stay at a hotel.

I booked a room here for $40 a night and let me tell you, you get what you pay for. The rooms (though classy looking) are pretty much what you get when you stay in a motel: tiny bathroom, no fridge, no microwave, the ice bucket seemed to be some flimsy bucket a kid would play with in the sand, no ceiling lights, basic tv channels, and a VERY LOUD air conditioner. The room was so hot and stuffy but the air conditioner (even on the lowest setting) was so loud and obnoxious we couldn't sleep with it on. The walls are paper thin and we heard our guests talking, showering, and watching TV all night. 

On the plus side, the casino area was great and we won about $400, and the beds were very comfortable. The drapes also completely blocked the light, so when I woke up at 11am I could have sworn it was still the middle of the night. Room service is also fast and efficient, and not too pricey (unless you're ordering alcohol). You also get to go to the top of the tower for free if you're a guest (I can't imagine paying $15 just to take an elevator to the top).

Things I would change: 
The air conditioner!! Please! Vegas is hot and us out-of-towners need our rooms to be cool.
The wifi should not be $12 a night... that's steep.
A fridge please! I assume they don't want you bringing your own booze because they want you to buy one of their $180 bottles of grey goose (there's even a placard in the room saying 'no outside alcohol'), but I would have liked to save my PF Changs leftovers from last night and reheated them for today :(

All in all, this is a good deal for $40 a night... but probably not any more than that. If you want the full Vegas experience, pay a little more for a hotel that is actually on the strip and has more amenities.

I also wanted to mention that for a hotel\/casino, they should offer a coffee pot  for those that request them.  I mentioned this to a front desk lady and she responded with, "do you realize how many rooms we have? That would be a lot of coffee pots" - I'm not saying buy one for each and every room, buy enough to accommodate those that want them!!  I hate having to do ANYTHING first thing in the mornings and having to walk all the way on the other side of the casino for a $5.00 cup of coffee is just ridiculous!! They have a blow dryer in every room, a clothes iron and ironing board in every room - why not add a coffee pot.  This might make you stand out a bit more because I, nor my husband was impressed with anything about this room.  

The bed was hard as a rock, and both nights we stayed I woke up hurting and feeling stiff - so much for a good night's sleep when we are on vacation, huh?  We ended up checking out a day early because of this being one reason for such huge disappointments with the place. 

Places like McDonalds (for those that wanted just a little cheeseburger to eat) was clear on some floor labeled "R" (retail) floor, and clear in the back of the floor!  We couldn't figure out how to get to "R" because there is only ONE ELEVATOR that takes you there - such inconvenience!!!

I would be almost sure that majority of people bring their own hair dryers, and not much less would actually use one of those irons in the room - GET SOME COFFEE POTS!!! This place nickel and dimes you to death!!
Why install two elevators if one just sits there going nowhere when there is a line.   Ridiculous.

I came here to go to the Top of the World restaurant and 107 lounge, so this review is based strictly on my observations as a non-hotel staying guest. The hotel is not my cup of tea, but everyone is looking for something different. It's pretty low end, with a Chinese swap meet-like store (anyone want an Asian wall fan for $9.99?) and a store selling no-name handbags right by the check in booth for the restaurant. It's also very far from the center of the strip, and in a "bad" area.  If you have a car, it's probably not so bad, but I wouldn't be walking around there late at night by myself.  I did ask an employee for directions to the restaurant and he was very helpful, which was nice.

By far the most disgusting hotel I've ever stayed at. Upon arrival, our room was not clean, the cleaning lady was sitting on the bed talking on her cell phone while watching Maury. When she saw us at the door, she continued talking on her phone and took her cleaning supplies with her. She said, "I'm done. Go ahead," as she was walking out. There were used tissues on the night stand- both on and in it. The trash cans were not emptied. Ek! Disgusting. I spent a week here and did not want any of their lazy maids to clean the room again. I just called the front desk when I needed things. Worst experience ever.

Two stars because at least the front desk people were nice.

Recently went there and it was good and the beds were very comfortable (well, the one I slept on). The only thing is that when I first came in the room, there was no soap and other stuff that hotels normally provide. However, I was able to get some from the housekeeping service people which they had great customer service skills.

Also the view from the tower, especially at night, is great, and the Big Shot ride was fun (just wish it went higher). I think next time I visit I'll Skyjump from the tower.

Decent hotel, clean and easy to navigate. But i booked a room with a king bed and when we checked in we ended up with a queen bed in a handicap room. which meant the entire floor in the bathroom got soaked when you showered and no counter space at all. Other than that it was good. The in house Buffet isn't bad and if you buy tickets for the buffet at the desk they are cheaper than buying them in front of the buffet.

DO NOT STAY HERE! Fire alarms were going off 3 of 5 days of my stay that no one could turn off. Room service couldn't even make a club sandwich without ham on it.
If you do stay here, be prepared to hear "Sorry I wish there was something I could do".

Out of all the hotels I've been to, this place literally has the slowest free wifi ever. 
Besides that, the room was decently clean but there was no refrigerator or microwave, and the bathroom space is very cramped. Also, you'd think you would get a nice view of the strip at the tallest standing hotel. But I think even with paying extra to go on one of the higher floors you won't get a nice view.

This only got three stars because I wasnt impressed by the rooms and location of the hotel. Compared to other hotels in vegas (minus the circus circus because I have no idea who would want to stay at the creepy place) it wasn't great. But it was cheap so I guess you get what you pay for.

Two of us stayed for a long weekend in room 16110. 

In the heat, the tiny window (which offered no view anyway) was closed to keep the room cool the whole time. Even at night. Luckily, the ac worked pretty well, most of the time. 

Someone did mention previously that this casino is situated far enough North of the proper strip so as to be expensive by taxi or Lyft and that's true. So ride the bus. It is air conditioned and frequent and only $8 for 24 hours. No weirdos, super easy to navigate, helpful drivers and very safe.

There is an airport shuttle which requires a reservation, the registration line is bananas. Get yourself a drink and settle in. We walked by each day several times to a very long line. We got in at 730 and waited probably a half hour in line to check in.

We also felt like there should be some literature in the room explaining the local liquor laws that might be of interest to tourists; as long as you are on the strip or Freemont street, you can have an open container. Though this is not the case anywhere else and any others that you could run afoul of in thinking that anything goes.  

The toilets here required multiple flushes, there was no full-length mirror or coffee pot or fridge, and the neighbor's pot smoke came right through our bathroom vent. Also, it would be nice if there were a proper sink and mirror IN the bathroom so that late night trips to the bathroom don't wake your room mate. 

Other than that, the beds were clean, the tv worked and as long as you have earplugs, it's reasonably quiet. There's a discount to go to the top if you are staying there so only $5, which you MUST do, preferably at sunset. No really exciting dining options, but enough. Starbucks. 

Would stay here again, but will absolutely look closer in on the Strip to save on the half hour ride each way and for more basic amenities.

The Stratosphere is good for two things and two things only, No Craps Craps and Amusement Park rides. If you have stayed here and have been burnt by the $29.99 room who do you have to blame, the Hotel or You?

The Stratosphere is the only Casino that offers no Crap Craps, meaning on that first roll, if you roll a 2, 3 or 12 you can not Crap out, which is a REALLY BIG deal when it comes to gambling, so if you are playing craps somewhere else you are insane. 

The Stratosphere has figured out the market and figured out how to charge everyone for everything when it comes to going to the top. Just walking to the area in which you have to purchase the ticket to take the ear popping elevator ride to the top is a hike from the valet. The Casino makes sure you have to walk through the Casino for several minutes which means you are probably going to want to gamble. Once you get to the area to purchase ride, elevator or observation deck tickets you will have been walking through a mall, massage tables, video arcades, restaurants etc. 

The Stratosphere Tower tickets (means Elevator ride) charges $16.00 for adult and $10.00 for a child. Seniors and Nevada residents are $12.00.

At the top of the Stratosphere they charge the following to ride their rides: 

Big Shot (sooo much fun) $13.00
X-Scream $12.00
Insanity $12.00
Sky Jump (Controlled jump off the side of the building) $109.00 & UP. 

The Stratosphere now offers unlimited rides and Tower admission for $34.00. I am not sure if you are allowed to go up to the top several times or if you are stuck up there for the entire day.

This place is a lot of fun for riding rides and let's be honest non gambling time which at the end of the day saves us all money. People will stick $20 into a slot and burn threw that it 30-45 seconds but we will complain if we are charged the same to ride an elevator that takes longer than that.

Came to Vegas for a wedding, so was looking for a cheaper place to stay that was still close to all the chapels.   

Had a HORRIBLE experience with booking since I was flying in at 6AM, and originally booked through hotels.com and even though I was willing to pay for an extra night, they were still giving me issues saying i had to wait until 3:00PM , when I had the wedding at 5.   Called the hotel directly and they wouldn't help me because I was going through hotels. com.   Nice.  My experience is with the hotel, seems like the don't care if its not booked through them.   Called hotels.com... and they won't let me pay for the day before with an extra late check in... I mean really, no one wants my money?  I finally had to book two days via Hotels.com and then call back to the hotel and book another night with notes that I wouldn't check in until 6AM the next morning and pay them directly.  The second person I talked to at the Hotel directly was much nicer and they linked my two reservations together so that I didn't have to check out and then check back in.

After the above was all settled, upon arrival everything went smoothly.  The rooms were ok, there was a resort fee that I didn't see anywhere in my hotel.com reservation information, but oh well.  Plenty of parking, loved the casino, not too bad shows, yada yada. 

I like that its away from the main strip, as we spent no time there. We did walk down to Circus Circus and the Riveria, but to go further would have been pushing it....  BUt its easy to get in and out of the hotel, and since we had a car we spend most days in Downtown Vegas... 

The rooms are a little outdated, but they fit our need.  We did go up to the observation tower (included in our room) and that was pretty cool.  I had started coming down with the flu, so sadly i didn't get to partake in any of the extreme fun things you can do at the top... like jump :)  You can even see video of other jumpers on the TV.  

We did the buffet one morning... it was amazing.  tons of breakfast foods and even lunch\/dinner stuff too....it was good, and plentiful... and since we just joined the membership in the casino... it was free!!  

I would stay here again unless I found something cheaper.   I'd rather spend my money DOING stuff than needing 3 bathrooms and a tv in my mirror( ahem Bellagio)...

The Stratosphere is significantly less expensive than hotels on the Strip, but there are significant drawbacks. The location is pretty far from the main attractions of the city, and the hotel itself could use significant renovations in its shopping, restaurants, and rooftop locations.

Our initial room was good in terms of space, but the bathtub was initially filled with hair from the prior guest and the room itself could have used a much deeper cleaning.

Staying at the Stratosphere was a pleasant surprise.   After reading some of the other reviews here I was expecting a pretty yucky place.   I was pleasantly surprised to discover this hotel wasn't that bad.   Don't get me wrong, the MGM and Aladdin still kick butt over the Stratosphere, but it is better than Fitzgerald's.   

If you are staying here, plan on renting a car or taking lots of taxis because it is away from most things.   Eventually, the strip might make it's way toward the Stratosphere, but it's not there yet.   They charge everyone a $5 per night per room "Resort Fee" for access to the pool and the tower.   I never made use of it, but I wish they just would have included that in their fee.  
The rooms are decent.   Expect to pay extra for a view of the strip.   The showers all seem to have issues.  Ours made a horrible screeching noise unless you adjusted it just right.   That was just annoying.   Our friend's room had a major leak in their shower head, but they got it replaced within a couple of hours.   Housekeeping was fast and thorough.  

Will I be back?   Yeah, maybe, if there is a major event in town and the other hotels jack up their prices.   In that case, the Stratosphere becomes a bargain.

Stayed here back in July for my birthday weekend. We booked about 3-4 months in advance and couldn't beat the price. Yeah the stratosphere is an older hotel and north of the strip, but why pay out the ass for a room if you're almost never in it?  When we checked in, our room had been given away to someone else so we were upgraded to a "suite" on the 24th floor in the newer building. The room was pretty small for a suite but it was clean and we had a view of the tower and could see people doing the sky jump. Our bathroom had a hot tub which was sweet however the lighting was very poor in the bathroom. There was one fluorescent bar above the mirror. We did get to use the hot tub which was nice and relaxing. Hotel guests get free access to the tower and observatory deck. Also you get coupons for deals on drinks and rides. We unfortunately didn't get a chance to ride the rides since we were out and about.

I played a little downstairs and won money on the OITNB machine which was a nice bday present. We signed up for a player card and you get a free swipe to win free play and other prizes including a voucher for 25% off the buffet. We went for lunch and Sunday brunch. It was ok, nothing fancy. The eggs benedict was a bit disappointing. The muffins were rock hard and difficult to cut. My parents had gone earlier that morning and we were told there was bagels and lox. When we got there, someone had already put them away. My boyfriend asked someone behind the counter if there was still bagels and lox. The lady glared at us, turned around and pulled the salmon and bagels out, plopped the tray down and walked away like we ruined her entire day lol. Whatever.

We checked out Radius which is their adults only rooftop pool\/lounge on the 24th floor. We were on the same floor so it was convienient. It's a small area and you have to pay to use their bigger sized pool chairs\/beds\/whatever they're called. Lame. It wasn't crowded when we went and the DJ was playing all the popular club hits. The pool water was ice cold but you get a few drinks in you and it feels nice lol. 

We picked the Stratosphere because the rooms were cheap and it's close to Fremont street. I personally enjoyed gambling in old vegas as did my boyfriend. I'd recommend staying here if you're looking on the cheap side. Overall, our stay was decent and satisfying.

My wife and I recently booked a room at the Stratosphere for two nights. We were celebrating her 30th birthday and wanted a nice, well known hotel. We settled on the location because the prices were beyond cheap for the rooms, pictured online, portrayed a more than decent room. It was a very long day of traveling and wanted to settle in. We walk in to our room to see a wall lined with outdated, non-matching, broken furniture that looked like you'll catch something just grazing it as you walked by. The lights tinged and flickered for 30 seconds once you flip a switch which will make the hair stand up on the back of your neck. The shower head was nothing more than as if someone was spitting water on your head. The nicest part of our stay was that room service leaves you layers, nay mounds, of years worth of dust, spit sunflower seeds, and whatever unholy dirtiness the past guests leave behind. We opted out of asking to upgrade and checked out after a sleepless night spent wondering what creepy crawlers were on you and if Norman Bates was going to appear and make you his toy. We booked a room at the Cosmopolitan, BEST hotel on the strip by the way. Even if you are on a very strict budget and think this is a deal, please keep looking for better places for the money.

I'm giving this place 2 stars, I booked on Hotwire for $25 a night, which was a good price and I'm a local, been to the stratosphere before just to gamble. Long line to check in, friendly hotel staff, they upgraded us to their jacuzzi suite for $60 which was a pretty good deal, I was ok with paying that however he told me it was normally $400 a night which I find that hard to believe. Our first room was nice until I tried to take a shower & it smelled like seepage from an elephants butt hole. They changed our rooms, same floor, no smelly shower, nice tub.

The adult only clothing optional pool was nice, cheap happy hour, breathtaking views of the mountains and they have floaties so you can relax. The loungers are comfy too..

Roxys diner, good, reasonably priced however my date found a hair in his food, not so great. 

Tower, if you don't easily get seasick or lightheaded, go for it. I've been in that tower twice in the last six years, I don't need to go again any time soon

Mccalls, great late night happy hour with friendly staff


Back to our room.. Went to bed around 12:45.. Woke up between 1:30-7, multiple times because I was itchy.. I woke myself up scratching various areas on my body.. When I woke up for the day, it was like I had been eaten alive by something, I don't know if it's bed bugs or not but holy hell, whatever bit me thought I tasted good, big, itchy, welt like bug bites, swollen and just plain terrible. 

So I go to all the little shops, all of them sold out of benedryl except one.. I didn't buy it simply because it was $12 and I figured I could wait til I got home.. The sales lady at the one shop also told me that for some reason benedryl was very popular lately.. Hmm..'wonder why?

The hotel reimbursed me for my resort fees & upgrade charges and took a security report & pictures of my bites. 

I was thankful to be reimbursed but it still really sucks. I thoroughly checked the mattress & couldn't find any signs of bed bugs so I am not really sure what it is..
Good luck to anyone else staying there

Terrible service. This place is a dump, where do they train their bartenders, no wait they don't care about customers.  Stay away from the bar at the top, they are too busy to serve you trying to find the Mr Boston book to find out what goes on a Shirley Temple.

I booked here with a skeptic mindset and I didn't expect much for the price (being at the end of the strip). 

Upon arrival seemed about right I was traveling alone and just needed a place to sleep for 1 night. 

Right away upon checking in I was greeted with a smile by Jennifer. I went up to my room and was appalled there was no fridge, a dirty restroom, and it was a two queen instead of the king I had requested (just on a higher floor as a trade off). 

I was literally about to call the front desk when all of a sudden I received a text asking if everything was okay with my room. I explained my situation and both  Jennifer and Maria got me out of that room and upgraded me to a suite no questions asked! 

I had a peaceful nights rest and am extremely satisfied in their level of customer service. Give this hotel a chance as they are making changes and be sure to ask for Jennifer or Maria. I will definitely stay here again. 

Request room 22036.

Thank you,
Shafi

I was in Vegas for a wedding and everyone in the wedding party was staying at the Strat so my girlfriend and I decided to stay here. Before my stay here I had never even set foot on the grounds of the Strat because it is so far from everything else. I was however pleasantly surprised! Our room is really nice, especially for how little we paid! The casino isn't smokey at all, and we received 2 free drinks while playing the penny slots (which never happens!). 

The view from the top of the Strat at night is effin amazing! The bar downstairs has all you can drink 5pm-9pm for 20$! It's also on the Bus line that is 7$ for 24 hours unlimited rides so it's easy to get down to the bigger casinos for shows or poker rooms!

Overall it's really cheap, it isn't the Venetian by any means but it's a nice clean place to sleep! I'd 100% stay here again, and probably will.

My two complaints....buffet is mediocre, and the elevators take a LONG time around check out time cuz it's super busy!

Unfortunately, I stayed at the Stratosphere the night of the horrible incident on the strip.

I'm giving it five stars because after I walked back from Hooters (left at 3:30 am when it was clear and got back at 5:20 a.m.) and when I got back I was tired and pretty upset with the whole night.

I thought I lost my room key, but found it. I went to the service desk and due to the events, asked for a late checkout. The guy was very happy to do it and very understanding.

I'm thankful for that.

Otherwise, it was fine. It's just so far from everything. Just sad to experience a stay anywhere on a night like that.

I actually stayed at the Strat last year in May. I love the Strat for it's colorful ambiance, and the fact that I was winning at their slots and tables (though I lost it all which was entirely my fault). I also won free tickets to the AMerican Superstars show and I enjoyed that show so much! The Michael Jackson impersonator really touched my heart. I trekked back to Stratosphere in February of this year just to see the show again. It's truly too bad that the Strat got rid of the show the past month because it brought me back everytime. 

I also enjoyed the food options. The buffet (but only for brunch) and the Roxy's Diner (but only the milkshake). There was also a Mcdonalds there that I frequented (hey, good, cheap, reliable, late-night, fast food). The Mcdonalds outside of the Strat and around the corner I also frequented because they had free Wifi (which no Vegas hotel has). There is also a Burger King and IHop near the Strat. I did not appreciate their gym very much because it was small and always packed but I did get to use a treadmill and for paying only about $25 per night, I figured I got a lot more than what I paid for.

The pools are great too. The big pool is rather large with little theming. The hot tub was nice and it was a fun environment. I love the heat of the sun there! The adult pool is also nice with amazing views and nice music. I was not crazy about the tower because it was there I learned about my fear of heights but if not for that fear, that, the thrill rides, the restaurant, and clubs and lounges up there would have been ultimately enjoyable. The clubs and lounges were free for guests always so that made me happy because I at least peak at them (and they were cool) before running to the elevator to make an exit! Entry to the tower was also complimentary because we were guests.

The rooms were definitely functional and pretty with nice red and white tones. It had one of the best room colors I have seen thus far in vegas. The bathroom was not extravagant but simple and nice. 

I feel that the Strat will fall off even more now that the Sahara will be closing and the AMerican Superstars show left. I mean, what will be the point to go all the way out there except for sleeping there or the thrill rides? I'm afraid I might have to say bye bye to the Strat real soon. *tear*

Booked for 4th of July what a mistake $140 total. For a 1970s ish room with a lawn mower of a AC unit. A toilet with the noise of outdoor public one. A shower that had dirt still in it in clumps. And hearing people and plumbing noise all night to top it off. All because bookaroom.com deceived us with pics of the new remodeled ones which is not what we got. Resort fee jumped up an early check in at 10 dollars extra. Never will I stay here again. The only plus was with room was free tower view.
Don't know if would stay again. Rooms were ok. Pool service sucked. Took 1\/2 to get drinks, and another 1\/2 for change

A smoker's delight.  The suite smells like an ashtray and the HVAC blows second hand smoke in my room.  There were college kids partying in the hallways til about 4 am.  The casino is a smokey hell hole.  ON the plus side, it was pretty cheap and the pool was nice.

Although I have never stayed here as a guest, we frequent this casino with people who are visiting, come and see shows, etc. They always seem to have cool stuff going on! Yes, it is a bit "ol' school" smokey, no doubt. 

The view from the 107 Lounge ( 107th floor Bar) is 180° AMAZING! Hands down the best in the city!

Have never tried the rides on the top, or jumping off the building, but if you are a true thrill seeker! You can jump from 109th floor to the 2nd! Seriously! 

We always have fun here! Worth the excursion to the far end of the strip!

If I could give this hotel no stars I would! First off hotel manager "Majid Barati" stated that "Vegas was not for families" and the "pool was an amenity" and therefore nothing further can be done. No flyers given, no warning given, no promotion given that the only kid friendly pools allowed in this hotel would be closed early. Not only does that eliminate the one activity families can do in the hotel but the attitude received by the manager was awful. No regard for customer service, no regard for righting a wrong. There is still plenty of sunshine to at least allow an extra hour so the families can enjoy. But no nothing this great hotel and staff could do for their customers.

I unfortunately stayed at the Stratosphere for 6 days. The casino is smokey, bad carpet and dated. The rooms are awful unless you upgrade to a suite. The hotel is in horrible and unsafe area at the furthest end of the strip. There are boarded up homes all around complete with drug dealers, crack heads and hookers everywhere. I would not ever stay here again. The front desk was rude and unhelpful when checking in and said no non smoking rooms were available and that our room preference was not guaranteed. The food at the McDonald's and Roxy's was awful! The Mexican restaurant was decent and I heard the Italian place was good. The pool area was surprisingly nice and the view sky deck was pretty cool. Overall, I would not stay here again!

I stayed in this hotel 3 Days, Check  in was quick, updated room, attentive staff,  Buffett Area is clean and good, Free parking. MJ live is Amazing! Top of the world with rides and views is fun. The retail shops prices are affordable, compared to other shops at the strip. I found $1 keychains and shot glasses, Duffle bags for $10. I forgot the name to the store but the worker there was very helpful. The china shop was my favorite for gifts, I bought a huge bamboo fan for $15. Overall experience was really cool.

Took my daughters to the stratosphere in Vegas this past weekend.  Nothing spectacular! The room that I had was clean but the toilet ran all night and made noises. Room service brought our pizza cold. The views up top of the hotel are great. The diner in the hotel was nice. Great food. He hotel staff was about 6\/10. The bartenders seemed like they hated their jobs. Not very friendly. 

The area of the hotel is in a kind of rough neighborhood. It's far from the strip. Be sure to have can fair.  They don't offer any shuttles. 

I'd stay there again but I won't have such high expectations. The main pool was closed. But there was a second pool. We were told that adults can go to the second pool until late night. That wasn't correct. It closed at 8pm. 

Enjoyed Vegas. Next time I will get a better room. I guess I should have paid more.

Overall, my experience at this hotel was good. I recently stayed in LV for a work trip near the convention center and picked to stay at the stratosphere because of its close distance to the convention center.

It is an older hotel and not directly on the strip, so be prepared to take taxis or Ubers to the fun in town! But it's got a good casino and the rooms are not that bad. 

I also really liked that this hotel didn't charge a security deposit. I know some hotels charge an insane amount on hold for security- but wouldn't you rather be spending that on your vacation! The resort fee was about $25 per day so it was also very affordable.

What I really enjoyed about this hotel was their lounge that was atop the Stratosphere. It was absolutely amazing and so beautiful and relaxing to enjoy at the end of your night.

I booked via Travelocity for a week long stay in Vegas for the APA Nationals. I think for the rate (under $40 a night) and room I got, this place is All Right. The King sized bed was great, the room was clean, and the A\/C was kickin out nicely! However the room was right next to the elevators, and the walls are super thin, I heard the elevators all the time, ... I could hear my next room residents...which means they could also hear me... (blushes) The staff was nice and the layout was easy to follow. The pool was fantastic! Tons of room and cheap drinks, however only 3.5-4.5 ft deep all the way around, and the water was super salty, which was strange. 
I enjoyed my stay here and will consider this hotel again when I return to Vegas.

I am going to only write about the actual stratosphere itself and not much about the hotel. I haven't been here in a while so I am writing from memory. The stratosphere is located on top of the Las Vegas Hotel. The hotel itself is located between downtown Vegas and the Strip. You cannot simply walk there because it is far from all the other hotels. More importantly, it is located in a rundown part of Vegas. I would definitely not advise any first-timer to walk around, especially at night.

Now back to the stratosphere. It is pretty cool if you haven't been there before. It presents a breath-taking view of Vegas for miles. There is a restaurant where you can eat. They also have a few attractions, like a roller coaster and a bungee jump. There are NOT for the faint of heart!!! The prices for all is pretty steep but worth it if you have not visit here before.

I recently stayed at the Stratosphere, about 2 weeks ago. I must say after reading the reviews on this place, I was a little reluctant in booking. I went ahead and kept my reservation, since I wanted to see the amazing view. Well it was worth it. The hotel room itself was nice! The renovated rooms really made me and my husband want to just stay in the rooms. But since you cant really do that in Vegas we had fun in the casino and hotel itself. I loved how the tower, mall, and casino where all in one place. 
I did not like the LOCATION. It is on the END of the strip. We had to buy a cab every time we wanted to go to the main parts of the strip. But honestly its VEGAS.. so you have to be ready to walk anyway. 
The worst part if i had to pick one is the LOCATION! it is literally next to the hood! so BEWARE.. but if your not scared like me... GO FOR IT!

The location of this hotel is further than I thought and it's close to the older casinos on the strip but it was okay because we had a car. 
When we got to the hotel we noticed there was not a trashcan in sight. So we asked for one by calling the front desk. Minutes later a guy shows up and rudely questions "What's the problem?" WTF? We told you the problem so bring us the freakin trash can!! (I HATE bad service!)
Secondly, we notice there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom so after showers, the bathroom is incredibly humid and stuffy. 
The next night, we noticed it was a bit warm in the room and came to the realization that the AC wasn't working. We made about 5 separate calls to the front desk for someone to come up (we were told that someone should be up within minutes and it was 115 degrees outside so we were irritated) It was after our fifth call when they told us we were getting a new room. Why didn't they just do that in the first place?
The last one was the one that took the cake. My sister saw yellow stains on the sheets so she peeled off the sheets and slept on top of the inside comforter but above the top cover. She and a friend got bug bites probably because of bed mites or other nasty critters. I slept on TOP of the covers so my bf and I were not parasited. Someone I know took hotel management and its a standard that the comforters don't get washed unless a VISIBLE stain was apparant. That is soooo nasty!!!!!! I'm just glad I didn't find a pubic hair in the sheets. 
All in all, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. I think it would have been better if I slept in the car..
A great value and a great experience. While it will always be location challenged it now is worth the walk. Can't wait to get back next month.

The Stratosphere seems to get more and more ghetto as the years go on. 
I'm guessing the reason it has trouble keeping up with the times is because it's surrounded by the grit and sleaze of the Naked City, and it's just so far away from everything. 
The mall is laughable. There's a pretzel place in there which I grabbed a pretzel from in my Journey to Nowhere, and the pretzel kind of saved my life, but the whole Journey to Nowhere is a completely different story. The mall of the Stratosphere is a strange mashup of Beijing and Paris, it fails on both counts, and all of the stores sell overpriced, tourist trap junk. 
You know what else is laughable? The showroom. If you walk past it when a show is going on, you can hear EVERYTHING. There's also a translucent window behind the the theater bar, so if you sit there and look closely, you can see whatever show is playing for free. Both of their shows (American Superstars and Bite) look like crap so it's probably better to try and see it for free anyway rather than waste your money. 

Suggestions: Close down the buffet since it seems to have lost all hope and buy up the surroundings so the neighborhood will be more aesthetically appealing. I'm shocked the Stratosphere hasn't been closed, the only thing it really has going for it are the rides, restaurant and observation deck on top of the tower.

This hotel is ridiculous ... Nasty room.. I booked this since the orbitz deal gave a better price for this place an the photos luked nice.... Dont b fooled by the photos.... Kindly avoid this also circus circus hotel ... Also rivera... I was a seeing vegas for first time... My opinion is to avoid these three places... Rest all seemed fine...if possible i wudnt even giv a star

I brought my brother to vegas for birthday present and i was happy to stay in stratoaphere since it has thrill rides on top. Also i wanted to have fun at the radius pool today since hotel guests are free. I bought swimwear and shirt to go there but when i arrived there at 8:15 pm yesterday (apr 14th) employees said we have to pay 22 dollars per person since it is after 6pm.
I didnt see any comment on the website we have to pay after 6pm or no one mentioned there is a fee after 6pm.
How come no one notified guests and make us waste money and time. we cancelled dinner reservation and came back to hotel from the strip because of this.
Yesterday was my last day at this hotel and i cant use it any more.
These guys should change information on the website or make it free for guest because thats what you guys said on the website.
I still didnt receive any explanation from the hotel.
Good basic Vegas hotel with a huge casino. The room was large and cheap and the staff happily extended my checkout time by an hour. Wasn't incredible, but was cool

Look, it's not the nicest place on the strip by any means, but it's cheap and they really do try. We had a miserable experience at another hotel and just needed to get out of there, so we asked for a refund and left with nowhere to go. I'd stayed at the Stratosphere before, so I knew what to expect.
