We walked up to the desk and spoke with a really nice guy who went to his manager to see how good a deal he could get us given our circumstances. We saved a ton of money. They get an A+ for customer service in my book. The room was old and really basic, but it was clean enough and cheap and it was exactly what we needed. We saved a ton of money and escaped a bad situation. I think next time we'll stay in one of the "select" rooms at the Stratosphere. They've just been remodeled and from what I can tell they're much nicer, but for the money, the cheap rooms are fine.

Came here for the rides and the view.  I recommend them all, especially the one where you jump off the side of the building.  Do that one last, when you're done with happy hour at the lounge.  Gets you to the bottom floor in no time flat and as no one wants to do that ride there never is a  line to "get down" from the top.

Maybe my opinion is slightly skewed because I actually appreciated how empty this place was compared to the other hotels the weekend of the NBA Allstars. If not for the relief from the crowds, I probably would have given the Stratosphere 1 star. I didn't make our reservations, but if i had, i would have spent the extra bit on a nicer, more centrally located place.

Las Vegas really is all about location, location, location. A outlying hotel on the strip might as well be in another part of town. The stratosphere is no exception.

The casino area is actually really small in comparison to most places, but it's not the best place to gamble anyways. Granted if you are staying here, there are some low minimum Blackjack tables that can be fun. But I'm a craps girl at heart, and the tables here just didn't have the good luck. 

The rooms are okay. You can tell it's an older hotel, the rooms don't look like they've been updated in at least the last 10 years. I've stayed in worse places, but in comparison to all of the other Vegas hotel room's I've stayed in, this place is a dump. 

The restaurant at the top of the world (what they call the place at the top of the tower) has a horrible ridiculous policy where they charge your credit card $50\/person to cancel a reservation.. and I don't mean for a no show, or without reasonable notice, but at all.. Needless to say we didn't bother to make a reservation, let alone eat there. 

The main lobby bar is hit or miss. Some of the bartenders were nice, friendly, and helpful, while others were just downright rude and impatient. To me, this is a major pet peeve. When someone makes the choice to work in a service industry they should be friendly and outgoing. 

All in all, I doubt I would ever come back here again. In all my trips to Vegas this was the first time I've even bothered to visit the hotel\/casino, and now I know why.

I wanted to stay somewhere off the strip for a night this trip so I chose the Stratosphere because I always wanted to check out the viewpoint and it's not too far away from everything.
I stayed in one of the revamped rooms so it was pretty nice. There were not any issues like bed bugs or random blood stains on the wall. The bathroom was nice and no gross smells anywhere.

I'd recommend staying here if you want to get away from the main strip and want to get a nice view of Las Vegas. The view is definitely worthwhile. I only saw it during the day I am sure it's better at night since you'll be atop the Vegas glow. I think the tower closes at 2:00AM.

I think this place is hit or miss.  My boyfriend and I booked a last minute Vegas Vay-Cay to hook up with some family members who were gonna be in town for a couple days.  We got decent priced rooms (under $100) less than 24 hours before our trip, and it was completely worth it.  The casino isn't very large, and location- wise, it's not in the heart of the strip, but I think there were less drunken crazies because of that, and it was still a quick cab ride to Caesar's.  Stratosphere is also just a couple blocks from the Las Vegas outlets on Charleston.

The rooms looked like they were just remodeled and had flat screen TVs and updated furniture.  Bedding and bathroom were clean, but minus one star for the weird lighting in the bathroom... I felt like I was taking a shower in the dark.

Other than that, the overall experience was great for a last minute weekend escape :)
Came here for the observation deck, which was awesome!  They also have a few rides up top for those looking for an adventure.  Pretty cool.

The Stratosphere is a good hotel to stay in if you get it for the right price.  The rooms are spacious and the hotel is very clean overall.  One of the best hotel bathrooms I've experienced as well.  The pool area was nothing to write home about though.  Also, this is located far north on the strip, so it's out of the way from the main drag.  It is a ten minute walk to the Sahara to hop on the monorail, which isn't too bad if it's not past 2 A.M. or in the middle of the day with the hot sun beating down on you!

Just ran off to Vegas to elope this past week on a whim. Without really researching anything(a mistake I'll never make again if I ever travel to Las Vegas in the future,) we booked at the Stratosphere. 

The reason I say the lack of research and proper planning kind of hurt our experience is because of the Stratosphere's location: it's on the north end of the strip, which puts you pretty far away from everything. Thankfully, there's a bus line that runs up and down the strip 24-7(The Deuce) which can get you to the heart of the action within a half hour, but still... definitely made things a bit more stressful\/exhausting.  

Beyond that? The Stratosphere itself was a joy and struck me as a very reasonably priced resort, though a bit stripped down when compared to some of the bigger hotels like Caesar's Palace or the Aria. The hotel staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, from registration to dining to the concierge desk and attractions. We were able to upgrade our rooms to the 23rd floor for a pittance, which gave us a king size bed, a view of the mountains, and a jacuzzi tub. The concierge was a delight, helped us book two shows and gave us some great advice given, again, that we didn't properly plan. Everyone was just plain fantastic and shared in our excitement for our trip, which honestly went a long way towards us enjoying our time. 

The restaurant\/lounge at the top of the tower was very classy, though the restaurant was a bit overpriced. We spent about 200 dollars for two at Top of the World a la carte. I'm sure that's typical of most Vegas restaurants, but the food itself was just okay and definitely not worth the price tag. The lounge itself was very chill with an amazing view of the city, the staff was (again) a delight, and the drinks\/appetizer specials during happy hour made it worthwhile. There are other shops\/eateries in the mall section of the hotel that are fine, but nothing as fancy or upscale as the stuff you'll find in the bigger resorts. The buffet and the 50s diner on the ground floor were so-so, but not so horribly expensive that I'd discourage anyone from eating there.

I think it almost goes without saying that the Skyjump made the whole Stratosphere experience pretty unforgettable. Being a hotel guest, you can jump from the top of the Tower for less than a hundred bucks. While it's a controlled freefall and feels pretty safe\/secure once you take that first step off, actually mustering up the courage to take the plunge keeps it incredibly thrilling and I confess to grabbing a few drinks before I worked up the grit to give it a whirl. Absolutely worth it and if I ever go back to Vegas, it'll be something I do again. There's also a glass observation deck with an open view of the city, some smaller attractions and thrill rides for those unwilling to check out the Skyjump. 

The only other real downside beyond the hotel's location on the strip was the casino itself. It was dark, outdated, and pretty derelict. I'd recommend gambling elsewhere.

Bottom line? This hotel is great for someone looking for a Vegas experience that isn't too overwhelming\/ritzy. It was affordable, a ton of fun, and the staff was fantastic. The only real downside was how far it was from everything, but it wasn't so far that it ruined our vacation. Would definitely go there again. 

(PS: The review asked if the Stratosphere was kid-friendly... I checked "no" because seriously: why the hell would you bring your kids to Vegas? Shame on you.)

The stratosphere is the best casino in vegas. i have been there so many times i stopped counting. not a lot of crowd  and it is far from all the craziness of the strip and the other so called luxury casinos like the one that makes the salad or the one with the sitting lion. forget those. you want to have fun go to stratosphere. one small little problem and i think this goes for all the las vegas casinos. how come they dont payout with coins any more?? we want to hear the coins falling out of the slot machine. it really sucks. last time i was there i was very upset about that.

Dont know why so many complaints. This is a nice hotel for the price. We got $38 for a Wed night before xmas. The room was in the premier tower, it was clean and comfortable. I remember asking for a king bed, but instead got 2 queens, but that's not a big deal. Its away from the main part of the strip but, I drove from the bay area and prefer driving around vegas instead of walking or taking the monorail.  We liked the $3 blackjack table they had. The waitress was quick with drinks, they were great, pina coladas, fuzzy navels, kahlua with cream, etc mmm. The view from the tower was pretty good, we got free tikets to the observation deck, but it should be free anyway. I wanted to take a ride at the top but it cost extra and it was cold and drizzly. 

Its a nice hotel and casino for the price. You can't compare it to the Wynn or Venetian. Geez. I'd stay there again next time.

One of the blackjack dealers was really grumpy with my friend who was new to blackjack, but the other dealers were nice.

The internet was extra but thats the same for other hotels. They offered free use of the laundry machines. Didn't have time to check out the fitness center or spa.

So glad that I took the trip up here to ride the rides at the top of the Stratosphere. I got the unlimited ride package and rode each ride twice, which took a little over an hour on a Saturday night. Some of my best photos of my Vegas vacation were taken up here.

No. N-O.  This place was awful.  We arrived at 12:45am on a Thursday night\/Friday morning.  Thinking that not too many people would be there, we walked towards the check in.  "Hmmm... must be some sort of special event going on; what is that line for?" we thought to ourselves.  Oh, no, don't worry.  No special event, that is the CHECK IN LINE, roughly 25 people long, at 12:45am.  Patiently we waited.  And waited.  And waited.  I mean how long does it take to swipe a credit card and hand over a set of keys?  Well....fast forward to 2am.  We are walking into our hotel room.  Come on, if there is a line that long put some more people behind the desk.  The whole time we waited there were 2 employees checking in guests.

Now, because we, my girlfriend and I, had work to do on Friday morning, we called in to have breakfast delivered at 6:50am.  The woman took our order, with rocky phone manners, and refused to allow the delivery to occur without first running a credit card.  I offered to give the credit card upon room service delivery, but apparently that just wont work. I also offered to read the number to her over the phone, again no success.  So I told her to send someone to get the card right then and there (roughly 2:15am).  Fine.  So they pick up the card.  No issues.  We crawl in bed and are peacefully going to sleep...until....the phone rings.  She now wants to know if she should bring the card back right away.  I politely ask her to bring the card with the food at 6:50am.  We turn back over to catch a few Zs before the rapidly approaching wake up call.  Just as we're falling asleep, the phone rings again.  This time: an emergency.  They are out of ham and she wants to know if I want bacon or sausage.  MAKE AN EXECUTIVE DECISION!  Or better yet, call me at 6:50 to let me know...don't call me AGAIN at this ungodly hour to ask me asinine questions.

The room itself was completely mediocre, and we had the suite.  The place was clean, and it didn't smell.  For that I will add one star.   That is about all this place has going.  The casino is more so depressing than anything else.  There was construction going on - I think they were installing a new slot machine or something. 

Long story short - this place is cheap, and shitty.  Don't bother.  Its removed, and the service SUCKS.  Spend a few extra bucks and head somewhere else.
i love this place, its very entertaining! although, our view from our room was trash. overall, i still love it! the restaurants are fine, especially roxy's!

Kind of a let down. Their rooftop pool sucks, the music is too loud and the bar tender I dealt with was rude as hell.

I paid for a king bed but they put me in a queen. When I complained they did nothing about it.

If you're gonna lose money in Vegas, do it in the casino, not in the hotel. Definitely skip Stratosphere.

Well I'm giving this hotel \/ casino a 4 rating ...u know why? I never got any trouble with the accommodation.  Suprisingly, the staff was very friendly, accommodating and helpful.  We actually got here pretty late, you see I finally got to redeemed a "supposedly" 3 nights and 4 days I bought 6 months ago from the banana fair in Sacramento from a pushy sales people that work for diamond resort ... A vacation time share but that's another story.  They booked us to this hotel which u think worked hand in hand with diamond resort.  You see we have to go to a presentation to get the full discount for this trip.  120 minutes of sales pitch.  

Anyway we got here very late ... Almost 1 am in the morning and missed our voucher that we have to redeem prior to checking in.   Suprisingly the staff of Stratosphere help us and got us our room.  Not the the greatest but will do.  I really appreciated that. 

Our stay here was memorable ,... We got an all day pass to the rides and the top of the tallest tower in Vegas.  Oh btw not only that we got discount since we stayed there, the lady that helped us gave us a cheaper price for two for only $36 ... That was 10$ each off from what discount what we already had.  The view was breathtaking and the rides were extremely terrifyingly good.  We even came back up to see the views at night.

All in all it was a great experience.  The only I can't give this place a full 5 is the smell of the hallways we stayed and the cleanliness of some areas ...I would stay here again

I have been to LV a few times and I have stayed in 2, 3, 4, star hotels, and I have to say that the Stratosphere rank below a no name cheap Motel.  The customer service was painfully poor.  The front desk had poor manners, The management team did not care about what their guest needs and boy was the operations of the hotel poor.  this hotel was dirty from the north end to the newer south end.  The one one word I heard most often was "NO"  No this no that we will charge you this charge you that because we don't care and give a shit.  My phone was broken in our room, the bathroom was dirty, and we ask to change room and the Answer was "NO".  No options provided, no is no.....  Will never stay at the STRATOPHERE AGAIN, people who are look should spend the extra money and stay at another Hotel on the strip.  Circus Circus would have been a better deal and experience.     don't be fool by there photo online  the rooms they put you looks like it was from the 60's.  bait and switch!!!!!!!  its a crime.....

Great prices and the view from the top is good.  I only go when they have a good promo.  The location is far from the strip so if you are here to visit it should be one night here not a week.  Going to the top is not free and the casino is just below average.

Absolute worst hotel I've ever been to. Cleanliness is not of importance for this hotel. The bathroom door hinges were all rusty. Also the bathroom shower head was just covered in green build up. Some of the TV control buttons did not work. As another reviewer did mention, this hotel definitely does try to nickel and dime you on everything. After talking to the front desk in regards to my concerns, they didn't have any other rooms to move me to and told me to come back the next day and couldn't offer anything for the inconvenience. The buffet was way over priced for what they offered there and the quality was really bad. Definitely my first and last stay at this hotel. Advice yelpers, save your time and money as this place isn't worth any of it.

One of the least pleasant hotel experiences I've had. First of all I should say that we only paid $62 including tax and resort fee for one night, so our expectations were not high - I realise you get what you pay for. But we paid for a non-smoking room, and got a non-smoking room which stank of cigarette smoke - yuck. 

We did actually get upgraded from the smallest\/most basic type to a "King suite". However, this just meant a bigger bed (this was admittedly comfy) and a bigger but weird-shape room. Our TV was so far from the bed that the remote wouldn't work without us getting up and walking across the room!

The room was clean but dated, and despite having our AC set to 66, we both woke up sweating in the heat in the night. 

Wifi, often free in cheap hotels, was $12 for 24 hours, but whereas with the Cosmo I could use the Internet anywhere in the building, here I could only get a (patchy) signal in the room. The speed was appalling and it kept dropping out completely. 

Finally, our shower only gave us lukewarm water in the morning.

Overall we couldn't wait to get out of this place.

Motels provide better service than this hotel. Stay away. 

First thing: their wifi does not work. When we called about it, they sent a technician up to our room but he couldn't fix it either. He then disclosed that they've been having problems with the wifi, but only in the particular area where our room is. Lies. Wifi does not work no matter where you are in the hotel. Our rental car got hit by the valets, and we had to file a claim. They apologized. Concierge whose job is to provide information gave us the wrong information, causing us a 30 minutes walk. Our room was not serviced even though we left a sign requesting it outside or door. We left that morning at 11am and returned at 6pm. We called down to housekeeping twice to no avail. When we asked the front desk, they told us that "technically room are serviced every 3 days unless requested," which I pointed out we did. They insisted protocol is every 3 days unless requested.

Usually I come on Yelp to write bad reviews ( yes I'm that person ) BUT I must say I will always go to the Stratosphere to stay at in Las Vegas. Great price delicious food ( except Chicago style ) , friendly employees.. I literally just had an amazing time. Would recommend to my friends and family

Stayed February 10th thru the 12th.
Check in process was fairly quick, however they charge a resort fee of 50+. Most hotels charge this surcharge and I'm not exactly sure how it breaks down. In my opinion it's just another BS tax as this by no means had "resort style offerings". 
Room was a standard double bed . It's in a serious need of an update!
Our rooms bathroom was below standards. New fixtures are needed as well as a fan for ventilation. ( See Picture)..
Walls are extremely thin, we could here the guests next to us using the restroom & the toilets flushed with a great deal of force! 
For the money we paid to stay; this hotel was less than adequate. We were disappointed in our experience, the cost and our stay at the Stratosphere.

Last night I went to the Stratosphere for the night.  I tried to check in prior to the official check in of 3 pm and I was warned that there would be a 10 dollar surcharge applied to the room because I went in before the 3 pm posted check in time.  Unfortunately, the room was not ready at 130 or 230 when I approached the registration.  So I saved the ten dollars.  About 515 I went back for the third time and I was able to successfully check in.  The room was OK but the hot water in the shower was not real hot and it took about 10 minutes for the shower water to turn from cold to warm.  That was disappointing considering this hotel is not that old.  The Top of the World restaurant was good but pricey for what you received.  The view was nice and that is really what you are paying for.  The man at security took my selfie stick that attaches to my camera for some reason.  He said I could not take it up front.  It is plastic and could never be considered a weapon by any one with some sense.  This one still puzzels me.  The valet was quick and easy.  The C bar was expensive and I paid 9 dollars for two Miller Lite beers.  I will not return to the hotel part of this place but would go back to the Top of the World Restaurant.
We went to comedy show here was at the LA comedy room they had a decent drink special for strip prices. The comedians were good was def a good time had some good laughs.

Total dump!  I'm sure some people are happy with it just because it's so cheap but it's not worth it at all.  It's located way off the beaten path at the very end of the strip.  The area seems completely unsafe.  The monorail stops nowhere nearby.  If you want to see the American Superstars show be prepared to wait on the same insane line as the tower attractions.  My girlfriend and I showed up 45 minutes before showtime and decided not to go to the show because the line seemed like it would last at least an hour.  The room was every bit as tacky as a run down truckstop motel.  All in all the hotel is very depressing.  I know people are always going to love something if it's cheap but staying at this hotel completely jips you out of having a true Las Vegas experience.  If you're going to be this cheap with yourself why even bother going to Las Vegas in the first place?  This hotel is shit hole and it's way too far from the nice part of the strip to even be remotely worth considering.  Avoid at all costs!

Let's start from the beginning shall we?

Attempt 1 at check in:

My family's check in time was 3pm. Granted asking to check in at 11am was a long stretch, but please don't try to sell me another room. It'll just make you look bad, save yourself the embarrassment. 

Baggage drop off:

I asked the counter if there was a charge for drop off as I scope the city. There was no charge but I was told to tip. Tip is suppose to be voluntarily based on service, telling me to tip is basically charging me... might as well just charge, no?

Attempt 2 at check in:

I booked two rooms due to being in a party of 6. Both were booked under the same name because it was all under one credit card. During the first attempt at check in, I was given a summary of my bookings (2 non-smoking rooms with double beds). So the computers at the hotel were certainly not going haywire. But can the second hotel desk clerk be anymore... what's a better word... um stupid? She gave us one room and I was a bit confused, thus I asked if the two keys were for two rooms. She spewed out a bunch of yes, dismissed me and moved onto other customers. 

Fine. I was tired, hungry and wanted to shower. I headed to the 24th floor and looked in the room keys' envelope; one room number. Oh fuck my life. I headed back down to the registration desk (mind you, the walk was rather long) and was treated as if it was my fault; maybe 30% since I didn't fight it the first time. Though I specifically asked if the keys were for TWO ROOMS, was I speaking gibberish? 

Front desk lady proceeds to be rude and asks if I am sure, blah blah blah. Curses swirls in my head. I had 6 people! I wasn't even allowed to register more than 4 people in one room during booking! I told her I was sure and that there should be enough rooms if I was given two confirmation numbers. Wait for it... I got an eye roll. She's no longer stupid, she's a bitch. Phone calls were made; 10 minutes wasted and I finally got my room. 

Room summary:

-Sink was mucky.
-Towels were dirty.
-Towels were not replaced.
-Nothing was stolen.

Amenities:

The positive of this hotel is definitely the fact that it is an attraction. Discounts for thrill rides and unlimited access to the Stratosphere tower for hotel guests. Downside to going up was going down (like my pun?). Wait for an elevator is approximately 15 mins, if the elevators you are waiting for malfunctions.

Gym is small and limited.

Shops are limited and awkward. Though I loved the magic shop because of the friendly greeting I received and puns as I walked around the store. My friend and I spoke with Joe (I think that was his name) for a bit afterwards. Joe is the best and was willing to converse about anything and everything. If I wasn't so tight on time, I would have stayed longer.

Check out:

Smooth.

This hotel Is verrrrrrrrrryy dirty. You can not find any clean place here. Customers service is blow average or the worst. 
The price is cheap so every thing is cheap.
30$ per night is more expensive for stratospher hotel.

After driving four hours we finally arrived at the Stratosphere. We stood in line to get the room key and when we got to our room it was overlooking the parking garage and had only one bed in it, after we had called earlier that day to make sure our room had two queen beds in it. We called and the front desk changed our room to another one that had two beds in it but as soon as we carried all our luggage up a floor, we arrived at our room only for our key not to work. So then my husband had to walk all the way downstairs, wait in line and get a new key.

We finally got into our room about 15 minutes later and the sink is clogged and the walls are paper thin. You can hear everything and everyone who walks by. The room temperature also doesn't go below 68 degrees. You're also about 10 minutes from the strip and downtown vegas. It's in the middle where nothing else is. I travel to Vegas a lot and like to try out the different hotels, but unfortunately I don't think I'll be staying here again.

Even though the Stratosphere hotel is not as modern as the Venetian or Bellagio or Caesars Palace or Palazzo just to name a few..Still it was able to sustain its iconic name as one of the pillars of that makes up the Las Vegas. Just being on top of the tower, over looking the million of colors that lights up the city. man made beauty.

Upon walking inside, I really like the ambiance. Our room was clean and but the bed wasn't very comfortable. We did really enjoy the tower access which was amazing! The rides looked super fun but I wouldn't dare get on one. (Yes, I know I'm a chicken) This hotel is very far from everything else so before we rented a car we were somewhat stuck in the area. Playing in blackjack in the casino was one of the worst experiences I've ever had gambling. The dealers are very disrespectful and won't crack a smile if your not tipping...we did eat lunch at the buffet and it was fairly good. The food we ate at the Mexican restaurant in the mall was much better and a great value. The stores in the mall could use some updates to make it look trendier, but we had a good time walking around non the less. We enjoyed the drinks from Fat Tuesday's and the gift shop there is very reasonable. I think I will stay at another hotel on the strip next time.

Great disappointment with the hotel. I did not have great expectations about the quality but the service was poor, poorly managed and workers do not seem to care. We waited 2 hours you check in on a Sunday evening.  Our rooms were not available, we had to compromise for a smoking room, which was a suite. It smelled bad and it was filthy. See pic attached.  I recommend going somewhere else

The hotel is cheap but you get what you pay for. I stayed here 4 nights and my room was serviced twice. And I use that term loosely - barely any cleaning involved. I got 2 hot showers during my stay. The rest of the time it was lukewarm. The room is basic and the fixtures are worn. The casino floor smells of smoke. Every other casino I went to, I didn't notice it. Be warned that the hotel is not walking distance to the strip. The strip bus stops at the hotel but it is a pain to have to bus everywhere. I didn't try all of the restaurants onsite because I didn't want to - our first dining experience with Roxys Diner put us off. The best thing about this hotel is Level 107 Lounge, which is worth a visit - but you don't have to be a guest of the hotel to do that. I would not stay here again.

This place was just what we were looking for; a cheep roof over our heads while in Vegas. We had the kids so I didn't care about the gambling and we were not drinking so we didn't care if we had to drive to the main part of the strip. So.....perfect. I liked the "mall" it was doing something without dranging the stroller and diaper bag in and out of the car. I kept telling our 3 year old that we have to find kids gameS (he wanted to gave a go at the slot machines) and we found an arcade and had a good time! The tower was cool I thought the view was amazing! I  might stay here again but everywhere eles looks so new and cool I really
 wanna try somewhere different.

The only reason we decided to stay at the Stratosphere was because of a deal we received from Amex.  This place is as far away from the action as possible.  We probably would have had a better time staying at one of the dumpy Travel Lodge's off the strip.  We decided to walk to the center of the strip from the hotel and it took us about an hour at average speed.  During this hour walk we were constantly accosted by homeless people asking for change, at one point even being followed by a homeless guy.  We took a cab back when returning in the evening.  

The hotel itself definitely needs some updates.   The room was nothing spectacular.  You can hear people in the other rooms flushing their toilets and showering.  We were lucky enough to have a bunch of girls staying in 2 rooms across the hall from us who were slamming doors and running around the hallway all night.  Calling security amounted to absolutely nothing.  

The casino was absolutely lifeless, couldn't even find a decent blackjack table.  It is basically packed in with slot machines and cigarette smoke.  Even the non-smoking floors smelled like smoke.

During our visit, the 8th floor pool was not available but we decided to relax and lay out in the sun anyway.  But was unable to because of the drilling that was being done to the unavailable pool.  

We will definitely pay 3x as much money to stay at any other hotel on the strip.

I agree with "Sarah E". Stop complaining about the small stuff, hell you're in Vegas, most of the time you're not even in your room! AND I dont complain about free liquor!

I loved the Stratosphere HOTEL; the front desk was very nice and helpful. Our room was a decent size, our bathroom was clean.

I also loved the Stratosphere CASINO; there was 24 hour excitement. I hit several times on the slots, and the cocktail waitresses were surprisingly faster than the other casinos we went to that weekend.

There's also several restaurants, and shops throughout the hotel, including a mall upstairs. With this being said, I give 5 stars to this hotel.

Size of the room we were given was OK.But the bathroom,OMG,that is one horrible experience.
The tub is light 2 foot higher from the ground level and I fell down almost every time I stepped out of the shower.
And the actual shower did not seem to be in a normal working condition.
The internet was 12.99 a day,and you have to give your credit card details to a web link to get that activated.
We gave the credit card details and it said it could not process the transaction.
BUT WE WERE CHARGED ON THE CARD.
we enquired the front desk about the same and they said they could not refund the money as we did not go through them to get the connection(THE REASON THEY TOLD US IS THAT WE HAVE USED THE WEB LINK WHICH IS A THIRD PARTY).WHAT THE HECK?
OVERALL,THE experience is BAD.

I've never stayed here before, but I wanted to make a comment on recent service.My parents were checking in last weekend for my mother's birthday and I wanted to surprise her with a gift when she checked in. I called and it took a while for anyone to answer. Finally, someone picked up and they transferred me to catering, but I wasn't sure what catering was going to be able to do for me. It went to voicemail, but I needed to place the order ASAP. I hung up and called back a few hours later. Again, it took a while for a response.

The next person connected me with the concierge, which sounded like a better choice. Laura understood my needs and recommended me to a local florist. She transferred me, but I had to leave a message. I felt uneasy since I needed immediate service. I left a message and figured if I did not get a response that night, I can call in the morning. Robert called me back, luckily, and took my order of chocolate-covered strawberries and a bouquet of flowers. I trusted the florist to put something nice together.

The next day, Laura called me and said she had the order, but couldn't find my parents' reservation, so I confirmed the name. She eventually found it and said they haven't checked in yet, so she will hold it and personally deliver it. I still felt a little uneasy, but she mentioned that the bouquet was beautiful and Robert did a good job. I felt a little relief.

Their arriving flight was delayed several hours, but they eventually checked in. My mother immediately texted me "Thank You" and a picture of her with the bouquet and strawberries. I was so happy that she liked them. 

I wanted to commend Laura for the awesome service that she gave. Unfortunately, the difficult time I had getting anyone on the phone was a disappointment. I would have rated 1 star if it wasn't for her. I might try a night or two next time I'm in Vegas, just because of her wonderful service.

We stayed here for 6 nights from 3rd May.  I don't see why everyone complains it being at one end of the strip.  You know where it is when you book it, why book it if you want to be closer to the action????

Overall we were very happy with what we paid.  After reading the reviews, we were very worried about the booking we had made but we should have not been.  

We were given a room on the top floor (24th), overlooking the Strip, what a wonderful view.  The room itself was very very big, the bed was very comfortable too.  The shower worked great as did the toilet.  Only downside was that there was no in room safe BUT not to worry as the hotel offers a FREE deposit box in the cashiers room on the casino floor.  It's got to be safer that having it in your room.  It is totally free with 24\/7 access to your box.  We thought it was brilliant.
Housekeeping came daily and made the room up.  

We went up the tower about 6 times which is free if you are a resident.  You cannot beat the views from the top.  We say at the bar at the top of the tower and easily spent an hour just chilling out.

We also ate at Roxy's which we actually really enjoyed, I'm not going to spoil it for you but there is a little surprise that happens and it is not for the bad.  It's a great diner, the food looked good and tasted even better.

The casino does smell of smoke but then all the casinos do, I agree that it's a little more here then elsewhere but the others pump a lot of air freshener out so you can in some taste the perfume which is not nice.

I know a lot of people have also commented on how rude the staff are but again, we had no problem with any of them, all were very polite to us.

Valet parking is free and the guys are very friendly and some of them made sure to get to know our names which was very nice when either picking up the car or coming in after a night out.  You can park yourself but for a couple of dollars why would you?

Overall we think the hotel is great and would definitely stays again and recommend it.

Für unseren dreitägigen Aufenthalt hatten wir das Stratosphere Hotel ausgewählt. Es war vom Preis, den Leistungen und Lage das beste was wir kurzfristig buchen konnten. Ausschlaggebend war der 350 Meter hohe Stratosphere Tower, der umsonst von uns genutzt werden konnte.

Da man den Aussichtsturm überall in der Stadt sieht, hätten wir den Weg sicherlich auch ohne unser Navi finden können. Das Parkhaus ist kostenfrei. Der Check Inn war problemlos, den Aufpreis für ein Zimmer in einem höheren Stockwerk haben wir nicht bezahlt. Wir hatten ja die Option mit dem Aussichtsturm. Wie in vielen Las Vegas Hotels ist beim Einchecken dann noch eine Ressortgebühr fällig.

Wir hatten ein renoviertes Zimmer gebucht, das keine Wünsche offen ließ. Flachbildfernseher, kostenfreies WLAN, hochwertige Pflegeprodukte im Bad, Tresor im Zimmer und Schreibtisch mit Sitzbereich. In der 8 Etage befand sich ein großzügiger Pool, von dem man die Gäste beobachten konnte, die sich vom Tower in die Tiefe stürzten.

Das Hotel befindet sich am Anfang des Strips, so dass man zur Besichtigung der interessanten Hotels auf das Auto oder öffentliche Verkehrsmittel angewiesen ist. In weniger als 3 Kilometern ist ein Outlet-Center zu erreichen, das alle gängigen Designer beherbergt.

Der Casinobereich wurde von uns nicht genutzt, ist aber auch nicht anders als in den anderen Casinos. Im Hotel gibt es diverse Essensmöglichkeiten, ein MC Donalds und Starbucks. Die Läden in der Einkaufspassage fand ich im Vergleich zu den Top-Hotels eher einfach.

Es gibt auch ein rund um die Uhr geöffnetes Fitnesscenter, ein Spa Center, das Restaurant Top Of The World in 240 m Höhe, ein klassisches Las-Vegas-Buffet und vieles mehr. Highlight ist der für Hotelgäste kostenfreie Tower mit einem herrlichen Panoramablick über Las Vegas. Hier oben kann man auch diverse Fahrgeschäfte buchen oder sich an einem Seil in die Tiefe stürzen.

Das Stratosphere Hotel war für uns vom Preis- Leistungsverhältnis eine optimale Wahl. Für 3 Nächte haben wir mit 4 Personen ca. 160 € bezahlt.

Don't make early reservation on those online deals from credit cards, rewards, etc
By the time u get to the hotel u will not be in their priority list. The best room could probably give u is a 2 beds facing a parking lot or back area of the hotel ughhh.. Trust me its not pretty specially if u wanted it to be a nice romantic room! We got ripped off paid 20 bucks more cause we reserved it early and got a crappy room.. 

The bathroom was too small.. Everything was so standard! Don't expect it to look like the one's in the pictures. Lol

Pool is so low 3ft only and drinks were alright..

Their buffet and attraction were the only good thing about this place..but pricey...

I didn't even get a chance to stay here...due to the rude staff and miscommunication on Priceline.com. That's why I am rating it low. But from the other reviews, I was better off at the Circus Circus anyway

Love this hotel. To start the valet stand is awesome. They get your car quickly. Rarely a wait. 
The front desk is quick and efficient and made sure to get my preferences. 
Here is the great part. On my way to the room I was asked 4 times by staff members if I needed directions or needed anything. That is service!  
Had a great time in the tower and even took in a show.

This is a fantastic place for $29 per night which rate you can get most of the time.  My room was as nice as at the Los Vegas Hilton which I pay $300 a night for during the shopping center convention.  The casino is a casino, what do you want?  It's not directly on the strip and so if you want to walk up and down the strip going to this place and that, this isn't the place for you.

If you want to go to Vegas and just gamble, this is as good a place as any.  Remember that in Vegas, the house isn't gambling, so when you think you are gambling, who are you gambling with?

If you want to really experience Vegas, this isn't the place for you and you should spend the money and get a place on the strip so you can walk up and down the street with thosands of other tourists.  There is a worthywhile experience to be had in Vegas just walking around.

Great price.  Pool was a little Cold but clean.  Rooms nice and clean 
Staff very nice and Black Jack dealers are very nice.

Awesome shopping . Got some hats and other items for 80% off

Such a mediocre hotel. I'd say a step above a motel! Sink didn't drain and I can't say the room was very clean. I didn't complain because we were only there one night! Never again!! Very poor service as well!!
I booked a room for two nights thru expedia. Com. I would have to say i am very satisfied this is my first time here, im on the 17th floor with a great view.I will be back it has everything here

Hello people are just want to talk about my experience in this hotel.
Well we went there for my nephews birthday and July 10, 2017 once we check in on our room we noticed that it was a little bit dirty on the corners behind the TV and also the closed, did you to make a big deal because you know it's your vacation or just trying to have fun while at the next morning my two years old baby he was playing around the room and we know it is that he was chewing something and I think he was chewing it was a piece of peeled that we found in our corner of the bed so I went to the bed I move a little bit the bed for work and I saw more peels so I called the front desk they never answer and I called the security guys and then they went up there to my room so we talk about the situation and we decide to call the paramedics, in that moment I just want to make sure that my baby was OK cause we didn't know what type of peal it was so they told me that my baby was OK but if I want to take him to ER it was under my responsibility ¡"WHAT" !!!! Ok we spend almost all day at the Hospital good thing my baby was perfectly fine went back to the Hotel "stratosphere"try to speak with the Manager and a skinny guy short hair told me that "there was nothing that they can do" OK!
Im going to attach pictures of the condition of the room and all the dust and dirt PLEASE BE CAREFUL WITH YOUR KIDS PEOPLE !!
MY KID IT COULD DYE THANKS TO THIS IRRESPONSIBLE MANAGEMENT !!!!

I'm giving 4 stars only because of the very pleasant lady on the reception. The hotel itself is getting 3 stars and not more. I didn't like the room. It was clean and neat but very old furniture with scratches were there. 
I enjoyed the view from the 109 floor and made a few rides up there.

i thought this hotel was hella good from pictures ive seen online. looked so fancy and all but as soon as you checked in to your room it is one the simplest ugly room ever!!!! their toilet doesnt even flush it took like 3 or 4 flushes until it finally flushes down! As soon as you flush the toilet, there was a smell that was coming out through the sink and it smelled like sewer and stanked up the whole room!!! I let it go for a night but the next day i tried to complain at the counter but guess what the guy said he cant do anything unless it was fixed by someone before moving us to a different room because they always complain about the same thing and it was not the first time it happened! I was trying to explain to him that I have asthma and its hard breathed that in my lungs because it gets so bad where I have to inhale it throughout the night he said he understood but even if he talks to the manager he will say the same thing that he cant move us because it sold out and blah blah blah!!!! He said he was gonna send someone to fix it maximum wait was 20min so we were like ok then 1 hour passed no one came and we came back down to ask where the guy was hes like oh I just got a responsed back they said it didnt smell anything when we just told him nobody came in our room to fix anything and few sec he was like oh i apologize the guy came in the wrong room!!!!! To make it short dont even bother to pay a dime in this hotel!!! Dont get me wrong the rides & view was great but the staff & room wont even recommend it!!!!

Who ever feels pissed or cheated that they stayed at the Stratosphere, is more of an elitist douchbag than Obama.  Seriously, it's like $50 bucks a night, right on the strip.

Sure, it's not as posh as the Venetian, or as 'showey' as the Mirage, but the casino is perfectly adequate, the rooms were just fine for the price, and there's a McDonald's right inside for all your late night burgering needs.

When I go to Vegas, it's either for business, or a good time.  When I go to have a good time, I mean business!  Good place to stay if you're looking for value.

This hotel is a really a great deal for how clean and comfortable the rooms are. We also get discounted rooms often for gambling here. Yes the place is older, however it is clean and gets your needs met comfortably. It also might be further down the strip, however you more than save on cab fare by the savings here. There are several places to eat (I suggest Roxys), rides, and shopping here. Me and the hubby have been coming here for years. For the seasoned traveler that wants a comfortable place, and knows a hotel is just to sleep in and leave, this is your place!

Ehhhhh it's alright. While I wouldn't stay here again, it was okay for what it was for just one night. I went with my boyfriend at the time for a business thing so we had to stay cheap and just for one night. We were in a high up room so the view was outrageous, just gorgeous when we got to our room at night. Nothing special about this place, I think it's just an average room really. The buffet was incredible. It's a little far away from anything though. When we arrived we relaxed a bit then decided to walk to the strip. It's a little far.... Just a little... Yet we managed to make it clear to Bellagio to see the fountains before decided to make the trek back. Staff was friendly. No real complaints, but it's nothing to write home about.

This place is a dump. I would never stay here, not even if it were free. I booked an upgraded room online with a king bed. When we arrive after a 5 hour drive in the melting heat, they tell us all the rooms with king beds are "gone". I had booked a room on a higher floor so if I wanted to stay on a higher floor in the remodeled section I would be forced to stay in a room with 2 queen beds, the view and feel that their website offered was what I was most interested so we decided not to argue and just take the 2 beds. Their pictures on the website and descriptions of the rooms are so deceiving. I understand this isn't a 5 star resort but don't lie to me. They put us in a cubby hole with 2 beds that smelled like smoke and had a connecting door where I could hear my neighbors getting it on. I was in the room for not even 10 minutes and I was ready to go. I went down to the front desk and the rude front desk agent agreed to refund our deposit so we could go elsewhere. 
The staff is horrible, I also work in the hospitality business so I know what to expect. They are not willing to work with you whatsoever to try to find a solution to a problem they have created. Room quality is that of a low grade Motel 6 and the staff isn't even nice enough to work at a gas station in the middle of nowhere.
Spend the extra money and stay elsewhere, or learn the hard way like I did.

I'm very disappointed with my room and the service here first when i arrive i pull into the valet the guy that is doing valet is yelling at ppl in thier car then go to check in they gave me a room that the lights didnt work and a shitty view of thier roof and abandoned looking houses , i cant believe they made me pay $10 extra to check in at 1  so then i had to go all the way back t the lobby because the wait on the phone was soo long  for them to give me another room  so then  a little later i call valet ahead of time to bring up my car so by the time i got to the front it would be ready  i was told him we need to see the ticket to pull up my car even though i just read him the number on the ticket ??????what is valet for then so i went downstairs waited 30 minutes for my car i wont be staying here again the rooms are not clean and the neighborhood behind it looks shady  i am very disapointed with my choice of hotels i would stay at treasure island  or hardrock. Dont waste your money.

Pros: Nice and clean hotel with good amenities.
Very good price. Free tower access,  nice launch on tower.
Cons: bad location if you not driving, no coffeemaker, closet and cooler in room.

The Stratosphere Hotel & Casino gets 3 stars in my book, although I've had five star moments more than once.

Generous comps
Lucky Blackjack tables
Drinker-friendly pool bar
Reasonably priced rooms
Golf courses nearby (for daytime drinking)

This property values "moderately" priced play. In my experience, blackjack play averaging $50\/hand results in 700 sq. ft. comped suites with a jacuzzi tub big enough for me and friends (if I had them). The other strip properties don't even make an effort at that play level.

I have been offered comped tickets, travel, & suite accommodations including the 2007 NASCAR races at Las Vegas Motor Speeway & the 2007 Las Vegas Grand Prix.

I get an awful lot of play without digging too deep into the gambling budget account. For some reason, the dollars don't disappear in a drunken haze like at other properties. Truth be told, though, the $1000 I won for a Royal Flush was gone in five hands of Blackjack.

The pool bar re-opens in early March, probably to coincide with the arrival of all the NASCAR psychos OR because it's warm again, not sure which. Very basic bar with water-misters to keep you chilled out. 

There are two regular bartenders, Dick & Melody, that I've gotten to know over the years. Watch out for these two. Besides really good drinks, they're still on the hunt for a quality photo of the "moose knuckle". They already have the framed photo of the "camel toe" behind the bar and wish to add to the collection. In other words guys, go to the bar before you go into the cold water.

Years ago when I began visiting this property, rooms were less than $40\/night and as far as I know, still remain in that price range. I don't care who you are, that's cheap in Vegas these days. 

Definitely a good value for the traveler on a budget or who doesn't need the glitz property to have a good time.

I called to talk to someone about having my wedding reception at the top of the tower on Friday, 3\/18\/16 after looking over the private dining menus on your website. I called around 3:45pm on 3\/18\/16. I spoke to a girl I could barely understand that had a heavy accent. She asked a few questions including when I wanted to have my reception and my budget and told me she would get John Fisheddy for me and placed me on hold. Although, I couldn't understand her very well, she was the most pleasant part of the phone call. I was placed on hold for over 5 minutes and she got back on and said he was going to pick up in a second. I waited 10 more minutes until I finally hung up. 

Called back again, got through to John, and asked if he had time to go over a few things with me and he said, "not really, I've been busy." To which I politely told him to have a nice day and called Drais next. They were much more polite and helpful. 

Will not recommend this place to anyone I know, even for free. If that is the kind of attention I get for wanting to spend $60k on a private dinner for my family and friends after my wedding at Bellagio next month, I wouldn't recommend anyone spend $100 there. 

Good luck with your "job", John! You're obviously doing it very well.
The rooms and suites here are affordable and although the location is a little off the beaten path, sometimes thats a good thing.

Third time here. I only come here for a couple days while I wait for friends to get here and stay at whatever hotel they are at because I come a couple days early just to play poker. Well this will be the last time I do so to save the couple hundred bucks. Was trying to tell them I was going to have a late check in had to spend 30 minutes on the phone getting transferred around because of bad service. Then shortly after a long night of gambling I get woken up early in the am from construction noises above. Called the main desk and after another 20 minutes of waiting I get ahold of someone and they say the mangers about to call to tell them to stop... well the noises went on for another hour. I get a hotel to be able to have a good nights rest and this is ridiculous to have construction that's crazy loud start in the morning. I will never be back here. I might even try to get my money back and stay somewhere else for the next couple nights.

Can't complain, ok hotel in select room except our toilet over flowed with bubbles everywhere only got 3 free drinks fo not being able to use the bathroom.  Pool was nice very cold.
Italian restaurant is very good.  Love bus system, catch right outside of hotel only 8 dollars for 24 hours.  I would stay again just a bad part of town.

Sure you can see it from anywhere on the Strip, but is the Stratosphere really worth the trip?  I can only speak from a customer service standpoint as we did not stay in the hotel, but I was nothing but impressed by way we were treated in this hotel.

We were on a scavenger hunt as part of the Yelp Spring Break weekend, and one of our challenges was to get a picture in the elevator of the Stratosphere.  Belly's full of custard from Luv It, we decided it was worth a shot to ask if we could just get a picture in the elevator without actually going to the top.  What we thought would be a simple yes or no turned into a full blown tour of the upper tower of the Strat, with no stone left unturned.  

The fact that one of their staff would take time out of their day to show us around was totally unexpected and gracious.  I would come and stay here simply because of the phenomenal customer service.  Hats off to you Stratosphere, you've won my heart.

5 Stars

I go to Vegas all the time and had never stayed here, so I figured why not. We get there and they charge us another $70 "resort" fee. Which is weird because we were on the 5th floor and when we looked out of our window it was all vents and air conditioners surrounded by walls. Literally NO view and not my idea of a "resort". The room was nothing to write home about but I have seen worse. On Saturday we bought the bracelet to ride unlimited rides but the lines were too long. The guy said they were open until 2am and to come back around 1am and the lines would be better. My boyfriend went back at 1am and they had shut down everything except 1 ride. The next morning we go to check out and we were told there was a $70 charge to our room from the 107 lounge. I just paid it so we wouldn't miss our flight and looked into it once I was home. I called and spoke with a manager of the lounge(Jason) and he verified on the phone with me that the ticket authorizing $70 to be charged to our room was signed by a man named Jesus. There was no Jesus in our party nor staying in our room. The manager(Jason) said he would have surveillance look at it just to confirm and call me back. The next day I got a call from a different manager(Anthony) that told me he was working and saw my boyfriend sign it (which my boyfriend said he didn't) and when I asked him to send me proof, all he sent me was a receipt with scribbles all over it. All that was legible on this receipt was the $20 tip that was left. When I emailed the manager(Anthony) back telling him I could provide proof that wasn't my boyfriends signature all he did was pretty much tell me he wasn't going to right this wrong and if I still had issues to take it up with the surveillance manager and hasn't returned my emails since. That was 4 days ago. It was one thing after another after another. The first manager I spoke with told me that they absolutely check IDs before they let someone charge something to a room. Apparently not. IF YOU GO AGAINST MY ADVICE AND STAY IN THIS RIP OFF HOTEL... BE SMART AND USE CASH!!! LET THE FRONT DESK KNOW THAT NOTHING IS TO BE CHARGED TO YOUR ROOM!! AND GO SPEND YOUR TIME AT THE HOTELS THAT WANT TO TAKE CARE OF YOU INSTEAD OF STEALING FROM YOU.

Been here twice. Spent week here after Christmas and fun was had.

Room in the 19th floor and we had a great view.

Tables had great dealer. Pitmen were fun and ensured everything ran smoothly. There were a few folk begging for money...be careful near the joker poker. 

Bar in playing area had drinks at decent price. Shouldn't need to pay for drinks..just play a game or two. Hookers hang out there. I was asked twice if interested...I mentioned to management. Nothing to my knowledge happened.

Sports book is small...this is a place for hanging out. If you want to pay more and get the full vegas experience go to a casino closer to strip.

$20 cab rides mount up...tell cabs you want to go via the strip...don't let them use te highway.
Fun but the bungee jumping doesn't really feel like you're free falling you can feel the rope like dropping you down so it's not as scary but I guess that makes it more safe.

Got a really sweet deal on a room here for two nights; it barely set me back $100 total.

Now, when you pay so little for a place to stay, you should generally understand that a few things will be lacking.  This said, in the case of the Stratosphere, overall, there really wasn't all that much to complain about.  The room was surprisingly spacious and was clean.  We didn't have one of the newly renovated rooms but it was still in good shape; nothing super-memorable, but, nothing *bad* either.

The view from the 15th floor was nice; we had a decent view of the strip and it looked great at sunset.  Mind you, the Stratosphere is definitely on the further end of the strip, so consequently, you have to walk or cab about a half-mile before you start seeing much and don't really hit the thick of it for about two miles, which I really don't mind.

Had fun in the casino and actually came ahead with the slots.  The desk staff, attendants at the tower and rides, and the lounge staff were all really friendly and had a great sense of humor.  The bartender at the bar when you first walk in the front doors was quick, but wasn't much help when I asked if there were any places that had pizza or tacos in the area and quickly left to go talk with other staff members, but the guys at the desk on the graveyard shift were helpful.

Overall, had a nice experience and didn't pay too much for it.  I'm the sort of person who doesn't spend much time in their room when they're out on vacation, and I found the free tower access and 2-for-1 martinis at the tower lounge to be preferable to having a marble countertop in my bathroom (which I have at home anyways).
My husband and I came here to eat while on vacation and it was nothing short of spectacular!!!! The view is AMAZING. I don't know all about the rides though lol

Didn't stay as a guest, but did visit for the evening to check out the Pin Up show- which I was nearly late for due to the clusterduck that is their parking system. Someone needs to get on fixing that up, stat.

Drove up, pulled in where it said to drive through for self-parking only to sit in a line of taxis. No employees directing traffic. Finally found the Self-Park signage\/arrows, only to be unable to get to that area. After looping around twice, I follow the arrow only to enter an exit into the parking garage. Luckily I immediately ran into an employee who told me how to get around and to the third floor.

Only to follow the directions and head straight into oncoming traffic, since I was still going the wrong way. Essentially, the guy directed me to the exit. Looped around a third time, and all the openings to the garage that I could find whiel following the signage and the printed arrows on the ground, directed me to DO NOT ENTER spaces.

Finally I pulled a U-ie and went in the one actual entrance, and found a spot. Which was roughly 20 minutes later, and only after getting harassed by a loud screaming guy in a white Escalade who followed me with his high beams on yelling at me going the wrong way-- even though, as I said, I was following the signs and the white arrows on the ground, and was even encountering stop signs, but couldn't ever find an entrance to the garage.

Check-in line was SLOW.   Casino was smoky, old and dated and needs a complete remodel, however room was clean because we updated to Select Tower. The buffet was small and for their food below average.      The amenities that cover the resort fee (which is primarily just another TAX on the hotel room rate and are a standard policy of all of the Strip Hotels are unliked by most tourist)   are local calls on room phone (which we didnt use),  gym located on another room and SMALL (which we didnt use),  access to the TOWER (which we didnt use) and you have to go each day of your stay to get the pass at another location in the hotel.  Dont understand why we werent just given a 3-day pass on checkin, and pool (which we didnt use).   There is no free shuttle from airport to hotel.   This location is at the northern end of the strip in a sketchy area that I wouldnt want to venture away from at night.   Once on the bus (which you can take for $8 for a 24-hour time stamped in front of the hotel), I felt safer.    The best thing about the stay at Stratosphere is the cheaper daily rate but would not stay here again.

Our room wasn't clean, the floors weren't vacuumed, holes in the wall, the lampshade on upside down, lipstick on the wall, walls peeling, stained sheets, the list is never ending. Honestly, I definitely would rather stay in the motel 6 than here.
Awful service, total dump, avoid this place and all employees should be fired.  The worst in Vegas.  Total disaster!

Had to write a review after reading all the negatives.  We had a good stay here at the end of May.  Check in was easy.  Room was basic but clean.  We had moderate luck at the casino.  Check out Roxy's Diner, especially for breakfast.  Had a good stay.  No complaints.

I truly wanted to give Stratosphere 4 stars because they did an awesome remodel but the location of this hotel is shady and the room temperature was warm. The AC would not allow us to go lower than 69, however, it felt like 75. Now, the beds are very comfortable and the bathroom is a nice size. The walls do seem a bit thin because I heard a lot of random conversations coming from the hall and other rooms. I would stay again because it's cheap but it's far from the strip so I would rather pick another hotel. 

Tips: Top of the World restaurant is worth dining at at least once :)

LOCATION:  If you have been to Vegas before, you would know where it is... It's at THE END OF THE STRIP.  And if you are in Vegas and don't know where it is, look for the tallest thing in Vegas.

ROOM:  Meh... I asked for a non-smoking room, but I can still smell cigarette.

CASINO:  I don't like gambling here.  (Especially not in the middle of the night).

"AMUSEMENT PARK":  Nothing amusing about the rides they have at the top of the stratosphere, but they do have a great view up there.  Unfortunately, you cannot take tripods up to the observation deck.

OVERALL: If you wanna stay at Vegas on a low budget, this is probably your place.  Their room rates are usually dirt cheap.

My family and I love going to Vegas and typically have a great time. 

We won a free trip this go round and the hotel they placed us at was the Stratosphere. In the past we heard positive reviews on it and were excited to see how things would be once we got here.

Upon checking in we were told that we were on the "un-renovated" side; the north tower 19th floor. We were told that in order to upgrade, it'd be an additional $30 per night (we were staying 3 days and didn't see the point in spending the additional $90 so we figured we'd give the room a shot) 

Once we actually got to our room, we were not impressed by the dingy linens that were placed on the beds and noticed that they had a few tears in the sheets. 

Like another reviewer on here, we noticed an indescribable foul smell in the room when the air\/heat wasn't on. In addition, the water pressure was very hit or miss; some days it'd be strong and others it'd be so weak you could barely wash your hands properly. 

Parking wasn't too much of a hassle as they have self parking. If you want quick access to the bridge for the casino\/hotel part, park on the 3rd level as there is a bridge that will connect you.

Had a bad experience here with Chris the hotel Mgr front desk, paid for an upgrade on room and was not the same as my friends upgraded room. He had view of the strip and big jacuzzi tub, and we didn't. So I called front desk and was only willing to give a $5.00 discount per night total of $15.00- wow big deal; I asked to get the same room or waive the upgrade fee of 68.00, but not willing too. First time and last time here; thanks!
I'm a Vegas local I can honestly say this place has horrible beds my back is killing... no sleep I would not ever stay there again even if it was free..

Had a really nice time at Stratosphere. The staff was very friendly and helpful!  We upgraded to a suite and it was very spacious with a HUGE hot tub. Room service was great!! The food was warm and delicious. I feel bad for the complaints to this hotel because they really were accommodating in every way. We also received a complimentary gift basket of wonderful goodies! Thank you! We will be back :)

Not sure about all the negative reviews. We had a good experience. We stayed at the Stratosphere because we were eloping and the location was convenient the Neon Museum, where we were having our ceremony. Yes you walk into the lobby, which is full of slot machines and people smoking cigarettes. But our stay was fine. Our room, 6203, was in a non smoking section. The room was clean and bed was very comfortable and quiet. The electric went out one night in our bathroom, but the staff took care of it right after we called. We also need additional hangers, which were brought upstairs immediately. There is no fridge, microwave or coffee maker, but we ended up not really having a need for any of those.
Because of our schedule, we ended up having breakfast daily at the hotel (Roxys Diner...where you can get the normal breakfast even yoghurt, granola and berries) and a nighttime draft beer at McCall's Heartland Grill (salad with steak was very good). Everyone at the hotel was helpful & pleasant. 
Definitely check out the top floors (106th - 109th  )which include an inside 360 degree observation deck and bar and an exterior deck where you can see the crazy "rides" that hang off the side of the building! There is a very good restaurant called Top of the World, which rotate slowly 360 degrees for a full view of the city. The food was great and not overly expensive for what it is.

Just don't get sucked into going on a tour for a time share..which they try to get you into if you ask for a shuttle or taxi!!

The Stratosphere is the perfect place if you're doing Las Vegas on a budget and you still want to have a good time! My boyfriend and I went for our anniversary (because we're awesome) and we were actually really impressed. The rooms were clean and the view was great (we could see people bungee jumping AND we had a view of the pool, which was sexy). I found myself almost every morning sitting in the window ledge watching crazy people jump. There's also a live stream of the jump on one of the hotel's tv channels which serves as the perfect music for getting ready, especially if you grew up loving pop punk. 

THE POOL! Why is no one talking about the pool? Yeah it's not Rehab, but it's awesome! The cocktails are fabulous and SOOOO good, seriously so good, and there's bikini black jack, tons of giveaways, and CABANADA! Obvs, I appreciated that. Honestly, my boy and I didn't leave this hotel for the first 24 hours or so we were in Vegas and I don't regret it. The casino has awesome drink deals and I still remember our Black Jack dealer Annie who was amazing! We were there during playoff hockey and got to bet on the games, big deal for Torontonians let me tell you. Also I found everyone here really nice. They all wear the locations of where they're from so conversation is a breeze. It's incredible how many people go to Vegas and decide not to leave! We also caught the show Bite - a topless vampire musical set to 80's rock. It was a riot!

THE BAD: The hotel was much farther down the strip than Google maps led me to believe. We decided to walk down the strip to get to the action and it was sketch central. So many people who were really messed up. 

Honestly, everything was good here. Great restaurants and lots to do, plus the view from the top is breathtaking. I regret not dining in the restaurant, which apparently is amazing. We headed to the top one afternoon to do the rides, which was such a rush! It really provides perspective on Vegas as a city. We ventured into other hotels and casinos and they were nicer, granted, but you really can't get better than the Strat on a budget.

Best view of the strip...great breeze...its quiet a bit far from the happening part of the strip...so take a cab...we walked from venetian to here...its not too far but the heat makes it feel like 100 miles...
But you cannot beat the view from up here at night...the contrast between the land outside Vegas and the lights of Vegas...its almost like a painting on a black background....

Check in took forever. We arrived late Friday night and the check in line was longer than we expected. It wasn't moving although there were many counters open. Who knows what's going on. We finally get to the counter and even though we were checking in late, they had a room available with our preference. One star for that.

The bed was comfy and there were enough pillows. The premium view wasn't so premium. The bath tub was rather deep. Everything seemed clean.

The casino itself was nice. Stay away from the Wizard of Oz machine if you don't want to get addicted. 

A stay in this hotel comes with free entrance to the tower for up to four people per day. Take advantage of it if you've never been to the top.

When we were checking out, they had a power outage that affected some parts of the casino and even the outside traffic lights.

3-Star is my average from the 2 times I've stayed there.  The first time in March of 2012 I stayed in a select room and would've given the hotel 4 stars.  This time (Oct. 2012) I would only give them 2 stars.  This time I was put in the north tower and I will never stay there again!  

I can chalk my disappointment up to being spoiled with a free upgrade my first trip but the lack of customer service when I called the desk to complain really got me.  

Select room:  very nice.  There was a safe in the room, modern decor, spacious and a beautiful strip view (18th floor I believe)

North Tower:  room was ok, very simple decor, clean enough and a view of essentially nothing.  The lack of safe was my biggest complaint, I am in Vegas travelling with cash I don't want to bring it ALL with me when I leave my room.  The other complaint I had was the bathroom.  Being that I was by myself it wasn't the biggest deal, but if I was travelling with a companion it would've been a deal breaker.  The bathroom floor was barely big enough for the door to close.  I am a big girl and literally I had to stand between the toilet and tub if I wanted to shut the door (the sink was outside the actual bathroom).  The toilet seemed to sit very low and was not comfortable, it felt like when you get in the car and someone was sitting straight backed only you have no recline lever.  The tub on the other hand was too high.  It was up on a platform of sorts so standing next to it the edge was over my knees.  It was a very deep tub if you wanted to take a bath, but getting out seemed dangerous to me.  I almost slipped each day so I learned to leave the bathroom door open and use it as a handle when getting out.

I will be torn whether or not to stay here again.  The price was right both times, but I don't want to be put in a position that I have to pay for an upgrade.

As for the casino:  I arrived on a Saturday and the stench of cigars was very overwhelming.  The rest of my stay I didn't' notice it nearly as bad and the good part I seemed to do ok in the gambling department.

I will not be returning to this hotel. I've stayed at 4 Vegas hotels and this one was the worst. The room was dirty, the shower didn't appear to be cleaned prior to our arrival. It's a waste of money. Go eat at the Top of the World restaurant but do NOT stay overnight!

Had heard good reviews about this hotel but was not thrilled. Got a good price with a Groupon deal which was the only reason it was worth it. Only one pool was open and it was only open from 11am to 5pm. Very limited hours. The entire building reeked of smoke which was by far the worst part. If smoke bothers you even a little, do not go here. I wore a mask the entire time I was there. It was also much farther than the strip (and everything else). Even the monorail to get to the strip was a bit of a walk and pretty creepy at night. We did rent a car from the Budget Car Rental inside the hotel and the guy working was great so that's where the two stars come in.

Stratosphere hotel and casino is one of the best hotels I have been too great beds, shops, food and much more is great about the hotel. I stayed at the hotel and went up the tower many of times and it's really great!!! It's also very cheap $800 bucks for a 9 day stay with double queen rooms and very active room service. The only reason it's not 5 stars is because of location it's a little far from the strip about 5 min drive and wifi is 10 bucks per day but you can use up to 3 devices on the wifi so I guess that's good. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is ready to have a fun time!

I was very disappointed when i came here. 
I always wanted to do the sky jump so when i finally got the nerve, I was almost disgusted with the sight of the hotel. 
First the parking was so filthy that I almost forgot that i was in Vegas. It reaked of urine and was full of trash all it needed was to have homeless drug addicts asking you for money when you stepped out of your cat. 
The inside was if the casino desperately needed a cleaning. The casinos at state line trump in cleanliness compared to this place. 
The room was depressing. Very small and dirty. Also or was like I was transported to the 50's with the out of date furniture. And the bathtub also had a deep tub that you need a step just to get in.
The sky jump, the staff half were very nice the rest RUDE AS FUCK! ! They half-assed answer any questions about the jump pretty much ignore you. OH AND IF YOU'RE DEALING WITH ANY STAFF MEMBER WHO IS BLACK, THEY WILL TREAT YOU LIKE SHIT IF YOU ARE NOT BLACK WHILE FAVORING BLACK CUSTOMERS IN FRONT OF YOU!!! 
The worst part was getting robbed, I'll just leave it like that. 

The pro's.
They have a $20.00 all you can drink happy hour starting at 5.

What I reccomended is to only visit the place for only the rides if that, have a drink and leave.

I was told the rooms were inexpensive, and for all intensive purposes, they were just fine - comfortable beds and clean bathrooms.  They looked like any other nice-to-middle-of-the-road hotel rooms.  And when you're exhausted from a glistening night out, they will suit you just fine.

Of course, taking into consideration the location, which seemed like it was almost in a neighboring city, the price of the room goes up when factoring in cab fare.  I spent $25 getting a cab from Stratosphere back to the MGM Grand, where I was staying.  Thus the price of the room increases.  Even so, that is still far less than at some other places on the strip.

Dec 25 2016

Take the tram (stops at many strip hotels and ends not far from stratosphere).  The place has adventures which you can read about.  I went to the comedy club on Xmas night at 10pm.

Hidden on the 2nd floor...I bought a ticket online and had to ask where it was (signs need improvement) but very happy overall.  I had emailed saying I was alone Xmas night and they offered me 50% off ticket and $20 open bar.  I WAS IN !!!!!!

Great show, great booze, met some very nice people, got a bit shlooonged....then took uber back to the strip ...great night overall.  Consider the stratosphere ...better $$ deals and they have some sky high adventures as well.  With the tram the distance off strip is not worth talking about.  We can all do a 2 block walk !!

I had to book two rooms just for one night because my step daughter was coming into town and I flew her into Vegas with the grandkids I'm not crazy about this Resort Hotel feet thing but I feel like this place has more to offer for the extra money you get free internet and a decent room when I stayed at the linq I paid 10 times the amount that I paid for this room and I got nothing for the resort fee when I want came to check in the girl offered me an upgrade for 10 additional dollars I took her up on the offer she said I would be closer to everything which I am I'm on the 8th floor and the view out my window is the roof of something and some generators I can barely see the sign and a little bit of the tower but that's okay I'm just here for one night I would definitely stay here again for the price that I paid compared to the linq even though I am far from most of the strip and I have to either drive or take a taxi to see the main part of the strip but that's okay I save money staying here

I enjoy  my stay but this place needs to upgrade their rooms. Had I known this was the farthest away hotel from all the fun I would've never chose  this one.

The customer service  was great. The atmosphere was ok. The tower was fun. The rooms smell extra fresh. Would've gave more stars but the restaurants on the casino level was not great. The tower bar amazing. The guy who serve  us drinks was so nice and even gave us options for places  to go.
Last choice and only choice. Last minute reservation. Nice to visit but no not going to stay here again.

my wife and i love this place. its also a great place to take kids. we have stayed here several times. good rooms at a great price. i just wish they would hook peolpe up with a room after spending several days there. always clean and helpful. the check in process always takes a minute but its worth your time.

Fun casino with great table stakes and a friendly staff. Check out the thrill rides at the top of the tower! The shopping mall has good stores and the arcade is small but has a lot of good games. It's a little out of the way if you are staying on the main part of the strip and it is in kind of a shady neighborhood. Once inside you will forget about all of that and let the good times roll!

My stay at the Stratosphere was good. I came on a slow week in Vegas and couldn't beat the price. Self parking and valet is still free which is always welcome as most of the Strip casinos charge for parking now. 

Upon check-in I was told they had room upgrades available for $10 more a night. I decided to do the upgrade and was happy with my room. It was nothing fancy but was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large and the shower was nice. More importantly it was quiet.
