Two days later we went out with the handout and he examined to us that it was a promotion from last year...but he would do us a favor and make it anyway but we couldn't have the souvenir cup....whatever.  The pool is huge and overall the bar food they offer is pretty reasonable.

We had brunch at the buffet and it was decent.  No complaints at all.  We also ate at the Chicago hot dog joint, tho we didn't have hot dogs, it was OK.

The worst part of the experience was waiting for a cocktail waitress while gambling.  Drinks were sans booze and slow coming....

I enjoyed our stay but would prefer to move down the strip...it's just too far from the action.

I booked for 3 nights, had a good view of the sky jump, but only stayed for one night.  Room was just okay.  Stayed on 24th floor.  Lobby smelled grossly like cigarette smoke.  Crowded.  Very unsafe neighborhood at 10pm when I arrived on a Saturday night (I walked alone two short blocks to Walgreens to buy coconut water).  Was less than impressed.  Bed totally uncomfortable and literally had no blankets.  Just sheet on sheet.  
I didn't even bother to check out- went to stay elsewhere.

I didn't have any problems! Room could've used better lighting but I guess that's Vegas. Other than that, clean contemporary room. Nice bathrooms and the hotel seems to have a bounty of activities although I was only there on a quick short overnight. The clerks were nice and helpful. Room was only about $55 all said and done. Wifi is free at slow speeds, pay 10 for high speed. Hotel buffet is very good

Never judge a book by its cover! This was my 9th trip to Vegas, and had never stayed in the North Strip area. The Stratosphere met all of our needs and exceeded our group's expectations in just about every way. The hotel rate was $75 per night out the door including taxes and resort fees. It seems as if every hotel on the strip charges at least $23-30 per night for resort fee nowadays. The pool and the fitness center along with free wi-fi and unlimited access up to the observation deck tower is included.

We stayed mid-week for 2 nights, Wednesday\/Thursday and it didn't feel too crowded. There are food options and drink options for every budget...just do some research online.

The CBAR has a 24\/7 happy hour. $3-5 per drink. There is a convenient McDonalds with good prices upstairs in the food court. Overall, the room was great, updated and clean. Stratosphere Select Strip View Rooms on floor 20 had an awesome view of the Sky Jumpers and the rides at the top. Housekeeping was very friendly and always make sure the room was taken care of. They include a free gift bag in the bathroom also which is very nice. 

People complain about the location, but honestly with Uber or Lyft, you can get where you need to go for cheap. We rode to fremont st 2x and it was only $7 each way for four people. Cant beat that!

We took advantage of the free valet and the bellhop. Service was excellent. We received a text from Vic, the front desk attendant, who wanted to make sure everything was up to standard for our stay. Like I said, service was fantastic and they seem to care about their guests. Adam, in the reservations department sold us the room over the phone. Best rate guarantee and believe me, I shopped around. Casino is just like any other strip casino, tight and the longer you stay the worse you do.

Dirty halls, tiny bathrooms, old equipments, and its locations are the cons of this hotel.
Service is the only pro.
I wouldn't have given 2 stars, if I haven't seen hotel worse than this next day.

I love the stratosphere. this is my second time here. my room was one that was probably  on the list for renovation  and I did not have an ice bucket but all in all it is a good deal and the sky view is unmatched  from the tower. I will likely be back but will pay extra  for  a mini fridge.

Das Hotel ist einer der älteren und damit schon etwas abgewohnt. Die Zimmer sind trotzdem sauber und die Betten gut. Man merkt es nur überall, dass es schon etwas älter ist. 

Was mich sehr gestört hat, waren die 15 $ Resort-Gebühr, die beim Check-In auf den Buchungspreis aufgeschlagen werden. Wohlgemerkt 15 $ pro Tag, nicht Aufenthalt. Dafür kann man das den Pool und das Fitnessstudio nutzen oder die Shows verbilligt anschauen. 

Was sich lohnt, ist der kostenlose (für Hotelgäste) Ausblick vom Turm.

There's something to be said for having the view option so from atop the Strat tower and the spinning restaurant at the top is excellent (read my review of it if you are going),   It cannot save the overall rating though.   We had stayed at the Palazzo so we knew we were downgrading but it was a shock anyway.   Women in curlers and men if dirty wife beaters at the check in desk so right away we knew, oh boy.   There wasn't glaringly wrong with the hotel.   It just felt worn out.   Rooms are straight out of a motel 6 and we upgraded.   The position are OK and the adult pool has a good view though it is quite small.   Casino seems fair enough but we don't gamble so my review of it would be incomplete.  The Stratosphere is affordable which is really the primary reason to stay there.   Is it worth it really depends on your expectations.   We would not choose to stay here again.   We'll pay the extra coin to stay at better choices but if economics is a driver and you must stay on the strip you could do worse.   Circus Circus or Excalibur for instance.   Guests at the Strat get free access to the viewing deck and opportunities at the top of the 100+ story tower.

Average Stay.  Overpriced, But it's Vegas.

SITREP

Arrived in Vegas for some quick weekend fun.  

THE SETUP

Decent room, but too much for what the average metrics of what we saw other friends pay at places like The Luxor and The Golden Gate.

Rooms not as big, a bit difficult to get the inhouse maid service to answer calls and switch out linen from prior guests.

THE LOWDOWN

Would I stay here again?  Most certainly, in a pinch.  But if more time had been available, I would have done some more research and stayed at another hotel in the Old Vegas Strip area like The Golden Gate, or The Luxor in the main strip area.

I'm glad that I got to experience this restaurant, is a very nice experience that I think every one should have, place is great and good is very good, then you can go to the up floors and check out the view from the outside, is a must see if you are in Vegas

Stay at the NY NY instead.  Better quality, location and basically the same price. 

I was very disappointed with this hotel.  It was icky from the moment we arrived and called the front desk to ask about parking and got major attitude and smart mouth from the front desk chick.  No bueno.  

On the upside - we were upgraded to a "Select" room for 6 bucks extra each night.  This actually meant a shabby chic toilet seat.  Hooray for us!  Seriously - it just meant that it wasn't a total S-H-I-T hole...but almost.  

We were informed that we had access to the "Select" elevators.  Warning: do not feel special.  You aren't and they aren't!  On the upside to this - they were close to the parking garage entrance\/exit, which was imperative to avoid smelling like an ash tray the walk from our room to the outside. 

The bed wasn't exactly a cloud and the pillows SUCKED.  The towels are WIMPY, to say the least, and the water pressure reminded me of a drizzling rain.  The shopping center inside of the hotel would be better titled the White Trash Mall. 

The positives: The room appeared clean and had an iPod\/iPhone ready alarm clock.  

My advice is to SELECT another hotel. 

P.S. I wish I had taken a photo of the toilet seat...just horrible!

The view is beautiful and I enjoyed watching the people bungee jump. The service was slow and the food was not that good at all. The prices were expensive for bad food and service.  I glad we tried it but will never go back.  :(

Pretty bad experience. Clogged wash basin and bath tab. Call them for help twice (first call soon as we checked in) and no one turned up. Imagine washing your face with dirty clogged wash basin. Yak. No stay here at all, not worth the money..

Not the most high end hotel in Vegas, but you definitely get more than you pay for.  Room was upgraded for free.  Had a view of the parking garage and mountains, but the size of the room more than made up for it.  Incredible cinnamon roll french toast for breakfast.  One order was more than me and my wife could finish.   Really nice 50s theme restaurant that I unfortunately can't remember the name.  Had chicken fried steak and a coke float for breakfast.  Not on the strip but easy enough to get to.  Great outdoor lounge in upper stratosphere with incredible jalepeno bagels.  Cant wait to stay here again.

Requests we made when we reserved our room were not accommodated.  The rooms are not sound proofed well and we were kept up all night by people yelling, running up and down the hallway, and slamming toilet lids. Our window faced a wall.  We will not be staying here again.

Got a cheap deal and decided to stay here... now I realize why it was cheap.

This review is purely on the hotel room we got.
When we checked in, it took a very long time, even though there was 5 different people working and only 2 of which were actually checking in customers. No worries, I am a patient lady and I am also in no rush. We checked in and the receptionist gave us our key and we were on our way.

We got a room with a lovely view of... the hotel's air conditioner unit. No big, I didn't pay much for the room.
I started to unpack because the drive had been so long and I just wanted to sit on the bed. I got my things settled and then took my shoes and socks off and then walked over to my bed when I stepped on.... something. No clue what it was. It was very brown and very sticky. Okay- note to self, don't walk by the left side of the bed without shoes on.
My friend and I started to change and get dressed for a night out. I walked over to grab my bag when, a large, metal, panel for the electrical unit in the room fell on me. Literally fell and hit me in the back. I thought I had done it but when I tried to put it back, I realized, there weren't any screws in it except for one... which had ALSO come loose. I decided to call front desk to make sure we don't get charged for this and to be honest, I was kind of expecting an apology. Nothing. I told the lady who picked up what had happened and she laughed and said, "Don't worry about it. Thanks"

Luckily, I only spent one night there otherwise, I would have been a bit peeved that I had spent ANY money on this place.

My parents have been staying at the Stratosphere for almost fifteen years and haven't really had issues but I booked an extended stay due to an upcoming relocation out of Las Vegas. The room I was given was not the room pictured on the reservation page. I booked a Premier View room in the renovated rooms. When checking in I was told if I wanted those rooms it would be an additional $20 per day. In addition to resort fees I was also told I had to pay a $50 per day deposit because I was a local. Seriously????

When I got to the room, there was a fork and bits of food in the hallway by my door. The room was old and outdated. The bathroom fixtures were lined with mildew and the sheets slightly stained. There were stains on the carpet that looked like blood in one area. I immediately checked out. Spend some extra money and stay somewhere clean. The front desk staff were polite and friendly but did nothing to make me stay in a different room. Ive settled in elsewhere and am much happier.

Wow talk about a real shithole...it was a shithole when it was called Vegas World & its still a shithole even though its the Stratosphere it still has lingering ghosts of Vegas World! Full of pimps prostitutes crackheads thugs weirdos and every other "undesirables" you can think of! & another thing why the hell do i have to PAY just to go all the way up the stratosphere tower?!?!? That's just downright ridiculous!!!what else is ridiculous is the food prices @ the restaurant up there! Nothing less than 20 bucks a plate when the food is sub-par at best?!?!?  Thank you but no thank you.. You should be ashamed of yourselves!

Decent hotel. It's located on the complete end of the strip, so if you want to visit some of the hotels like Mandalay Bay or Luxor, it's a little bit of a drive. The attractions are good, but if you already have a room, you still have to pay to get to the top of the tower. The rooms are nice, but you have to pay for a view. The beds are ridiculously confortable though.

I will not even give a rate to this hotel. I checked in 12\/21\/14. I called in to the front desk and ask them for a late check in. To my surprise when I got in about 11:05pm after a very long drive, as I checked in I was told that my room is not ready. Now the check in process was like 30 minutes and was told that they have front desk agent call in sick. A lame excuse. So I went to eat at their Roxy diner for the wait. To my airplane my food has a fly. Manager didn't do anything was told it will be credit for the food with fly and yet when I receive the bill it was there. This restaurant is a big fucking joke. Then when I finally got my room, the pillowcase smells like it has been used for weeks but the housekeeper insisted that the smell is the way it is. Management of this hotel should be fired and banned to work in a hotel.

Went for 5 de mayo with a few of my friends and it was ok for the price: 

The hotel itself is pretty decent, the room was very clean and the beds very comfortable !

Now you have to take into account that the hotel is located near downtown and it's not the best area , so you will see a bunch of sketchy people and sketchy things going on.   Doesn't feel like the safest place to go out tbh , BUT the location is convenient if you're trying to hit freemont ST and the strip all in the same day.

Cool fun place for gambling, food and rides. Top of tower great lounge and restaurant, there is an observation deck with three great rides for the thrill seekers and a gift shop. 

On ground level, all your favorite slots and table games, great place for a night out.

Miserable.  Dirty.  Untasty restaurants.  Why do I continue visiting this place??!  It is very cheap though, if thats what you're looking for, this is the winner!  Slightly...slightly better than Sahara.

I been going to Vegas for four years and have always avoided the Stratosphere due to preconceived notions that it was a dump and cheap.

On Sept 27, 2013, those thoughts were immediately dismissed when I checked in for a last minute convention weekend. 

The hotel room is actually clean. It's up to par with any standard room on the Strip. You get free admission to the top of the Tower if your a guest here. There are plenty of cheap restaurants if your on a budget. If your a video poker fanatic like I, be sure to play at the bar area. Those bartenders do sure take care of you, consistently refilling my Coke & Jack :)

With that in mine, there are two things to avoid at the Stratosphere
1. The Buffett (enough said?)
2. if your a low limit blackjack table, stay away. the $5 tables here pay 6-5 on BJ.

Having nothing really bad to say about the Strat.  Have never stayed in their hotel, but have visited the property about 8 times to shop and go to the top of the tower.  the casino itself is VERY dark, and one big round circle it seems.  Prices to the top of the tower are pretty high, like $25 a person or so, not counting the rides.  Would I stay at the hotel?  No, bad part of town...meaning location location location is EVERYTHING in Vegas.

Without having to bid on priceline, I got a special nightly rate for only $67 from Amoma.com. The room is big, nice and clean. The hotel has several restaurants and the one I like the best is the Italian Restaurant. One of the nice things about this hotel is just located a couple block away from the strip and walking to the strip isn't a challenge. I also like about the big nice pool there .

I just got back from my trip to vegas and must say I was very happy with this hotel\/casino. Everyone on here is so picky but you have to realize you get what you pay for. The rooms were so cheap. I paid around  70 dollars for two nights. What a great deal. The pool on the 8th floor is beautiful but too many kids running around. I preferred the adult topless pool on the 25th floor. I went with my gf and it was a very relaxing place. Its kind of small but pretty darn good for a place where you pay about 30 bucks a night. The staff was super friendly. My only gripe is the bathtubs are so darn small but like i said if i wanted a huge bathtub I could have paid much more for another hotel.

Well, during this trip to Vegas I stayed in Stratosphere two times: my first time and my last time. Unfortunately I read reviews on yelp after we came back, I should do it before we reserved hotel. But well, let think I paid for my mistake.

It was first time in my life I saw hotel aplomb of five star place and amenities worse than in motel in the middle of nowhere. OK, I saw hotels with paid Internet in rooms, but not for $12\/day. And all of them have free WiFi in public area, like cafe, business center, lobby, etc. But I forgot last time when I saw hotel without coffee machine and fridge in room.

And one small piece of soap for four people tree days stay. I understood from one of reviewers, that new owners had to cut expenses, but is it really so bad, to make them save on soap?

We have been going to the Stratosphere for years. Our reason for returning year after year is the players representative we have. Ron Guse. He's more than a players rep he's like a real friend. On one occasion we missed our flight and couldn't get another flight until the next day. I called Ron and he arranged for the Stratosphere limo to pick us up and he compted us a room for the night plus dinner, then arranged to have the hotels limo take us back to the airport.
We are not  big betters and we usually only visit Vegas once a year during our birthday or wedding anniversary. What ever the occasion Ron goes above an beyond to make our special day a memorable occasion. Usually he compts our dinner at the restaurant on top of the Stratosphere.
The rooms\/suite are always clean and the food is delicious. Ron Guse is the best players rep on the strip. He always makes our visit feel like a special event.

Stayed here on our first night, and thankfully it was only for that day.  The place is kind of old and out of date.  Of course it was free with the comps so I couldn't complain but this is probably one of the low places I have stayed at.  Since I didn't go up the tower the first time I came here, I decided to check out the top.  I can't believe they actually charge people to go up.  There's nothing really there but a high view with magnified view finders.  You still have to pay extra to ride the rides that they have.  They got this new controlled bungie jumping ride that looks pretty intense especially since it's 110 degrees outside right now.  Other than that I would say to save your money, and go somewhere else.  We probably spent like 10 minutes up there before going back down.  All in all, if you're only in Vegas for a couple of days, skip this place altogether and do something else.

One of the oldest hotels on the strip, their prices don't disappoint. We had to come to LV for an impromptu funeral and desperately needed a hotel for 4 people for a few nights. Stratosphere had the best price. The rooms where clean and we had a great view of the actual Stratosphere ride, which is costly I'm hearing.

Side note. I wasn't digging the upper floor pool. If you want to be surrounded by sunburned, potbellied, 60 something year old men, by all means go up there. And does no one SWIM anymore? What's up with all the seats being taken up and no one in the pool?

We recently stayed at The Stratosphere for my 21st birthday. It's on the completely opposite end of the strip from all of the major hotels (MGM, Caesars, etc), which made it really nice because we spent all day on the strip and it was nice to get away from the crowds and relax at the end of the day. It's one of the cheaper hotels that is actually on the strip, so it's a pretty good deal. It is in NO way within walking distance to the other sites, but we grabbed some monorail tickets ($30 for a three day pass) which took us pretty close to where we were heading. The view from the tower is amazing, especially at night. It was also nice that it had it's own small shopping mall so you could buy whatever you needed, or grab a quick lunch before heading to the strip. The room was pretty plain, nothing elaborate. Nice comfy king bed. You're (hopefully) not going to spend much time in your room anyway, so it's really not that big of a deal. They've got a decent sized casino, a few decent bars (I really like C Bar in the middle of the casino, except for their uneccessarily loud music), a burger joint, a buffet, an italian restaurant, AND A MCDONALDS! They also have a pizza place that is pretty good. Also, there is a Fat Tuesday in the shopping area so you can get your giant margarita before heading out for the day. Also, by staying here you get 2 for 1 passes to their amusement rides on top of the tower, and the their vampire burlesque show 'Bite'. All in all I'd say that if you're not concerned about having a fancy schmancy room and are looking for a great deal, the stratosphere is the way to go. I would definately stay here again.

Terrible experience this time around.  We have stayed at The Stratosphere several times in  the past, but this time will be our last.  We arrived and were put up in one of their non-renovated rooms on the North side of the hotel.  The entire room had only 3 electrical outlets, and the shower head felt like it was jet-powered with no way to change spray patterns or pressure.  It literally threw out this piercing mist.  We requested a new room and were transferred to a 'renovated' room in the select side...for a small increase in price.  This renovated room was the exact same as the previous room except that it had some updated furniture and fresh paint.  No refrigerators in any rooms outside of suites, but they'll rent you one for $10\/night.  A cooler at Wal Mart is $3, and the ice is free.  Lastly, we called housekeeping for some towels.  2 hours and 3 phone calls later and we finally got them.

The bottom line is that there are better hotels in Vegas that will take care of their patrons much better.

If you've been to Vegas a lot and have not been on top of the Stratosphere, you should go the next time. Go at night and you'll see the bright, colorful lights of the strip, and beyond it, all the residential lights of the desert. It's a view of Vegas that you could probably only get from the top of the Stratosphere. It's different from the High Roller Wheel in that it's located at the end of the strip, and so you can see all of the strip from one point of view.

If you're into bungee jumping, you can get that rush here as well, and get a heck of a view while you're at it. If not, come up here to watch the people back out the last second, it gets pretty funny sometimes. There is also a roller coaster ride that goes over the edge of the tower, for all you thrill seekers.

Overall, it's a must to see Vegas and all its glory from the top of the stratosphere, at least once.

Lori at front desk greeted us with unnecessary rudeness. She insisted our reservation had been mysteriously canceled & made no attempts to offer solutions and was a total grouch. This was completely untrue, we had a current reservation indeed. I was showing her confirmation emails, a tab in my apple wallet for the booking that was in fact current and then finally called booking.com to square it away-i requested that the manager take over because her bad attitude was killing me. Manager sorted out the problem, quickly getting us into the room we had booked 4 months prior. It had not been canceled, Lori was just incompetent. This next complaint might be just coincidence, but the air conditioner & TV were both busted & the nice man from engineering had to come up 3x to fix things. They also tried putting us into a lesser room than we had booked. I argued for 20 minutes before finally getting settled in the room we pre-booked. So that was the first day. On the second night we noticed security clocking us as we went out to walk my assistance dog. My husband went to buy cigarettes & i took his key card to go back upstairs. 10 minutes later he arrives at the door accompanied by hotel security. They insisted he couldn't possibly be a guest of hotel because his key was on the 20th floor, in our room with me. I was shocked when I opened the door to the inquisition. I strongly believe this was due to how we look. We do not dress like the basic crackers that mostly fill the Stratosphere's fast food scented halls. My husband has long hair & a beard, so he must be a criminal right. The security guys did go away quickly after I called them out for their faulty profiling, but it was VERY upsetting for my man to have been harassed like that for NO reason. They had seen us going in & out together several times already & wanted to mess with someone, it was weird. Harassment was not warranted. What it comes down to is this. Everything about this hotel casino sucks. The prices are so inflated. When u check in, they give u a stack of unredeemable discount cards. Not a single bar in the place would honor the "show your room key & get a 2 for 1" deal, not one. I would never recommend this hotel. I will never stay here again. I suspect this place will be boarded up & eventually leveled like so many other failed, out-moded casinos in Las Vegas. Good riddance Stratosphere, thank you for attempting to ruin our honeymoon, you will have to try harder next time- oh wait, there will not be a next time.
Arrived at 1145 Wednesday night, only 3 people working the desk and had to wait 1 hr to check in.  Horrible start to a much needed get away, screw stratosphere.  Going back to Hard Rock next time.

From day one this hotel was a disappointment. When we entered in our room that was the first one. The room was very diff as described as when we booked it online. Then there was construction that woke us all up. There's not even a fridge in here. Bathroom was tiny and outdated. Before we booked here we were debating on Luxor. This is really a big disappointment considering how much we spent. Then on 2nd day here, no housekeeping came by. So at 530 before I left the room I asked for them to send someone and I come back at 1030 to find it uncleaned! I called out of rage and asked for it to be done and why it wasn't done. She said they were short staffed. And will send someone soon. My dad called shortly to make sure they were coming but we were too mad already cus we were trying to go to bed. They said to him that this isn't their responsibility. No clean towels no toilet tissue! I went down to talk to the manager and she just gave us a $20 refund for the resort fee. I told her what I was informed and she said no they are not short staffed and that there is no housekeeping at this hour. Soooooo what were we waiting for then??????? I asked to have our room changed and she said no. Just a $20 refund. Really disappointed and not returning. If you made a mistake you should treat the customer to feel welcome and satisfied. But nope, not stratosphere. Didn't even ask for much but to change our room. I just don't understand why they didn't clean\/ service our room in the beginning. I saw them cleaning other rooms on our floor.

I came here both times to meet guests or new found Las Vegas friends.
I like the location, right on the edge before descending into downtown. 

It was close to some folks I met at a nearby tattoo parlor. I have played a few slots and had a shot or two of Jose Cuervo. 

I really want to make it back for the Karaoke night.

My husband and I checked into The Stratosphere after a long flight. The first thing we noticed when entering the room was that the floors didn't look like they had been cleaned for quite some time. 
The bathroom tub needed to be re caulked and some of the caulk was molded.
We went to eat and, after returning, decided to shower. We discovered that there were no bath towels. We called housekeeping and it took 3 calls and 1 1\/2 hours for them to bring towels.
While showering, the water barely sprayed enough to be called a shower.  I don't think we will stay here again.

I am rating this based on the price of the hotel.  If I paid more per night I would probably expect more; however, I thought everything was great for the price.  The rooms were clean and almost always quiet.  The pool was awesome with a beautiful view.  I went to of the restaurants inside which were also good.

The stratosphere is way out of the way situated at the north end of the strip, so it's easy to forget about it when booking trips. But with it's cheap rates and great views in the tower, I highly recommend it. It's an older hotel but I guess they are slowly renovating the rooms... or at least planning on it. As the strip gets builded up and the north end fills with higher end hotel casinos, my guess is that the Stratosphere will catch up to the times. Old School is no longer the Cool in Vegas.
It is inexpensive and you get what you pay for. Value is added with the free tower admission, which is normally $20 each person. So factor that in and the place is a bargain compared to other hotels!

I stayed here for a one night stay so that I could go to a wedding;
the price is RIGHT!
Bathroom a little small - we did not upgrade although the front desk asked us if we wanted to. The beds and room were clean.
Downstairs they have an awesome shoe shine - even if you don't stay you should get the guys here to give you a shoe shine.
The neighbourhood doesn't look the nicest as it is poorer and there are a few vagrants that might ask for change (not is a really persistent way), however, I would prefer to walk around here than on the rest of the strip where those guys (and girls) keep giving you the 'modelling' magazines!
All in all, if they keep the prices reasonable this is a great place to stay if you don't mind a walk or taxi to the rest of the Strip

DO NOT VISIT THIS CASINO! There were a ton of bed bugs in the hotel that we stayed at. Also, their customer service is extremely rude! They told us that we would be able to get two nights for free, but then ended up charging us for each night!

I do NOT recommend this casino. There are plenty other choices in Vegas that are MUCH better.
Great view, I did not try the roller coaster I may be crazy but not stupid. We did not stay here just checking out the view, so for that it got 4 stars

A friend suggested I try this place since it's a really affordable price and it had nice rooms.  Looks like only if you picked the right rooms which are the renovated ones that are SELECT, and not get the north tower with their non-renovated rooms.  The rooms here are still old style motel with the clicking flickering light that groans and turns on.  The indoor air that is too hot or too cold no matter what you set it too.  The rooms feel pretty clean which is its redeeming factor.  The view is terrible.
Checking-in wasn't that bad of a line but it their computer system went down and everyone was doing everything by hand and making photocopies of everything.  And all the rooms were now pre-assigned.  Not cool.
Thankfully got a non-smoking room and not assigned accidentally a smoking room.
Parking lot is pretty dirty.  The nice thing is the parking is Free which I thought was strange that it was now listed as an amenity but that's because most of the other hotels now have paid parking!!  What kind of insanity is that?!  It started Dec 2016 apparently and now after decades of free parking at all the strip hotels, there is now an unheard of paid parking being implemented!  
The hallways smell and the room smells.  Really felt like gagging when entering the hallways.  Yuck.

Reserved room 30 days in advance. Asked for specific room as I am a local and enjoy a nice hotel room with my husband kinda like a stay-cation.  Our room was not ready, we were 35 min early, no problem, we grabbed a Starbucks coffee and waited.  We returned at 3:00 when our room should have been ready.. still not ready, but the desk clerk was trying to help us.  He then informed us that the room I had reserved was not the room I would have received if I had checked in at 2:15..  He did get us a room, no view except the air conditioning ducts\/pipes.. Hotel also charges locals an extra  refundable 50.00.. WHY??  I paid in full at time of reservation 30 days earlier.  I am a retired military wife.  I have stayed here before with no deposit.  weird and rude,   Yes, they give it back, but why make me have to give you cash or credit card for this?? and not other hotel guest??  The room had approx 5 lights that did not work or the bulbs were burnt out so it was dark. Also the coffee maker had only decaf coffee.. Oh and the creamer packets are those awful dried things and the coffee and creamer were GROSS. I think they may be the only hotel that still uses powder creamer packets. Also what is with no caffeine coffee??  They only had 1 attendant for the tower so wait time was approx 30 min. on a Sunday.  We loved the 107  bar.  Beautiful views, happy hour, and yummy drinks.. I also do not think the hotels should charge a resort fee.  I mean you are being ripped off.  Nearly everyone has internet on their smart phones. or just go to Starbucks..Most pools are closed off season... I was there one night so the GYM I did not use..So if you think you are paying a great nightly rate, check again.. you will have to pay an additional 10-30 a night for your room once they add the resort fee.  They should do away with resorts fee and just list the price for the room.  Some hotels even charge for their water bottles and coffee in room too. So do your research and ask questions.. Garage is a bit sketchy too.. Not in the best part of town or the the strip. I have stayed here 3 times and I can honestly say I will never be back.. Done with this hotel. Honestly you can get the same room with tub, robes, kitchen etc at Trumps.. I have stayed there,, very classy.
I love this hotel the people, Service, and just everything else is such a  good place to get away to have fun

First time I've ever stayed off the strip and it was a great experience! Honestly, I stayed at this hotel simply because I wanted to go to the top of the tower without having to pay $25 per ticket, and so I was on my way to Vegas, needed a place to stay right away, and killed 2 birds with one stone. 
Yes it's located far from the strip, but not too far that you can't walk, drive, or take a taxi! Come on people stop being lazy! The best thing was their wonderful customer service at the front desk, housekeepers, and at the casino. Since this was my first stay here, I wasn't aware if they had a renovation or anything, but the room was big, clean, fresh, had contemporary amenities, and the prices were very reasonable. And best of all the tower had AMAZING sights! A must 'do' if you're going to Vegas!
Unfortunately it is located in a very seedy, ghetto area of Las Vegas, but hey! you won't notice it if you don't care. I go to Vegas to have fun and that's what I had. Will I stay here again, definitely. I'm a fan!
Is it fun and safe for kids?, honestly I don't know because IMO Vegas is not for children, you people who bring your 5 year olds to run around in smoky casinos need to see a psychiatrist.
I also did not pay for any resort fees, but then again I booked it on Orbitz.com, so maybe they omitted that.

Oh, and Vidya K (a couple of comments below mine), drunk people in Vegas? SHOCKING!!!
Disappointed, I was there 3 days\/2 nights, I was never able to use the WiFi...same problem 5 years ago... Good accommodation for $40, the tower is the top..the gym, no comment!

do not recommend staying here as a hotel.

1. thought there would be killer views of the strip so upgraded to one of their top floors - weak, at best. cant see the strip, nothing.
2. Went in knowing hotel was off the beaten path and we'd have to uber everywhere - but WOW. we took up to 20 ubers over the course of the trip and EVERY.SINGLE.DRIVER couldn't find the pick up location\/drop off location.  the situation at the hotel for uber is crazy.
3. its boring in itself.  We tried to take in a show to kill extra time - pin up something - so boring, unfortunately.

If I ever see the stratosphere again it will be because i'm in vegas, in a different hotel, and want to go to the bar at the top of the tower - now THAT place has awesome views and is worth ubering once for it.

never stay at the stratosphere they r crooks who like to steal n when u report something got stolen they drag there feet and we were mis treated there so now its turned into a huge lawsuit against them

The pictures upon booking looked like a descent hotel, but pictures can be deceiving because when we got to our room I thought we accidentally walked into POS for-rent apartments across from the parking garage. They seemed to have updated the décor to the late 90's in the hallways, but forgot about the rooms which was straight out of the dingy, low-budget horror flicks. Don't get me wrong, if you're just looking for some place to store your bags while you party all night, then this is the place. If you're looking to get a good night's rest, you might as well sleep in your car because at least parking is free practically in any hotel garage. Is this place cheap? That depends, I booked a deluxe room but the only thing that was deluxe was that it had running water. This place is outright shitty, the room was as grotesque with a capital G. Don't waste your money, pay a few more dollars and stay at the other higher end hotels...because you will be very disappointed.

The rooms have been renovated and found them to be fairly nice.  There is no refrigerator or safe in the rooms.  We had a view of the strip which was nice and you could see the people bungy jumping off the tower.  The food selection they had available at the hotel was decent and we had food on the second story food court and at the buffet which we ate at.  The self parking garage is a little past the hotel on the side street.  Most of the parking is on the 3rd and 4th floor.  The elevator to the garage can be accessed by exiting the hotel near the Starbucks and walk to the garage if not the bridegway in the on the third floor and you have to either take the stairs or the escalator to the casino level of the hotel.  As with most Vegas hotels, smoking is allowed and even in non-smoking rooms, people smoke in the hallways or near the elevator so it's not like you can be smoke free totally in the hotel.  Despite the reviews that I've read about the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised and pleased about the Stratosphere.  Yes, it is a good hike to the rest of Vegas but it's certainly not as congested as the other hotels either.

Everything smells like smoke. Changed my room 3 times.... non smoking but it still stank to high heavens of smoke in each room. The rooms are awfully small for a Strip Casino (and I've been to other ones before.) The front desk people hardly smile, and are quiet rude to their guests, especially any of the foreign guests. What would have been nice is if they asked "How is your day going" or something similar. This didn't happen, and they just seemed to want to get rid of me as soon as I came up. The bathtub in my first and third room were disgusting, it didn't seem to be washed at all. It had calcium deposited all over and black spots all over. The furniture looks like its ready to fall apart, really. The Stratosphere itself is located in a particularly shady part of the city, lots of homeless and dangerous people loitering around.

I remind you that I have been to other Hotels on the strip that are MUCH better and fairly equal in price. I recommend going to the Tropicana, Luxor, or Mandalay Bay instead. You'll be waisting your time and money's worth at the stratosphere.

I always have a great time running around the Stratosphere. For some reason, it's just fun. The bars downstairs are a bit divey for the prices they charge. Some man kind of harassed me in one of the bars last time I was there and then I fell pregnant, so I haven't been back. But I would definitely go back for the upstairs bar experience and LA comedy club!!

If you're looking for an average place to stay with bad overpriced food and 1\/10th the selection of restaurants then quick to orbitz and make the resey. 
I'm used to the Vegas 'everything is overpriced' but stratosphere is the epitome. The cleaning staff missed us a few times, the buffet was beyond average into borderline shit and for the $50 tab i don't think fresh fruit is an overbearing request. 
One bright spot is the parking is easy except for the fact that you better have an alarm on your car...not because of thieves but because the garage is a labyrinth and mid evil dungeon master would shit a brick for.

Absolutely the best deal in town. 

We stayed in the "Tower Premier Guestrooms" for an average of $44 \/night. The rooms were recently remodeled and were modern, contemporary, and had things like a LAN plug for high speed Internet.

Our room also had a 42 LCD TV and MP3 alarm clock.

Nice use of colors and fabrics in the room. The bathroom had granite counters and custom tile on the floor. 

Bed was comfy and air conditioner \/ heater worked fine.

My only complaint about staying here was that despite the heavy-duty doors, hallway noise could be heard VERY easily while sitting on the bed. 

Check-in took 5 minutes, and check out was similar.  Parking was sometimes a chore to find, but we went during the Christmas holiday so the hotel was very packed.

If you're on a budget and don't mind being off of the strip a bit, then book here and get one of the remodeled rooms - it's worth every dollar.

My husband and I were coming here to have our anniversary dinner at Top of the World. He got this idea that we should also spend the night because suites here run less than the average room on the strip. We didn't have a bad experience here, but it isn't the best option for the area. The room was clean and even had a coffee maker (a small miracle for an on strip hotel\/casino), but it's very outdated. The location also isn't the greatest because it's all the way at the north end making it a long walk to other casinos. The restaurants inside are okay, but definitely not the best that the strip has to offer. It would be an okay choice for someone looking to save money that is willing to walk quite a bit to get to food and shopping.

Paid 12 dollars for superfast internet, but I'm not able to send an email with 500 kb. What a joke!!!!!! It is very loud, ok, it's a casino too. Room is old, some lights didn't work. No nice experience and I don't feel satisfied

Went there with wifey, last week. We got to go up to the 107th floor, ordered some drinks, then proceeded to hang out up there for a little over an hour. Amazing view! It was AWESOME!! After our drinks, we went one more floor up to the 108th floor. WOW!!! We walked around for another hour or so. Then we went up to the top floor outside on the balcony. Breath taking view!! Will most definitely return!!

Good deal on the hotel due to playing in a poker tournament.  I don't see what all of the complaints are about.  The room was clean, casino was pretty good, and I feel they meet the Vegas standard.  Not sure if everyone expects fireworks and butler service.  Only complaints are that the rooms are not well ventilated.  I don't understand why the bathrooms don't have fans, but neither did the other casino I stayed at so whatev.  I would stay here again...Really loved the Radius pool.  Felt that the drink service was good and the bartenders were pretty friendly overall.  I'd recommend

I definitely wouldn't stay at the Stratosphere again. I've been to Vegas numerous times before and never stayed at the Stratosphere. Me and my girlfriend arrived on 12\/30\/2016 and we immediately went to go shower and iron our clothes so we can go out. The iron was literally attached to the iron board and couldn't come off which made it very awkward to iron. The water didn't event flow properly from the shower. We got a non smoking room on a non smoking floor. The next day we woke up to our bathroom smelling of smoke, we thought maybe someone was smoking outside or maybe someone was sneaking a smoke in the next room. We left in the morning and came back around 4pm and around room still hasn't been cleaned or bathroom restocked. So I happen to see a housekeeping woman on my floor and ask for some new towels so we can shower to get ready to go out for NYE she gives them to me says a housekeeper should be coming to the room. I went to get ice and see another housekeeper on the floor and I asked her for toilet tissue and she said shed come to my room after she does 2 rooms mine will be next. An hour goes by that housekeeper never came. I had track down someone else to be sure someone will come and clean the room. The very next day both my girlfriend wake up to our whole room filled with a strong smoke smell and our allergies were going crazy. So we had to go down to the desk speak to the manager and he said the only thing he can do is have air filtering process that takes 2hrs so we left so they can do so. When we returned it was better but not completely out. We also asked the manager for a new remote control because it wasn't working and a do not disturb sign which we never got either. We got the remote but not the sign. Later in that evening when we came back (of course again the room isnt done) my gf had gotten out of the shower and was drying off in the room when she hears someone unlock the door with a key which freaked her out because she wasn't dressed. The person opens the door first then knocks. My gf runs to the back of the room I'm standing there in my boxers and the housekeeping woman walks in and asks me if I need towels as if it was normal to walk in on man in his boxers. I said yes we need towels. So she puts towels in our bathroom and proceeds to leave I ask her if she was coming back to finish the room it was after 5 by then and said okay. I told her we were leaving for the night. So the next day housekeeping just never even came at all. The day ofy checkout I called for bellman service to get the bags from our room and they told me 30mins by then I just said forget it I was just done with experience. Will be my first and last time at this establishment.
Ok so i won 3 free nights at this hotel tried to book  this weekend before my vacation ends. It's blacked out...so annoying for an event i don't even care about.

Held hostage by Stratosphere elevator operator. 
     We had dinner last evening at the Stratosphere top of the world restaurant. Like other reviewers, don't bother requesting a window table. Even though we made reservations a week in advance, walk in's were given a window table in front of us and we were told the wait would be an hour. The dining staff was very good and the food was okay... Not worth our $300.00 bill including tip. 
     After dinner, we went to the observation deck at the suggestion of the staff. After waiting almost 20 minutes for the elevator on the observation deck floor to leave the floor, we entered the elevator car that finally stopped and were told by the operator to exit as she was only allowed to pick up people from the restaurant even after showing her our receipt, she refused to close the doors to take us down to the lobby and demanded we all exit. We refused stating we just wanted to leave and she offered no solutions to meet our desire to leave just we had to leave and that she was calling security. 
    After some time and an elevator full of paying customers and who knows how many other paying customers stranded on other floors, the elevator maintenance people came and told her to just take us down. 
     We are local Las Vegas people and will never spend another dine in the Stratosphere and will make sure our terrible experience of being held hostage  in the elevator story is re-told. 
(

Lame. This place, classically, is all about taking as much as possible and giving as little as possible in return. And I'm not talking about gambling. Rooms are shoddy, dirty, smelly. Don't fall for their "I just talked to the manager and I can offer you an upgrade for only $45!" You might as well light your money on fire.

The service is snarky and stereotypically Las Vegas shyster chic. Bellhops show up when they feel like it, and expect tips. We had to haul our own bags when they didn't show up after an hour, making us late for check out. Asked for directions at the information booth, and some sleazy woman tried to sell us a time share. Gross!

Everything is tacky, low-quality, expensive. They claim to be part of this whole "take back Vegas" bologna, but all that really means is "we are going to cut costs to boost our profit margins and pretend we are catering to "the common man"."

Congratulations, Stratosphere, for continuing to be the reason that the best views of Vegas are still in the rear view mirror...

Never book the basic cheap room! We did and gross! Literally looked liked a room someone would have died in in a CSI scene. But upgrade was only 20 dollars a night and that room was beautiful with a great view. If you stay here, stay here... Don't walk around outside. This is too close to downtown Vegas and what they call "Crack Alley". The slots are tight, your not going to win big here, no-one in our group of 50, won anything worth mentioning. Tryjng to get a drink while playing slots, forget about it, they only come around about every 45 minutes to an hour, on a good day. The Buffett... Ehh. It was ok. Most of the food was very similar to cafeteria, in fact, i think Furrs would have been better. Even if you stay at hotel, plan in 35.00 for buffett for 2! The shops are ok, but nothing you can't find on the strip. It took 45 minutes standing in line to check in and both days we waited over 25 minutes for valet to get our cars. In short. Room was ok after upgrade, view was amazing. But we won't stay here again. Its too limiting!

Paid to see the 4th of July fireworks in the observation deck of the Tower. It was the absolute worse experience ever!! Prices were $28 per person, it was crowded, hot, no view of anything and the worst singers\/performance they could hire.  So bad that the overhead speakers kept going out and all you heard was very loud static.  It got so bad that everyone was chanting "turn it off, turn it off"! Save your money and don't go here. You can see it free from the sidewalk!

No return business from me...  

Pros: low rates and pretty friendly staff

Cons:
1. Technically on the strip, but nowhere near where the action is
2. Nickel-and-dime system... I've never been in a hotel that not only doesn't provide guests a free kiosk to print boarding passes, but also charges $5 for the concierge to deliver a faxed or emailed pass
3. My mom ate the food and reported it was of a low quality
4. In the shady part of town
5. TV was faulty, no luggage stand

Was in one of the remodeled rooms and it was decent, but far below stellar.

Full disclosure: before coming over to this hotel for a little family reunion I was in a suite at the Cosmopolitan. This Stratosphere place can't possibly compete with that--no way (can't hold a candle to it).

If you're on a tight budget perhaps, but otherwise...  next time I'm staying ensconced at the Cosmo.

Note: one of the hotel staff--embarrassed that having to charge to print boarding passes--did it for free.

I stayed here for three days in July 2013
Pros- The hotel is very quiet. Its not like most hotels on the strip where theres a lot going on. Its a good hotel for people who want to go to Vegas and want a good experience but are also watching their budget. The stratosphere is one of the cheapest hotels on the strip but yet is good quality. I appreciated the chinese theme going on when I went there. The buffet was nice.The room was above average, though next time, if I do book with stratosphere, I would get a room where you can see the strip. Our view was just the desert and mountains and the back of buildings. The lookout was the best and I think families would really enjoy it,especially at night seeing all the lights on the strip. There is also two roller coasters and sky diving for the thrill seekers. A nightclub at the very top by the lookout with a bar. Great for taking pictures.
Cons- Although this was also a pro. its very quiet. Theres really nothing going on if youre looking for hotel life. Its quiet and that can be bad for people who want that excited vegas experience when it comes to hotel stays. The location is also a con, it is on the strip but a good walking distance from all the big events. 
In conclusion, I would only book a room at the stratosphere if I want to go to vegas again on a budget. If not, I will be looking for something more on the strip.
Stayed in a suite and it was really nice. Whirlpool tub, big bathroom, and comfortable beds. I would definitely stay there again especially for the price.

The location might be the only thing I don't like about this place. This is the worse part of the strip. If you ever go here, do not walk anywhere from here at night. I don't care how close it is, don't do it. 

This place is much bigger than it looks. The bar, roller coasters, and restaurant I will say is the best thing going here. The view is absolutely second to none. Being local or military will help with pricing here for everything. So please take advantage of the discounts. The food court\/shopping area upstairs isn't bad either. I am not knowledgable of the gambling scene so don't ask me.

Worst hotel room ever. Your better off at a no tell motel.

They give zero fucks and run it like slum lords.

We thought we steamed up the room, but no, we were taking credit for faulty climate controls.

Serving staff was bare bones and took about an hour to get us a drink. 

The band on Friday\/saturday was on point and great. Sunday band was horrid and off key.

Don't go here. Srsly. Slum lords.
Great Attractions but do not stay at this hotel the rooms are awful, the Jacuzzis are stain. Avoid at all cost.

Stayed one night at was pleasantly surprised.  The room was neat and clean and the elevators were fast.  We used all of amenities available to us and had a great time.  The 107 Lounge was excellent!  Will stay here again soon.
Expensive place u gotta pay to just go up the tower.  The rides were ok wasn't busy which was a plus.  And there is a creamery there with lactose free ice cream for the bf that he said was ok.
Pretty nice place would return forsure... The casino was nice. The sports book was also nice.. didn't smell a lot of smoke..

Clean, friendly staff.  The bonus of this far from the main strip is just that.  Was great to have a more quite, low key place to crash - sure they food options were lacking and it is far from where you want to be, but for the price and the small amount of people, I'd recommend it.

We got an updated room with strip view on 15th floor of select tower. Excellent price. Around $65 which also included access to observatory ( we saved on  a family of 4). McDonalds in the hotel . Includes access to fitness \/pool.

I've stayed in a few places in Vegas, from the Palazzo to T.I. and the Stratosphere is definitely one of those "you get what you pay for" kind of deals.  My girl got a promotion for us to stay there for 2 nights for free basically so you can't beat that price.  The room was fine, nothing awesome or to write home about.  The location is super far from the heart of The Strip and a lot of the clientele were college kids and country bumpkins.  Bumpkins aside, I found the location to be the biggest detriment, I mean you could walk it and many do, shiet we did once, but it will wear you down pretty quick.  
On a high note, there were these two Dueling Piano guys performing and they are crazy good (they do request, they killed it with Montel Jordan).

Stayed the 27th and 28th at the Stratosphere for my husbands birthday. Reserved a room for King size bed and got placed in a nasty dirty room with a queen and was told that this was an upgrade. There were broken cigarettes in the room, it had a horrible smell and when I opened the mini fridge it was sticky. The remote was sticky as well. The casino was nice and the top of the world restaurant had great food but our waited neglected us so he did not keep the drinks coming. He only gave us one and we didn't see him again. This was our first trip to Vegas and our first vacation in the ten years we have been together so I can honestly say that I was very disappointed with our trip to Vegas but we learned which places to stay and which to avoid. This is one place we will never stay again.

Awful, just awful. The facility wasn't the worst but the service and staff were. The pool is something you would find at a motel in the worst of neighborhoods and they neglect to inform you that in addition to your room key you also must bring I.D., turning a 15 minute (one way) walk to the pool a 60 minute round trip. Also a 2 drink minimum so the "free" pool costs  $30 per guest. If you want to watch a movie in your room, get ready for another hour long journey. Instead of using the card on file that you leave at check in (that would be too convenient) you will be forced to go back to the front desk to give them the same card you already provided.  First you try to call the front desk only to have nobody answer for ten minutes. Then you will call everyone else in the hotel until you found that only housekeeping will answer. They will inform you that you need to go back to reception where you will hand over your card, again. When you get to reception at 1am be prepared to wait in line for an hour because they have 2 employees checking in 25 people. When we were finally leaving this shitty hotel in a horrible, crime ridden neighborhood we went down to grab a cab. We put our bags in the car then a hotel employee came over and said we were in the wrong cab and that we MUST use one provided by the hotel. He actually made us get out of the cab in 100° weather and walk, with our bags, around the block just to get back in the same cab. Room service: horrible food and they add gratuity before they bring it. So you will be paying for sorry excuse for food and horrible service, no choice. Don't stay here, it is awful. 0 Stars

You would think with paying 20.15 for their resort fee they would at least give you some damn coffee in your room. Paying 6 dollars for a Starbucks every morning is ridiculous. There is no refrigerator in the room so you can't even bring leftovers back to eat later or keep drinks cold. Put Kuerigs or the old fashion coffee maker in the rooms. If I wasn't here to meet some old friends I'd stay somewhere else. Sorry Stratosphere you are not keeping up with the other hotels on the strip

The price may be low, but they're going to nickle and dime you to death.  I've stayed at lower rated hotels that cost a third of what this place does and gotten more amenities.  There's no in room mini fridge, and it costs extra to get one.  My safe does not open.  They charged me extra for an "upgraded" room, then put me on the side of the hotel that can't even see the strip.  But the thing that broke me was that, as of writing this, I have been listening to the in room dining phone ring for 20 minutes.  It started as a joke to see how long they would go without answering, but now it's just sad.  I will not be staying here again, no matter how good the price is.

Un des célèbrissime café de la chaîne.
Amateurs de caféine, ici vous trouverez tout !
froid chaud fort serré tout

My sister had her 21st bday in vegas so we book this hotel with them. Omg worst experienece every when we walk down the hallway it small like cramp or someone taking a cramp. The hallway just stinks. On top of that we smell weed just air flowing. I open my covers and found someones hair on my bed or puberty hair which im not sure. I called the room service to change my bedsheets and my sister bed too because i wasn't sure if heres was clean either.



This place really needs to be remodel and updated and get better housekeeping team. If you have no choice don't book this place.

So this review is for the buffet which I've always enjoyed every time I come to Vegas. I was here Monday and the floor manager for breakfast was the most accommodating and polite person I've ever met in a hotel setting. This dude was legit as I had my son with me and he knew what I was going to ask before I even asked it. As far as people being good at their job this dude was top notch. 

I'll definitely be back here next time I'm in town.

Everything about the Stratosphere is actually farther than it looks. The tower is so tall you can see it from just about anywhere, and the journey to the top works just about  all of your anticipation muscles. 
 
Allow plenty of time for the whole excursion, especially if you are walking, because once you arrive at the tower, the entry is also long and involved. You have to decipher the directional graphics to find your way upstairs to pay, and then wind your way through the mall-like maze upwards to drop your possessions into a locker, and then finally get in line for the disclaimer part. Then you wait in a line to ride the elevator to the actual top, where you wait in a ride-specific line. This wait is relatively long, and you get to hear all the details of your fellow thrill seekers anxieties. People are trying to be cool and psyched and\/or talk themselves into or out of actually going on the rides. It's all good, and sets the stage for experiencing this truly creative use of outdoor public space. 

You need to be wearing shoes, (no flip-flops or bare feet) and there are cages to leave the little stuff in your pockets that you forgot about when you got that locker to store all the geegaws you bought in the mall on your way up.

I really enjoyed the thoroughness and imagination of the ride design details. They have all the blinking lights and comforting features of classic well-made carnival rides, yet the context is sooo strange and unique. A normal view out of a very tall building is at least panoramic and static, if not also breathtaking and dizzying ...add to that the dynamics of motion, and eXtreme changes in direction, and let's just say this one goes to 11. Or 12. Or 15.
Not my favorite place in Vegas... Kinda reminded me of a Best Western type hotel. Did not have that Vegas "wow" factor. Will not be staying here again...

This review is based on staying at the hotel all of 5 hours... we checked in around 1am (which is a surprisingly popular time to do so!) and checked out at 6am for a tour we were taking. 

Granted this was a weekday and we had the world's shortest stay, but we definitely appreciated the free upgrade (no prior stayings and a booking from Expedia) to a nice "romance suite" with a built in hot tub. 

Service was friendly as well. -1 star for managing to have a 20 minute check-in queue at 1am on a non-holiday weekday.

After staying at the D hotel last Nov 2013 - which has its own Yelp review - it was great to be back at the Stratosphere this Sept.

It was on this trip to Vegas that I made a crucial discovery. I have been cheating myself by not making the most of this city when I'm not staying at this resort.

When I stayed at the D hotel on Fremont Street, I never left the downtown area. The Strip is enormously long with its grandiose resorts. When I stayed at a resort on the Strip, that hotel dictated what I'd see and do because we didn't want to venture out too far from our room. The years I reserved a room at the Palm, Mandalay Bay and Hard Rock, I felt isolated from the city. In short, I compartmentalized my visits; but, it kept me coming back year after year in different seasons for various reasons.

This year was the second time my boyfriend and I spent 4 nights\/5days at the Stratosphere for Mr Olympia in Sept. This year, our room was upgraded to a higher floor which offered a better view and bathtub. 

Because the hotel is smack in the middle of the Strip and Downtown, we always say 5 days isn't enough. We go to pool parties, clubs on and off the Strip... attend the Olympia expo and pre-judging... loiter, do the zipline and celebrate Halloween (it looks like it every night of the week) on Fremont Street... we don't think about it, it just so happens we spend time at both ends of the city; but, it only happens when we stay here, no where else. For that reason, there isn't a better reason not to!
Very nice. Probably the best hotel in all Vegas. The watch tower was extremely nice. ... and scary but nice.
DO NOT STAY HERE.   This place is a dump.  Just visit the casino and the attractions.

The hotel rooms were pretty cheap, especially if you take the nearby hotel costs into consideration... I don't know if it's a 100% worth it tho because the rooms are pretty crappy. The sink and bathtub water gets stuck pretty often. It's a decent distance from the main strip area and you have to get a ride there. Some cool things are the rides. And the money you save is a plus too because then you can spend it where ever else you go...

Was disappointed in this hotel. It looked basic but cool online. However the room was very dirty. Scum and hair in the bathroom, stuff behind the dresser, etc. also there were like no wall plug ins!! Very frustrating. The window was tiny. Buffet sucks don't eat there. Happy hour drinks at the 107 lounge were delicious and a great deal. Casino is small and it does take a long time to get to the good part of the strip and its kind of creepy walking anywhere near by. It was nice that there was a bus stop right at the hotel and that it was a little more secluded. Also, no coffee pot in room!

I booked a room with a strip view. When we got there was told that the room wasn't available. Had to be moved to a room overlooking the ghetto. The wait time to check in was an hour and a half. There was no do not disturb sign in the room to put on the door. Called hose keeping to ask for a card. No one answered after 30 min waiting on the phone. Called the front desk to ask for one, they said they would send one up, no one ever came. When we went down to the casino floor to do some gambling the drink service was terrible. I stopped a waitress who was walking by and asked for a cocktail. She said "I have half a casino floor to tend to by myself and 4 girls called in sick, I can't get to you at this time."We booked a room for 2 nights, I cancelled the second night and got a room at the Excalibur. Never coming here again.

Just one more thing to add, yesterday (7-5-15) the day we were due to come back home to STL, we needed to print our boarding passes....and the stratosphere wanted to charge us $5.00 to do so. I was furious. Yes, $5.00 isn't much, but it's the principal. We had already paid almost $800 to stay there, in a shit room & then they wanted to charge us $5.00 for two pieces of freaking paper. Get real. We had family staying at circus circus, and Paris & they printed their passes for free. Throughout all of Vegas we got penny raped. The policy for printing boarding passes for guests at the hotel should be changed immediately.

We stayed in the Oasis Suite. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. The jetted tub accommodated both of us, and the bathroom was quite large. This was our first stay at the Stratosphere and we were pleasantly surprised.
My boyfriend & I came here for my birthday weekend to enjoy it & woke up to a ton of noise above us construction

Horrible! Took forever to check in and our room was gross. Smelled like mildew. We were near the elevator and it was loud all night. No mini bar in room, curtains didn't close all the way, which sucked in the morning. Everything way over priced and generally this is jus a grimey hotel. You get wat you pay for folks. I won't stay here again.

When this place first opened, everything here seemed great, but now everything is just average compared to all other casino hotels on the strip.

It looks like they never updated anything here so the casino and all the furnishings appear kinda old. I booked the cheapest room which provided basic accommodations for travelers who only need a place to sleep, which was perfect for me. I got one of the newer rooms, and it was neat and cozy, the only inconvenience is that there is no small fridge.

Location: It was a little far to walk to the more popular places on the strip, but great if you are going to Fremont Street. So if you don't have a car, you either have to spend a lot of time walking or a lot of money taking the cab, of course you can also consider taking the bus.

To me the best thing here was still the view, and guest here can go up to the top of the tower free.

Hotel staffs I met were friendly, however, one particular security on the top of the tower was extremely rude. His attitude was obnoxious and disrespectful. I will not consider staying here again.

I had a very disappointing verbal encounter with the assistant hotel manager Eileen. She was definitely not hotel guest friendly and although we both remained calm, her lack of managerial support has made me decide not to return to the Stratosphere for future accommodations. I have 7-10 rooms booked and we will venture into a different direction next year

This hotel is gross. Found hairs everywhere on my bed and the bathroom had the most disgusting odor I could barely enter. Room does not come enabled with movies and you have to go all the way back down to request it even if you put incidentals on your card and room service takes 30-45 minutes to pick up the phone. Grossed out and will never stay here again!

Hotel staff is very friendly! The hotel room was ok, but the bathroom not so good! The toilet don't flush well and it sounds like a airplane bathroom. To get to the shower you have to step up into the shower. To have a fridge or microwave into the room is $10 extra for each per day. To get the same room but renovated its $15 extra a day! The TV channels there aren't many. I would not come back!

Ive stayed at high end and mid level hotels in vegas. Thought id try it out.  All the good reveiws must be from drunks or people that dont stay at better hotels. The place is no better than a local ez 8 motel.  Pimps and hos yelling at 2 am knocking on wrong doors. Ridiculous place . Ive been more comfy at palace station and thats supposedly cheaper than here.  Decent if u just want to crash and dont mind all the ruckus.

My wife and I had a stay scheduled at the Venetian and decided to come into town a night early and check out the Stratosphere as it was part of the Southwest Rapid Rewards program. Upon arriving in our room, we quickly noticed a strong odor of cigarette smoke in the room. We had specifically requested a non-smoking room when booking and confirmed this with the front desk while we were checking in. The bathroom also scored failing points as the toilet seat wouldn't stay up. This might sound like a minor thing, but it's not. As a man, I had to hold the seat up with one hand so it wouldn't fall down on me as I was going #1. Additionally, the walls of our room were paper thin, so we could hear our neighbor's conversation word for word (they also were disappointed with the room).

Shortly after checking in, we headed up to their Top of the World rotating restaurant where we had made reservations and were meeting another couple. From the moment we sat down, we felt that the server (Rebecca H. according to my receipt) was in a rush to get us out the door. We came for fine dining and I wasn't even asked if I wanted a drink before dinner. Truly astonishing! When it came time to receive the check, we asked Rebecca if she would split it by couple. She didn't even try to hide how frustrated this made her. She was able to split it, but not after making a production about how she had to go "look into whether or not this could be done." Give me a break. Our table had spent nearly $400 in total on this dinner. A real restaurant would have asked us if we wanted the check split before printing it out.

As for the food, my wife and I both ordered the filet. I thought it was average and she thought it was slightly below average. My advice: check out the observation deck (free for hotel guests) but skip dinner here. It's nothing special.

After dinner, we headed over to the Bellagio to gamble and drink for the remainder of the evening and early morning. We returned to the Stratosphere at approximately 4am. From the front door, we had to walk the length of the casino to get to the north elevators. We had dressed up for the night. I was in a suit and my wife was wearing a classy, shorter cut dress. As we passed through the poker room, there was only one game going on which wasn't surprising given the hour. As we passed this table, I immediately began hearing heckling aimed at my wife coming from the approximately seven men playing at this table. The phrase that sticks out in mind is "she's gonna take it tonight." Of course, it's also hard to forget the sexual grunting and moaning sounds that we were also treated to. As I looked back at the table, they began to actually mock me with chants of "oh look, he's getting mad now!" What upsets me more than these comments themselves was that neither the dealer or the poker floor manager who was standing nearby said a word to the players. I doubt that this heckling technically broke any hotel or casino rules, but they certainly broke the rules of common decency. I own a business and if I learned that two of my employees sat idly and let this go on without saying a word, I would have been furious and the employees would have been reprimanded and\/or fired on the spot. It was so disrespectful to us as customers and to my wife as a woman that neither employee had the guts to say "calm down guys" or "those type of comments aren't appreciated here".

When we got back to the room, I called the front desk and they transferred me over to the poker floor manager who we had previously walked by. After telling him what we had happened, he told me there were two poker games going on and that I would have to give him a description of the dealer so he could determine which was the problem table. This was an outright lie. There was only one game going on. I decided that was enough on the phone and walked down to the front desk. Here I was, a paying hotel guest who had also spent over $200 at dinner in the hotel earlier in the night, standing at the front desk at 4:30am. I spent about 20 minutes talking with the night manager who "would be just as upset" if he was in my position but "men will be men especially in Vegas". In the end, I wound up with free breakfast and a late checkout.

For what it's worth, the breakfast sucked. My stomach didn't feel right for the entire rest of our trip. The moral of the story: you get what you pay for! We'll never step foot in this place again.

We visit Vegas regularly and have stayed at the Strat 4 times. We will not be staying again. The hotel has really gone downhill the last 2 times. Customer service is poor. Our friends also stayed ( on our recommendation ) and called ahead to confirm a late check in with a specific bed size and a smoking room. When they arrived they got a room with 2 small beds in a non smoking room. the management didn't even fix that until i went down and made a fuss! My other friend checked in and the room was not even clean. There was urine in the toilet and toothpaste in the sink.
The casino doesn't vent very well and tend to be smokier than most of the newer casinos. It is impossible to get a drink while at a machine ( I totally recommend Planet Hollywood for this) and we won more money at the airport machines than in this place. Good bye Strat!

The hotel is dark and dumpy while the food and drink options are slim pickings, but that isn't really why anyone goes here - is it?  Free January trips to the top for locals is pretty much all you need to know and with excellent views and a light crowd I'd recommend everyone do it at least once - touristy for sure, but far cheaper (and taller, and less of a hassle) than the Seattle Space Needle or the St. Louis Arch.

Not the best hotel can be a little boring the crowd is a little dull they don't give you any perks customer service is fair but let me tell you one thing that Michael Jackson show ((MJ LIVE)in there is out of this world I mean it was like I was at  a live Michael Jackson concert that guy was absolutely amazing the rotating restaurant and the roller coaster rides were also nice step up your game on the rooms& Club Scene& you may get a Much  better and bigger Turn Out.....

Nice enough casino, not the greatest location with the heart of the strip and downtown far away and a seedy neighbourhood just steps north.  The real draw to this place is the tower with a great Lounge on the 107th floor, with a 360 degree rotating restaurant right below it.  Entrance to the tower is free if you're going to the lounge or restaurant and Lounge has a decent happy hour from 4pm to 7pm, both have the most spectacular view in all of Las Vegas.  Full view of strip, mountains & airport (planes are actually climbing out a little below you).  Above the restaurant\/Lounge you've got some of the craziest thrill rides you'll ever find.  Definitely worth a visit!

Leider musste der Starbucks oben auf dem Tower weichen. Evtl. zu Gunsten eines weiteren "Fahrgeschäftes".


 Der Starbucks auf dem Casino-Level existiert aber noch.
Ein Starbucks wie jeder andere in den Staaten. Hier jedoch erschien mir das Personal etwas pfiffiger als in vielen anderen Starbucksfilialen. Und leider kann man bei der Kaffeezubereitung doch Fehler begehen. Diesbezüglich durfte ich erhebliche Qualitätsunterschiede in den USA feststellen.
Bei meinem heutigen Besuch gab es an der Kaffeezubereitung in diesem Store nichts zu bemängeln.

Decent hotel, best price I could find on the strip, clean rooms, good view... but I should have listened to the warnings in other reviews about the location. It's a little farther from the other casinos, and the space in between it and the SLS was pretty ghetto, crazy people (even more than normal for vegas, people trying to sell us meth etc) and the monorail stops at SLS and not any further, although we are young and healthy, when in high heels it sucks to walk any extra. If the monorail ran here I would give it 4 stars. LOVE the Rollercoasters!

My friends and I stayed here a few nights. 

The rooms are ok (clean and neat). As for the casino itself.... kinda sad. It just has an off vibe. Very not cool. Another drawback is that it's in the shadier part of town, so it's a longer commute to the other casinos. 

About the best thing about this casino is that they sell delicious $1 tacos not far from it (don't ask me where. I was... inebriated at the time). 

The reason we stayed here was because we wanted to experience the rides on top of it. FYI - they charge extra just to get you to the top and then again for the rides. Not worth the cost (for me).

Overall, the hotel was not bad. but I am not sure if I would stay there again, even with cheap accommodations.
