This place has a fee for everything.  60 dollars for a resort fee, 10 dollars if you want to check into your room early, bull crap like that! There was 1 waitress and 1 bartender at the pool that were nice and the rest were rude and grouchy!  I never want to stay here again!!!!!

Where is the zero star option? I arrived after a red eye flight last evening around 12:45 am, the line wasn't too long but I was not helped until 1:30 am. 45 minutes to check into a hotel is mildly ridiculous. I was traveling alone and tried to eat at the 24\/7 diner, the place had very few people eating and I was told it would be a fifteen minute wait for one, so naturally I just headed to McDonald's instead of waiting for no reason. The main reason for the review (in case the 45 minutes to check in wasn't enough) was the cleanliness of the room. Now I travel on a regular basis, I've stayed in hostels, motels, days inn, Hiltons, and five star hotels (a whole array of hoteling) but never have I seen such an unclean room. The lamps were gross and dirty, the phone was disgusting as pictured, but the winner was the bathroom. The pictures attached do not do the filth justice. Black hairs EVERYWHERE (for the record I'm platinum blonde), clumps, pieces all over the floor, counters, tub, no way would I ever walk back into that room barefoot. The whole experience was terribly disturbing.

WORSE experienced ever! This was our third time coming to Stratosphere and this time it was the worst. We booked our reservation two months before and paid over $300 for a two night stay.  when we got to the location they gave us a really nasty, dirty room. The tub had black rings around it, the walls were dirty, the shower tub does not drain, and The drain on the sink was dirty. We complained to management and they would not change our room because they said they were no rooms left. Anyway it was NASTY! Nasty! Nasty! I compare this place to hotel inn !
Best place to stay in Vegas strip with convincing budget!! Great advantage of having super fun activities and casino and specially top of the world restaurant!!! Must visit and stay!!

Pool is closed, not allowed to charge a cell phone on casino level, place is a dump. Everything needs to be updated. Not a very clean resort and casino. I won $400 so that was the only positive experience. I recommend Mandalay Bay. Good luck in Vegas.

We enjoyed staying here. The rooms were nice and the food was great. However, at night I would not recommend walking the strip in that area. It's not a very good area. The hotel is also considered "downtown" if you're taking a shuttle. So it's extra cost despite it being on the strip. Showtime shuttle said it's closer to downtown that's why the rate is higher. Due to the area at night, we will not stay there again.

A true 3 star.  Now that I'm a little older ( I said a little) or shall I say a year older hahaha... I prefer to stay at a hotel that is not soooo crowded and congested.  I haven't stayed here in a long time so I figure its affordable and I don't recall any bad experiences from my last stay.  Honestly, I think it was well over 5 years since I had been here.

Anyway, I wasn't expecting much from this place as far as aesthetic.  I am usually a normal resident of the Monte Carlo and Mandalay Bay everytime I visit Vegas which is at least 3 times a year.

The staff, including our housekeeping lady, bell man, and valet staff were all extremely courteous and helpful.  I was so impressed with their service that I think this is the most I had tipped a staff. Ever.

Anyway, like I said its a 3 star hotel.  The only thing that really was disappointing was the distance we had to walk from valet to the hotel lobby.  And from the hotel lobby to the hotel elevators.  There's a reason why its valet, right?  I might not come back here to stay for awhile just because of that.  Especially when you are battling over 100 degree temperature outside even in the evening... I was not a happy camper having to walk that far everytime I leave and come back:\/

It was a great stay for the price. We wanted to stay close to the strip but not right on it. We also didn't want to pay a arm and 2 toes to stay at the big boys! We arrived on a Saturday, the check in was a breeze, the desk manager was super helpful and accommodated my request to put my 2 rooms side by side and on the pool floor.

It's crazy how people trip out (negatively) on this place, do some research before you stay.

Yelpers :) 
Stratosohere es un hotel ubicado en las vegas, Nevada. En donde sin duda alguna puedes pasar unas ricas vacaciones. Cuentan con cafeterias las cuales tienen diferentes menús y con diferente decoración. 
Asi mismo cuentan con un casino en la parte de abajo en el cual hosters o no pueden jugar ahi. 

Si te hospedas ahí tienes las atracciones que este hotel cuenta, las cuales son el mirador en donde podras observar las vegas, la cual es una vista impresionante. A un precio menor o algunas ya estan incluidas, y sino eres hoster puedes acceder a ellas pagando por ellas. Vale la pena intentarlas. !!! 
Asi como la zona de juegos mecanicos con la cual cuenta. 
Asi mismo tienen una disco y una sala de espectaculos super, en la cual encontraras desde conciertos hasta espectáculos extremos. 
Asi mismo cuentan con un gimnasio para que puedas hacer el jercicio del dia y estar en forma para disfrutar las vegas by night. 
Finalmente tienen albercas al aire libre donse seguro tomaras el sol como nadie y además veras todas las vegas!!!

Great hotel, great value"

The Magnificent Views, Awesome Thrill Rides, Friendly, Accommodating Staff!
Stayed here 3 times (Year 2014, 2015) Nice, comfy, executive kind room 
and I always had a Great Experience.

Benefits of Staying At Stratosphere:

Free Unlimited Tower Admission
Free Radius Pool, and 8th floor Jacuzzi pool Admission 
Buy 1 get 1 Free Thrill Rides for $36
Free 24hr Gym with large selection of equipment 
Starbucks, McDonald and Nice Taco restaurant inside.
Free Hassle free Luggage Storage.
I also Like Comfy Chairs at waiting place near the entrance of hotel!

Had only 1 unpleasant experience here, I was doing internet surfing half naked on my bed,
a man staff came into my room at noon yelled at me he thought I didn't pay that night.
Please always double check next time and be more considerate...

It's a perfectly nice hotel but in a really seedy part of town. Certainly not a neighborhood you'd go out in at night! The Top of the World restaurant was amazing and the Diner is good too. There's not a lot of casino action in the way of poker games but slots galore. The gentleman who checked us in was super friendly and helpful (I think maybe his name was Les), but ultimately if you plan on spending any time on the real Strip expect a $20 cab fare for each trip. It wasn't worth what we "saved" on the room just because of the cabs.

We spent 4 nights here in September. Room was clean, and they did clean it every day as well. Room service was nice, not too pricey, but pricey, on the other hand...what would you expect for room service? Food was good though and the staff was nice. Restaurants inside the hotel were great. Main bar in the casino had slow service at prime times. Side bar near the select elevators had a great bartender and wasn't as busy. Check in line was long, but express check out was very easy. Will stay again.

I remember this hotel when I came to Vegas with my papa them when I was 12. Didn't go in it then but did in our trip here. 
Awesome self parking connected to the hotel. (not a mile walk) 
Cool, old school feel walking around the Stratosphere. Lot of cheap minimum bet gambling tables which was perfect for a first time gambler. Their dealers at the blackjack table so so funny and inviting. Not like those foreign, grumpy ones at the higher class hotels. 
Would have been 5 stars if they didn't charge to go up to the tower. I can't complain, the view was phenomenal. I ain't afraid of heights but would have been cooler at night to see all the lights on the Strip.
Visited Aug 2011

TERRIBLE.  Just got back.  The deluxe rooms as dirty, outdated, horrible.  I got bug bites two nights in a row.  Not sure if it was bed bugs I look but saw no evidence of it. My arm swelled up from the elbow to the arm pit.  They simple moved me to a new room on the SAME floor after taking pictures of my hand and arm.

Do not go there!!!!!

They charge you a resort fee and then you have to pay to use a computer to print off boarding passes.

My husband and I came here in July for one night (a Monday night) at this hotel.  We had never stayed at Stratosphere before, but we were already on that end of the Strip, so we decided to chance it for a night for $30.  We wanted to check in before noon, but that wasn't happening unless we paid $20 extra.  No thanks.  I was able to pay and do all of the paperwork, but they were not going to give us the key to our room unless we paid that $20.  We checked our bags and off we went to grab lunch.

After 3pm (normal check in time), I had to stand in line again, just to get my room key and officially check in (even though at noon, I had done all the paperwork and paid).  Seemed a little silly to me, but whatever.  The line was long and not moving very fast.  I noticed while in line that there were a lot of families at this hotel.

Got checked in, got a basic room w\/ a king sized bed.  Definitely nothing fancy.  

Check out was just as bad as check in (at 730 in the morning!).  Long line, one worker.  It took FOREVER.  

The casino was fine, it kept me busy for a while.  The shops seemed empty and the workers seemed bored.  Not a lot of foot traffic for a Monday.

With our room reservation, we were able to visit the observation deck for free. That was nice.  Standing in another LONG line to get up to the observation deck was not so nice.  But once we got up there, it was cool.  Enough room to roam around, great views, and rides if you dared (we didn't).  We did notice a lot of kids.

It was fine for a night, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Now I usually have nothing but great things to say about stratosphere which is why this is the only place I usually stay when I visit Vegas. I could write a full page detailing my experience this go around with the stratosphere but instead I'll give the short version. First I will say there were some great staff members here but many of them we ran across were just rude and unprofessional. Messed up reservations, then trying to charge us more than triple, moved us to a filthy room the second day, locked us out then got snappy when we asked to be let in and get new keys. Table supervisor was so rude, after all the problems we've experienced I simply picked up my money and left. I will not be returning nor will this hotel see another dime of my money.

The room was fine, and you do get free rides up to the Stratosphere though I never went.  It did smell like smoke, but hello, every single hotel and casino I went into smelled like smoke along with the majority of the city.  You are in Las Vegas, the whole city is dirty!  The only downside is that it is a bit far from the attractions.  Although we were walking, I honestly did not mind the extra bit of length since it prevented me from gaining a ton of weight while I was on vacation.  And there is a bus you can take and it is dirt cheap so don't be cheap and complain how far away it is from everything.  Overall, I would certainly stay there again, but that is unlikely as I don't think I would ever return to Las Vegas.

Very slow check-in process, hotel is a bit run down but prices can be low even on holiday weekends. The beds are comfy enough and rooms are clean. The casino is low key. The location is convenient to downtown. There is a Starbucks in the hotel. Staying here you get free wifi and access to the observation tower which has phenomenal views.
Did not stay here, we were planning on eating at the top, but it was such a dirty, disgusting rathole I lost my appetite.

Don't book there.
There is an hidden "resort fee" of about $20 a day.
You have to pay at on the spot or only with a fax with your credit card info.
It took me more then 3 hours with over 10 phone calls to get that fax from the hotel reservation desk.
It is a nightmare.
The hotel was $35 a night and then it changed to $60 with the resort fee.

1st night here and no house keeping. Left the room since before noon with service requested on the door but came back at 4pm and still no service. Left again and returned at 11pm and room still no house keeping. Wow what service...

Sorry to say but this hotel has gone downhill since we stayed here 2yrs ago. Maybe the management has changed or doesn't care?
At check in we were asked if we'd like an "upgrade" of course they wanted $20 a night more but. We said sure. 
Well it actually seems like a downgrade to us. The room vents are dirty, the carpet has dirt around all the edges, furniture is all scratched up, tile in bath coming off, sink doesn't drain and too much more to mention. 
Needless to say we're extremely disappointed and definitely won't stay here or recommend this place to friends. 
Oh yeah we paid $25+ resort fee and the wi-fi isn't even secure? 
You'll get a better room and service at Motel 6
DON'T STAY HERE!!
Fabulous seafood, great service- attentive and friendly, and a phenomenal view.  We will return on our next trip to Fabulous Las Vegas!

With a night nearby Vegas we decided to have  a little fun and ended up making a prepaid reservation at the Stratosphere for the one night. We arrived later in the evening and were told our reservation for a king room would not happen and they only had queen\/double rooms, nothing with a view and nothing could be done.

The room itself had a failed air conditioner which did not work even after maintenance was there, 2 outlets that are not secured all the way in the wall, a vent in the bathroom falling off and a bathroom door that we could not close or we would be stuck in there because the handle just spun. When we did shower, the towels smelled as if the dryer had caught fire while drying them.

...and no smoking floors SHOULD NOT STINK OF SMOKE. Heck, maybe get rid of the ashtray by the elevator, people may get the hint.

As for the appearance of the room, I was dumbstruck how this makes a 3 star rating. I can only think of one hotel in my adult life I was more disturbed by the cleanliness and the 'happy nap' feel to it... and the other hotel offered 'happy nap' rates.

Can somebody tell me WTF is up with the ironing board? The damn iron was attached to the board by a cable and the base was mounted ON TOP of the board, making 1\/2 the board useless. I am pretty sure prisons have irons that aren't chained to anything, but Stratosphere does. I guess when you are down on your luck and pissed you are staying in a room like this you will try to pawn anything including their irons.

After this first hour in Vegas, we decided to head out of the hotel and spend any money that weekend elsewhere. This hotel is 4 blocks away from anything you would want to give a crap about in Vegas. Seriously, Sahara was closed and nothing for blocks. If it wasn't prepaid, we would have taken our stuff and left. Instead, we had fun elsewhere.

Tip for those at the Stratosphere, we don't need the signs every 30 FT telling us abou the brand new rooms you have... if we can't stay in them, that only makes the experience less appealing.

... I'm only 5'5".

For the bartender to hear me over the din of noise and ruckus, I had to lean up and over the bar a bit.  That's when she made her move.  She was an attractive and curvaceous woman, maybe 5-6 years my senior at most, a half-drank Cosmo(?) in one hand... the other hand... firmly posited upon my derriere.

"Oh, hi... "  I squeak, a bit taken aback.
"Hey there... " she singsongs.
"... eh, you having a good time?" I query.
"mmmmmHmmmmm... I always do... you?"
"..oh yeah, yeah..."

After some conversation and flirty banter, the bartender, either oblivious or desensitized to such comedy, brings my drinks over and gives me the tab.

"Let me get those for you, Hon..." she offered, gesturing to the bartender to put it on her tab.
"Oh, no, thank you I'll..."
"My treat" she protests. 
Pressed against me she says, "Come find me in a little bit, okay?" as she takes one last chance to let her hand wander.

I never did see her again that night.  Perhaps she had caught some new prey...
She treated me like so much meat.
I felt cheap.
I felt dirty.

I kinda really sorta liked it... =)

________________________________
Oh, the actual hotel and casino?  For the SUPER CHEAP RATES you can get on southwestvacations.com, its really not that bad, if you don't mind staying way off at the end of the strip.  Don't let the fact that you can SEE it fool you, its friggin' far!  Cab fares will eat your budget up...

The 7th floor saltwater pool is really awesome though.  I highly recommend laying out up there, if you stay at this hotel.  Nevermind the topless pool on the 21st(?) floor, its kinda *meh*.

Poly Esther's Nightclub here APPEARS to be a jumpin place, if a bit gimmicky and un-Vegas-y in regards to chic and hype.

There are at least two really good cover bands that play at the casino\/stage\/bar towards the back that kept me entertained as SE tore through a Hold'em tourney (never underestimate the pretty girl, she's a shark...!)

My encounter with Lady McGrab-@ss happened at the main bar in the middle of the casino.

... ah, Vegas, where "hey, i never get picked up on at home" happens.

It is crazy high and great fear to taste :) I don't like to be away from ground and it was awesome experience :) Inly one thing bothered me that 48 " can ride some of those crazy ones :O my 6 years old wanted to do one if those ride I freaked :)

I didn't think the stratosphere was terrible. Granted, it was a little ways from the strip, but we had a rental car so it was fine. 
I didn't have much of a view from my floor (18th) but for the price I paid I wasn't to upset about it. 
I actually slept through the night surprisingly because last time I was in Vegas 7 months ago we stayed in the Hard Rock. I was up all night because the people next door were partying. 
The hallway always seemed to have slight smell of vomit. 
The beds were decently comfortable. 
The guy who brought up our bags seemed to be fishing for a tip. I would've given him one of I carried any cash. 
Unfortunately my stay got cut short due to some unforeseen circumstances. 
I went downstairs and gambled for a while. I think I won a whole 40 cents. I don't really gamble or know how to for that matter!
I would recommend the stratosphere to anyone that is in need of a decent hotel for a decent price.

If there was any such thing as a "budget" Vegas trip - this is where you should stay.  Our stay was $99\/night and included 2 show tickets.  Granted, the show (American Superstars) was retarded... but a show is a show.

It's on the strip, but isolated on one side - so if you are going to Vegas for action, you'll have to cab it around to get where you need to go.  Cabbing it kind of sucks, and you'll probably spend just as much on cab rides as you saved on the room.  

BUT, if you are coming just for gambling, then this is a great spot.  The casino is pretty big and fully stocked with all the tables and machines you would be looking for.  It's not crowded, and doesn't have the high minimums like the posh hotels towards the middle of the strip.  Even on Saturday Nights, there were $5 blackjack tables, and usually 1-2 seats open.  It also had a really good mix of people there, so playing the tables was always fun.

The rooms were basic - nothing fancy, but if you were expecting more from a $99 room in Las Vegas...

Located on the farther end of the strip the Stratosphere offers all the amenities you need without the center of Vegas prices. 

I'm a fan of the roof top pool with gorgeous mountain views and the renovations they're doing to the place with surely help to bring the cost effective crowds down from the center of the strip. 

If you're in Vegas an want to spend more on the tables and shows than a bed you may not sleep in, stay here, just grab the Deuce to get to the action.
Went to a wedding here and the view was spectacular. The food was ok, but it was about having a good time. Walking through the casino itself I was unimpressed.

We stayed here for a night on the way back to Reno from the Grand Canyon. Perfect pit stop. Excellent value for the price $39\/night plus $24\/night resort fee. Our room was spacious, clean, and we were up high enough for a moderately nice view. 

The Negatives:
Parking garage is adequate but not great. Parking in the garage is free. They do offer valet for those who can afford it. In terms of safety with children, I felt much better having brought both my tazer and my mace. We were able to get to our car and back as needed without incident, but be careful with kids: it's not well lit and people drive scary in there. It's located in a pretty sketchy part north of the strip, but I like a good value, sometimes to the point of absurdity.

The casino is nice, but the people who frequent the casino are "characters." Keep your kids close to you. Hold hands. I don't play in the casino, but in order to get to the reservation desk, or to your room, you gotta walk through parts of it. My kids are pretty sheltered, so just walking to the reservation desk was an adventure for them. They LOVED that. Like sitting too close to a bonfire. *sigh*

The Positives:
Here's what made me very happy about the Stratosphere. First, as a hotel guest, you get free admission to the observation deck (with 3 kids along, this saves me a fortune). Also as a hotel guest, 2-for-1 day passes for the thrill rides. My kids had a blast! In terms of thrill, it's an 11 on a 1-10 scale those rides are beyond scary. My two teenagers rode until midnight, and my little one (aged 7) stayed with me (we are afraid of heights) and just took in breathtaking views of Las Vegas. It's very high up. 104 floors up; you get the same kind of views of all of Vegas as you do views of Chicago from the 94th floor observation deck of John Hancock Center. Incredible! There is also a very talented caricature artist who drew us at a reasonable price (I found a coupon online cartoonvegas.com). See my photos for the caricature of us. In it, the artist makes fun of my high cheekbones, but did it in a way that didn't piss me off. She also gave me long eyelashes, which I appreciate, because I am mostly Asian and I probably have none.

Anyhow, one thing that was a pleasant surprise is the amount of yummy food you can get at the observation deck snack bar. I fed four of us dinner for $20! We had a $5 baked potato the size of a minivan (now that I think about it, it was probably slightly bigger) with ALL the fixings imaginable! They have a loaded bar of toppings (bacon bits, cheese, chives, dressings, etc. think generous salad bar without the lettuce). Not all you can eat, but all you can fit on your potato. We also got a giant clam chowder bowl ($5) and all the toppings you can fit on that. The cashier took care of us and gave 4 free clear water cups. Plus tax, the bill was less than $13, so we paid with a $20 and tipped the remainder. I feel like they lost money on us. That's always a good feeling.

The staff is helpful and friendly, and the customer service is very good. We will book here again.

I've stayed here a bunch of times because the price is good and the traffic around the area isn't bad. One of my favorite things about this place is that the Premiere rooms and better have flat screen tvs which I can hook up my laptop to. We enjoy the gambling, fat tuesday, and fellinis, however after a couple trips we got a little tired of the same routine. We now stay closer to the middle of the strip(usually monte carlo) but still visit the stratosphere for fellini's. I've been to Top of the World twice, I would not recommend it at all. The prices are inflated and even if you put that aside, the experience isn't that great. It feels a little snobby and stuffy when there with other diners who come off as trashy. This may just be from the dumb lady who kept walking over to stand right in front of us so that we could see her fat ass while she was snapping pictures of the view. UH-hello we paid for the view too, not to see your ass! Otherwise the rooms are good and there are some decent attractions. They have a nude vampire show, Bite, which was pretty boring. Basically just paying to see a bunch of acrobatic people get topless. The back alley bar also seemed like it had potential but every time we walked by it was completely empty. Stratosphere is good once or twice to stay at and then I would recommend seeing what else Vegas has to offer.

So the Stratosphere was where we ended up our last night in Vegas.  Before then, my dad had been footing our hotel bill, and we'd slept in luxury.  After he left, we had to fend for ourselves, and found an outrageously good deal on a one night stay at Stratosphere. So we took the cab right all the way to the end of the Strip, and hoped for the best.

While it definitely isn't as fancy as most of the Strip, it was definitely worth what you paid for.  The rooms were reasonably sized and reasonably clean.  We weren't aware that nonsmoking rooms cost more, so we got stuck in a smoking room, which sucks because my husband is allergic, but when we got up there, it didn't smell like smoke, which was a pleasant surprise, because our hallway was disgustingly cigarette-smelling.

Restaurants were better than I expected, and while you can definitely tell a difference in clientle and entertainment, it was fine.  No problem for a eight hour stay.

One of the cheaper hotels on the north end of the strip that has a high observation deck and rides. My boyfriend and I had to book a room at the last minute on a Saturday night and the Stratosphere had the most reasonable price.  When we checked in they gave us a free upgrade with a jacuzzi in our room and was very spacious.  My boyfriend had done a Spartan run that day so it was exactly what we needed. The rom decor felt a little generic, but we were so happy to get an upgrade.  The only downside to staying at this hotel is that it's so far away from the rest of the strip.

The observation tower and stores at the top were very neat to look out at. There is a "free fall" bungee jump that you can watch from the top that's very entertaining.

I arrived on a Friday night\/Saturday morning in January around 1AM and it was busy, but there was a lot of staff on hand. Valet guys were fast and courteous, and hotel registration had 5+ people helping guests check in. When I informed valet that I would be leaving in 3hrs, they kept my car out front instead of taking it away. It made it easier and faster for me to retrieve my car later.

I stood in line at about 1:05AM & was checked in by 1:20AM. I was helped by Rachel Anne and she was exceptional. She was very informative and accommodating. I requested a room with 2 beds if possible, and she informed me that all the king bed rooms were taken anyway, so the only option was a room with 2 beds. She offered me a complimentary upgrade to one of the newly renovated rooms. I was grateful, but skeptical at the same time because I had read recent reviews that stated the newly renovated rooms were not good, smaller, and the smell of paint was very fresh and too strong. Regardless, I accepted her offer. I inquired about the observation deck. Even though it was 1:20am and the deck closes at 2am, Rachel Anne ensured that we would make it in time. She informed us about the location of our hotel room elevator as well as the escalator leading to the observation deck. The cost for hotel guests to go up to the observation deck is $5 per person, and up to 2 people per room key. Rachel Anne made the start of our stay very enjoyable, especially since we were tired from being stuck in traffic & arriving so late. She goes above and beyond.

When I arrived at the room, there was a light smell of paint, but not too bad. Everything else was good. The room does seem to have been renovated. Our view was of the parking structure so we always kept our curtains closed as we don't want peeping Toms from across the way. The only complaint I have is bad lighting. There is no light in the center of the room, only 2 lamps, one on the nightstand and one on the working desk. Aside from that, our overall stay was better than I expected.

With all the bad reviews I've read, I wasn't expecting much besides a decent room to stay in since it was only going to be for a couple of hours. I was only passing through on a road trip, so I didn't feel the need to stay somewhere closer to the center strip. I also wanted to stay here because of the discount to the observation deck. If you stay here, going to the deck is worth it! A month ago, I would have never given Stratosphere a second thought; I would avoid it at all costs. Now, I'm glad I gave it a chance because it was a great stay!
Easy check in, room service excellent, cleaners were prompt and affordable. Shoe shiner was awesome! Room is clean and modern. Overall stay Excellent!

We came here on a weekend and we were surprised it was not packed. We like their lounge and the fact that there is no admission fee. However,their drinks are a little bit pricey but everywhere else is anyway! So we recommend this for those who would like to see the whole strip while enjoying a drink or dining an elegant meal.

Hadn't been to the Stratosphere in a while, but it hasn't changed much since my last visit. The upgrades to the rooms and hallways seem to have held up for the past few years and what was remodeled, still looks pretty new. Also love the fact that it doesn't smell too much like cigarette smoke like some other casinos.
The room and hotel are clean BUT no free wifi, parking lot sucks because my car got hit, drinks are watered down and view sucks from hotel rooms. Won't be staying here again.

My go-to hotel in Vegas. Not on the Strip and the hustle bustle. I feel comfy here gambling and hanging out. 

I took a 2-day get-away. Quick check in, updated room, clean surroundings, good, attentive staff, except that one smart allic parking valet. I would have gotten his name, but he walked away quickly after being rude. He made me take an extra loop around the whole parking lot and not park in a spot that was directly to my right, with cars stacked up and partially blocking the valet lane. He said that I had to drive under a certain spot to get seen in the camera so that I could be safe, blah blah. Not sure how true that is. 

I have came here for over 5-years and chose to ignore that 1 tool. LOL
Keep doing a great job Stratosphere Hotel.

I expected this hotel to be old and run down, but was very surprised.  Clean and rooms looked good !   With the staff we did deal with was very nice and helpful.  We had a small problem with our TV, the remote was not operating the TV.  The desk sent someone with a new remote five minutes later (this was around 8pm at night). It did not work so he stated a tech would be sent out.  The next afternoon as we were leaving our room we advised the housekeeping and by the time we returned to our room it was all working.  Loved the fact that the public transit (RTC) was right by the hotel.  A Starbucks is located in the hotel, a big plus!  The hotel bar offers all you can drink between the hours of 6pm-10pm for $20.  The restaurant in the hotel (the roxy) was good food for breakfast.  It seemed a little expensive , but everything in Vegas is.  The only issue we had was that we stayed on the 8th floor and that's where all of the traffic to the pool was, so we had kids running down the hall.

My friend stayed here and was attacked in the parking garage. This hotel never even returned her calls to offer any assistance. Thank goodness the emergency room staff was helpful and local sherif dept also. Location of this hotel is in a very seedy part of Vegas & after talking to people about this incident it seems like it has happened many times before. Visitors beware!

We ended up staying here after our horrible experience at South Point, the price difference was only around sixty dollars, not too bad for a hotel\/casino that's on the Strip (like 1 mile or 2 away from the Strip).

Just a tip, it's highly recommended you take a cab or car with you. It's all free parking at all the parking garages anyways, the only downside is the traffic you'll get at night (thanks to your local drunkies, bad drivers, and pedestrians). Unless you want to be in total pain the next day cause you're walking in heels from one side of the Strip to the other, don't try walking, cause you'll be limping the next day.

The shower water smells like bleach and I had to make an effort to get into the shower cause they thought it would be funny to raise the tub a couple inches above the ground. Short Asian girl + raised tub = lulz for boyfriend. Bring your own toiletries, the ones they supply are not to great, something about being eco-friendly, so I guess you have to give them some credit for that. 

Don't bring your laptop to facebook it up, cause the internet here costs money, and that's money that you can spend losing to the dealer at Blackjack (which was not me, by the way).

Do not stay here!!! Worst hotel experience ever and since we booked online we cannot cancel it. Bathtub looks like a scene from CSI. The room we booked online wasn't available when we got here. They gave us a room without a bathtub which was a handicap accessible room, when we complained they "upgraded" our room and gave us a tub. Unfortunately our tub looked like it had been used in an episode of CSI. We spoke with manager who sent housekeeping to clean it. The maid politely informed us she didn't know what the stain was and didn't know how to get it out. We once again spoke to a manager our only choice was to pay for an upgrade to have a clean working tub. The only problem with that is the tub doesn't work. It doesn't close so it constantly drains. (Great upgrade right!) Now that we in our wonderfully upgraded room that has paper thin walls we are now jamming to trap music with our neighbors ALL NIGHT. I love Fetty as much as the next man but even trap queens need rest. But even our security and managers love this because in order for us to change rooms again guess what? We must again pay. My honest advice avoid this hotel at all costs. It is absolutely horrible and the management staff is completely incompetent. You would do better staying at one of the 1 star hotels at least then you know what your getting.
We've had a great stay here, its been great dining, fun gambling and rides and not a far walk to the heart of the strip. Its clean and all the customer service has been great.

I've been to the restaurant atop this place many many times, but before this last weekend I've never stayed here. Now that has changed, and I did not regret my choice.
I booked a deluxe room online a few weeks back. Two of my buddies and I were staying in one room, and I wanted to have more space and luxury. So I upgraded to the suite. The room itself was awesome, sporting a hot tub, a spacious bathroom will all the amenities I needed, a king size bed, a couch, and a good view of the strip. It was a comfortable room, and provided possibilities for whatever can happen in Vegas.
The one thing I didn't like about this place is that they didn't allow a checkout extension. So I got back to the room at 5am, and had to sacrifice sleep to be out in time. I was willing to pay more for a few extra hours, but the front desk denied this request. Ultimately, I got 1 hour of sleep because my crew wanted to eat at a good breakfast place that got busy fast. So I'm not docking any stars because I was going to be sleep-deprived anyway. Fellow yelpers, this paragraph is just an FYI.

I'd say give this place a shot, but make sure to stay more than one night, or get back to the room in time to get a good amount of sleep. Take it from me, driving 5 hours to LA on 1 hour of sleep is not fun.

Basically:
 - it's cheap and you can cram 5 girls into a double room.
 - the pool is pretty basic but comfortable
 - Yeah cabs are expensive but the monorail is a block away.

You want Vegas on the cheap?  Stay here.  It's TOTALLY worth it.  You want Vegas on the strip?  Don't stay here.

This was my first time here. Same day reservation the price was good $75 after tax. We had a single king bed the room was roomy. Very clean and comfy! Upon check in the lady asked how long we were here in Vegas upon hearing how good the Luxor was to us she gave us 7 2for1 drinks. Slot servers were fast and super friendly. Love this casino we will be back.

Decent hotel to stay for a couple of nights. Rates are good. Went to their buffet for breakfast...ehhh just mediocre, gets the job done. The location- it is at the very beginning of the strip so be prepared with your walking shoes to get to middle of the strip or take a taxi. We stayed for 2 nights and took a taxi for a total of 4 times (15 bucks each way) probably could have used our taxi money and stayed at a hotel in the middle of the strip but that's okay we had a good time! If you book a room here you get unlimited trips to the tower that has a gorgeous view of the city!

Disgusting, never again will we return here for a hotel stay. The bathrooms have mold and rust growing on the walls and shower heads, the vanity counter space is hardly enough for one person, the carpets are filthy with black stains, and room service never came to clean our room. 

The worst part was we reserved a King room online. When we arrived, we were given a Double Queen. The front desk said reservations only hold a room, but do not guarantee you'll get the room you want. RIDICULOUS! 

You're far better off paying more for a different hotel than coming to this place. Never again...

I swear I will never stay in this f****** hotel again. 
So they received a complaint about our tv being too loud at 3 o'clock in the morning and while we was asleep. 
So we get up and go to the door and all of a sudden the door starts opening. So I run to the door and slam it back. And then I ask who is it? The guy says security..
SO WHAT GIVES THEM THE RIGHT TO COME STRAIGHT IN YOUR ROOM LIKE THAT? Remind you I'm half sleep still!! My thing is that they could have call the hotel phone first and told us that our tv was too loud. And then if we didn't answer come up here and knock at least 10 different times then ok just come in! 
NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY AT THIS PLACE!! 
O did I mention I had the DO NOT DISTURB SIGN ON THE DOOR

This place should have a minus star if it could be possible.

Where do I begin? The rude valet who would not even help us get a cart for our baggage? The supposed upgrade room that turned out to be the room I thought I booked since it was the one shown on the website? The awful waitress service on the casino floor? The machines where you can't win even a dime? The RUDE service from the wait staff at their supposed high class restaurant, that we walked out on before even ordering.... The housekeeping that never came to clean our room, then when we called we were put on hold for 20 minutes. When we left and came back again at 8:00 pm the room was still not done, the maid was barely starting to clean and would not let us in the room. So we left AGAIN.... We came back to find out....

SHE DID NOT EVEN CLEAN EVERYTHING!!!!!!!

When leaving we requested a cart. JUST A CART. The bellhop insisted on helping, even after I said it was not necessary then told me I HAD to tip him. He would not let us unload our stuff until after I did. 

We would have been better off staying at a cheap motel closer to the strip. Take back Vegas? Vegas wants YOU to go away you shitty, over-priced MOTEL.

I went to Vegas for the first time about a week ago. I stayed here because it is more reasonably priced but you do get what you pay for. 

Pros: Radius Pool & Bar (No kids allowed plus an amazing view), the Italian restaurant had delicious food, and 107 Lounge with the amazing view and wonderful 2 for 1 drink specials.

Cons: Out - dated basic room,  was upgraded to a room with a "view" of the strip with an even greater obstructing view of the back of the tower at the Stratosphere, shower head that barely ran water and a chipped and eroded water facet, buffet with limited choices, room was barely cleaned, and unfriendly dealers.

The room served it's purpose but I don't think that I'd be staying here again. Without the pros, the hotel would have received a 2.

I have stayed here for at least 5 times already. 
The first time I stayed here with 5 friends and we booked a suite, which did not look like a suite with me. It was just a little bit bigger than standard room and had a sofa bed in addition to the 2 queen beds. Plus, the room looked really old. 
The second time, I stayed at the select room which was newly renovated. It was pretty standard and clean. Good size. Bathroom is not updated but acceptable. 
The other times I stayed here for free or almost free, because I got a player card here and I gambled. They started sending me room offers after one month I got a players card. Most of the offers are pay 1st night for $20 and get the second night free. Even though the rooms here are not fancy like Venetian, which I absolutely love and miss. But come on!! How I can resist the $20 for 2 nights deal and pay $300+ for Venetian. I would rather save the difference for food or gambling. 
The casino here is actually not bad at all. Lots of slots like other hotels. Decent amount of blackjack table. For poker players, they do have a poker room, even though it can't compare to Venetian and Caesars,but my friend who play poker said it does not matter where you play. It depends on the fellow players. 
For people who are planning on staying here and come to vegas all the time, I would recommend to get a players card, and play some slots. Then you will start receiving offer in mail or online for cheaper room. By the way, the managers told me the room offers have no blackout date, which I can also use it on holidays or new year eve, and that's not other hotels would offer. 
The only down side is that this place is all the way north of the strip, and I would not walk on street in this area because it's more ghetto. So having a car is pretty important. I personally am fine with it because I always drive to vegas and I dont walk on the strip too much.

I've stayed at the Stratosphere twice, my first time staying here was back in 2007, it was also my first time in Vegas and I had nothing to compare it to. It was decent, I enjoyed the casino, the buffet was ok, the room was clean but reeked of cigarettes as if it had at one time been a smoking room.  I enjoyed going up to the top of the tower, but would definitely not go on those crazy rides! It's all the way at the end of the strip so to get to mid strip, where all the happenings are, you're looking at either a half hour on the Deuce bus, $25 cab ride or a very long walk. 
I stayed here again in 2008, this time the room was really nice, we somehow were given a two room suite, the bed was super comfy, the room did not smell of cigarettes, and the housekeepers cleaned it every day.  The night before we were set to leave, I was getting ready for bed, I had taken my contacts out, and then I saw something moving in the bathtub, ugh, it was a roach.  Needless to say, I didn't sleep much that night, it completely grossed me out. We actually ended up getting up early, packing up our stuff and just hanging out in the casino until it was time for our shuttle to pick us up.
Needless to say, I've not been back to stay at the Stratosphere since 2008, and I probably never will.

The hotel is not horrible. The lady who checked us in was awesome. I don't remember her name but I know she was from Rolling Meadows, IL.

The room was not what it looked like in the pictures I saw while booking, but it did have a view, as well as a pair of women's underwear hanging in the bathroom that the maid must have missed.

The casino is lacking. Severely. Usually, there is an endless sea of slot machines. I felt like I played every single one here three times.

They have great happy hour specials and give you two buy one get one drink coupons when you check in. This is the reason for the two stars. All day Saturday I drank Bloody Mary's for $7.50 when I was not gambling. The next day we used our coupons and they charged us $10.75. An hour later my friend came down and ordered one and was charged $8.50.  If there is one thing I can't stand in a business it is blatant shadiness. If you want to charge me $17 for a Bloody Mary, like The Bellagio, do it proudly and I'll happily pay it. But if the same group of bartenders are at your main bar and they are charging whatever they feel, there is a problem.

It was a great one time 4 star experience. We will never stay here again as it is too far from the action. The suit was large, and had a huge bathroom featuring a large shower and huge 2 person jetted tub. The bed was huge and comfy. The colors in the room were a bit drab but other than that the room was great for the price. We got a good discount on the rides up top. That also was an exciting one time experience that I don't feel the need to repeat. The general pool area played the same rap music at high volumes most of the time. That's just not my cup of tea but the pool was okay for what it was. The casino itself was just okay. One night we came back from the strip exhausted but hungry. We walked to the back just looking for some good grub and stumbled into this place called Back Alley Bar or something like that. It's been well over a year since we stayed there and I believe the place isn't there anymore and if that is true it is too bad. We had the bacon wrapped hot dog and rock shrimp ceviche. Both dishes came fast and both were satisfying. Overall, given the large room, the rides, the shops and eating spots in the hotel for a one time experience it definately was a good time. But like I said, there isn't enough to draw me back.

Great Hotel and a cheap alternative at the Strip.
Clean rooms and even the top level with view to the strip is not too expensive.
Pool is ok too.

The Breakfast Buffett is great!

Got a room here for $40, and it was well worth it. We got to the hotel around 11:30pm, and it took us more then 45 minutes to check in, as far as I am concerned this was the only thing I didn't like. The room was clean, and unlike most Las Vegas casinos it was not overly crowded. The hotel is on the far end of the strip so you have to take a cab pretty much everywhere, but for $40 its more then worth it.

The hotel is no where by the strip. Got good prices of Priceline. They offered to upgrade us to a view room for more money. Still not worth it. The Buffett they offer isn't good. Everything is over priced inside the hotel when it's a name brand except for McDonalds.

There's no microwaves or fridges. Cable not great. Pools aren't heated. Need to upgrade the pillows and bathrooms. 

No comps for anything. The towers were closed most of the time for maintenance of the elevators. You order pizza from outside but the delivery drivers won't take it to your door because of security but have non visitors get by to disturb or rob people's rooms. 

I don't think we'll stay again.

Unless you are staying here it will set you back $16 to get to the observation deck. You can go up to the bar for free, but you are so far away from the windows that I wasn't impressed. The hotel itself is nice, I stayed here for one night a few years ago and thought it was a great deal. Its north of the good stuff on the strip, so don't expect to walk down and see stuff. You'll need a cab or a car.

Money well spent. Nothing fancy and incredible. Standard clean room. Friendly staff. Fees during check in were unexpected. I feel like I got what I paid for. A nice place to relax your head after spending the day walking the strip. I would stay again.

Horrible experience. Bathroom shower was covered in black mold. Room was dirty. We asked to switch rooms and in between doing so maintenance walked in our room where our 17 year old daughter was by herself. Got new room. Cleaner but luggage rack broke when put luggage on and phone does not work. Last day there was stuff outside door that looked like throw up from rowdy people in the halls knocking on doors at 3 in morning. And lastly they locked us out of our room on last day. I don't like to complain but I would not recommend anyone to stay here.

The Stratosphere is a little out of the way, on the northern end of the Strip (technically no longer part of the strip at all.) It's not bad if you have a car but not a good option if you're without a vehicle during your Vegas stay. This part of town is a little run down. Lots of construction and lots of empty lots. All of this is no bother if you're driving here so it wasn't a consideration for me when I booked the room.

I got the room at a steal for a two night stay in the North tower, in one of the older rooms. The front desk gave me the option of upgrading to a newly renovated room for $15 but I didn't see the point as I didn't plan on spending much time in the room anyway.

Cesar at the front desk was a delight during the check-in process, which made the 15-minute wait seem much more bearable. 

Unfortunately, that's when the good times stop rolling. Upon entering the room (11142) I was confronted with an overpoweringly unpleasant odour, akin to a bag of sweaty gym gear left to simmer in a hot car. I rang the front desk right away to ask for a room change. The lady on the line didn't seem apologetic or understanding. She asked me to describe the smell to her (as if I was lying about it). When she was satisfied with my answer, she said that I could go down to the information desk to pick up the keys for the new room. When I got there, she told me that she needed to see ID in order to give me the keys. I asked her why she didn't just tell me this on the phone, to which she replied that this was hotel policy without offering an apology or acknowledgment of a mistake.

After switching to the new room, I discovered that the bathroom sink had a small blockage. I called housekeeping a total of 3 times within 10 minutes to no avail, even after being transferred to the front desk, the call went unanswered. The switch hook on the phone was broken, so even calling those 3 times was a frustrating endeavour. The next morning, when housesekeeping happened to be in the hallway, I asked if they could get some draino for the sink. The lady didn't seem to understand what I was saying so I showed her the blockage. She told me to call housekeeping on the phone. I literally didn't know what to say after that. The shower also drainly slowly, which meant taking a shower involved standing ankle deep in soapy water. I didn't bother trying to get them to fix it. It seemed more trouble than it was worth after my previous interaction with housekeeping. 

It goes without saying that this hotel is a little rough around the edges. It's not meant to be in competition with the main attractions on the Strip and I didn't expect (or want) a luxury experience but the service left a lot to be desired even in this price range. 

Rooms also do not have a kettle, a safe, coffee machine (the first American hotel I've ever stayed at that doesn't have a coffee machine) or a fridge. I mean seriously. I've stayed at $40 a night motels that have a coffee machine, safe, fridge and microwave. What is this? 1951?

Wifi is free but capped at 1Mbps. Just like dial-up days. You can pay to upgrade it to 5Mbps but, either way, don't expect to be streaming anything or getting any work done if i relies on a decent internet connection. 

Finally, I observed that the 2 dirty glasses that had been left in the hallway outside room 11135 since the afternoon I checked in were still there when I checked out two nights later. Presumably housekeeping felt they needed to be dialled on the phone for that too.

I'd give it a 1 star but I enjoyed the rooftop pool and bar which has happy hour from 4pm-7pm. It's a little crowded sometimes but still worth visiting for the view alone. Beyond that, there's free parking at this hotel, a luxury most of the resorts along the strip have rescinded in recent years.

It's one of the older hotels, but a must go. It's probably the tallest hotel in Las Vegas Strip and at night time, the view from up top is spectacular! There is a bar and restaurant on the top most floor so I would go visit it!

We were booked for a "premium" room.
We checked-in to our surprise, there was a "resort" fee of $23.something. 
This hotel was in no way a "resort."

Two queen beds. 
I guess I got my hopes up. 
We were one floor short from the penthouse suite (if they have one) or the very top floor, 23\/24 floors. 
Being on the 23rd floor excited me until I got to our room. 

One star for the view at the top of the stratosphere, being the highest observation point in Las Vegas & the ride attractions. And yes. That's all worth just one star. 

Rides:
If you purchase or receive your unlimited wristband, 
Make sure you use it all on the same day. 
If you're still checked into the hotel for a few days, they're not going to let you ride the next few days. 
DESPITE the unlimited rides you get. 
And NOBODY told us that. 
We were embarrassed and held up one ride because they had to call management to see if they could let us ride after purchasing our unlimited rides the previous night. 
And we ended up getting kicked off the ride. 
On top of that, your pictures are gone from the night before. 
So if you like them, buy it that day. Not the next. 
Because they delete everything from the day before. 
And again. Nobody told us that. 
Very upset. 

Room:
I hated being in the room. 
For starters, you would think being on the 23rd floor out of 24, you would have a great view.
Wrong. Our window is short of half the size of the wall. 
So smaller than half. 
And not to mention, turning the AC on in the room made the window foggy. 
So not much of a view to enjoy.

I'm definitely not one to complain about anything being clean. 
But our room reeked of some sort of cleaning chemical. 
Not as strong as bleach but close enough. 
Every time we came back into our room, the stench was so strong.
I mean eventually we accustomed to it but it gave me a headache.
We took our shoes off and one of us noticed the floor was very damp. 
I thought it was wet before anyone mentioned anything but I tried to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt and assume that he AC just made the carpet cold. 
But WRONG again.
So we finally just assumed that the cleaning chemical smell was probably from a recent carpet cleaning. 
So I made sure I was only in the room to sleep. 

Few more issues about the room.
The bathroom was so small. 
Usually, bathrooms in any hotel I go to have room to change. 
But here, one you open the door and the toilet and bathtub were in reach. 
This room didn't have a fridge. 
So any drinks we took back to the room, had to be finished. 
No coffee machine, no safe, no ice bucket, no hairdryer. 
It was worse than your regular motel. 

I'll never ever recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas. 
I'll only recommend checking out the view at the top. 
As far as the restaurant and bar, I hear good things, but a 5-star restaurant at a 2-3 star hotel seems ridiculous. 
Never had I made it a mission to post my review everywhere possible, until this hotel experience.

Had my wedding here last week and had the best time of my life, had the Oasis room. Great size room, huge bathroo with shower and hot tub. The wedding was amazing, top with a killer view. The only thing I would suggest is going to the main strip to gamble, not much of a selection. Aso the smoking here is 5x worse then other casinos. But I would most definatly come back...great room, great view, great price, lved it!

Recently stayed here and had a pretty good time, but a couple of huge issues will prevent me from coming back. 

Pros:
-cheap rooms! 
-decent casino downstairs
-lounge 107 was AWESOME! happy hour half price apps and unforgivably delicious desserts
-skyjump is cool, though i didn't have $100 to drop
-decently comfortable beds 

Cons:
-no free wifi - seriously, if I can get free wifi in Days Inn, huge disappointment to have to pay 12.99 per 24 hours. I even had an outage of internet, which thankfully caused my payment to be refunded
-location - pretty far down strip
-lack of some amenities - a microwave or mini fridge would have really helped

Ultimately, you get what you pay for.

I am not rich. I always keep an eye out for a good deal. When I booked the Stratosphere I was worried it would be REALLY far from everything and that it would be crappy. Well it was only sort of far from everything and slightly dated! Which for the price I paid I thought was well worth it! Our room was very nice and clean and the casino paid out pretty big on their slots! And the wait staff were really nice! Don't do the buffet it's really bad :o( The hotel and stores are outdated but not that bad. The travel to the strip taking the DEUCE  wasn't that bad either. Again for the PRICE I paid it was really good!

*** Review is for casino only ***

The Stratosphere casino is a fairly large area that meanders from the self park garage around to Las Vegas Boulevard.  There are little tricks to remember where you want to go and which set of stairs\/escalators are the best for getting to the theatre.

The casino itself has a good selection of various slots and denominations.  They seem to target the lower rollers like me.  The casino seems to be a lot cleaner than it was when I've been there in the past.  The cocktail waitresses were around often last night and were very pleasant women.  I did notice the large percent of people who were smoking but unless you were right near them, smoke was not a problem.  They've installed a good ventilation system.

I'll always have fond thoughts about the Strat even though I'm not there very often.  It was here when I was invited to a free slot tournament that through some twist of fate, I came in first and won the grand prize of $10,000.  That still doesn't buy the place an extra star but it brings warm fuzzy thoughts!

I knew it wasn't going to be the Venetian, but I didn't know that black oil-like substance would spew from the tub mid-bubble bath...
No one knew what it was, and I really don't believe they ever even looked into it. I asked them to leave us a message letting us know what they found out, I was curious to know what it was that I was sitting in for a minute and I never heard about it again.
Of course they offered to move us out of that room so they can fix it, but I actually had to ASK to be upgraded to a better suite. That should have been offered. No one at the front desk seemed apologetic, or even surprised, which was concerning. 
They need to be a bit more thorough with their cleaning, there were body hairs in the bathroom when we were first checking into the new room.
Two stars for the upgraded suite with a big whirlpool tub that I definitely appreciated.

AAA DISCOUNTS  saved some money...management was helpful; but the room offered for upgrade wasn't ready by the arrival time.
I didn't wish to wait around with the fiance for unknown hours til ready for the king size with fridge so took a queen w\/ a fridge, still an upgrade  but not what was told I got booked for.
Yet, I did get the fridge accommodation and slight upgrade at no additional charge.
CHEAPEST rates I found were here at the time.

Their hallways are not picked up well and housekeeping can't be bother to say hello. Plus, we found a dirty sock behind a sitting chair. When booking this hotel, read all the fine print on what type of room you're getting. We were offer a promotional upgrade to a non-smoking room for $10. Wtf is this? When did non-smoking rooms become a premium in the hotel biz? The hotel rep. did comp us for a non-smoking...As we were leaving I looked under the sitting chair and found a dried out rotting lime. So I called the front desk to talk to a manager. I told her the situation and she replied back that she couldn't comp is for any days and she can't switch the rooms since it's our last day. First off I didn't want anything comp'd and didn't ask for it. All I wanted to do was to inform them. It's rude to assume that I wanted something free. Next time please ask what your guest would like instead of making their decisions for them...

Meh. I was here this past weekend and all I have to say is this. If you aren't afraid of heights and enjoy watching really insane people jump off towers and ride extremely terrifying rides- this is the place to go. Personally, my favorite part of the experience was getting back on ground floor and eating a sandwich. This place is certainly worth seeing while you're in Vegas.

The hotel itself is pretty good. Considering they run deals regularly on room process, you can get in here pretty cheap. The biggest issue is the distance from the "main" strip. If you don't mind a bit of a hike, or paying for the monorail, you'll be fine.

If you're really adventurous, try they Stratosphere bungee. They hook you up to a bungee cord and hang you out over the edge of the highest point, which is pretty freaking high. I'm adventurous, but that was too much for me, so if you do it, let me know your thoughts. 

If it's nighttime I don't recommend walking around the outside extended area too much. We tried to venture to see what was around and it got sketchy pretty quick. Probably not a good idea. 

Overall: B
Far from the main strip, but a good hotel!

There is a reason I never hear anyone talking about staying at this hotel: IT's NASTY! 

Staying here for the weekend for my birthday... Got hit with a "resort" fee upon arrival of $55. Got to our room and it was below a Motel 6... Furniture was old, stained... And dirtyyyyy... Dusty. Seriously? 

We went back downstairs, asked for a supervisor and were told we could pay $30 more a night & be upgraded to a room in the new tower. Asked if we could have a late check out on Sunday for the inconvience & was told there was a $75 charge for that... Really? Wow.

Customer service on a scale of 1-10, 10 being best... I'd give them a gracious 2. 

Got to the new room and it was better in comparison but still disappointing.

With all the hotel competition you would think the stratosphere would up their game... Ahhhh, no. Should have known we were in trouble when we saw that everyone behind the desk was wearing t-shirts.

Grinning & bearing it to make the best of my birthday but not patronizing this hotel ever again.

***update: it gets worse... Hubby & I decided to get room service. Sat on hold for over an hour--- NO ONE EVER PICKED UP... We are now heading down to Starbucks. This place sucks!

I stayed here for only one day and let me tell you,,, I had a blast!!!!

I was in Vegas for three days and had a better night at the starts than Luxor.

Granted I spent less at this hotel but got a better room than in Luxor: 

Pros: 

All renovated rooms (except for the old tower) if you pay a little more you can get a suit for half the price the other strip hotels charge. Stratosphere did not have the room I ordered available so they gave me a suit instead. It was incredible! 800 sq feet of luxury. 

Close to Fremont street and pawn stars shop.

Unlimited tower visitations.

Unlimited bar from  4-10 for 20 bucks at the bar.

Much cheaper prices than strip:

Cons:

Far from the strip: however it's closer to circus, encore, and treasure island. 

Need to get taxi for transportation. However it's worth it. 

Important note: don't believe all the people who post negative comments. I thought it was going to be a bad experience and it was not at all. If you have high standard than stay at the palazzo!!!

I would give this place no stars if I could. We have only been here 2 nights and this is the second time our key card does not work. First incidence was right after check in at 2am. We literally checked in, took the elevator to our room and the key card did not work. Second time was 2 days later. Call front desk and the customer service rep was very rude. Waited over 30 minutes both times for security to unlock our door. Horrible customer service. Don't stay here!!

I am currently writing this review from my laughably terrible room at the Stratosphere using the laughably expensive $12 a day internet (more on that later).

This whole place just reeks of quiet desperation and looming bankruptcy. Tired, old and sad.

My best friend, her husband and two of our other friends were coming to Vegas and were not in a position to be high rollers so when my friend booked the rooms, we got the cheapest place available pretty much. It WAS ridiculously cheap (I think less than $40 a night for our room) but I really wish we had spent ten or fifteen bucks more a night and stayed somewhere nicer and closer to the nicer part of the strip. We would have ended up spending the same amount of money anyways, since a cab is a minimum of $15 each way to the Bellagio or Aria etc and can be as much as $25 if you leave a 20% tip and pay by credit card, for which there is a $3 fee) and we would have been so much happier. After reading through all the other shitty reviews of the place, I have to say our experience seems pretty typical. We didn't notice the neighborhood feeling particularly ghetto or feel unsafe walking to the car at night, but maybe that's because most of us grew up in East or West Oakland? I have stayed in a lot of really posh hotels, a lot of really cheap motels and plenty of shitty hostels and this was truly the worst spot I have stayed at overall. I would have much preferred to stay at a Motel 6 or Howard Johnsons, etc. 

CONS

- When we arrived we had to stand around for fifteen minutes and then go hunt down a bellhop who would take our bags up to our room.

- Our room was fucking gross in addition to not being updated since the early 80's I'm guessing. The bathroom was dirty and the size of a broom closet. The lights flickered forever before turning on and were not very bright. It was pretty smoky smelling. The window (singular) is only 2.5 feet wide and has a gorgeous view of the parking garage. The TV remote was out of batteries and the sound was off from the picture. There was no refrigerator. The toilet took multiple flushes to flush any toilet paper. I found a small cockroach in the bathroom. On the second night our tub wouldn't drain (like ten inches of water to stand in while showering and then couldn't shower because it would overflow). We complained about each of the problems that were fixable and they did eventually send someone up to clean\/give a new remote\/look at the toilet\/fix the tub draining problem, but they never once offered to switch our room or comp us anything for our inconvenience.

- Super far from everything, as I mentioned previously. We probably spend more than $100 on cabs in three days.

- They charge $12 a day for internet PER COMPUTER!!! Not only this, but on the third day, they charged me twice for internet for my laptop and it wouldn't even work. I called the service number where I was then disconnected twice before finally hearing that the charge had been removed and they fixed whatever the problem was with the internet.

- The service was shitty almost everywhere in the hotel and casino. I don't gamble but the whole casino just looked so tired and sad and desperate. The other casino's we walked through looked much more lively and with much more attractive people. 

- The food is gross (especially if you're a 'foodie', but lets be honest, even the fine dining establishments in Vegas are at least something of a tacky copy of their namesake's better restaurants in New York or The Bay Area). We ate at Roxy's diner and it was like a subpar Mel's diner with the same tacky 50's theme. I had the caprese eggs benedict which was ok but the eggs were really overcooked (totally opaque yellow and hard in the yolks). I had eaten one half and asked the manager to either remake it or refund me 50%. He agreed. Then when the check came he had only taken off 25%. I complained and he rolled his eyes and took off another 25%.

-We heard other people staying at the hotel complain about having their room robbed (I can't confirm this obviously, but they seemed believable). We chose not to have our rooms cleaned during the three days we were here because we were worried that valuable or medication might disappear. 

- Weak drinks. A pitcher of daquiris a person at the pool bar brought on nary a buzz. Boo. Even when we supplemented them with one or two 'alcohol infused popsicles'. These things were kind of hilarious. They had to put some kind of gelatin in them to solidify the alcohol so consuming them really was like blowing a guy with a frostbitten semi. 

PROS
+ When we finally did get a bellhop to bring our luggage up, he was a really sweet old guy who rapped west coast shit for us. A little Snoop and Pac.

+ At the pool we went to, the bartender was really nice. I dropped my $22 pitcher (its a SMALL pitcher) of strawberry daiquiri and he replaced it for free. 

+ The bed was actually pretty comfy. I slept well and had no back problems, which is rare for me

We booked here just for 3 nights and four days. On our first night, we got a room that is pretty decent and clean when you look at it until i was looking for an outlet to charge my phone found garbage behind the night stand. ( both night stands, side of the bed) i told the front desk about it that it seems like the housekeeping only clean what we "see" makes me question how they clean the entire room.Brenda the accomodating staff there took care of our problem same night and moved us into the newly " select" room for compensation. First, and second night was ok. Until second morning around 12 pm we were planning to shower and go have our day started and surprisingly no water in the bathroom at all! ( can you imagine trying to flush the toilet and opening the sink to at least brush ur teeth and nothing?!) u cant go out of the room and delayed all ur activities for the day! Called front desk and no answer. Until i texted the number of the hotel( they have a new system where u can txt staff) and complain about it. Manager said " im sorry but it will take for at least one more hour total of 2 hrs i guess to fix the water! No water in the hotel from 14th floor to 24th floor they claimed that it was unplanned that is why no notice! So, for us check in this floors too bad for us we get stinky and waste our day waiting till water gets back) i cant imagine the people in the middle of their shower.. More problem right? So just to compensate the manager offered to take out the 2 days resort fee about $50 i guess they charge. I mean, do i have a choice right now? Overall, i will never, ever come back in this hotel. I thought it will be a good idea since they have a great view deck and rides and all but now i know its a bad idea. So, for all of you reading this comment,, have a second thought if your planning to stay in this hotel to save some disappointment and waste of your time.

Stayed here on two separate occasions. First time in April 2015 and it was fantastic, the staff was very friendly and the we ate at top of the world and had a great time. The view of the strip was amazing.

Second stay August 2015, this stay was overall the worst ever las vegas experience. Upon checking in they didn't have enough people working the check in and basically only one of the three girls were working at all. Not to mention they were letting people skip around the line and taking them ahead of us waiting in the line.

The hotel offered to consolidate the reservations to make it easier on us and them, and they locked us out of our room because they didn't group the key cards, not to mention the staff was rude this time also.

One great experience and one bad, guess it can't be perfect everytime, however I will stay somewhere else next time.

A solid 3 stars. Pros: easy on the budget, good customer service, very organized valet service, plenty of onsite amenities, strong security presence.  Cons: on the very edge of main strip, sketchy surrounding neighborhood, no shuttle service to the center of the strip. We would stay here again.
Stayed here for 3 nights. Great room service! Friendly, and helpful staff! Not too many tv channels to see just basic local tv which sucked! Other than that stay was pleasant!!
This place is a dump. Filthy chips and cranky dealers in a room stinking of smoke.  Nowhere near the best of what vegas has to offer. You're better off up at the golden nugget or Binnions. Avoid.

So extremely disappointed. My mother booked two nights at the Stratosphere for a much needed couples week-end with my husband. She used Expedia. Cus we Expedia the Stratosphere kept telling us we booked with a third party and to work details out with them. Expedia said to call hotel and request room type and preferences. When I did I was told hotel did not have our reservation from Expedia yet and call back day before.  When I called a day before I was told rudely we were in the "old un remodeled part of the tower in two queen bed and it was to late to make changes". Once we got there we did get one queen bed but very far from the pool and with a horrible view of the rooftop of another building and depressing North Las Vegas. We ate diner at Mac gross -the most pathetic attempt at a steak house. Gross. The pool closes at 7. There is only ONE POOL and it's full of kids in clothes. Sunday we slept in. Skipped brunch an decided to have dinner in the tower at 11:00pm. Everything was closed (with exception of the diner) club 107 had only 4 appetizers available out of the entire menu. None appetizing. By the way... We had to pay $15  per person per day to. Use the facilities as a guest of the hotel! WTF?! That was $90 extra for a gross kid filled jacuzzi and a pool that closed at 7! A restaurant that closed too early to enjoy and a stinky old room with a debtor easing view. No wonder 7 people have committed suicide here! We should have stayed in Laughlin!

Parking was convenient and easy enough.  We were able to check in easy enough I waited about 20 minutes on a friday at about 5 pm.  Room that we got was decent and up on a high floor so we had a pretty nice view of the mountains.  The room was clean to the naked eye but since I clean for a living I noticed a lot of areas that have been neglected for at least a few months.  I mean dust and crust in corners that should easily be vacuumed or wiped by housekeeping at least occasionally.  We had 2 flat screen tvs which was very nice and the shower was very large and good water pressure.  The machines in the casino seemed pretty tight because I did not witness any big winners usually at least a couple when I come to vegas.  The employees at the bar seem really pissed off like they do not want to be there.  One bartender told some guy this is not the land of the free drinks you need to play more.  I was like ok maybe he does but don't say it like that.  He flat out said you have to lose more money than you drink.  Bad service in my opinion.  Buffet food was hometown buffet at best and not worth the money but if it is free.  Still not sure...  The pool was not heated and the hot tub was completely full the whole time.  They need to pay some serious attention to some small details and they will be back in business.  The Top of the World Cafe is worth checking out but do not stay here it is too far from the strip and the atmosphere is not welcoming the employees are bitter and do not want to be where they are.  However I was still able to enjoy my stay without a real bad hiccup so hence the 3 stars.

Most of the staff have been great! The lady at registration , Yesenia was FABULOUS! ! Steve the repair man (our t.v. wasn't working ) was friendly! !! BUT the girl at the Valet Pick Up window Brittany, was so rude! Not friendly, was bothered that we even asked for assistance

We didn't stay here so I can't review the hotel rooms and such. However, we did come here to play and we're kind of disappointed. The casino floor was small and if it weren't for the rides I don't think I would've even consider coming here. That's where I kind of lost it. We pay to get on the Insanity, waited about 45 minutes and once we get to the Observation tower we're told that due to the intense winds the ride was shut down for evening. I understand the security concerns, but it was a bit rude the way they handled everything. 

"Yeah, go get a refund." 

The lack of communication between staff created a bottleneck downstairs in the ticket booth. There was only one cashier issuing refunds, which made the situation even more stressful. Once I was at the counter, the cashier was yelling into a phone for help. All I could say was, "It's going to get better."  She was nice to me and issued a full refund. Perhaps this is one of the things that the Stratosphere needs to work on. The Starbucks downstairs was overpriced and the live music was the only thing that was memorable.

Might as well get a room in downtown.  The place is on the strip but not in the same class as other casinos on the strip.  Hotel rooms need major revamping.  worst case- they charge a resort fee!!! I would call this place a bad version of motel 6.

Hotel is falling apart lobby has water leaks everywhere. I have a 9 year old and the rooms have mold on ac vents and the bathtub as well. Carpets in rooms or dirty furniture in the room falling apart . Management in the hotel has no regard for anyone only worries they have is taking your money tub filled with water and all management can say it they have no rooms and no one to correct the issue with the rooms.

Worst hotel in Vegas!!! We made reservations before we left and drove all night to get there.  When we got there around 3, they said since we hadn't arrived by midnight our reservations were given to someone else.  They gave us a coupon for breakfast at the coffee shop (the food was not good, cold and overcooked) We went back to the check in and were told we had to wait a while longer, no rooms available!!! I asked to speak to the manager, it was about 5 am by this time.  They got him on the phone and I explained that I had a reservation that I had paid for and wanted my room right away. We are exhausted after 5 hour drive.  He told us he would have a room for us in 5 - 10 minutes.  We finally got a key and got to the room, opened the door and saw an ice chest sitting on the table, then saw 2 people in the dark, looking at us very scared.....we left immediatly and went back down to the desk and told them there were people in our room....they apologized and got us another room!!!  The second room was hideous with a view of an air conditioning unit....horrible.....we were so tired, but just couldn't rest, I called down to the desk and they said they would get us another room.  The next one had a woman inside, she was just getting out of the shower, we apologized and saw a security gaurd in the hallway and explained to him what was going on.  He called down to the desk for us and finally we got results, they put us in an upgraded room but still felt creep in this hotel!!! Would NEVER recommend this hotel, not even to my worst enemy!!!
