Horrible and smelled creepy!!! Do not, I repeat do not stay at this hotel!!! Plus it's way down at the skid row area of Vegas.  You can walk but have some good shoes. or a taxi, but it's a long ride.  My 1st and last time at this rat's hole!!

I booked the room for my employee. Someone entered her room ( you need a key for the elevator and to open door) so obviously an inside job. They stole laptops jewelry and credit cards. The hotels lack of concern was astounding.

Was truly looking forward to this stay.  Booked over the phone since I was not able to book multiple rooms.  Was promised a king-sized bed in each.  When checking in (Longer than it takes at LAX--and on a Monday) was told there were none available.

Asked if they could apply my Senior discount, and was told that there was no such thing.  I said I don't know what you're talking about, look at your website.  He then came back and said you're already getting a 30% discount and the senior discount is only 10%.  I said that's not true.  The rate I paid is 17% less than what your site quotes as your "Regular" rate.  The site also promises a Senior discount on top of the rate you select.  Could he apply it now?  "No sorry, once you've checked in I can't do anything."
I'm not quibbling about their prices per se, but their dishonesty and lack of respect for their guests.  Go to someplace honest!

Review from 4\/7\/14

I just came home from spending 4 days at the Stratosphere and I loved the place. Had none of the problems the other reviewers talked about. No constant cigarette smell, good food and multiple choices to eat, clean room with a nice view.

Of course you cant beat the view from the 109th floor which is the observation deck. It is all in one thrilling and romantic. The best seat in the house.

My only real complaint was that the wifi was non existent. They charge for faster service but it should be included in the resort fee.

I will definitely return to the Stratosphere and will recommend it.

One word.... ROACHES!
Its impossible for me to give this hotel anything over 1 star because I found a roach lingering in our restroom.  That is a deal breaker and ruins a stay automatically.  Paid money to sleep in a roach infested room., disgusting.
Now to be fair, the good and bad of it all:
Good: Nice, fun pool and service was good. 
Felini's was awesome!!! Delicious and service wonderful.
Bad:
Roaches
Toilet not flushing on first night and took 5 hours before someone came to fix.
Far off the main strip
Valet service is slow and don't make it a point to open doors
The decor looks like its from 1972

Do not stay here!!!  Its not worth the cheap room rate, seriously
Great place for a great price !! Staff was very helpful and nice. The only downfall was the pool was a bit small and the water was warm.

We had a crappy time there, First we get there and they said our room wasn't ready, and was told to come back in a hour so we did and then we were told that it still wasn't ready and come back in an hour so we did then we came back and we were upset this time cause they told us it still wasn't ready, so they directed us to the manager and so she asked us if we wanted another room same type and on the different floor, so we said yes then we get to the room and it's a standard room and we reserved a oversized studio room, so we went back and then she finally gave us the correct room. and after all that she didn't apologize or anything. I don't recommend this hotel at all. we got the room at %50 off on the website and we thought it was a good idea but if u can put up with the crap they put us through then do it, lol

This place is more like a glorified motel. Way north of the strip. Too inconvenient to get to any other casinos on the strip. I was not a big fan of the facilities. Our room seemed more like a motel room. The AC was too loud and we could not sleep first night. The hotel however, fixed the AC next day when we complained. They do not even have a fridge in the room. The staff in general is friendly. If you compare the casino this place is nowhere close to the other casinos on the strip in terms of class. If you are going to Vegas at least go to a decent one in the middle of the strip.  Even the Atlantic city casinos are 10 time better than Stratosphere. If all you want to use this hotel is for room stay then why not stay off the strip. You would never go to the casino to check out how it is or gamble here. Unless you are seriously on a very tight budget and want to "technically stay on the strip"...don't stay here!!

When you first enter the tower area, you wait in line ( I waited on a Tuesday night 30 min) to get your picture taken on a green screen and to go through a metal detector.  Ladies - be ready to hand over your purse to the security worker(?) they actually look into your purse.  Gents -  take everything out of your pockets and your belt.  They won't let you through until the metal detector doesn't beep.  I kept beeping as I was making my way through the metal detector and the security worker made me stretch out my hands and passed a wand over me...

After getting your picture taken, you go upstairs to the elevators.  From here I waited a good 15 minutes for an elevator to go up the tower.  A staff member will count 10 guests into the elevator at a time. (Total wait time to reach the top of the tower - 45 min).  

I reached the inner observation deck area, with the slanted windows.  They had nice seating areas right next to the windows.  They also have a sandwich shop, souvenir store and bar.  

It's always a treat to go up and see Vegas from the Stratosphere, I just felt the waiting time was a bit unreasonable.  Also, some sections of the inner observation deck were closed off for a private party.

Bed bugs!!!!!!! Bed bugs. My husband and I had to stay at the Stratosphere until our apt was ready to move in. I was in one room and everything in the bathroom stopped working we were switched to another room. I woke up two days later with what I thought was a rash at the time. I went to quick care and was told that the appeared to be Bed Bug bites. I went back to the room and low and behold there were several Bed Bugs I found. I immediately told the hotel manager and was moved to another room. I made a report with the security. I had bites all over my body that turned into these big dark spots that looked like little rashes. No one never inspected the room while I was there this was done days later. Security took pictures of my body in the new room. I had to buy all these different itch  creams, take all my cloths, bags, luggages, shoes ect to the cleaners to get steamed cleaned and washed because the only way to kill these Bed Bugs are by high heat. Finally risk managment got intouch woth me and said theu had some one come to check it out and it was negative sign of bed begs. I have pictures showing these things. The hotel didnt compensate me for all the money I had to spend to get rid of these bugs they offered me a complimentary dinner at the nasty a** disgusting resturant cafe these people are a fuc****  joke and im still suffing from the incident. This hotel is the fuc**** worst. Please please spend a little extra money and find a better hotel to stay at. The worst hotel in my life.

Check-in was a quick process. Was upgraded to a high roller room. The phone didn't work, but eh I've got a cell phone. Hotel was nice. There was a $5 blackjack table :-) The pool was very nice and kid friendly. One thing that I would improve on though is when I ordered drinks by the pool, first they said they would take the coupon for 1 free drink, then once drinks were ordered, they said they wouldn't. At that point the drinks were already being drunk, then the computer was down so we couldn't charge it to the room. At that point the drinks were already half way gone. Who carries cash anymore (especially at the pool) at the end of it all, they took the almost finished drinks back. Was kinda lame...
Nice hotel but rooms are not really good .good attractions to see .tower is great .not be back .customer service very slow

Cannot say enough bad!!! They charge a $15 "resort fee" per room, every day you stay, at the front desk when you check in. No mini fridge or coffee machine in the rooms. If you want a mini fridge, it will run you another $10 a day. Now lets add Internet, $12 a DAY!!! Its located at the very end of the strip where I wouldn't advise walking around at night. The staff is a joke. Very abrasive and could care less. I'd rather stay with Ted Bundy if it was an option!

I went to Stratosphere for lunch (Top of the World Restaurant) and extreme rides (Stratosphere Thrills). It's best to make reservations for Top of the World. Guest can purchase tickets for extreme rides online (save you a lot of time). The views from the top of Stratosphere are amazing. It's a great place to take pictures of Vegas. Arriving early for extreme rides and lunch is a good idea. The elevator line can become very long at peak hours. I didn't stay at Stratosphere but it's a cool place to visit. Definitely put Stratosphere on your Las Vegas bucket list.

The hotel itself is a little hard to navigate. Upon arrival, we were a bit overwhelmed by the long checking line. But to our surprise, the line moved very quickly. When we got to the counter, our receptionist by the name of Myisha went above and beyond for us in making sure we got settled. We went up to our room and were very impressed with the cleanliness and overall atmosphere of the room. We would recommend to anyone.

For the price I paid, 250 dollars for a four night stay (including Friday and Saturday night), staying at the Stratosphere was worth it. I consider it a mid-range hotel: better than a motel or off-strip hotel, but nowhere near as good as the other more well known hotels on the strip. 

The first thing I will mention is that the front desk agent Maria was very helpful, and even upgraded my room to a suite for free. I booked the room through Verizon Rewards, and apparently you just get whatever is available. I was going to get a room with two beds, which was excessive since I was alone, but Maria fixed it and gave me the free upgrade. She was also very friendly, and I can tell she will go far in her hospitality career. Someone give her a raise or a promotion, because she deserves it. 

The suite included a bedroom, living room area and a bathroom. The room was spotless and it came with two large flatscreen televisions, a refrigerator and free cable. Definitely not bad at all for the price I paid, and they put me up on the 21st floor (the view wasn't great, but it was still neat being up that high). The air conditioning worked perfectly, and the shower was always hot. The water pressure wasn't the greatest, but it did the job. 

The location wasn't the greatest, and I found myself using cabs a lot since it takes forever to walk anywhere from here. I'm used to New York City blocks, which are much shorter and crammed with businesses. When I heard something was two blocks away, I got excited that it was close...only to walk and have it take almost twenty minutes to get there. Vegas definitely isn't a walking town unless you are in the heart of the Strip. The oppressive heat didn't help things either, but that's not the hotel's fault at all. 

I honestly didn't spend very much time on the gaming floor since I'm not a big gambler, but it did seem to be a tad bit outdated. There wasn't really anything impressive about it or anything that stuck out in my mind. It just looked like a generic casino. 

I would stay here again if I got another great deal, but I think next time I'll try booking at a hotel that is more conveniently located down the strip closer to entertainment.

Cool spot with a great view. Went on a Saturday night and the wait wasn't too bad. Price is fair at 20 dollars for an adult ticket. The only drawback I can think of is they don't allow tri pods for cameras. Overall a really cool experience.

I give it 2 stars just due to the fact that it's older vegas! Other than that...the service,organization and just appeal is horrid!  I'm waiting for this to be the next addition to the neon boneyard! I will take my kids to watch this travesty imploded in the near future. The ghetto fabulous side of vegas exists closer than you think.

3 stars for the Casino, & lounges. 1 Star for the hotel room and housekeeping. Rooms were small and outdated. Housekeeping did not come my first two days to clean, and when they finally did, i was still finding trash places. Extra towels took around 45 minutes, the "Roxy's" had terrible service and ok food. For the price, I would suggest the Circus Circus rooms, they were alot spacious, updated, and cleaner. The lounges here were pretty cool and relaxing. Cover bands played some good music, and tables weren't crowded, valet was really quick, and the self parking was not bad. $20 a day resort fee, $10 early check in fee.

I just got back from Las Vegas last weekend (April 3rd-6th) and stayed at the Stratosphere. Biggest mistake ever! It was SOOOOO far away from the strip. You will be paying about $15 per cab ride, $49 if you take a town car to get back to your hotel. Guess what? That adds up to staying on the strip at the Bellagio or Venetian. I also booked through priceline and they said I could upgrade. I thought awesome, maybe a suite or a great room. Um not so much. I paid $60 for 3 nights and we ended up with a "Normal" room. This was after 3 upgrades apparently. It was a normal hotel room with 2 queen beds and a bathroom. I could only imagine what tuna can room we would have had.  The "strip view" lol it is a really shady neighborhood where the hotel is. We ended up with a select room that had separate elevators and free tower passes. Also the "stores" in the hotel, not so great. A very cheap mall. 

Positives were the valet guys were great and free parking. Also jumping off the building was awesome, other than that, no thank you. We tried the lounge on the top floor. The service was horrible. 

I would rather pay more money and stay someplace better.

Stayed here over the last weekend during our Vegas trip and found it to be conveniently located at the south end of the strip. Is surrounded by Dennie's IHOP, Carl's Jr, McDonald's all within walking distance which is another plus. Had a big line for check-in but still got done in under 15 mins which was good. Rooms are cleaned late in the evening unless you are checking out in which case they will start hounding you before 9 a.m. itself. In the mornings even though there were 4 elevators had to wait almost 10 mins to get one free to come down. All in all a good place considering the amount that we paid for the room.

Hotel was average, my view was ok but only on 7th floor. Be prepared to do alot of walking, it's so crazy how if you get on the wrong elevator you end up on some mystery floor. Everything is totally expensive in the restaurants and bars, the back alley bars bartenders charge different prices every time you order the same drinks, it's totally odd, burgers are 15 dollars just for a cheese burger that is all dry and nasty .  and be totally ready to have everybody offer "upgrades" some do it nice and some are just down right pushy and sneaky, telling you how much better it is blah blah blah, worked one time on me with the rental car but not again...everybody wants your money so have a budget and watch out for the scary area's and hookers.

Our sink overflowed and water was pouring from the bottom as well. My brothers separate room had bloody towels as soon as we arrived and the bathroom door knob fell off. Instead of staying here stay at motel 6 it's probably better honestly.

I used Hotwire to get a room here. I usually stay on the other side of the strip but this is a great hotel for the price!! The room was clean, the staff was very friendly, and I was able to take a quick cab ride to the downtown area.

I would stay here again.

Just reviewing the casino... WAIST OF TIME AND ENERGY!! Im registered at all the casinos on the strip.. i ALWAYS register with my international Spanish photo ID driver license.. at any casino\/place i come in the worls its a valid ID.. Here my ID was not accepted.. it had to be a pasport for them to register if you are not American... what the hell??? Came here to gamble.. but im not gonna gamble without a players card where i dont register player points... so they lost a gambler.. never going back for the casino ever...

After reading other reviews on here prior to my trip, I was a little apprehensive. But since my expectations were so low, I was not too disappointed with the room. I was just thankful the sheets weren't dirty, which seemed to be the case with many people. Our toilet, however, was not working. Despite knowing this, I *had* to go, so I left two little pebbles in there if you know what I mean before we asked to switch rooms. 

I didn't think the neighborhood was that bad, but I also am not prissy about that kind of stuff. We walked dinner off by skipping the Deuce (the bus that goes down the Strip) and walking from the Wynn back to the Stratosphere, and I was never scared. It is a little annoying to be so far from the larger hotels on the Strip, though. 

Service was just so-so, although I was thankful we got a better room when we complained about our toilet. One thing that peeved me was that when my husband asked the bartender at a bar\/lounge at the hotel for water to refill our water bottle, he CARDED my husband. For water. And it's not like the bar was super busy, either. It was like 11 a.m. and no one was around. So lame. I hate Vegas for many reasons, and this is just one of my many complaints about it.

this place is horrible.  from dirty towels to unfriendly staff, as well has finding a broken needle, yes a broken needle on the floor between both of the mattresses.  i normally would not slander a hotel as bad has this, however after discovering the broken needle on the floor, they advised me "its human error".  there would be nothing they could do, not even offering an apology nor taking any responsibility.  we only stayed here to experience the tower rides.  unfortunately that was a mistake.  please save yourself the time and money from being a guest of this hotel.  i read many yelp reviews, and did notice a 3 star for this hotel and figured it cannot be that bad.  i stand corrected.
Dirty hotel, nobody come to clean up the room, the drain on the shower suck, never again

Ehhh.....well I didn't stay here, in fact I was only here about 45 minutes, but I still feel compelled to write a review.
On a recent trip to Vegas, my friends and I decided to take a trip to the Stratosphere and go on the rides. It's $15 just to go to the top of the tower. $15!!! And on top of that, you still have to pay for the rides. Needless to say, I wasn't paying that much. While I waited for some of my friends to go on the ride, I wandered around the hotel. The stratosphere is definitely showing it's age, the carpets are worn, the decor is dated, it just looked kind of dirty. 
I played a couple slot machines trying to score free drinks, and bought a sweet fanny pack in the gift shop, but the whole hotel was just kind of dead. I would definitely not stay here

I would never in life stay here... The rooms are not bad what was so nasty and scared me are the bed bugs here. Ewhhh I had bites I assumed it was from a mosquito or something. Well no I got more by 2 night and my husband as well. While laying down we see one running through our sheets. As soon as I get home I washed my clothes with hot water. Be warned this place has bugs!!

Great restaurants and you get a really nice view of the strip from the tower. The entertainment and rides are also cool, however the hotel rooms were'nt. 

Had to move because the first room was dirty. Even though second room was not much better.  The shower had an issue where it automatically came on when you turn the water on for the bath.  

For a hotel with a cool night life, you would expect much better rooms. I was very disappointed. The casino was pretty empty and I hardly saw anyone gambling.

The location is a nice walk from the monorail, so I would suggest driving or catching a cab to any other casinos.

After a trip to the Grand Canyon, we decided to stay one extra night in Vegas on a Monday, after a long Cinco De Mayo weekend.  I booked the room online on Sunday Morning during brunch, after we had already checked out of Treasure Island.  Considering it was Sunday we decided to switch it up and get a little closer to Downtown (Fremont) so we could check it out since we'd already spent most of our weekend on the strip.

The check-in line was super mega long.  I was like "what the heck is going on?".  When I say super mega long, I mean the wait time at a hotel in Vegas has averaged about 5-10 minutes at the most.  The wait time here was over 30 minutes.  It was Sunday afternoon folks?!?!  It felt like we were in line at LAX or we were like cattle waiting to be herded somewhere.  If we would have waited any longer I think I would have started mooing. 

The hotel room was decent, clean but a little worn. The patrons seem to be a little rough on the place.  I noticed a do not hang stuff here sign next to the fire sprinkler in the ceiling of the bathroom.  Who the heck would think to hang something on a sprinkler?  I can only gather they've had enough guests who have done so, prompting the hotel to put signs up.  Not classy at all folks.
So our room was shaped like boomerang with the bed on one and the TV at the other end, around the corner.  Good think we don't watch too much TV is all I can say here.
I will say the bed was comfortable which is something I think is very important.  The overall hotel room was similar to staying an a median Marriott.  I was kind of expecting something a little more considering it was the Stratosphere.  I may have possibly set my expectations a little too high.  I can complain really though, considering the room price was pretty good especially considering the last minute reservation.

I know this isn't related to the hotel but I'll add it in here anyway for those deciding on a means of transportation around town. We decided to use the Bus Transit to get us over to downtown (Fremont).  Getting our tickets was pretty straight forward.  The bus stop we needed was out of service. It only took us about 20-30 minutes of trying to sort it out because there was really no indication of this outside of a small 8.5X11 piece of paper with some scribbles on it which wasn't very clearly written.  Someone, skipped writing in elementary school and got a job in the transit system. I think maybe at the very least, turning off the lights at the bus stop would have been a decent indicator.  Bus transit needs clear direction for visitors when the decide to make a bus stop out of service so people aren't blowing their time wait for a bus never to arrive to pick you up.

Now for something related to the hotel was when we were asking about where to find the ticket machine for the bus transit.  It pretty much turned into Sales pitch for timeshares.  The hotel has plenty of staff awaiting your arrival and departure prepared to sell you an amazing time share for a next visit back to Vegas or to some other location you never thought you'd like to go. Very persistent. Only wish they were as persistent at helping you with the transit system. Always room for improvement and there's plenty of opportunity here.

Ok so now for the amenities of the hotel.  We went to the top of the Stratosphere to check it out and see what its all about.  We were informed there was no fee to go to the observation deck if we purchased 2 drinks per person in the lounge at the top, so we proceeded to follow this option.  We got to the lounge to get our beverages and we walk around for a bit.  There were several couches and lounge chairs, all of which were pretty much taken. Then we sat and ordered a small appetizer.  Our server was super cool and helpful.  She was keeping an eye out for folks standing around who were looking for a place to sit and would then coordinate a place for them to sit.

When we finished, we headed for the deck.  It was good timing because it was just before sunset.  The sky was clear which made for a great view.  We hung out from sunset to about when the city lit up.  All things considered, it was a good experience.

Stratosphere... you gotta check it out at least once.  We'll be heading back for sure to try out the rides at the top next time.

This is exactly as it is advertised; a 3-star hotel. We stayed here off of Hotwire's Hot Rate hotel deals. We got one weekend night for like $40, but they charged an additional $17 for a resort fee when we got there, plus a $30 late checkout fee (since we decided to go hiking and wanted enough time to shower when we came back). Late checkout is at 3pm, but standard checkout I believe is at 11. 

The room itself was old; definitely outdated and doesn't belong on the Strip! I would imagine this kind of hotel would be on the outskirts of the Strip, but if they want people to return, they need to do room updates, stat. The room wasn't dirty per-se, but it was definitely old and used, so it gave the feeling of being dirty anyway. 

The staff at check in was pretty friendly and helpful with the check in and check out process. 

The only good thing I would say is that your hotel card key lets you go up to the top, which I think costs $18\/each if you're not staying at the hotel. If you're traveling with multiple people, consider it a discount on what you paid for your stay. So in total, we paid about $87 for the hotel room, but we got $54 worth of credit to be able to go to the top, which makes it worth it... right?
beware of the rooms at the very end of the 10th floor, north tower... They are funky, in many ways.
I found bed bug when i woke up in the morning, i am so disappointed with the quality of the room. Also when i turned the heater on there was so much dust coming out of it!!!!

Stayed in hotel for 50th Anniversary. Nice accommodations, nice front desk. Had dinner at the top. Excellent view, rotating, excellent drinks. I had steak wife had shrimp of some kind. We had window table so all was perfect. What I found was that some of the items in the dish were ones I do not eat. They were not specified in the menu except just vegetables. Trying to get our waiters attention took some time.
Stayed there again a few months later and it now costs $5 per person to go up, even if going to restaurant or bar. We didn't go up even though I would have liked to.
Tried to make contact with one of the top management team who had same last name and I thought we were related but he never called back after 3 tries. Guess they don't think enough of their guests just to make one easy call.

This review is for the observation deck only as I did not have time for any of the restaurants. It's a fun thing to do but honestly I was underwhelmed by the guest service. I was there on 3\/31\/13. The line was decently long, however there was trash everywhere. In a 15 min wait I saw so many food wrappers and bottles left in line by guests, where is the clean staff? The elevator ride was fast, and there was a fairly old operator but barely spoke any English and nobody could understand the speech he was attempting to give. The view was nice enough, but trying to get down we waited in a room of clustered elevators and literally the first 3 we tried we couldn't go to the ground on, they only served the restaurants and club up there. However there was no sign as to which one would take us down and the operators there seemed peterbed the more people asked them which one. The lady on the way down was better but was kind of boring. None of them smiled or seemed to like being there. Now in reality, I'm an elevator operator at the Space Needle in Seattle, and was quite surprised at the lack of enthusiasm and service from the staff compared to the level of service I personally am used to giving. I was excited to meet operators from the stratosphere and talk shop but they seemed so bored and blah I didn't bother. The Eiffel Tower on the strip is a WAY better view.

If you're looking for a luxury hotel\/casino this ain't it. Although it met our needs for this trip, we wont stay here again and here's why:

1. Its too far from where everything happens, you're a good 4 miles from the best part of Vegas.
2. Taxis are expensive, you're going to pay $10 one way and using your own car is nearly impossible. 
3. You're in the ghetto!

Some of the best things about this hotel are:

1. The Top Of The World restaurant - Be prepared to shell out some $$
2. Clean rooms for less than $100 a night
3. Free valet parking

Party at the pool...NOT! I'm pretty sure that I saw penguins due to the frigid temperature of the water and some other things that I can never un-see. 

On another note, if you are a biker, DO NOT valet\/store your bike as it WILL sustain damage in the hands of the bell staff. 

Take Vegas Back - There's a reason Vegas left the Stratosphere!

I stayed one night in the hotel, I doubt I will go again. It is relatively cheap but the hotel is not in a good shape. I tried one of the rides on the top at night, it was cool. I might come again just for the rides and the view.

I mean really...a monkey could run a hotel better. Even with the room upgrade the rooms are of less quality that an average Marriott room even. Went here because one of my friends didn't want to go elsewhere because of the price, but you end up paying extra fees and if you want to go anywhere enjoyable I'd recommend a taxi or it's a couple mile walk. Do yourself a favor, go big, stay at a nice hotel\/resort, and have a magical time in Vegas. On top of all this their rooms are dirty and have bed bugs. I ran my hand across the wall and dust went everywhere, a lot of dust, never seen so much dust on a wall.

One word to describe the Stratosphere: Decent. It is not a wow factor. We didn't have any trouble checking in. I do have to say that before you even get inside the hotel lobby, there is an unusal smell mixed in with cigarettes. That cheap ass shady motel room smell. Then as soon as you walk in, the cigarette smell is intense but that is how all Vegas hotels are. 

Our room was 8-119. And it was an okay room. The walls are so thin that you can hear what the other person is saying. The view was awful. If you like staring at the parking structure, be my guest. It was awful. The window cleaning guy starts very early in the morning. If you ever stay here and hear something banging against your window, it is him. 

The bathroom was sooooo  small. It doesn't fit two people. My fiance and I tried. The sink is outside the bathroom and the toilet is with the shower. Overall everything was clean. They should really put shower caps for us sistas' with weaves on. They were lacking. 

The shops upstairs are swapmeet style. If you want to buy cheap jewelry, cheap purses, cheap leather jackets, etc, this is joint for you. It is not like The Bellagio that has Gucci and Chanel stores. We only came up here to buy t shirts and thats it. 

On my next Vegas visit, I wont be staying here again. It is too far from the Strip. I hated walking to the Strip and got used to it.  Bring $40. $20 to Strip and $20 back to hotel.

This is our first time staying here and it was a great hotel. The rooms are clean and a nice size. It is not that far away from the strip, even if you wanted to stay off the strip there is enough to do here to keep you busy. I can see myself staying here again

Un bon hôtel\/casino à Vegas. Chambres relativement peu chères (j'en ai eu pour 120 euros la nuit pour une chambre avec 2 lits doubles). Propreté OK. Accès gratuit à la tour pour les clients de l'hôtel (pas aux attractions malheureusement). Pas de WiFi gratuit, comme dans la plupart des hôtels de Vegas. Casino relativement grand, quelques boutiques de souvenirs et 2-3 restaurants, dont un MacDo ouvert relativement tard. L'hôtel est assez loin du Strip. Pour y faire un tour, petit conseil si vous êtes en voiture, garez-vous aux parkings gratuits du Wynn ou du Encore, et faites le Strip à pied.

i came here for my 1st trip in vegas a month ago.

pros
(tower view)
(variety of food\/shops)
(above average drink service)

cons
(getting charged twice for hotel)
(being harrased at tables if your a mid\/top stakes player)
(slippery bathroom floor,  I almost broke my leg)
(remotes that hardly work)

It's older but it did it's job! This was my first time staying in another hotel other then TI (treasure island)! I started thinking after I booked this hotel did I make a mistake? But was actually kinda happy i did :) it's away from the popular main strip so it's quiet or maybe it was just bc it was off season? Who knows but I didn't hear a sound at night and slept like a baby :) Comfy beds huge tub and clean room! They have Mc Donald's in the shops that's open 23-7 only closed from 4-5am I think he had said. Which is nice when you just want something cheap to eat after leaving the bar Late night, or Roxys diner. I do have complaints though as soon as we walked in we were harassed by these woman at the entrance! I mean as soon as we walked in! All we wanted to do is check in our rooms the last thing we wanted was them stopping us asking 300 questions about how long were we here for, do I own kids , when's the last time I brushed my teeth, lol ummm no I don't want to sit in a timeshare presentation to get a free crappy breakfast that would cost me 6$ to begin with! They caught us everytime we went to the parking garage! Just upset me! So park valet that's the only way around those people! This would have been a 4star for the staff and clean rooms and it being quiet! But those timeshare ladies just ruined it!

Just a FYI ... Get a rental car if you stay here it's far from the main strip and I'm just saying I wouldn't walk around at night in this area lol the more north you go the more bums and creatures of the night you will see

Johnathan at valet is amazing! Party pit is on point, paying n giving GREAT advice! Def recommend for gambling n valeting! Thanks for the great n friendly lack of memories! Lol I'll be back! Love ya guys!

Three stars is for McCall's, and the view, nice clean casino and staff is pleasant. That being said got charged to much for a extra night. Get back to room late and it had never been cleaned. What a bummer to return to. Then let the night from hell begin the walls in this place are thin. Kids running in halls and people fighting in other rooms all night. Kids are because of parents but it still not worth taking a chance on this place. But by all means go see the view from tower and eat at MC Call's.

Stayed here a couple times over the past ten years and my husband nor I have ever had a problem. Top of world restaurant-we ate there 10 years ago, food was okay, not sure how it is now but the view was amazing. We like staying here only for night and then we move it to the heart of the strip for the reminder of the our trip. Our rooms have always been clean and smelled fine. We really enjoy going on the rides and hanging out at the bar at the top, again you can't beat the view up there and we love going up there every time we get to Vegas. The gambling is okay, I rather take a trip down to Fremont for gambling. Overall we have been satisfied with our stay here

One of the biggest problems with this hotel is that they charge extras for things I call essential. The fact they charge a mandatory "resort fee" to your room is criminal, just put the room rate at its correct level. They charge a lot for wifi, which most other hotels I use give for free. The restaurants I used were mediocre. The hotel rooms are a little tired, from the pictures it seems they have renovated some rooms but mine had clearly not been done.

Won't be here again.

Not bad for the price. Room was clean. Bed wasn't very comfortable, but sufficient. I would advise not walking around outside the hotel late at night, especially as a female. The neighborhood is sketchy and dark.  The diner inside is open 24 hours and was pretty good quality and price. Must do the rides on top of the hotel!! Expensive but fun!

When I was getting married in March 2016 I wanted to buy my parents something to say thank you so, I decided on some show tickets and dinner at The Top of The World. I called the front desk and they transferred me over to the gift card department where they told me I couldn't order a gift card over the phone they had to send me a credit card authorization page via fax which I had to fill out then fax back. No big deal, it was a bit of an inconvenience because I had to do everything on my wedding day but I filled it out and faxed it back. I paid the extra $10 to get it to me within 3-4 business days because my parents were only in town for another week and a half. I got married on March 25,2016 it is now April 13, 2016 and I have yet to see that gift card. The gift card amount was taken out of my account and everything. I called last week on Monday and was told that the manager was out but would call me back. I waited a few days and no call back so I called again and was told the same thing. I waited a week and called back today and was told once again the same thing. At this point I am fed up and would just like my money back. My parents are now back in Washington and they can't use it anyway. I called today and was put on hold and when I refused to leave my number once again for a manager to call me back they put me on hold to talk to him and he never came on. 

So ridiculous just give me my money back!!

Is this the nicest hotel I've ever been to? Nope. The worst? Not even close. For $30 a night, however, this place can't be beat. Yeah, it's a bit of a trek from the fancier parts of the strip, but it was clean, the rooms were nice and the showers were hot. It's not the kind of place you might want to lounge around in, but it's a comfy clean place to lie your head at night. Also, when you stay here you get to go up the tower for free, and it is awesome up there.

Its been a while since I stayed at this casino, probably way back when Stardust was still around. Back then, Stratosphere was bustling with people and the environment was really lively. This place seems deserted now in comparison to when it first opened. We picked up a drink at the bar in the center of the casino and there were only two other patrons at the bar. The gaming floor was darn near empty.

We took our drinks and walked up to the second floor where the shopping area is and the only place that had a few people was McDonalds. The rest of the shops were empty to the point where several of the shop owners were just standing by their store entrances, looking really bored. 

This place has lost its grandeur and I find it bizarre that this place hasn't gone out of business from its lack of guests. I've seen casinos in Downtown Vegas that had more guests roaming about.

Horrific customer service. Please, I beg of you, do not stay here unless your budget requires it (especially if you're sensitive to unkind people like myself). I chose to be frugal with my first stay in Vegas and regret it. Almost every staff person acts as if you are inconveniencing them with your presence. They will be rude, they will ignore you and then they will gouge with resort fees. 
I was always told that as long as you're polite, playing and tipping well you will be treated like royalty in Vegas. . . And outside of the stratosphere that statement holds true! Even as just a sight seeing visitor. But as a paying customer at the stratosphere, I was treated as subhuman.
The example that was most upsetting when trying to see the top: "I understand that if a person's job is to take and sell "souvenir" photos that they may be aggressive in their sale. However, when I whispered to a security guard asking if I could step around the photo line as I did not want a photo, I was immediately reprimanded by the female "photographer" (I put that in quotes for a reason) aggressively stating "she's not the one, she's not the one" and shaking her head for all to see and hear. Indicating the guard is "not the one" who makes those decisions. Guess what?! I make those decisions for myself. At no point in time should I be made to feel guilty for politely removing myself from a photo line so I could get in an elevator to see the top." 
The only redeeming staff were those that rode the elevator to the top for 8 hours a day. Possibly the most frustrating job but the most warm and welcoming people.

I have always been an advocate for these older style original Vegas hotels.... Until this trip.  We payed way to much for a room that had black mold on the bathroom ceiling,  out dated dingy decor,  dirty shower and toliet,  and a circuit breaker that went out every time we turned on the bathroom light.  To make things even better on first pressing when trying to use the 107 pool the pump was broken and it could not be used until later in the day. This was followed by attempting to get a drink at the level 7, 8th floor bar that smelled of old rotting fruit tended by a guy who didn't even acknowledge us when we walked in.  Needless to say we went else where to buy our drinks. After purchasing our drinks elsewhere we did return to the pool and the pump appeared to be working although the water was cloudy and heavily chlorinated. While sitting at the pool chatting with other guests we discovered our moldy bathroom and dissatisfaction with our room was mutually shared with all the guest we spoke with (at least 5 others besides us), infact one woman had been waiting 2days for maintenance to fix her circuit breaker so she could have light in her room. The one jem  we found in this place was McCalls grill.  We had excellent service and the food was great. This venue was considered for our wedding and now after seeing it I am sooo happy we made another choice.  I would have been so disappointed given its just as expensive as other hotels but lacks the quality and attention to detail and costumer satisfaction.

Positives-casino area has great variety of slot machines, great restaurants, Starbucks onsite, front desk staff helpful, MJ live show was great
Negatives-Private party caused pool to close early two days in a row. For this party, management also reserved two of the elevators, causing increased waits times, non smoking hallway reeked of marijuana for days, bathroom in room was filthy, tub stained, toilet seat dirty, floor dirty. Housekeeping was horrible!!!!!! they only cleaned the room if you called. Then they only dumped the trash and replaced towels.
Stop by to play and eat, but don't stay at this dump!

First time in this hotel and it's ok. The bed is comfy and the view from 20th floor was ok...it was mostly a view of the ghetto part in Las Vegas :( the tower lounge is cool with a very nice view, but the hotel is far from the strip and everything else. No coffee machine in here!!:(

Stayed for 1 day.  Great stay.  Very clean room.  Nice strip view booked thru trivago. Did the sky jump and loved it
 Got drinks after and it's such a beautiful view.loved it here. Minus 1 star bc my registration desk person was bitchy (it was a young male ) other than that good times.

Do not stay here! low to average price but the resort fee pushes the price up to average.  Resort amenities almost non-existent. Pool nothing special and short hours open.  Average fitness room. Tower experience is nice but long wait unless you do it early.  Desk does not particularly care about problems like the water being shut off in my room in the middle of the day for hours.  Did't even offer to change rooms . I guess because it effected a few floors.Room was linens were clean but bed drape was stained. Shower drain was plugged with hair and would not drain. No compensation for problems but the did say they were sorry.

Las Vegas has changed in the last 14 years... And this hotel has suffered for it.  The exceptional view of the strip from our room on the 23rd floor.... It doesn't exist anymore and is now blocked with new hotels and the climate control was lousy.  The Oasis Suite that I "upgraded" to, was less than expected and not as shown on their website. 
    On the plus side, the bathroom was giant and fabulous and we made full advantage of the giant jetted tub.  Shower had great water pressure, which is a real plus.  The people were nice and helpful and we won $$$.  So, all is well...

Stayed here in May 2015 in a Deluxe Premier View room-- and it's not something I'll be doing again. This place screams OLD VEGAS. The room smelled and didn't even have a closet (just a pole to hang your clothes on). The furniture was old, and the room needed new carpets and paint. Despite the fact that Rock in Rio (over 120k people attended), this place was absolutely dead and the hallways reeked of Marijuana. It's definitely not a place you would want to hang out in. The only convenience factor was that it was right across the street from the Rock in Rio venue which helped us save on parking. Overall, you could pay the same price for something much nicer that's actually located on the strip. 

Pros: 
Friendly staff
Stratosphere tower (beautiful views)

Cons: 
Old Vegas feel throughout-- Old damaged furniture, terrible smell of cigarettes and marijuana, old paint
Far from everything
No Value-- you could get a nicer hotel ON the strip for the same price
Noise-- you can hear everything

I stayed at this hotel back in 2010 so decided to come back because of the excellent rate and first experience that we had. Our second experience of this hotel  in 2012 was the worst experience I have ever had in my life.

 We checked into our hotel and came to find out that the shower had little to no water pressure at all and the water temperature did not warm up. I wanted to make sure I wasn't just being crazy so I had my husband check it out as well. Low and behold it was not just me. 

We called maintenance and it took them several hours to come to our room and look at it. Finally they said they could see the issue but he could not fix it and would need to call for an additional repair man. It took them an additional call and seven hours for them  to come up to our room and we had a show to attend that evening. 

When the second maintenace man came up he said that the entire side of this hotel had the same issue. Our question at that point was, if the entire side of this hotel had an ongoing water issue why did they book us in this room. 

We decided to go to our nine pm show and returned later that evening. I decided to go to the front desk and speak with the night manager. She kept apologizing and saying the hotel is "old." I told her that the hotel definately might be aged but this water issue was not acceptable. I do not mind if the pressure isn't all that hard in the shower, but to have one drop coming out of the shower head is just ridiculous. 

The manager said I can credit you the resort fee of $7.50 only. I just got back from Las Vegas and the hotel charged me the full amount for my stay 220.00. They did not even credit me the little $15.00 fee that they said they would. I will be calling my bank to disupte this and I will also be contacting them to fight for a credit for my one night of a non functional bathroom. 

We will never be returning to this hotel ever again! Is it to much to ask that we are able to take an actual shower?

*********Review for the hotel only************

Why 1 star?


1) $17 extra per night for resort fee (was charged $100+ for 2 nights\/3 rooms just for resort fee)

2) $12 extra per 24 hours for in-room WIFI, which the resort fee does NOT include, no LAN cable internet connection.

3) Non-smoking rooms smell like cigarettes.

4) AC next to the beds sound like helicopters for all 3 rooms. The hotel were lucky that we were tired enough to fall asleep.

5) Old and small bathrooms. Ceiling fans also sound like helicopters.

I called to complain and they don't care. Oh well.

I'm rating this place a three because I actually won money at the casino !!
Other than that, the rooms were okay. Clean room, but there wasn't anything spectacular about it. The bathtub was clean and deep but the bathroom was tiny in general. There was no place to put stuff near the sink ! 
The pool was saltwater and ok, but it reminded me of a Disney resort (ie lots of kids). The bar poolside was okay. 
There's a shopping area here but everything is low class and cheesy tourist trap. The arcade just plain sucks. 
I was too cheap to pay $6 to go up the tower; but if you're staying at the hotel and happen to not be asleep from 10-2 you can go for free. 
The buffet is pretty good! If you sign up for the player's card, it is a bit cheaper.

Their idea of a pool view room sucks. The guy at the front desk lied upon check in. The ply view of the pool we get is as soon as we walk out our bedroom door since it's literally the last room on the floor next to the entrance. While checking in the guy told us of you don't like the room we can switch it which should've been the first red flag. We then called to switch and were told oh well, were completely booked try to switch tomorrow. We were woke up by all the traffic noise for the pool. The worst experience I've had here so far!

I had bought a new home last Thursday and it was a happy and stressful day all at the same time:)  I had only rented a car from this Hotel I was not staying there, and after the day was over, I went to have a few drinks at McCalls, I had this bartender (Carl) this guy was amazing, the food was great, the drinks were cheap and great !  He did a good job at talking about the city and taking care of me as a customer, this Hotel, needs more guys like him!  The next time I stay in town, I will be visiting this McCalls, over and over again!

It was my bday weekend and we thought we were getting  great room when we booked it. but when we checked in the room it was terribly outdated, it smelled, the rugs were filthy and the ac didnt work. the shower was weird the way it sprayed out like u were getting hosed down..then i plugged in my phone to charge overnight and turned out the plug in the middle of the night stopped working. so my phone was dead all day! I WOULDNT EVER STAY HERE AGAIN. OH BTW b4 it was check out it was 10:15am the housekeepers lightly i mean lightly knocked i thought it was next door. i was changing and she walked in!!!! i said HEYYY! SHE SAID OH ILL COME Back.. now really!!! WTF!! CHECKOUT WASNT UNTIL 11:00... needless to say when we checked out we complained. and we are going to get our refund back! what a horrible experience!!
We stayed here for two nights and loved it. The pools were great and had amazing views, food options were superb and the room was very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

There's a reason why the rooms are so cheap.
It's in the north end of the strip and a far walk from anywhere you want to go.

If you have a car and want to drive to where you're going, that's fine.
But why don't you stay at the place you were going to in the first place?

I give it 4 stars not because its a 4 star Hotel, but because its a nice hotel ON the strip that gives you excellent rates, I have stayed 3 times here when on a low-medium budget and loved it, rooms are basic and clean, staff is really nice, one time at check-in I told the lady that there wasn't only 2 of us but rather 3 (they charge you for the extra person) she was really nice about it and didnt charge us.(They avoid this by just not giving you the extra room key)
The casino is kinda small but nice, didnt really gamble that much anyway.
I do however recommend having a car for your trip if staying here because it is a good 3 miles to Mirage (example), if you wont have a car then change your hotel.
The worst hotel customer service in Las Vegas.  It's such a false advertisement when they are rated 3 1\/2 star on priceline.  Someday they'll get sued, and priceline will have unbiased reviews.

So far away from the main part of the strip....I was stuck bored at the hotel. The room was small and I had a viewof the fan or some sort of air chute (received no sunlight) two feet away from the window. The buffet is pitiful with old salad and mediocre selection. 

The shopping center upstairs is dead with a bunch of gift shops and sleezy jewlry shops and food court.

The only thing I enjoyed was the pool.

My girlfriends and i chose this hotel as part of a Southwest package but regretted it within an hour of arriving there. We arrived at 12:30pm and opted to choose early check-in to pay extra. We were assigned a room in the North Tower and as we entered the elevator to go up to the 24th floor, a guy jumps into the elevator totally drunk, does not select a floor and then follows us when we hop out. We wait in the hallway and pretend to use our phone as we do not want him to follow us to our room and he is flustered, mumbles something and then jumps back into the elevator. We were freaked out!!

We get to our room and are so disappointed. It is tiny and there is hardly room for 3 of us to move and there is barely any sunlight in the room from a small window. We call security and inform then of what happened and they promise to send someone to checkout but never do. And to add insult to injury, the water is cutoff from 1-2pm. Why did they offer us early checkin if we cannot even shower or use the bathroom!

We went back to the registration desk and complained loudly and were ushered away from the guests into the managers office. He offered us a free upgrade to a better room as we insisted on a room which had more guests and traffic so we would not have the same experience. They reluctantly agreed.

Although they did fix the issue we never felt safe in that hotel and will never go back there again.

Disclaimer: A lengthy review but I feel it'll help for families especially. I'll summarize the key points:

- Greedy, unethical and bad customer service by the management. The employees and workers themselves are nicer though.
- Nothing special in the resort for which you're charged 18-35 per night. 
- Even their remodeled premium rooms are at par with a Holiday Inn at best. 
- Poorly ventilated lobby and casino.
- Be sure to check your bill on checkout!

I'm writing this after giving Stratosphere a second chance. The first time was last year when I came to visit Vegas with my friends. We were rarely in the hotel so a lot of things went unnoticed or we didn't care for them. But on checkout we were charged ~50 bucks evidently for some paid programming. I didn't make sense coz firstly, we didn't watch any paid TV and secondly, we had gone to the Grand Canyons that day! When I requested them to recheck and give us a refund, the front desk person went back to talk to their manager. While she offered to revert the charge, she was very disgruntled about it and even said "we'll let it go this time but next time you will have to pay for it". It was the total opposite of what good customer service is about. One would expect an apology or "we'll look into it for you" at the least. I wonder if it was one of their housekeeping folks taking the liberty in our room since we were gone all day, but it surely wasn't us and that wasn't the way to handle the situation for sure!

In any case, this year I gave them a second chance when I decided to go with my family (wife and a 2 year old). BIG MISTAKE. For families considering the Stratosphere Hotel, especially with younger kids\/babies, this is NOT the place to stay. You will be better off staying a little off the strip if you don't want to pay for a higher end hotel on the strip. And here are the reasons I say this:

1. Our kid is a very picky eater. We prepared his meals from home and figured any hotel would have a microwave and refrigerator. Not this one. The refrigerator was 10 bucks extra per night. I don't know if that's the standard offering on Vegas strip hotels now, but I'm pretty sure a Holiday Inn could've offered better. As for the microwave, they said it was a health and safety hazard, so they don't even offer them for a fee anymore. I had to ask around and a nice lady working at the Starbucks told me that the Circle K gas station across the street had a microwave I could use. So that saved the trip for us. 

2. I get the sense that Stratosphere's employees are nice, but their management is greedy and has the wrong idea of good customer service. One of the housekeeping people even said they can find us a microwave, but never came back. So at least she offered. One of the fast food places in their retail shops area had two nice employees who even offered to warm up my kid's food once I explained them the situation. By the time I came back with the food to warm it up, the owner of the fast food place was present. And he would not let me warm up my kid's food! I assured him there was no health hazard since the food was in a sealed microwave safe container. His explanation: the baby could burn his mouth and it would be an insurance issue on him. Again - I was appalled at how their management was concerned about their own ass and didn't care for a customer's child who was hungry. 

3. It's not all about the kid's food or the lack of a micro or fridge. They pitch their newly remodeled "premier" rooms as if they're the hottest thing out. Forget about offering a free upgrade. It's all about squeezing the extra bucks for them. Said rooms were only up to par with other retail chain hotel rooms. Not terrible to be fair, but nothing special either.

4. Also be prepared for a resort fee between 18-35 dollars per night. Mandatory. That would be acceptable except that there really isn't much they offer as a resort. The pool on the 8th floor is boring compared to those at other places. It was messy, dull and poorly organized. I used the pool only once on each trip and both times felt no need to revisit. The tower access is free for anyone and so is access to the observation deck.

5. The entrance lobby is dull, gloomy and smokey. Very uninviting and again, not well ventilated for children.

Although the hotel is a bit far from the strip( walking distance ) I would not mind staying here again. I will admit when first walking into the room I didn't see anything special but I can say it was a least clean and no bed bugs!!! I was determined to give this place a shot and ended up liking it more than a few other hotels I found on the strip central. We were here for the 4th of July and absolutely loved the view! The bar tenders at the top of the tower were awesome and the food was delicious! I recommend definitely visiting the hotels tower and the casino although a bit small was cheap and fun! I would stay here again without a doubt.

I had my wedding reception at the Stratosphere observation deck, and it was an amazing experience for far less than I would have paid elsewhere! The views were stunning, the set up pain free and very pretty, and the food catered by Top of the World was delicious. Will recommend to anyone wanting a special event in Vegas!

I expected more from a major hotel on the strip. The hotel and rest of the building was pretty nice, but extremely misleading. I stayed in the basic room for a conference nearby. I don't know if there are nicer updated rooms. The room I was in was extremely outdated and dirty. Looked like a motel room from the 90's. I've stayed in motels nicer than this place. There was dirt and dust everywhere. Luckily the one thing that wasn't dirty were the sheets. This is also more of a party hotel so there's a lot of loud obnoxious kids stumbling down the halls at 4am that woke up me number of times. Walls are also paper thin and can hear the toilet flushing from all the surrounding rooms.  I would not recommend this hotel or ever stay here again.
17$ Resort fee really?? and you couldn't take that during reservation? dirty bathrooms. unsuable TVs. Far from strip.

This hotel was just OK.
It's far as hell from all the action, and on site, there is NOTHING I consider so fun I'd spend an entire night stuck here.
The cab ride to the airport is in the $20 range.
The cab rides to any place on the strip start at $15.
Even getting downtown was almost too far to walk.
The bar sucked.
The casino was boring.
The rooms on the other hand were cool. Great view of the jumping from the peak of the stratosphere, as well as the rides. They were comfortable and standard. Nothing special, but not shitty either.
For the money we spent on cab rides, we should have stayed at the Palazzo...just sayin'

Basics, smokers, great price, a little trashy.  You can't beat the low price as low as $21\/night + resort tax.  If you need a Vegas fix and are tight on funds (does that even make sense?), this is your place.  What you don't get: great food, a whole lot of quiet, and luxury.

The pretty cool:
==============
*  Free Stratosphere rides to the top
*  Great views
*  Bar on the 107th floor

The bad:
=======
*  Smoky rooms, even for the non-smoking
*  Very smoky casino
*  Smack in the middle between the great stuff and downtown

Conclusion:
=========
If you can afford more, spend it.
Wish if I could give 0 stars.. very bad costumer service and charged extra money... I would never fly spirit again

Can't beat this place when it comes to price.  It's a good spot on the strip, to not be annoyed by traffic.  It's on the northern end, so getting in and out is a cinch.  Food is cheap and reasonable, the machines seems to return and the tables pay off.  When I was getting comped by Strat, I enjoyed the free shows, food and suites.  Wouldn't mind returning... but with over a dozen options, I'll stop by just for kicks. 

They do have a nice pool and arcade for kids.  The rides on the top of tower and nice too, but pricey.  I recommend buying the all day pass.

DO NOT BOOK HERE.  The Premium room had no comfortable chairs (just dining room chairs), no safe, one tiny trash can, an awful view of North Los Vegas, and very few TV stations.  And a broken sink.  We upgraded to a suite, which as much better, but the maid stole some things, and the management didn't give a damn.   And it's too far from the rest of the Strip.  And no, you won't stay in the tower, so you'' never get a great view.

I am never going to stay here again... Wow I was so disappointment in this stay. Front desk staff was very friendly and so were the staff for Valet. We checked in late, around 11:30pm. When we get to the room we find out they checked us in into a dirty room. I used to work for a resort before and understood at these things happen sometimes, computers have glitches at times, I didn't make a fuss about it. I called down to the front desk and let them know we checked into a dirty room and what did they offer to do, to have housekeeping come up and clean it! This BLEW my mind! By this time it's almost midnight and they are expecting us to wait over an hour for housekeeping!?! (I say over an hour because for them to clean that room it would have taken that long). When I asked to be moved they first didn't want to but then asked to give us a call back. 5 mins later they call the room back and told us they would send a bell hop up to switch rooms for us. 10 mins go by and we get the bell hop at the door but he just hands us the keys and leaves! Never offered to help us move our luggage! We come into the new room and it's smaller than the last room with an amazing view of the garage...
The next morning we wake up and I go to take a shower and the towel I opened that makeup smuges all over it and the iron didn't work. We call housekeeping and was put on hold for 15 mins and then had to wait an extra 30 mins for them to bring us a new iron! I actually had to call housekeeping again to complain and wow suddenly within 5 mins we got a new iron. 

My rating goes for the lack of cleanliness, lack of bell hop assistance, lack of empathy, and lack of responsiveness.

Dumpy hotel. Depressing Casino even by Las Vegas standards. They play the same obnoxious music reel over and over again until you just wanna scream.

The only draw for this location is their view tower at the very top. That and their revolving restaurant. You don't need to stay at this dump to enjoy their tower restaurant and by making reservations there and springing for a meal you get to enjoy their tower views without being gouged $$ for a ticket to the top. 

Lousy area of the strip.

The place is ghetto. Talk about run down and old. 

You get what you pay for. 

The rooms are DARK, small and a little eerie. The hotel is located at the furthest end of the strip- not convenient for going out on the strip. 

The beds looks like they haven't been changed\/washed in ages... but I suppose that goes a long with the 'you get what you pay for' theory. The bathrooms are small and the casino isn't plush whatsoever. 

However, there is a good Italian restaurant on the 1st floor which is pretty decent, worth checking out.

I have reserved the hotel a while ago and since we were already spending some time in Vegas during the day, we checked in relatively late. Unfortunately, this meant that the hotel gave away our non-smoking room (which was already payed for) and put us in a "smoking-optional" room. This caused the night I spent there a disastrous experience as the smell of cigarettes was embedded in the room carpets and walls, and the ventilation system did not work at all. Other than that, both the hotel and the rooms are outdated.
My room was great and at a good price, but didn't enjoy the casino area.

It was our 1st time in Vegas and we booked sort of last minute. This seemed like a good deal. I figured we wouldn't be in the hotel much so it wouldn't matter. Well.....it did. It was awful. 
Where do I begin. The shuttle from the airport forgot we were there so he dropped us off last but at least we got a tour I guess. After a long, hot ride we figured paying for early check in was worth it. We booked a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor...the room reeked of cigs. Went to the front desk to ask for a diff room. The "manager" didn't even look up at me while i was talking or apologize for it. He handed me a different key and walked away. Really??? I was livid when I got upstairs and the key didn't work. Room service was nice enough to let us in since we had a baby with us. As we were settling in a woman walked in with a key that worked. They gave her the same room. OMG. It was just a mess! 
By that time we were starving but still had to get a room with a key that worked. We waited for a long time at the front desk and finally they let us stay in the room we were already in. Had to ask them to refund the early check in fee. They did not offer us any compensation for our troubles. Horrible customer service. Actually everyone that worked there was rude and unwelcoming. 
After that whole mix up we went to eat in the hotel because we were too hungry to go anywhere else and Roxy's diner was pretty bad.....we waited a long time to order and the food was bland...fries were old...service was dead. We were ready to leave Vegas at that point. Our trip got a little better later but this hotel is horrible. Our bathroom light went out twice and they took really long to address it. It was 11pm they finally showed up. The casino is really smokey. The only good thing was starbucks in the hotel. If there is a next time we will be staying at a different hotel even if we have to pay double.

I agree with Barney B. this place is totally ghetto and a very out dated , especially in comparison with the chicness of places like the Wynn and Venetian... the stratosphere doesn't compare. My boyfriend and I stayed there for two nights and the room was something out of a politician sex scandal .. a clean but ugly typical room. It was cheap though which was great for someone on a budget , which sucks in Vegas , where money talks loud.  Our room was facing the parking garage and it was quite loud with car alarms going off all morning and night . So I won't be returning to the Stratosphere ever agian .. unless I hit rock bottom and have to turn tricks (yes I spotted quite a few hookers there)... put that's a whole nother yelp review.

Good value, clean good sized rooms.  Staff is very friendly and accomdatiing.  Starbucks in the lobby and McDonalds on the retail level, great for breakfast.  We didn't try any of the other dining options in the hotel.  On the far end of the strip but we liked that, it wasn't nearly as crowded as some of the other hotels.  Nice pool.

Stayed here for NAB '11. Stayed on the 22nd floor and had a great view of the city and the tower. 

The price wasn't bad, but I wouldn't recommend staying there if you are attending the convention center. Ended up spending about 40 bucks a day on taxi and parking to commute, and in the end it would have been cheaper to get a closer hotel.  

Food and bars are a bit pricey there, but then again, it is Vegas.
Our family (wife and 2 kids) always stay at the Stratosphere and have 0 complaints. We were always treated like VIPs every time we stay.  Daisy, our casino host is very positive and enthusiastic!
I've stayed at the stratosphere twice this year and you get a bang for your buck minus the larger crowds further down the strip.
This review is for the observation deck experience. We went at sun set, which was magnificent. We got some really cheaply priced drinks. And enjoyed the wonderful view.

You have to take Vegas hotels with a grain of salt.  You get what you pay for.  Cheap is, well, cheap.  And we wanted a cheap, fun place to stay.  If that's what you're after then Stratosphere is it!  We had a total blast.  The 24th floor (topless optional) pool was 21+ and the cocktail waitresses wear bikinis.  How can you complain about a place like that?!  Such a fun atmosphere, watching the rides above while you lay by the pool, seeing the skyjumpers whizz by your table in the Level 107 Lounge, and the great bartender that was at Air Bar last Monday night were all awesome!
I would recommend Stratosphere for an singles looking to party, but definitely not for families.  I was actually really surprised to see so many kids there.  I would pass on taking mine there for sure, but I'll be back again to party:)
And for the geographically challenged reviewers that say it's "soooo far" from the rest of the Strip...well duh.  Did you not do your research before you booked?  Once again, people who complain about something that's their own fault and the give a poor review should be ignored.  As should people who bring children to a casino...
Worat concierge \/ realist ration EVER!!!!!!no matter what time you. One there will only be one person at the registration area. 1:14 am and the longest line ever!!!

Just got to the hotel and at first was skeptical with all the bad reviews lately. However, Victor from the Dominican, was amazing. He was so friendly And accommodating! The room he put us in is great. Very clean and big. No view, but i would rather have clean And no view then dirty.   Hopefully the rest of this trip was just as good as the check in.

Im a fan! I booked SUPER last minuet, in-fact the day of with the stratosphere hotel for a four night stay in las vegas. They gave me a good deal directly over the phone. Our room was a select room (upgraded) and defiantly nice! The only negative is no fridge :( IF you do want one its an extra $50 a night lol. Might as well just book the suite. Other than that, Had an excellent time and the gym is awesome!! The hotel is NOT on the strip but they are quick to have shuttles and taxis to take you wherever your heart desires.

This is a nice hotel. My room was clean, the check-in and check-out process was really smooth an easy. My room was easy to find. 
I don't gamble and I didn't drink here, so I can't review that. 
My only complaint is that it's 2 MILES from treasure island- which is basically the 'end' of the strip. There is nothing past Treasure Island that is fun or popular. It's ghetto. So your really not ON the strip, you have to take a cab everywhere because your so far from everything.

Honestly my last trip i fell in love with this hotel for its low key personality. I know its not on the strip but the enviroment was wonderful. I loved it so much I tried to book a room for this weekend using my off one night $20 second night free. Well apparently if i pay full price i can get a room but not if i use my offer. its blocked out even though weekends we can book our appt. So i guess this is good bye to the stratosphere hello hotel on the strip.

I really enjoyed my time at this facility. I did have issue with timeshare folks pestering you. But just say no and walk away. I was a bit unhappy with the construction sounds during the day. I do wish we would have had a coffee maker in the room. Valet was awesome. Very nice folks. Observation area wonderful. The artist there wonderful. It was located a bit to far from the action of the strip. Long dark area for walking. We utilized monorail system, but you have to walk to that area as well.  But be warned, it does have hours of closure that are NOT posted. I was also surprised with the extra hit of price for facility over and above room charge.

Good place to stay and not so expensive, loved the night with my Man here. Just the two of us-we had much fun, but over spent soo much money on playing them damn machines. Ughh , we should of gotten a foot rub instead....

I am so shocked. I had booked this hotel for my mom`s birthday surprise over a month in advance. I constantly kept in contact with them to stress about how I did not want my mom to pay for any of the fees associated with her stay and that this was a birthday gift. They assured me that all she needed to do was show her ID. The check in process is where the nightmare began. I had called my mom to see if she checked in and she told me that they had charged her for the resort fee and security deposit. I immediately asked her to give the representative the phone so I can speak with the lady. The lady then began to explain how the charge every stay a deposit and resort fee like a script and I had to cut her off to tell her I know and understand but I have submitted paperwork for a 3rd party authorization for payment. She then said she would refund my mom and would charge me. I agreed, however, when I got off the phone I went through all my paper work and realized they had already charged me for the resort fees and deposit. So I spent over a hour with the 3rd party company I booked the package from. They got the hotel to realize their mistake and I am suppose to receive a refund soon. However, my story does not stop there. My mom had spent over 30 mins trying to get into her room. She went to the front desk 3 times to change her key and the last time they sent security to help her in. So her check in process was horrible. I am also disappointed at the location. My mom said that the hotel was off the strip. Websites made it seem like the hotel was in a central location.She also complained about the atmosphere. She said at night there were definitely a lot " women of the night" walking around in the hotel.I feel like you should only go to this hotel as a place to rest your head. Do not book this hotel if your are looking for great service and a romantic and intimate stay. I have stayed at large hotels who make it their priority to go above and beyond during your stay. This was certainly not. There was not even a mention of my mom`s birthday at all. I would not personally stay there and I will certainly not recommend this place to anyone. I am so disappointed.  I thought this hotel was suppose to be iconic but instead it ended up being equivalent to a shady motel.

The pros are a single item: cheap rooms

The cons are for more numerous:  the place is in a ghetto area of the Strip where I saw vagrants yelling at themselves on the way back to the hotel.  If you have a far of being mugged, this is not the place to stay.  Taking the monorail at night back to the hotel is an adventure all its own, since the monorail station closest to the stratosphere is a closed down casino with little lighting on the street  to get back.  It is also very far to walk to the big casinos on the southern end of the Strip.  Gambling was mostly the usual dreck of white trash and old people blowing their retirement accounts on slots.  There were quite a number of women who were dressed as hookers, but since this is Vegas real sex workers and women coming from clubs look identical since the level of class in the city is so high.  

They also hit you with an additional fee of 15 dollars a night for entrance to the tower and exercise room that is not clearly stated when you book online.  The rooms themselves are nice enough, with big TVs and comfortable beds.

A little jaunt to Las Vegas, and low and behold, we ended up at the Stratosphere....we couldn't beat the holiday rate (under $100\/per night).  Located at the end of the strip...we found it easy to get to and from, because of the handy monorail that is conveniently about a two block walk away.  Favorite thing we did at the Stratosphere...was stepping out to the Top of the World Restaurant (a rotating restaurants) for dirty martini's at their bar. Not for the faint of hearts or those who get quizzy with heights (my boyfriend :) but it does deliver the best view in Vegas! A romantic and unsettling cocktail lounge all wrapped in one. Biggest disappointment - not looking in the complimentary package that was handed to us as we checked in...as we drove home, we noticed that there were compliementary tickets to "Bite" and "American Legends" along with spa passes....Overall, the Stratosphere met our expectations...it was Christmas so with the holiday cheer around us, it made for a great time not matter what. I would stay there again...cool diner in the casino, friendly sports bar, and convinent shopping center on the 2nd floor.    Thumbs up.

I am so upset! I was promised a certain room and when we got in, our was a different room than promised. I am still awaiting a call from a manager because the front desk told me that there was "no manager on duty"? How is that possible! 1 star customer service is terrible they have really let me down :(

All i want is for them to make this right, ill update you if they do!

**FINAL REVIEW **** 1 STAR :(

Probably lost a customer for life - check in at 5pm room not ready so waited 1 hour. Got to room, it was mis-coded as a king but had 2 queens. Was told by front desk we are full there is nothing we can do for you. Asked to speak to manager, was told there was nobody on duty. Received a call at 930pm that a room was ready for us but we already unpacked. So repacked and switched rooms. Asked again to speak to a manager but never got a phone call. Nothing, no apology no credit no offer for anything due our troubles. Had to go thru Facebook messenger to get an answer on anything. 

New room had 1 king bed hooray.... But unfortunately there was no tv remote so i went to call front desk... Phone is dead. Also the fridge was not working. I had to walk down to front desk to tell them. Fridge abd phone never got fixed. Never received a phone call or apology.

Very disappointed all i ever wanted was an acknowledgment that they were in the wrong and just apologize that's it.

Stayed at the Stratosphere as part of a package with Southwest. Thought I got a good deal but quickly realized why the price was noticeably lower than other casinos.
