There was a $20 a night resort fee on top of the package price. No complaints there. That was made clear when I initially booked. Arrived in the wee hours in the morning on a Friday (2am) and the line was down the hall! Took about 25 minutes to get through it and check in. The agent was nice and offered us an upgrade to the newly renovated rooms for an additional $20 a night. We declined. At that point, it would have added an additional $160 to the package price. As aforementioned, at that point, I could have stayed somewhere like the MGM Grand! Disappointed in the cleanliness of the room. Pics of our actual room are attached. It worked for our short, 4 night stay. Would not stay here again simply because I felt like in order to have a nice and clean room, I would have to pay an additional $160.

Room is dated and no fridge, no microwave, no even coffeemaker... very loud toilet and thin walls... Lol.
But Buffet is yummy and at Shopping Mall on second floor we find an awesome magic shop, owner of that shop show us some tricks what - he did it upfront of us - and his sleeves short, so there seems no place to hide anything - truly amaze us! He is way better magician than many of "magicians" on the Strip!
I really recommend visit that magic shop, there plenty of awesome stuff and owner teaching how to use it to make tricks and amaze friends, and if you buy something, he will perform a little show for you right there! (:
Also nice Pin Up show there - good music, pretty costumes - and its a kind of show what considered adult but will not make your girlfriend or boyfriend  angry... Lol.
Good Comic Club show as well!

This review is for the casino only, since I have not had a chance to stay in the rooms.

(+) You have to go up to the top of the tower at least once. It's totally a tourist trap, but still very cool and offers up some great views at all hours, especially at night.

(-) This place is in a terrible neighborhood. Hourly hotels, liquor stores, and probably drug dealers and prostitutes can be found within a tenth of a mile of this place.
(-) Hit or miss with the staff. Some are ok, but a lot of snippy attitudes with some of them (especially at the cage. *cat hiss*)
(-) Despite what I have read on here, they will NOT let you go upstairs to Carvery 108 or Lounge 107 unless you are either a hotel guest or pay the admission for the tower tour. Epic Fail. Should be able to avoid this fee with a proof of purchase of some sort. Just another place that seems to believe that locals money isn't valued.
(-) my experience is that the machines have been pretty tight for me. I dont play table games at all, but those slots are tighter than a frogs ass!


I dont come here all too often lately, and every time I do I am usually quickly reminded as to why that is. With the sole exception of the tower, there is nothing the Stratosphere can provide that even a locals casino can't do better. 

Bring back Vegas World!! lol :P

2 stars.

Meh is right. I have definitely experienced better!

We had stayed here Thurs 3\/14- Sun 3\/17. My daughter had a soccer tournament in Las Vegas and needed a reasonable place to stay but also a place where the adults could have a little fun too. I was pleasantly surprised to have a nice room for the price I paid! The front desk was helpful. The housekeeper was friendly. Clean beds and bathrooms.  Flat screen tv. I would definitely come here again!

Stratosphere is pretty amazing.  It's a little bit away from the strip.  If you're staying on the strip like we were..it's woth taking an Uber or Lyft.  The best part of this hotel\/casino is jumping off the top of it. The Skyjump was amazing!  I'm going back in a few months and cannot wait to do it again..this time at night and I'm going to do it twice!  It was amazing!

Do not go to the Stratosphere! It is probably the worst hotel on the strip with the worst customer service. First of all it was my birthday and I wanted to get an upgraded room and try their "newly" renovated stratosphere select rooms and I was extremely disappointed. Yeah they are cheap and have the tower to draw people in but their rooms were disgusting. The shower was still dirty, I paid $100 more for a view of the strip and all I could see was the shut down Sahara hotel. On top of that everywhere you turned smelled like old musk and cigarettes. I understand you can smoke inside but other hotels we visited had very good ventilation and you could barely smell the smoke. The big deal about the Stratosphere is the tower which we could only visit once because they line to get it and up the elevators was an hour. They should have V.I.P for people who are staying at the hotel but no instead we waited an hour in line to get to the elevators and another 25 minutes to get up. We never got our room cleaned, and when I called to get it cleaned when I was leaving the room for the day no one came to clean it until 6pm when I already came back to the room. (Mind you I called at 6am) We hated the stratosphere so much that we ended up leaving and staying at Treasure Island. If you are going to Vegas pay the extra few $ and get your moneys worth. I will never step a foot in the stratosphere again! There shows are not entertaining, their food sucks, it smells, the fitness center is a joke, the rooms do not even have mini fridges so you can keep things cold, and the pool has a really weird smell and taste. Oh and on the website the first upgrade is for floors 14 & up well I got the 10th floor which is false advertisement! Do not go to the Stratosphere you will be highly disappointed!

Casino review only.  This place just bothers me.  The location is sketchy.  The casino has very poor signage.  The employees are unable to competently tell you where to go.  It's designed to just confuse the hell out of you.  I know this is the goal of most casinos so you will just give up and gamble, but please, I am not in the mood.  

Plus, they are constantly doing some sort of weird construction.  There is an escalator that goes up to the second floor, where you can access the top of the space needle thingy.  Which is the whole point of this place.  But there is construction so there is no escalator that goes down and no stairs, of course.  God forbid a casino provides non-emergency stairs.  So you must cram into a tiny elevator, complete with elevator operator, in order to go down one floor.  The claustrophobic in me protests.

All i can say, is from the last time i came to this casino, the inside seemed so dull and non inviting.  
Came here this weekend, and everything has changed.  Looks really nice inside. Open space, with a main bar in the middle of the casino..  Casino itself was as a good size.

I am doing three stars, as I found that there are real differences in the rooms here.  

If you do the "cheapest" rooms, you get a bare minimum room (like Motel 6).  On another trip, I had to upgrade to get in and it was a nice suite like room (kept thinking I was in the wrong place).  

This is off the end of the strip, and the low price brings in a different level of customer.  

When in Vegas on business, and going to be more in downtown this location is for me.
Great place to gamble and eat\/play at the top of the tower, but bad place to stay at a hotel.

Booked long time ago for 2 queen beds non smoking strip view room. Check in around 10:30 pm, told me it doesn't have my room type available. I have to either change to non smoking mountain view or smoking strip view. This is NOT acceptable at all!!! I hate this page, I would go to Luxor for same price level hotel next time. Stratosphere sucks ass!!!

Where do I begin...the Stratosphere is definitely not the Venetian...that's for sure!  Nevertheless, I found it to be a good bargain for the price, and as they say, you get what you pay for.  It's definitely not "prime" location on the strip, but I was satisfied.  We found a lot of funky places within walking distance.  Although I caution you not too walk to far too the left because that's the bad part of town (no seriously).

 Unfortunately there is only one word for their customer service, and that is TERRIBLE!  But the room was okay and the bed was comfortable, and we even had a "premium view" of a concrete wall!  But we weren't too worried about that because when you're in Vegas how often are you really in your room.  The Hotel also has a Mickey D's, a couple of cool shops, Ben & Jerry's and a Starbucks on the very top.  Their Buffet is excellent for breakfast, but I was a little disappointed came dinner time.

We really did enjoy their pools.  The 8th floor pool can get a little crowded and loud but the adult pool places good music, and a nice relaxing atmosphere...not to mention a HOT pool boy!

So, if you're looking for a five star hotel...THIS IS NOT IT!  But it's a great bang for your buck!  I would stay there again.

This hotel doesn't compare in any shape or form to others in Vegas. Location .. far from the strip. Everything in the hotel is outdated. The rooms and hotel in general has  poor ventilation. There are a lot of shady characters entering and exiting. The shops and restaurants there at best are okay. The management has awful customer service skills, they received two stars only because the bellhop service was fantastic. The bad yelp reviews of this place are accurate!

Just spent a weekend here and will say that you get what you pay for the price.  Yes, for the same price you might receive a little better amenities but this is Las Vegas so every little thing you expect from normal hotels is not complimentary here.  And what about this "resort fee" they charge.  Why don't they just call it a "In case you're not a gambler or don't want to experience our tepid thrills" charge.  Worst off, our towels weren't replaced and neither were the linens.  That's a big no no.

I guess the only thing that was nice was view from the top of the Tower.  Vegas please get on board with the rest of  the civilized world and pass a ban on smoking, please!

I was really worried about the room after reading all the negatives on Yelp. Yes it is an older casino yes the neighborhood around it is not the greatest. Yes the toilet sucked. But for the price and the low table minimums I was satisfied and would stay there again. I personally don't want to pay extra dough to stay at the Bellagio or one of the other big name hotels I would rather spend it on shows and exotic car rentals but that's just my opinion. If your looking for a cheap place and or are on a budget then this place ain't as bad as you read on here. Hint stay away from the tour of diamond resorts it's a trap and they are only after your money and it is terrible!

Great value!  I recommend getting a room on the 24th floor, which was recently renovated and still smells brand-new.  It was a very comfortable and nicely decorated room for a fraction of the price of other strip hotels.  What I loved the most was the 25th floor adult-only and European pool (i.e. top optional).  Despite the occasional "creeper", the pool was refreshing and so very relaxing!  No screaming kids and strong drinks make for a great sunning experience!

Serious, we booked our room ahead and when we got there they couldn't find our reservation and made us wait for an hour and a half just so they can find it, and all they said that it's the system fault and they only offered us $50 discount. Wtf like seriously? I drove 5 hrs to Vegas to enjoy my weekend and they wasted not only my times but also my energy. They also didn't accept fault and didn't even give a fuck about us. This ruins my trip and im late for my guestlist so I can't even go clubbing anymore. Thank a lot Stratosphere!!!!!! U guys should have better management and solve it better so we didn't have to give u shitty grade.

This has to be the worst customer service I have dealt with. The "Supervisor" Ricky was rude and deceitful. I would stay away from this hotel if you want to be treated like normal guest and not talked down too. The main Manager Robin does not ever call back after multiple attempts. If you have any issues, don't expect a resolution from this "staff".

I have stayed at the Stratosphere a few times - staff was friendly we upgraded our room which was nice - but they should just have showers - the bath tubs are so high its hard to get in also they should have security at the elevators anyone can walk up - we had flyers in our room everyday.

It's been quite some time since I visited this hotel. 

I just needed direction to the thrill rides and the closest spot I found myself at is at the concierge desk. 

There was only one person available and he picked up the phone and made a call right when I was walking up. He then gave me that "one second" signal. 

Not sure who he was talking to, but their conversation went about how he can't do (whatever it is) because he hasn't worked out in so long and that he may not have the stamina to complete it.

A line formed behind me. 

I left after a minute because there was NO sign he was gonna stop yapping up some non-work related issues over the phone. 

Ended up getting help from the cashier. 

Really?! You're gonna talk to your buddy about how you haven't worked out in awhile while you let potential guests wait?! Straight out showing some alarming levels of unprofessionalism. 

Ridiculous.

First of all: the hotel is NOT on the strip, it's not even walking distance to the strip...over 3 miles away. It definitely requires a cab ride (~$20 average) but still much cheaper than anything directly on the strip. That being said, it's a good deal for a Vegas hotel.

Check-in took over an hour. And this was at 1am so I can't imagine what it's like during busier times. They only had 2 people working the front desk despite the long line but the staff members themselves are really nice. There's a cute rooftop pool and a bar area, and I found the room to be really clean. There's a little mall-like area just above the casino with food, shops, etc. And the buffet was actually pretty good (for being a $20\/person buffet).

It's nothing fancy and definitely not as high key as Strip hotels but we paid $200 (including resort fees) for 3 nights so if you're looking for a good deal, this is it!

This hotel is far from the Vegas strip and all the action! I didn't know that when I booked a room at this place...
Check in was fast, but as soon as we got into the room we went back to upgrade to a better one. That room was old, no view at all, really small and feels ugly and dirty; the new one they gave us was almost $100 more per night but it was worth. The difference was great and you could even wave to people that was jumping from the roof as one of their attractions. 
The casino was ok except for this lady that stoped me and talked to me for over a hr like I didn't have anything else to do trying to sell some vacations, and I was tired just listening to her. 
The restaurant at the top floor of the tower is amazing, the waiter took great care of me and my husband. The food and the wine recommendation was perfect! They have this photographer there taking pics of your visit as souvenirs and they are really expensive! Even more than the food, due to the leather cases where they put the pics to make them look better. The restaurant is all in glass and the floor right under the big glass windows spin and it has this amazing view of Vegas.
There's a bunch of rites and activities you can enjoy there, but I didn't get on any of the rides because of the weather. They had to close everything for 2 days, so I never went back there after that and decided to visit all the nice hotels and restaurants on the strip!
They have a nice bar on the top floor of the tower and service was very nice and attentive. 
They have a bunch of stores where you can get souvenirs and a lot to do there at the same hotel.
I don't think I will go back to this hotel since they are too far from everything. 
I walked a lot the first 2 day so I decided to rent a car and I just started visiting different places all around, even the Grand Canyon. Parking is always free in Vegas!!! Woohoo! 
The hotel is not bad but it depends on what you are looking for and what you like.

Just have to start by saying hotel is nice but the first two employees we ran into we're the rudest !! No customer service at all !!! Place sucks don't waste your time or money ! We won't be back! We just wanted to check out the sky tower but you can't you have to pay !!! Sucks sucks sucks sucks sucks .... Don't go please listen to me !!! never again !!! Can't say enough sucks sucks sucks !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My boyfriend and I stayed here for four days. The check in line took forever. There was a woman next to us when checking in that was furious that the room she booked was not available. When they offered to upgrade her, she accepted. They then proceeded to tell her it would be an extra charge, when it was their fault. This should've have been a warning for how our stay would look. 

When we got up to our room there was a strong oder from the bathroom that smelled like sewage. We thought it would go away, but every time we entered the room, it smelled. The carpet smelled like piss. They either let dogs stay in the hotel and didn't clean it properly or it was a baby, and still didn't clean it well. The bathroom is ridiculously small. The sheets were still damp when we first arrived. They do not provide water like the other hotels we've stayed at and the fan in the bathroom looks disgusting. Roxy's diner is not very good and their buffet is only alright. The staff seems to be know of all of the issues and doesn't care. When checking out, we relayed the problems to the staff so they are aware and they only nodded, didn't respond, and asked for payment. It feels like this hotel is going down fast and the employees know it. This place will not stay open for long.

Stratosphere is great to visit for the tower view, however, I would strongly suggest visiting rather than staying. It's pretty far from the happening side of the strip and it's really not worth it. Hope this helps!

Worst fucking valet line ever. Even with a sign the lane is apparently "not for valet". I see no valet drivers either even though the security guy told me valet is still open!

As for the casino, this is the creepiest hotel resort I have EVER been to on The Strip! Like the Circus Circus, it caters primarily to the hillbilly and redneck tourists. Anyone who is not missing all but their front two incisors are either passing by or headed to the rides and bungee jumps at the very top of the casino.

Often you can gauge the quality of a hotel's clientele by the looks of the cocktail waitresses. If they look fucking old or octogenerian, and still wears the company-standard uniforms that shows WAY TOO MUCH (cover your fucking eyes!), then they probably cater to a group of gamblers that are mainly homeless on the penny slots. 

Personally, I use this place as a convenient parking spot for First Friday. 

The parking garage lanes are VERY confusing though. It's kind of like a very tightly wound maze that goes 20 stories up.

Worst casino\/hotel ever. They Racially profiled my husband and my friends. We were just on the casino floor talking about time shares when security walked up to us and FALSELY accused us of doing donuts on their parking deck and stated they had proof and had to leave. When asked to show the video, security just called casino management so they could say we were now trespassing and had to leave or law enforcement would be involved. They have ABSOLUTELY no video of MY VEHICLE doing any donuts and when being called out they knew they didn't have evidence so instead of looking like liars and incompetent they went with trespassing and that in the state of Nevada they don't have to have a just cause to brand us as trespassers.

very bad customer service. AC was not working. Finally agreed to give 1 day resort fee refund but didn't receive. No one is returning the call.  Whenever you call keeping hold for long after asking your name and reason for call.
Very tall, and a bit of a cab ride from the strip. However, it's totally worth it to go up to the top and just look down at the city or go on one of several rides that take you above Las Vegas.

Please do yourself a favor and don't stay here very dirty the hotel staff are extremely rude no customer service here whatsoever. They charge a resort fee for no reason it's not even a resort style hotel. For the price you pay you can get another hotel on the strip for about 10-15 dollars more with far more better service. So look at others who are posting here there experience.

Could not believe our luck when we scored a room for $20 a night 

(plus $8 resort fee, you just can't get around that in Vegad and it can easily be $20+ at other hotels)

Sure it is a bit dated but not like the ones in old town or anything.
Yes it is on the strip which is the reason we chose it, but a bit further out than we had remembered.

It was quite a walk to the actual strip and I'm asamed to say we didn't make it much past Caesars since we walked through all the casinos on the way.
Service is great, the rooms are updated and nice.

The views and fun stuff to do at the hotel like the skyjump or other rides are wild, we went up to the tower and took some amazing pictures and watched other foos jump to the ground.

Being at the highest hotel in Vegas looking out, all having paid just under $30 was a great nice and a wonderful Vegas experience.

What a wretched place!

A combination of weed, cigarettes, and alcohol! My family had a miserable experience from the moment we parked. Just look at the photos I took this past weekend. You can't make this up! 

I wouldn't recommend this hotel even to my enemies... and I have a lot.

Rooms were awful. As you can see in the pics we had blood on the wall, dust, and rusty hinges. The carpet was also filthy. 

The hallway smelled like weed. 

There was a naked homeless man outside of the hotel being restrained by police.

We got married here about 3 years ago, and man what a difference 3 years makes!

3 years ago this place was energized, exciting, it had a fresh faced staff that spoke english.  We hardly recognized the rooms, which had been re-done to make them SMALLER. Condos have gone up in front of the Stratosphere blocking the view, and making the neighborhood even more unsafe and removed from the newer strip which is moving farther south.  

It saddens me to give a low rating, and one extra star because it WAS a great place...but stay away.

This review concerns the poker room and the pai gow tables; I did not stay at the hotel.  The staff at the poker room was nice, but they did not have a game going in the middle of the day on a Sunday.  Eventually one started, but come on, run some promotions or something to make sure you at least have one table going in the middle of the day on a weekend.  The pai gow dealers were very nice and I had no problem getting a seat while waiting for a poker table to open.

This was my first time staying at the Stratosphere and before coming I didn't have high expectations due to the price. I wish I could rate the man at the front desk who checked me in separately because he was just simply amazing. After leaving the front desk though, it started to go downhill. The weekend that I was in Vegas the weather ranged from being 102-107, and the air conditioner in the room was more like a small fan. There were two beds in the room and the air could only be felt on the bed CLOSEST to the fan. Walking in the room, we were greeted with a stuffy, hot atmosphere. Also, the bathroom got overwhelmingly hot, so that we had to keep the door open while taking a shower so we wouldn't have a heat stroke. The bathtub\/shower was so high from the floor that I almost fell getting out of it at least twice, and NO I was not drunk. All in all, I would never stay here again it's too far from the strip and I've stayed at better hotels in Vegas that weren't that much more expensive.

very clean room with a clean, bright bathroom in a pretty good location on the strip--what more could you want for only $35 per night?  staff was helpful and the lobby\/casino area is nice and well kept.  you can actually get pretty liquored up even if you're just playing video poker.  i would stay here again.  some people hate it because it has a somewhat lower class clientele, but it's a good deal and having passes for free rides on top of the tower is cool.  don't hate ;-)
Great view up the tower. Should've tried the rides. If you're seeking for pump up your adrenaline, this is a must try.

I promised to post a review of the Pin Up show. It was really good. I enjoyed myself, so go see it. It lasted just over an hour and I was entertained the entire time. Lisa is the singer and she rocks it. Clair St. Clare was wonderful. Everyone was given the chance to meet the cast and take a picture with them after the show. They are the nicest people. 
The cost of drinks was high ($4 for a bottle of Dasani water)., but it is a theater in a casino.

Obviously you can tell you aren't in the Bellagio or MGM but I didn't feel like I was in a Super 8 Motel. Place was clean with friendly staff. Restaurant at the top was plain cool. I think I went up there 3 times every single day. Bungie jumpers were fun to watch

Since the only real attractions here are the thrill rides,they should call
it the Stratos-FEAR. I've never ridden on any of these rides and 
never will. But I enjoy watching other people ride them,and laughing
at their expressions of horror as they suddenly are face to face with
death. The rooms here are nice and you can always get cheap rates
even on a holiday weekend. Why so cheap? Because you're living 
in one of the scummiest dirtiest sleaziest neighborhoods in any 
American city. My advice is come here,go on the rides,puke and go
check in somewhere else.
Nice room,fun casino, Awsome Time!

Paid for package deal online. Showed up a couple hours before "check-in" and was told that no rooms were available unless I paid extra for the upgrade package. Said upgrade package was to get us a much better room and blah blah blah... long story short it was a total rip off! Buffet sucked and was a total rip off. Radius "roof top" pool was full of teenagers, Roxy's food was horrible and we ended up sending 1\/2 of it back. Had to pay taxi $20+ each direction to get from Stratosphere to other casinos + walk a long way. Been to Vegas 9 times and we will NOT stay at Stratosphere in the future

This place is a dump!! Do not stay here! After reading all the reviews me and my husband wanted to give this place a try, the first thing I did was check for bed bugs and luckily our room did not have any. First thing we got in at about 230pm and check in is at 3pm we asked to get in a early check in they said no! Wth! Most hotels will let you check in early, so that was strike 1, once it turned 3 we waited in the longest line with only 5 people at the desk we did not get to our room till 430pm that's how long the line was!!!!! Ron was the person to check us in and he was great but everyone other staff was very rude, strike 2 & 3. Once we were settled in we wanted to play craps and guess what the table did not open till 8pm!! What kind of Vegas casino does that?!? They offer no free play money when signing up, this place smelled and was run down. We will never stay here again unless it free :)

Hotel:

The big moment for me to go up the tower was the fact that I so desperately wanted to try the Big Shot. That's the ride that bounce up and down the needle in the tower.  Oh, but that's not how that thing works. Apparently I was not warned that it instantly shot up in the air like a rocket blaster and bounce back down like a yo-yo in a couple of times.

The adrenaline I felt was such a rush and had a freaked out moment when that thing shoot up in an unexpected way.  The X-Scream was awesome too as it try to drop you from over 1100 ft high.  That will cure any phobias that you have...or make one new.

The other ride was the spider like ride, Insanity.  That was OK, as it tilt 30 degree angle on the edge of the tower overlooking the ground.

Quality: *****
Decor: ****
Service:*****
Amenity: *****
Ambiance: ****

The tower view was breathtaking as you can see the entire city around the sphere tower.  It's an experience I would recommend if you were going to Las Vegas.

My first time staying in Vegas I stayed at the Stratosphere hotel and casino because I had no one to help me research a good hotel to stay in while I was there.....well let me start with the good.....the hotel you can see from anywhere in the city that doesnt sleep, and they have 3 extremely couragous rides here but you have to be nuts to get on those sky high rides that hang off of the hotel roof(they literally do!!) There are so many floors of fun things to do and places to eat, especially the buffets. The casino is saturated with cigaretter smoke and its not a good smell if you do not smoke, ciggarettes ofcourse. 

The downside to this monumental hotel and casino is that it is located at the end of the strip where the ghetto begins! It doesnt seem like it is too far from the strip but looks are decieving because it takes forever to the clubs, or the boxing matches. If I go  back to vegas I am staying at the Wynn.

Free is too much money for this place.

Horrible hotel. We were placed in a room facing the wall of another building. The rooms was incredibly humid to the point where it felt stuffy and hard to breathe. The shower was broken and the sink was backed up. The hotel's machines outside were noisy (the same as being next to a loud bus at a red light) and the ac unit in the room itself was loud like one of those huge fans. 
None of that was even an exaggerating. We chose this place last minute and were too exhausted to drive home\/ only needed a place to sleep, but barely got any sleep because of the problems.
Horrible staff!!!! Bartender constantly asking me if I'm playing (for comp drinks). my husband being accused of picking up someone else's money by the pitboss. Worst casino experience in Vegas!!!!

The hotel was ok. Kinda boring. Off the strip and a short walk from the lightrail. The rooms actually surprised me! I liked them. The views from the tower were breathe taking. It was freezing up there but I stayed because of the views. You can see the whole Valley!

My husband enjoyed the rides. I am too cowardly to think of such a thing.

I liked that before you went up the elevator in the tower they take your picture. My husband and I had some really nice pics taken. And you get to choose your background.

The staff was friendly and helpful. 

The Courtyard buffett was pretty good to me. The choices were limited but, the food was ok. 

The pool area was clean and spacious. It can get very windy on the deck though. They give you fresh warm towels when you walk in. They also have a workout center by the pool. Too many men for me! LOL!

Best known for the Stratospheres Amusement Rides in the sky! They all are creepy to say the least.  Rides are fun to watch while having a drink from the Sky Lounge. Or simply have some drinks in the sky with your special someone! You can make an evening of heading up to the stratosphere and enjoying some cocktails with one heck of a romantic view. The casino is standard, nothing to gawk at. If your already in the vicinity, do stop stop for the stratospheres', more than affordable, large buffet, down below.

If only I could go back in time and book elsewhere.

Not glamorous
Overpriced
Low class
Poor quality 
Rooms comparable to a shitty Ramada
Nothing nice
Would not recommend 
Would never book again
What a disgusting dump. Soiled jeans in lying in the washroom, transvestites offering BJs in the casino...and not the hot kind of trannys either. This place is awful !
The rooms need a lot of remodeling done some of the light bulbs in the room were going out lol not worth the money!!

Stayed there for 3 nights. Check-in was a nightmare: waited in line for an hour! Employees at front desk not apologetic, and not courteous at all! Reservation was for a deluxe room: DEFINITELY subpar!! Furniture very old and outdated, no fridge in the room, elemental amenities. Wi-fi reception extremely poor. Got an upgrade to a suite on 3rd night. At the smoking section. Room was stinking!! Apparently, no one has heard of air fresheners! Very unpleasant experience!

The Strat is underrated.  I haven't been in awhile but I was talking it up to somebody last night who was heading out there.

PROS
It's cheap* and clean, the pool(s) are really nice, the view at the top of the tower is amazing + table minimums are low most of the time.  

CONS 
Location is awful, if you like to hop from casino to casino factor in cab fare or rent a car.  I would not walk around the area at night.  DO NOT try to walk from the STRAT to Freemont Street. 

*A quick note to the handful of morons I've seen post negative reviews: EVERY SINGLE STRIP PROPERTY CHARGES ADDITIONAL RESORTS FEES.  They are not 'hidden' you just need to learn how to read.

The Stratosphere is trying but a long way from getting 'there'.  I booked this on an Expedia deal that included RT nonstop airfare from Long Beach to Las Vegas and 3 nights stay for under $200.  Had to jump on that.

With that said, I'm not coming back.  The Stratosphere is the hotel for 20 and 30 somethings that can't afford the Hard Rock, but with that comes some nice surprises.  I got a beer at the hotel bar for $1.20.  I thought I was back in 1990 when I got the bill.

Rooms are not very nice.  I had the upgrade room and shudder to think about what the non-upgrade was.  In house restaurants are not so good either and the tower bar is a hassle to get to.  You must clear TSA type security just to get up.  I gave up after 20 minutes of waiting.

Overall, this is better than a Motel 6, but not much.

Staff is nice and helpful but this place needs an entire make over to even have a chance at retaining business.
Employees are extremely rude and inconsiderate, rooms aren't that impressive kind of reminds me of a cheap motel

Uncomfortable beds, tiny cramped rooms, and too far away from everything. I guess you can't beat the price, though - hence the two stars. And the tourists are great to hustle at the poker table. Oh, and the blackjack dealers are all scantily dressed and dolled up - so that's a plus if you like that sort of stuff.

Interesting experience... this is a very barebones casino.  Don't expect water, a coffee maker, or any extras at all.  If the TV works, count your blessings.  But, despite it being on the north end, it wasn't the location that was the most irritating.  A tip- if you do stay here buy the monorail tickets- they run ever 6 min! You don't have to deal with traffic- that is great!  
The problem with this hotel was, they nickel and dime you... you want to check in early?- 15 bucks.  The rooms are below average and noisy... REALLY NOISY.  We did not get 1 good night's sleep.  You will hear everything, and we weren't the kind of people to go to bed early.  Both nights stay we heard slamming doors, yelling, running, talking... ALL NIGHT.  
Upon our check out ( we left at 4am) a naked 70 year old man jumped out of the hotel elevator.  We were on the 18th floor! 
When we went to the front desk there was one person working and she took so long to help us we had to leave without saying anything and ... despite being 2 min early for our tram they left us! I wouldn't use Bell Trans again.  
Do yourself a favor and stay right down the road at SLS... much Much NICER!

Really poor customer service I stayed here for 5 days they gave me a rate I asked the guy the next day would it be the same he said yes just come down and you'll be ok so I confronted a manager when the rate was not the same he told me sorry it's changed you want to stay or check out because the hotel is getting booked so screw u its busy low we don't need your business or care about what you were told pay more or leave I will never stay at this hotel again the proper thing would have been to say when I booked the rate changed daily \/ hourly to guarantee a specific rate one should book all at once otherwise we can't guarantee a rate not oh ok this is the rate were checking u out not the hotel is getting full so off to the flamingo I go where there is better customer service never again these two managers should be fired

Booked a room last minute for a great price. The hotel is a little old in feel and is far from the action of the strip, not my first choice. It is entertaining going to the top of the stratosphere to see the view and ride on the rides.

Probably the worst stay I've had (of many) in Vegas.  First, they charge a resort fee ON TOP of what you thought you had locked in and prepaid on Priceline (a site that does virtually nothing alert you to this abuse, never mind do the right thing: negotiate it into the price you think you're paying upon acceptance).

Second: no coffee in the rooms.  They say: "there's a Starbucks in the lobby," which is a hike from the north tower.

Third: the condition of the room is mediocre, and it looks like they skimp on cleaning and maintaining the common elevator area.

Fourth: they lay one of those housekeeping envelopes in the rooms, which is pretty dangerous.  It creates the incentive to retaliate against guests if there is no tip.  There is no such custom of tipping hotel housekeepers.  Are they being paid enough?

Fifth: the overall character and vibe of the place and the guests they mostly attract is pretty ghetto.  This place is a slum compared to most places on the Strip.

One way to avoid this place on Priceline is to not book at the three star level (even though this place probably classifies as about 2.5 stars), but a more direct way is to attempt direct negotiation with the hotels that do not charge "resort fees," which is what I will now do in Vegas until they disappear.

really disappointed, I had stayed before and was impressed. I brought my family and the rooms were like I was at motel 6 Hair still on the shower walls sink was clogged and the toilet ran for 5 min after flushing and the bathroom was extremely small. I notified management of my disappointments and all they offered was to remove the resort fee off one room. Needless to say I will not be returning and if you do choose this place upgrade.

This hotel is relatively cheaper than the others on the Strip. For one, it's located at the end of the Strip, away from everything, and in a sketchy area. There was always "police activity" outside the hotel at night. You have to drive to get to all the fun places on the Strip. They were in the process of renovating all of the rooms when we arrived, and we paid an up-charge to stay in one of the renovated rooms. We were less than impressed when we saw the room, it was pretty comparable to a Marriott. The view from the room was beautiful. We were up high and could see out for miles, and we also had a really good view of the people that were skydiving. Other than this, the rest of the hotel looks dated and dark. It smelled like cigarette smoke everywhere outside our room. I could tell that this place did not have the updated ventilation system that other hotels here have to filter\/mask the smoke smell. Because of this, we made a point not to spend much time in the hotel. We did eat at the buffet one night, and while the food tasted okay, a couple of us became ill by the next morning. If I had to stay in Vegas on a budget, I would choose a budget-friendly hotel off the Strip before I return to this one.
I always thought the stratosphere was a nice hotel until I stayed there recently. It was mediocre at best. It is also pretty far away from the strip so for the price it is kind of a rip off.

I got a good deal through orbitz- $155 : Sat\/sun & checked out Mon. 
Hotel is located on end of strip which I didn't mind since we had our own transportation. I enjoyed being away from the strip chaos and traffic. Friendly customer service was shown upon arriving. Check in took around 30min, room was on floor 11. Big room, with strip view, clean bed linens and towels and comfy bed\/pillows.

Room service was never completed bc we left the "do not disturb" sign but overall the cleanliness of the room and hotel was great. 

Buffet was nasty- 20$ each person. As a vegetarian there was shitty stuff to eat. The pastas, rice, beans, vegetables were low quality. Tasted like canned food. I was upset at the quality and the high price of the food.


14$ resort fee covers unlimited entrance to pool, tower and wifi. It wasn't a problem to me but I see how some ppl can mind this.

Overall, good place if u r looking for a cheap hotel where u will only care to sleep and see the view, rides.

Fantastic view of the city! I don't know why it took me so long to visit the sky lounge after moving to Vegas nine months ago. The lounge is on the 107th floor. The lounge doesn't rotate, but the restaurant below does! The best time to dine and get the best experience here is during sunset for dinner. Definitely bringing my guests here in the future! The berry-tini was delicious and the servers were very attentive. You can also order small plates too if you want to order a quick snack. I will be back for the rides very soon! Good job, Stratosphere!

Worst room ever so far in my life. We paid $100\/- night and still got the lowest floor (5th) n wall facing view. Horrible experience during check-in. I will NOT suggest or Recommend anyone this hotel.

This hotel at the very end of the strip which isn't a bad thing. The rooms here are from very basic to very nice. The basic rooms are motel 6 like and the select rooms are very nice, they have hard wood floors nice bath rooms etc. The casino is small but drink specials are nice. Overall I would say here of you don't mind not staying where all the action is at. And don't mind driving or catching the bus up and down the strip.

Terrible experience from the moment checked into the room. Shower rod were broken and sagging . I had to practically hold the shower curtain with my hand to take a shower. Maintenance guy came to temporarily fix the rod by screwing in anchors to hold the rod up. They told me they need to fix it after I check out which I'm booked for 18 nights. The front desk puts the customer on hold for 7 minutes.
I found out that the wifi only works in the room and not in the casino areas and even your own 4G phone does not work on certain areas of he Casino and no wifi at Starbucks.  I don't even use the facilities at all. I just think it's a rip off to charge the guest $28.00 per night for just room wifi. 
I mentioned to the front desk manager on duty on Sunday the 20th approximately 6:00pm and he sent a another maintenance guy up the room and he mentioned there's nothing can be done and also mentioned that the shower curtain was too short and that is also contributing to water leaking out to the outside of the tub. So the maintenance guy contacts house keeping to replace the shower curtain with the long one.  From the day one it was a miserable experience and yet the shift manager did nothing but it is what it is with no apologies what so ever. I will not go back to this hotel ever again and I certain will not recommend any of my 500 plus clients that I know to this experience at this hotel. The manager told me that it's because I booked with booking.com therefore can't do anything. I had to take the issues directly to booking.com.

The night we arrived we were told there weren't more rooms available. I requested a manager 3 times and she finally came outside and stated that they were gonna give us a room. Now all of the sudden a room was available. Well, the room was outdated, shower was clogged, and even worse the room was dirty.
The next day after my complaint the manager upgraded us to a better room. It was nicer but the hotel is far away from the main action on the strip. You either gotta catch a cab for anything you wanna do. The area is pretty hood

I've never written a Yelp review before, but so far this place has been shitty that I couldn't get past it and had to do something about it.
So after an 8 hour drive and arriving at 11pm, with 2 kids, we want to go to sleep.
FIRST...only rooms available are smoking rooms, and we didn't not request smoking room, and my son has special needs and asthma. They did offer me to upgrade to a suite but at an additional charge, NO WAY!  
SECOND, since we didn't want to upgrade for the additional charge, we had to either stay in the smoking room or have a room with 1 king size bed. For 4 people?!?!? Are you kidding me??? 
THIRD, since I don't want to upgrade and I don't want to put my children in smoking room I take the king size bed. I get to the room and call operator so someone can send us extra blankets so my husband can sleep on the FLOOR. I get cut off twice. I call operator again ask to speak to a manager, get transferred to front desk and wait over 5 minutes for my call to get answered and then the Front Desk supervisor gives me attitude that the reservation only said 2 people and not 4. NO WAY. Even if it did, at check in I told them there were 4 of us. 
FOURTH, we've been waiting for almost half an hour and our extra blankets aren't even here yet. 
My mother has worked in hospitality industry for over 30 years so I know what hospitality is and this is no way that guest should be treated, especially guests with disabilities.

Getting a call back from these people (Blanca) over a lost and found item is probably the worst experience ever, the tone and attitude of the people working at this hotel is of motel quality or worse. I would rather of stayed home.

I rated this 4 stars because I came here when I was a little girl and well let's just say I wasn't old enough to really do anything lol. But from what i remember, this hotel was pretty chill. The rooms were satisfying ( well except the window view, we got the back side of the hotel so we couldn't see the strip at all) and clean. Pretty small hotel and casino compared to others on the strip but when I come back I will be sure to get on the rollercoaster rides at the very tippy top of the tower. The pool is pretty big and it has a jacuzzi which to me was awesome!
I'll be sure to come back here (when I'm old enough of course) to experince it in a whole new way. =)

Very poor customer services and we moved from room to room because it was horrible smelling and dust every where they charge an resort fee for wifi n it doesn't work at all bathrooms are small they lie an tell you there are not any rooms higher than you prefer... Rude over bearing first time in Vegas an this is one thing I found an problem with.... Ask for a king got double beds like Wtf

We stayed here on our wedding night in a suite. So yes it was 4 years ago.
It was perfect for us as it was a suite and was located in the same hotel as we were having our meal. 
That said its not the best hotel on the strip and it is a way out from a lot of stuff. Perfect for our needs at that time ;)

On a recent trip to Las Vegas, I was pleasantly surprised by the Stratosphere. 

My boyfriend and I booked a deal with this place on the app Hotel Tonight. When you sign up for Hotel Tonight, you automatically get $25 free credits. The deal was $33 (including tax) for a king size room at the Stratosphere. Well, with my credit, I only ended up paying $8 for the room. Fuck yes!

The rooms are standard and no frill. There's some ugly shit on the walls which made me wonder if I'd like a hotel room better if the walls were bare. The size of the room was pretty big and the nice lady at the front desk put us right by the elevator. 

Noticing that the immediate neighborhood around this hotel was not-so-nice (even though it's on the strip technically), my boyfriend and I decided to just spend the entire time here. It was quite fun. Some readers may be familiar with my review of Santa Anita Park and know that I love a place where you can get all of your vices in at once. The Stratosphere kept us extremely entertained while getting said vices.

We went to the top of the tower which is free to hotel guests. We got drunk up there. We played the slots which surprisingly didn't take all of our money at once. We found a nice little store to buy booze and cigarettes (I don't smoke, but I guess I smoke in Vegas) right by the elevator. 

Basically, everything we needed was at either end of that elevator. 

I will definitely return especially if I can get a deal like that again!

not bad for the money, a deluxe room runs $59 with tax. It's clean, nice 42 inch plasma.

Your room key gives you and four guest's access to the top of the tower, 108 floors up and a spectacular 365 view of Vegas

Camped out for a week in one of the new suites on the 24th floor.  Breathtaking views from my room and the revolving rooftop restaurant!  Customer service in this hotel was excellent all around and my steak at Top of the World was one of the best I've ever had.  I also loved the little casino lounge as there was someone to talk to every time I sat and sipped wine by myself.  The servers were extra friendly, too.  My only complaint is housekeeping.  

Not sure why my room was not stocked with tissue or toilet paper but I had the Do Not Disturb sign on my door for the majority of my stay and when I did request service from housekeeping, they were routinely negligent when it came to stocking items in my bathroom.  Perhaps there's a one t.p. roll at a time policy?  Not sure.  But I sure didn't like having to track down housekeeping just to request some basics.    

I will definitely stay here again so long as they continue to treat me like a princess!  I love the unpretentious feel of the Stratosphere.  Two quick notes to self:  Check out pool, and bungee jump off roof!

We stayed here for 2 nights!!! Was initially impressed at the hotel because it looked clean and the room was decent! On top of that we were able to go up to the tower observation deck for free.

On our 2nd day, we left our room around 11am to continue exploring the strip. We left the "please service" sign outside our door to alert the staff that our room needs tidying. We came back later that night at 130am and got the surprise of our life! The room wasn't cleaned  at all. We called the front desk and their only explanation is miscommunication. They asked me if i want it serviced then. Seriously at 130 am? If you guys have done your job and cared for your guest i wouldn't have to complain about this! Asked to talked to the manager and his only response is "I'm sorry. I will send towels as soon as i can!" 35 minutes later we had towels and were finally able to shower.  When paying the kind of money you do to stay at a resort such as this, you expect the details to be taken care of. Especially when there is an additional $17 a night resort fee.  Very disappointed, will not stay again.
Great food at the buffet see the strip from above  make sure you get a caricature to remember your trip overall a good experience the city should do something about the area around it though.

This place is a hole. Let's start with arrival. First thing you hear when you leave the parking garage is construction, right by the casino entrance. Can't even hear the person next to you. Then, once you enter you're practically dragged over to a kiosk by someone who wants to give you 'free stuff", then you have to politely cut the person off when you state you don't want to hear their vacation package spiel. Checking in, you get charged a 'resort fee' (even after you've pre paid for a package deal) - you can pay $10 more to get into your room an hour before check in, or for $20 more (per night) you can upgrade to a room with a view. In hindsight, seeing the view we had, should have taken them up on that offer. On to the room itself. Basic, ordinary, nothing to write home about accommodations. Except, wait, what's that? No in room coffee, no exhaust fan and no extra blankets. All of which, Super 8, Motel 6 and any other cut rate hotel chains offer. The pillows were like sleeping on bags of rolled up t-shirts, and under the blankets, as soon as we turned them back the first night; a 8" black hair. My boyfriend is bald and I have blonde hair. EWWW. On to the bathroom, a rusty moldy HOLE IN THE SHOWER, mold and mildew on the shower wall, shower rings and curtain, as well as mildew on the counter top. There was a hole under the sink in the corner of the wall, and did I mention, no exhaust fan? Also, our toilet only flushed one out of three attempts. FUN! Plus, when turning on the sink, the water sprayed all over the place at such a high volume that my silk dress was soaked immediately and had to be hung up to dry before I could wear it to a wedding rehearsal. The hallways were dingy and there was a lovely build up of balled up trash and paper in ours on the way to our room. Check out - we go to the express kiosk and the pen is dead, I ask the bearded man (on his personal cell phone) at the end of the counter if I may borrow a pen that works and he snaps at me, "you don't need a pen, just drop your key in the slot". Oh, ok, because that's what it says on the express check out form, I mean, why have a form at all when that's all  you have to do? I snapped back that his help was less than tolerant and we left. Again, leaving to the beautiful sound of construction. I wish I could upload the pictures we took of all the nasty that our room had to offer. I travel all over for work, and the Stratosphere is the last place I would ever recommend. It was such a disappointment and clouded our experience, if you want to stay at a low end hotel for a high end price, then the Strat is for you - personally, I would have been happier at the Super 8.

Je dois dire qu'après avoir marché tout le long du strip du Bellagio jusqu'au Strastophere, quand j'ai réalisé qu'il fallait payer 16 dollars par personne pour monter au sommet, j'étais un peu verte...

J'ai hésité, hésité, hésité, cédé. Et oui, tant qu'à être à Vegas, autant y être complétement.

Un tour d'ascenseur plus tard, tout le monde débarque au 108ème étage ! Et là, c'est le gros gros coup de coeur. 108 étages, ça commence à être sympa, et la vue panoramique vaut vraiment le détour. Je ne suis pas du tout fan des attractions mais voir les manèges de l'Insanity tourner au dessus de nos têtes et quelques fous furieux sauter du haut du 108ème tenus par un cable, ça rajoute un petit frisson supplémentaire à la vue.

Après une petite balade au sommet et de nombreuses photos, nous avons même succombé au burger pas si mauvais que ça dans un des restaurants du sommet. La version cocktail du Air Bar doit être plutôt sympa aussi, je pense. 

Bref, si vous êtes à Vegas, je recommande, ça vaut le détour ! Et la promenade du milieu du Strip jusqu'au Stratosphere est longue mais sympa, vous y verrez plein des anciens casinos de Vegas.

!!! STAY AWAY !!! 
Doesn't even deserve a one star rating.
 
They say one price and later overcharge you 3X's what they said was getting charged to the card. Horrible service from bottom to top. After a 45 minute conversation with the manager, she never once apologized for their lies, miscommunication or their mistake. Not even after they "corrected" their error, did she apologize. Will NEVER stay, play or visit this location again.

Not a good experience for what i was expecting. If all you need is a bed and bathroom with a shower then this is the place for you.
Room doesn't have coffee makers. When I requested a coffee maker they said no only the suites get those. I called room service to get a cup of hot water- never got an answer, called a total of 5 times no joke. So I decided to call the front desk and ask for one, maybe there was a bellman available, but no, they told me to got down to Starbucks and purchase one. I wanted to check out before the first night had even started.

The one star I gave it is for the good view from the 108th floor. Otherwise this place is garbage, it's in the straight up hood and is a $30 cab ride from anything in Vegas you'd want to do. It's so far from the strip the taxi driver has to take the freeway to get you to the part that you actually want to be at. Stratosphere? More like Ghettosphere. Do not stay here!!

It's not a bad place, nothing fancy, not too crowded. North end of the Strip, so you need a car to get around. If you're driving into town, this won't be much of an issue.

Try not to get a room in the Regency tower. This is their oldest tower (from their Vegas World days). The rooms are small, the ceilings are low, and some furniture needs updating.

BED BUGS! 
BED BUGS! 
AND MORE BED BUGS! If you think they'll reimburse you, for an exterminator once you get home or any of the clothes you cannot wash, I'm sorry to disappoint you, because they will not. We even had pictures of blood stained sheets that were there the first time we walked in but knew they were probably just that, stains but clean, and had house-keeping change all our sheets later that week when we found actual bed bugs and took pictures of them in the hotel. 
The buffet's food is of poor quality and definitely not worth the high price, but we found their diner delicious actually. 
I wouldn't recommend staying here but I would recommend visiting, as their observation deck is actually something to see and their rides are quite thrilling.

Was not to bad for the price. Hot showers, air conditioning, soft beds.Hotel had a lot of restaurants open late and the gambling was fun. 
All I could say for the one less star is that the hot water in the sink smells like eggs and fart and also the buffet is not all that great they're only seafood selection was dry salmon  roxys diner cool but hashbrowns greasy and grey. Bartenders at bars were super attentive (you guys can have that 5th star ) plus ridiculous resort fee when pools only open 11am tp 5pm. The sandwich shop awesome. You guys rule. Little cheapy stores good for souviners. Cocktail servers on the floor doing the best they can. Valet . Otherwise may come back.

For the price of $18 a night I got a comfortable bed, and a place to sleep. I chose a smoking room with a mountain view and was rewarded with a 22nd floor room with a gorgeous view in the distance. Yes, if you look down, you will see the parking garage, but look straight to see the nice parts. 
Check in was very simple. They do add a resort fee per night but it's not bad and every hotel around here does it. If I wanted an upgrade it would have been $15 more dollars a night, not too shabby, but I passed. 
Free admission to the Stratosphere Tower was a nice bonus. I went up right before sunset to get some great city views & pictures. 
My one complaint is the showers. I felt as if I had to take a 20 minute shower just to rinse off as the water comes out with very little pressure. 
Overall it was a nice stay for the price. Nice choices for food, friendly staff. Definitely worth the $18 per night fee. I would stay again.

I've been to Las Vegas twice and both times I stayed here at the Stratosphere hotel. Even their most basic 'standard' tower room is very spacious and maintained spotless. There are many advantages of staying here. Their observation deck has the most spectacular view of the city. Their rides on the top floor are very thrilling and overlooks the city adding to the adrenaline rush! The last and the best of all is their lounge on level 107. Also, the must visit places in Vegas like the Bellagio, the Mirage and the Venetian are all close by and the easiest way to get there would be to take a Deuce that has a stop right outside the Stratosphere. This hotel also has 24 hour diners. If you don't want to spend too much money on the hotel and at the same time, you want a great stay, this place strikes a perfect tradeoff!

Views are amazing and the rides are nuts.  Yeah, it's a little pricey to ride the rides...but where else can you swing out over a city like this?  If anything, it's fun to watch people freak out trying to get themselves to go on the rides.  Had a blast!

Stayed for 4 nights in a Select guest room.  Room was clean, large and updated.  Did not try the main restaurants (a steakhouse, Italian restaurant and a 50's style diner) or the pool.   I did try the buffet which was perfectly fine and very reasonable ($21 for dinner and $18 for breakfast).  Food court was OK but could have had more options. The mall\/shops are forgettable--skip those.  Was super disappointed in the  "free" Wi-Fi though.  You get 1mb free, after that you have to pay $10 (per day I think).  Does anyone just use 1mb?  I'm not saying people should download movies or anything, but I probably use more than 1mb just checking my email!  I mean,  come on now. 

Still, I think overall Stratosphere provides a pretty good bang for your buck.  Reasonable price and service, free parking is super easy....I'd recommend it.

If you're looking for ways to cut corners on your Vegas trip. I recommend starting here. Don't let the negative reviews scare you, It's all about expectations. I booked through expedia and specifically chose it for the cheapest priced hotel with the best yelp reviews. I didn't want the fanciest hotel, just one that was clean. Stratosphere didn't disappoint. And the view from the tower is awesome! On a side note, the bellhop was great. We had a ridiculous amount of bags and he was really cool about it. He got to the room 5 minutes after I placed my call to pick the bags up. 

Pros:
*Clean Rooms
*Friendly Staff
*Free Tower Admission (Amazing View!)
*McDonald's\/Starbucks in Casino
*Located on Strip 
*Quiet Hallways

Cons:
*No Coffee Maker in the Room

Had some concerns because the Stratosphere was so far from the Strip but the prices were just too good to pass up!
Being far from the strip was kinda disappointing though, you cant just walk from one hotel to the other in less than a minute :(   And it was kind of in the ghetto...

The room was pretty nice and wasn't too outdated. there were nice beds and a good Tv. The bathrooms were really nice and had a lot of space. Room service was pretty good.

The Stratosphere thrill rides were fun and are a few bucks cheaper if you're staying at the hotel. The 360 degree room on the 108th was pretty cool too!

Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Stratosphere. There were no problems with our room but a disappointment being soooo far away from the strip. BUT the prices were just too good!

Recently, we stayed in the North Tower for several nights, and did not receive housekeeping services for over 48 hrs. We had the service sign on our door but still no service. Reported it to housekeeping and was promised our room would be clean first thing in the morning. We left our room before 7am & returned around 2:30pm. Our room STILL had not be cleaned. Called & spoke to the housekeeping manager on duty. She promised it would be cleaned after 5pm. Return around 9:45pm, room is cleaned but they did not fill the empty toilet paper holder & did not leave enough towels. Beyond disappointed by this point. We will not stay here again.

Terrible all around. The room we ended up getting was considered a "suite." What's interesting is that this "suite" happens to be located right next to the elevator shafts, which of course run all night long and sound like a freight train running up and down the walls all night long. Also, if you book a room with 2 double beds you are not guaranteed 2 double beds. What you get if this is not available is a room with 1 double bed and a pull-out sofa couch, which if you get stuck with you'd be better off sleeping on the floor. Overall, the room was nasty and kind of dirty. The surrounding area of the hotel (being in old Las Vegas) is quite creepy and run-down. If I were you I'd spend the extra money to stay closer to the strip, or somewhere else. For $45 a night I guess I should have known what I'd be getting.

Wir waren zum ersten Mal in Las Vegas, und haben das Hotel auch aufgrund des günstigsten Preises gebucht.
Sehr zu empfehlen ist das Buffet im Untergeschoss.
Das Hotel war sauber und die Zimmergröße war überdurchschnittlich.
Was uns aber gestört hat ist, dass das kostenlose WLAN sehr schlecht funktionierte. Wir hatten immer wieder Verbindungsabbrüche und nach einem halben Tag ist es auf zwei iPhones nicht mehr möglich gewesen zum WLAN zu verbinden.
Naja und jetzt noch zur Lage:
Das Hotel wird oft angepriesen dafür dass es auf dem strip liegt.
Als wir am Flughafen ankamen und Ein Shuttle Bus nehmen wollten, mussten wir aber 8,50 $ zahlen, also die Gebühr nach down Town und nicht auf den strip.  Da waren wir schon etwas skeptisch.
Wir wussten dann aber schnell warum wir die erhöhte Gebühr zahlen musste.
Das Hotel befindet sich ganz am Ende des Strips wenn nicht sogar schon außerhalb des Strips.
WM aber WLAN und die Entfernung egal ist für für den ist das Hotel absolut empfehlenswert, es war sauber und alle waren sehr zuvorkommend. Ein weiterer Pluspunkt ist, dass Hotelgäste umsonst den Tower besuchen können. Alles in allem für den Preis o. k. aber auch nicht mehr.

It seemed like nothing here worked. I called downstairs because the tv wasnt working, they said theyd send someone to look at it, after over an hour of waiting we called again and finally they came up and gave us a new remote. The elevator closest to our room was not working for some time so we had to walk to the other side of our floor to take the other elevator. The light in the  bathroom flickered for a while before staying on and was not worth it at all for the price, I would never come back here or reccommend this place to anyone.

This place could be better if it wasn't for the demographics. Place is kept clean but it doesn't last for long. Guests were loud and dirty;based from a personal experience on my floor. If you need a peaceful place to sleep well, do not come here. You will find a bunch of party folks of all ages.

My boyfriend and I came here for my bday last Friday.

The only downside to this casino was that there was no microwave or refrigerator in the hotel room. TSK. Aside from that, the room was clean; no bedbugs, clean towels were always replaced and the AC functioned properly. Wifi was ok as well.

The casino portion was fine, slightly dead for a Friday night, I am guessing because everyone else was at other casinos further on the Strip and the Stratosphere is waaaaay out on the end of the Strip. I won a little bit at the slots. 

We ate at Roxy's burger. Food was pretty good. 

I don't know if I'd want to stay here again, because it is so far from the airport and further from the action on the Strip. But I'd definitely play again here.

This is my best friend's favorite place to stay when in Vegas. The rooms are ok, it's clean but I wouldn't recommend as a "must stay there" kind of rooms like Venetian. I gave it five stars though for these reasons:

1. Top of the World- Had dinner here with my husband for our anniversary. The place was romantic, I requested a booth and enjoyed the view. The price was not over the top (pun intended) due to purchasing the dinner package. 

2. Level 107 Lounge- My favorite spot to relax and have a drink while having an intimate conversation. Make sure to visit during the happy hour though cause I seem to always have a $60 plus bill for two people when it's not. Also, the cocktail waitresses are quick and friendly. If you've read some of my post, that's very important to me ;-)

3. Slots- I win here every time! At least $60 and the most was over $500. Wheel of fortune by the escalator going to Top of the World and another by the rewards against the wall on New Year's Day. Won on the buffalo machine too!

Absolutely my favorite hotel and casino in Las Vegas! The check in staff are the friendliest and always helpful. The rooms are sweet and clean! The entertainment is top notch! From the new Michael Jackson Tribute to the award winning Pin Up starring Claire Sinclair and singer Lisa Marie Smith! The Top of the World restaurant and the Level 107 night club are top rated and the most beautiful views of the city. The newly opened Radius pool and wet bar style with awesome views and delicious food. I highly recommend your next stay to be here!

Disclaimer: I didn't pay for my room. A friend of mine was in Vegas for a wedding, and since I fly for free (airline employee) I decided to tag along. I asked about the price and it was less than I expected my friend had paid.

Check in staff were friendly and helpful, although the line to get checked in was ridiculously long and not terribly fast moving. The room itself was pretty much standard. I had a bed bug scare while here, but it turned out to be a false alarm. It's far from the strip, but honestly I enjoyed the walk (and Uber drivers are abundant in Vegas if you're not up for the hike), although the neighborhood gets a little sketchy if you wander off in the wrong direction (nothing happened, but keep your head on a swivel).

I can't be a great judge of the casino considering it's the only one I've ever been to, but I had fun and walked out $100 richer than I came in.

I Stood by the bar waiting for a drink while three other dudes walked up after me and were served first. When I was served, I wanted to put the charge on my room and needed to walk all the way across the hotel to get my ID. When I got back to the pool to get my drink he served me the original beverage that had been sitting on the counter with the ice melting in it (yum, watered down vodka). For God sake, don't serve someone a $9 watered down beverage.  

There aren't any employees capable of providing guests with the consistant hotel information. With regards to the events taking place upstairs on levels 107\/108. I had asked the following questions to numerous staff members including the concierge and front desk. What time does the top floor open? Is there a cover? Is there a dress code? Is there is there a club or only fine dinning? What time do they close? What nights are busiest? Do you need a reservation? About 6 hotel staff members gave me different information. No one was on the same page. So, during my 2 week stay I said screw it and went up there to find out for myself. (read tower review for the rest of this story).

One night I ate at the hotel's Italian concept Fellini's. WOW, this is by far the best food the entire hotel has to offer. I was seated right away and served hot bread with a carafe of Chianti with in 3 minutes. I looked over the menu for about 5 minutes before ordering the fettuccini and vodka sauce with shrimp and mushrooms. Not only did this entrée come out the door in 4.36 minutes (yes I timed it) but it was a marvelous dish. Extremely well put together and it made me want dessert. Just as wonderful was the red velvet cake. Everything here was spot on!

On the flip side of wonderful is Roxy's diner and it is in dire need of culinary help. This is one song and dance that's on verge of becoming the next episode of restaurant rehab. If you ever served Chef Irvin the middle melt burger which is what my server said was "the best thing on the menu" you would probably be about 5 seconds from a boot in the ass. I ate half of this soggy mess and most of it fell apart when I cut it in half. Trying to eat this thing was a chore. The shoe string onion rings should only be served on the sandwich not served as a side. I expected rings and got a ball of deep fried onion that was stuck together. No way was I going for dessert here. This was the best thing on the menu??? What a hot mess!

On the floor I stuck mostly to table games like Craps, Pai gow and wheel of fortune. All of the dealers were extremely friendly and really cool including the guests that took down $650 on Pai gow and the two guys that won $911 on the wheel of fortune slots. I had a good time gamming here but really wish there was more eye candy. The servers are really old and scary looking. They all carry with them this face that says I used to do drugs but now I just smoke a lot. Generally, the more one drinks the better the women look. Well, not so much at the Stratosphere. The more I drank the more scared I became. By the end of week one I remained completely sober and documented all the exits in pen on the back of my hand. Get with the times! Have you seen the gaming floor at the Cosmo? Even the Golden Nugget has a really nice pool going on...

Here is another real kicker... When I received the email asking me to complete the survey and respond to my experience online. I was told to be specific so I thought I would do them a favor and take 30mins out of my day to review them. I was willing to type out this entire post later to find out I couldn't submit it to them b\/c they only accept 1024 characters in the survey. Really? A hotel that is obviously behind the times and becoming the next shit hole on the strip is going to not allow me to give them a thorough review? Tell ya what then. I'll post this all over the web and just submit to you the links of where you can find it. 

If I were the GM overseeing this property I would change everything...

Service is good, the rooms are okay, the carpets are dirty with stains, the walls are paper thin and you can hear drunk people at all times. There is resort fee but there is no resort to be found. Its okay for a night's stay any more you will go crazy

I begged my friend not to stay at this hotel. The rooms are super outdated and the hotel is far from everything. You will end up spending way over $250 on taxi service alone. The hotel is a great place to gamble and I love the city view but that is about it. If you are trying to stay at this hotel to save money don't waste your time. We actually stayed in the renovated suite and it looked terrible. Mismatch furniture, outdated furniture, patches all over the wall, and one bathroom. The suites do not look like any pictures you might come across. Do yourself and trip a favor and stay in the middle of the strip.

Horrible service, from check in to management to check out.  Lost reservation, nasty attitude.  I've stayed there before and met my fiance there.  We were planning on having our wedding here, but, lol, think again.

Oh, and the manager asked me "What, are you going to give me a bad review??"  Yeah, the worst.

Ok. Honestly, I feel so bad for everyone that had an immense horrific time here. I really mean that because I didn't. I didn't have high expectations either though because I read all these horrific reviews, but regardless of that, I had a fine time at the Stratosphere.

I did not have any problems with the Stratosphere. My room was immaculately clean, I had a relatively nice view and passes to the top of the Stratosphere. Don't expect the Bellagio or Cesar's Palace when you go though, it's a modest one bedroom, a bathroom normal hotel room. It's like the Marriott of Oakland, Santa Rosa, and Napa. Nothing big and all that fancy, but clean and livable.

I've stayed in The Hotel at the Mandalay Bay and can absolutely see why people could be mortified that such a room existed in Las Vegas, but it was more than a $100 difference in price per night.

My only complaint is it is all the way at the end of the strip. Any further and you'd be in downtown, but me being able-bodied bought a bus ticket and just took it up and down the strip. Not the greatest way to see a city, but not too bad either. Sure beats the Oakland\/SF busses.

One of the things I do like a lot because they are in the nar corner of the strip, it's an amazing view up on top of the Stratosphere. Nothing even comparable especially by Paris' cold metal chamber Eiffel Tower look-alike top. I did enjoy that a lot. The casino part of it also gives you great rewards for little play.

So drive here or buy a bus pass for the duration of your stay. It's not so bad. Take a taxi if you can't tell if that was your girlfriend you just kissed or the guy trying to hand you stripper passes.

Why put the toilet so close to the bed? If you're kinky and wanna hear your friends icing the porcelain cake with chocolate frosting, then the Stratosphere is for you. I loved this place so much that I dripped puke all through their casino. One of my best friends slept on the floor with a coverlet as a blanket. And in conclusion, I ate the whole thing. This place hardcore sucks balls. I said it, cuz I'm classy like that.

My boyfriend and I stayed at the Stratosphere last week during our vacation.  From what I had heard from Yelp and from friends I was a little worried about a) the location away from everything b) the service and c) that it would be kind of crappy.  

I was pleasantly surprised by the experience.  We didn't have to wait long to check in, we got two doubles instead of the king we reserved (not a problem), the employees were helpful.  The room was standard hotel fare: simple and clean.  

Also, the actual casino was nice as well.  It wasn't as fancy as some of the other casinos but there was nothing to complain about.  Also, we enjoyed going to the top of the Stratosphere to ride.  Hooray!  We went before breakfast so we wouldn't feel sick.  We did the Big Shot and I felt better after the ride then when I took that shot of Patron later in the week.  

There was quiet a bit of walking.  We would walk to the monorail each day and buy all day passes.  I think this is a great deal if you get a good price on the room and don't mind a little walking.  We stayed at the Luxor later in the week and that was convenient because it was closer to the bigger casinos.

This was our home base for girls' weekend in Vegas.  We chose this hotel because it was super cheap, and knowing we wouldn't be there too much, we decided to save some duckets.  

This hotel is a little older, and pretty "ghetto" in comparison to those actually on the strip (Caesar's Palace, Mirage, MGM Grand, etc.).  Nothing fancy, the decor is pretty standard, and the shopping floor consisted mostly of Las Vegas gift shops.  

The room was just a standard hotel room, with one small sink.  A big disappointment was the lack of a mini fridge.  We had to buy a Styrofoam cooler at a nearby 7-11 to keep our beverages cold.  But the beds were big and very comfy.

Most of our days were spent at the pool, which they actually have 2.  The one on the 8th floor is all ages, and the one on the 25th floor is over 21.  Both pools were very lackluster, with no vegetation, slides, diving boards, or anything.  We spent the first day at the 8th floor one...tried to bring in our own vodka beverages, only to be denied and had to chug them before entering.  This was the bigger of the two pools, with lots of lawn chairs for laying out.  

The adult pool allows outside beverages in, but is much smaller with significantly less chairs.  However, it was never crowded, so finding a spot was pretty easy.  The downside of this pool (for me) was the 'bathing suit top optional' situation.  It just seemed to be a magnet for creepy older guys, who would just sit there and stare at all the boobs (even though most of them were not stare-worthy).  The bartender at the poolside bar would make little daiquiris and margaritas to pass out several times throughout the day, which was very nice.  

The one advantage of staying in a comparatively "ghetto" hotel, was that the food options were pretty cheap.  We had breakfast at Lucky's Cafe every morning.  The service was great, and the food reasonably priced.  They had a $5.99 breakfast deal available 24-hours a day, and lunch special for $6.99 available 11am-6pm.
