They are all over this place to the point that while eating at the Steakhouse there, we made the big mistake of taking a table in an area still in the casino, but outside the Steakhouse and while we were eating we were solicited by 2 panhandlers and one even took a handful of french fries off one of our plates. We told the waiter who only said "Yeah, it happens all the time". As you can imagine, my friends said they wont be staying there on their return to Vegas AND I certainly have no reason to go back unless I have out of town guest who want to go to the Observation deck. And even then it will be a quick "IN & OUT" and off to a Casino where we will not be bothered by a sea of smelly beggars & bums. The featured picture as I write this of a "hypodermic needle & syringe" says it all.
The worst hotel and casino I would never come back here again. If ur trying to save and u think its cheeper to come to this hotel ur wrong u spend on taxi even more.

The good: the view from the tower is amazing. The bartenders are excellent. The buffet is cheap and not bad, even cheaper with the player's club card discount. The place was clean, and the hotel staff were prompt.

The bad: obvious hookers, the neighborhood around it is an eyesore, the rooms are ugly and the noise of people opening and closing doors in the hall is as loud as if it were your own door. The TV remote barely worked, and reading other reviews that seems to be all over (couldn't guess why, I tipped the housekeeper to change the batteries). 

Overall: If it's cheap, then go for it. Otherwise, stay elsewhere.

I'm staying here for the All World Softball world series. Rooms are descent, but I'm fed up with the dealers who play blackjack and the slots. There is no character or even false friendship when it comes to the stratusphere hotel and casino. I've been here for 4 days and I can not count how many times I was dealt a split hand and could not hit on a card more than once or double down on a split of 10 or 11, with no ace dealt to me, once split. They offered me one card like a double down and not a split. It's my understanding that if you match the bet on a double down you receive 1 card, but if you split you can hit that card as much as you'd like until you stand or bust. As long as your original cards were not ACES! Finally last night I won on a slot machine with max bet of $1.25 (5 max bet) on a spin wheel much like wheel of fortune. I pressed the spin button and as it spun it came to rest on 200 credits, but then froze the machine. The wheel didn't continue to spin but the ball did, with 200 lit up. I called for service and they stated that this is what happens when the machine is tilted. They restarted it and it came to 200 once again, then again they restarted it and it came upon 50. Once again same scenario 50 , and once again , but then it landed on 20. They said the machine needs to reset to give you you're accurate payout, which was 20.....Really how did you get from 200 to 20 with 4 restarts of a machine....? They argued with me so I stated I'm cashing out and I'd never come back. I hit the payout and it only paid me for my credits that I deposited. Long story short. I wouldn't stay at this place. Customer service is terrible on the floor of the casino. They're cheats and all they care about is there $, which I understand but C'mon this was a couple hundred dollars and not thousands. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Stay somewhere, where the customer is treated great and the dealers know the rules of the game, the slots are updated to run correctly and you're not criticized when they dont. I give this place 1 star because the maids were the only people that did their job and everyone else failed.

Outdated but nice Hotel overall! Their buffet is not good, but their are other restaurants in the Hotel! Their is a restaurant that is on the top floor that is very nice.... It slowly spins & you will be able to see the highest view of Las Vegas! BEAUTIFUL VIEW! The resturant is very upscale. There is a photographer that will offer to take pictures! Beautiful pictures! The restaurant is very expensive! $50 minimum per guest but it was worth the experience! 

I won over $700 for my birthday in the Casino so I can't complain! I really enjoyed my stay! The rooms were plain but perfect... Nice & clean!

The room was not as pictured....AT ALL. "Strip view" that I paid extra for was really mostly just the roof top, an empty pool, the area inhabitants and a run down apartment complex. It is far from everything and enough into skid row to make you feel uncomfortable walking anywhere.  The front desk is impossible to get on the phone.  Had to wait in long lines in lobby to check in and ask questions.  Everything required headache and hassles.  Always got the feeling the intent was just to get you to go away. The "free wifi" was really only free for your first 24 hours. 
The only thing positive to say is that although rooms outdated they were clean, bed comfortable and the night views and food at Top of the World were great.
In the end, I would not stay here again.

one word: atrocious

* I ended up cancelling my reservation before I even checked in... the location isn't accommodating (vacant motels across the street), unfriendly staff; doesn't look or feel safe.
I wouldn't recommend this place to stay!!!!

stayed here about 9 times over the years. changed owners at least twice & i don't dig the current ones.  last time, i gave them a poor rating on their comment card & no response(i hate that).  one of the things they did , was change my room key code & i was locked out at an inconvenient time.  had to go downstairs & wait to get it corrected. buffet is excellent\/tasty. casino is hip--young patrons, cool live music at nite, cool bartenders. fun sportsbook.  pool is awesome & so is the top floor.  they don't comp me enough & the neighborhood is fulla crackheads if you venture off the property.  i'd stay here for free, but not the 30 spot they want sun-thurs.

I stayed five days and unfortunately this casino\/hotel is not decent.  For starters  it's not a very safe place.  I saw two incidents in the 5 days I was there, the parking garage is dark, they also had power outages and there is a lack of security.   To make matters worse, they are prepared  to hustle you out of more money.  I had requested  a King and they claim their website informs you they may not be able to accommodate your request but for $15 more you can have a king.  You would think you're  getting a bargain buy you'll  spend more there then staying on the strip because you'll need to rent a car.  You're  not going to want to walk or take public transportation around that area at night.  There are a lot of warehouses in the area making the streets dark and empty, just making a right at the garage puts you in the getto.  The quality of the food they offer in most of their establishments is low and Al thought their rides are nice, you can stop by while staying in a hotel.  I believe  this place was once interested  in taking care of its customers and providing a valued vacation but I think it's on its way down and living off its heyday past reputation.  Trust the last few reviews claiming it's not worth it.

We stayed at the Stratosphere over Thanksgiving weekend this year. I had a "Select Tower" room. Guaranteed view, right. The select rooms are all updated\/new. The room itself was very clean, the mattress was awesome. I don't normally sleep well in hotels, but I slept very well here. The walls are paper thin and you can pretty much here every word and cough of your neighbor, but luckily we had pretty quiet neighbors. 

So we checked in at night, and I had been guaranteed a view of the Vegas strip. When I looked out the window, I was totally disappointed. No strip. Because of the way the Stratosphere is situated in relation to the strip, there would be very few rooms that actually have a view of the strip. Most of them are more like partial view because the strip curves around, and the buildings in front of the Stratosphere block the view of the rest of the strip. So I was like...really?? That's it? HOWEVER, when we woke up in the morning, and opened the curtains, we were very pleased with the view because you could see the mountains, and it was quite lovely. Just not a spectacular lit-up night view, but mountain view--nice!

We ate at the buffet while we were there. It was just okay. Not spectacular. They do have a carving station that offers prime rib, and that was good. Also had some nice salmon and sushi. But they stopped serving the sushi well before closing, so we only got a few pieces, and it was just okay sushi anyway. 

We had breakfast at Roxy's, and it was nice good diner style food. Plenty of it! We rolled out of there stuffed and satisfied. The server was super nice. 

The best points of the Stratosphere:
1. If you are a guest at the hotel, you get free access to the top of the Stratosphere for the spectacular 360 view of Las Vegas. So fab!

Oh. I guess I didn't have to number that list. Because that's basically it.

The worst and the reason I'm only giving it three stars:
1. No coffee maker in the room. ARE THEY KIDDING? I am guessing it's because there is a Starbuck's on the casino level and they are steering people there. That Starbuck's SUCKS by the way. LONG line all the time. I just wanted a cup filled with hot water and they charged me 75 cents. I took the cup back the next morning for a refill of hot water and they claimed they couldn't do it because of "health regulations." Really? Putting hot water in a cup is a health hazard??? Charged me another 75 cents. And I had to throw out a perfectly good cup from the previous day. Waste makes me sick. 

2. The pool and hot tub (outdoor and not fancy or impressive at all) closes at FIVE. Because it "gets cold out there when the sun goes down." NO KIDDING. That's why I want to sit in the hot tub! Der

3. No mini fridge in the room.

4. No free wifi. Seriously? Even Motel 6 gives you free wifi! You can have highspeed internet while there FOR A PRICE. 

This hotel is at the far north of the strip, which is fine if you aren't into being at the center of action. But you will either have to walk a lot (which is probably a good idea because you are in Vegas and most likely pigging out and eating way too much), or drive. Driving down the strip is so nuts. It's like being in NYC. Rude honking drivers all up and down all over the place.
Stratosphere is my favorite place to stay in Vegas. They have Starbucks and McDonald, various restaurants and selection. It's away from the strip with all the overcrowded people and traffic.

I was really torn about this review, our first room left a lot to be desired, However we were given a different room which was much better. The pool staff were amazing and we had a great time there! We tried to eat in the Stratosphere restaurant up top... and that was a disaster!  The staff associated with that with the exception of one person were short and rude. Our waiter saw that we already had drinks from the lounge and just walked away half an hour later he still hadn't returned. We ended up leaving with out having dinner there. We ended up eating in the Italian restaurant - That food and Service were great. We also ate in the steak house and diner - both were awesome!
Great hotel just wish we had reserved a suite as only the suites have jaquezis,next time!

My group and I stayed here for our most recent trip. I booked through HotelClub for a really cheap price, which didn't go through at first which got me stressed out, but then that situation resolved. The hotel itself was pretty massive and had tons of games and restaurants. I was happy they had a Fat Tuesday there! It was really nice that our package included free admission to the top of the tower! The view was beautiful especially at night. Unfortunately I didn't get to go to the bars or restaurant up there to really experience the hotel. I did get to see someone free fall from the 108th floor though, crazy!

We got the most standard room, which wasn't too bad. The ventilation wasn't the best though, it kinda made our room smell bad. It was nice having the sink separate from the bathroom, but that made the bathroom itself a bit too small. The bathtub was pretty high for some reason so I had to watch out every time I got in and out of it. Beds were comfy for the most part. The walls and doors seem pretty thin though because you can pretty much hear what's going on outside of your room. I wish our room had a fridge though.

The hotel is still located in the strip but at the very far end of it so we still had to take the freeway to go where we wanted to go. We only wanted to stay here because it was cheap and only needed a place to sleep and get ready so not too much to complain about. The tower access was definitely a bonus! I would give this place another shot but on our next trip I'd like to stay somewhere closer to the strip.

If you want to feel like you're on top of the world, or at least on top of Las Vegas the tip top of The Stratosphere is where you want to be.

My Maid of Honor was visiting from out of town and the one thing she wanted to do was visit the Stratosphere. At first I was really confused, like out of everything you could do here in Vegas this is your one request? But of course we took her and I'm so glad we did!

We went at night and looking at how beautiful Vegas looks from way up high really makes you sit back and tell yourself wow, like I truly live in a beautiful spot.

If you have company and their looking to do something fun or even if you're bored and looking for a fun date night this is the spot.

Yeahhhhh.... this is one of those places that's good to stay at when you're a (insert underage number)-year-old with family members on a first or second time visit to Vegas.   Which I was, when I stayed here years ago.

That said, I still remember what I did distinctly.  Place is too far from the rest of the Strip, but the rides at the top of the tower are pretty good.  Probably a good way to treat a fear of heights, which I attempted to.  Ugh....f**king shivers. ..... Probably not a good idea to put your grandma on one of those rides.  Or staying at this place if you plan on getting wheelchaired blackout of the MGM, or something of the sort.

The cheapest hotel for a Memorial Day weekend.  I dont think I would come back here.  The sink water had an odor and tasted like burnt rubber tires.  Ewww I cant believe I brushed my teeth with that water!!

We had a fantastic stay at the stratosphere, just like we always do.  I've read other reviews, so let me attempt to clear some things up if you are thinking of staying here:

If you've been browsing hotels, you've seen they average $150 - $300 a night on weekends.  The Stratosphere is usually much cheaper than this, and there's a reason.  This is not 5 star, the furniture is not made of mahogany, and there won't be a butler to powder your bunghole.

However, for the cheap price, this is a great place to stay if you're on a budget.  The remodeled select rooms are a MUST!!  The cheaper deluxe rooms are outdated and quite ugly, but the select rooms are very, very nice in comparison.  Pay the extra few dollars a night and stay in the select room, you won't regret it.

Be aware that this hotel is at the end of the strip, away from all the action.  A cab ride is necessary, unless you're up for a bit of a hike (roughly 1.5 miles to where the action begins).  I prefer this location.  Vegas is VERY crowded on the center of the strip, and I hate trying to navigate through crowds all day and night.  The Stratosphere is much more mellow, with quick bar\/restaurant service as a result.  If you WANT to be immersed in the chaos non-stop, don't stay at the Strat.  If you want to return to your hotel and have it be less chaotic, consider the Strat.

If on a budget, the casino is perfect.  $5 minimums on table games and endless slots.  Keep in mind that while places like The Bellagio and Aria are much nicer, you will be forced to place much higher bets ($25 minimums on many tables).

All in all, I hope this all paints an accurate picture of what you should expect.  I recommend this hotel.

First of all, my wife and  I live in Vegas. I work for Clark County. I made a reasonable request. I wanted a non-smoking room. The first 2 reserevationis taccepted my request without question, accept they kept on dropping my calls during the reservation. The third time, a narcisistic reservation agent (She seemed to apologize but turned around and said they never drop calls), quoted policy and procedure and said that she could not guarantee the other request. She gleefully handed me over to her supervisor. He backed her up and offered a refund. I have been going to the Stratosphere with my wife for seven years. This was to be our seventh wedding anniversary there. We were not asking for a bottle of champagne or any special favors. Everyttime we have been there, they had to move us to another room because something was always wrong, smoke filled rooms, toilets broken, broken a\/c. Thanks Francisco! You admitted your company doesn't give a crap about it's customers!

Very nice hotel but getting to the rooftop attractions is a few elevator hops to the top. Rides are fairly priced and worth the money to ride. Definitely gets your heart pumping. All in all worth the trip to see the tallest building west of the mississippi

The hotel sits at the end of the strip, which is nice because you can view the strip and city from the Stratosphere Tower.  The Stratosphere Tower was the high point of our vacation.  Viewing the Las Vegas Blvd  at night after a fun-filled day was peaceful and relaxing.  The staff in the Tower was friendly and helpful.

The hotel staff was not as friendly as the staff in the  Tower was. But with that said,  The hotel has a Starbucks which was a nice way start our day, but pricey. 
We didn't play at the Casino at all so I can't review it.  I can add that it was well vented and we didn't suffer from the smokers, as we walked through it daily to get to our other Casino destinations.

The hotel is old but is in the process of being renovated. Our upgraded room was clean with the exception of the bathroom floor.  I'm not sure how they clean it between guest but I got athlete's foot from the dirty floor.  Our room was on the 12th floor and we had a great view of the mountains. We came back to our rooms nightly and found the clean and ready for us.

I guess their right when they say you get what you pay for. The moment we checked in we got a room that was currently still occupied so we had to go back to the hotel registration and get checked in to another unoccupied room. BTW, I had clearly asked the hotel agent if the room was available to be checked in at the moment and she said yes. The employees were not sorry at all. They were giggling, talking and being very unprofessional. The hotel room is very basic, be mindful that it doesn't include any coffee makers or fridge. So be prepared. And lastly the view is terrible and it is far from the strip. Long story short, if you are just looking for a cheap place to sleep in with poor customer service then this is the hotel for you. Next time I stay in Vegas, I will pay a little bit more and stay at the Luxor.


FYI the housekeeping never cleaned our room during our 4 night stay!!!!!!!!

It isn't great but it isn't aweful either. I would have to classify The Stratosphere as a lower to mid level Casino\/Resort as it isn't swank yet it isn't the worst though it could be better. The rooms are cheap (when it comes to Vegas, that doesn't count for much though.) Basically stay here if you must but if you absolutely have to go to Las Vegas I would recommend booking early or getting a cheaper place as I paid 210 for just two nights. Be prepared for an underwhelming experience at an underwhelming resort. The only thing this place has going for it is its tower, other than that I would advise travelers to go to locations closer to the strip.

I've been to Vegas many times, and was in town for a friend's birthday.  The hotel prices were unexpectedly higher than usual, so we got a fairly good deal at the Stratosphere via Priceline.  Since you aren't in the room often, we didn't think much of it and were happy with our choice.  We were wrong.

The first room we booked was awful, and looked like it hadn't been remodeled since the hotel opened.  Thus, we ended up having to pay an upgrade, which was better but still not great.  While we paid a reasonable amount, we still paid too much (almost $100\/night) for what we got.  Also, the Stratosphere is so far north on the strip, so you pay more with uber and cabs anyway.  Definitely a learning for this time around, and will look to book other options more centralized on the strip next time.

The two good things about the hotel is the view from the Level 107 lounge (breathtaking) and the McDonald's that is open late.  The views alone would be well worth the visit if you're passing by.

Going to the Strat is like going downtown but a tad bit classier I guess. Not  by much at all though. Surrounding area of the hotel is in shambles, far from the strip and the casino floor is small. People are very nice though. If you are looking for a place to stay for a clubbing trip, this surely isn't it. If you are looking for a place with fantastic access to other parts of the strip, it definitely isn't it. If you are looking for world class cuisine and service, this isn't it either. 

Why the heck did I come here then? Friend got room comped, enough said.

The rooms just aren't that great here.  It's like a motel room in a hotel.  The jacuzzi suite rooms are definitely nicer but still nothing to write home about.  I didn't really care for the casino either and didn't really gamble here.  It's in a convenient location to quickly get downtown or visit the Strip.  If it's my choice, I'll most likely never stay here again.  For a decent priced Strip hotel, I'd rather stay at Tropicana.

What a beautiful hotel with great service. Stayed here two nights in a suit and everything was perfect. Had the best house keeper I think his name was Estaban. Saw two shows here one was Frankie M it was fine but there topless vampire show Bite was nothing but amazing.

Stayed here in Sept 2016. I was not aware that it was 20 min away from the main strip. We spent $200 in uber taking rides down there. Should have just splurged on a room in the heart of the strip. 

The property is on the verge of a bad Side of town, drugs, homeless. We didn't spend much time there.

The hotel isn't bad, it definitely needs a remodel. You have to walk thru the casino which is heavy with cigarette smoke to get to checkin and elevators.

We didn't bother with dining in, we used room service. We wanted to stay away from the casino smoke. Food not bad.

Overall, not a great hotel, not a bad one either, but won't stay here again.

This is a review for the stratosphere restaurant that spins around to give you a vision of all of Vegas.

Food was decent, I had lobster ravioli but on second thought that was probably a bad decision since it was $55 meaning I could have purchased 1-2 full sized lobsters and ate that instead...Anyways the prices are pretty high, expect to spend around 40-60 pretip\/tax.

A good place to stay if your on a budget but a better place to just visit for the afternoon on they way to downtown as its along the way.

THE HOTEL
As a guest in the hotel its a good bet if your super value conscious. Hotel rooms are a steal especially if your willing to stay in the oldest little tower. I much prefer the small price upgrade to the newer tower. Ceilings appear taller and they seem bigger overall. There is a rooftop pool that is small but somehow pleasant. I like how you can look out since your at an elevation. There is some wind - which you don't get on a courtyard type pool and you get to look at the Stratospehere Tower up above. Its a fun place to be.

THE CASINO
Strato has been known to have single zero roulette. Those are some better odds and it becomes more crucial if you plan to sit at the table for any length of time. Blackjack has lower table limits than center Strip. Machines are hit and miss.

THE NEIGHBORHOOD
Well, you've got the old Saharah across the street, (I can never remember the new name of that place) Circus Circus next door and the unfinished Hilton Time shares nearby too. The foundation of the unfinished FountainBeu across the ways too. If you've got kids who like the midway this is an outstanding location. If you like Downtown it also has a small advantage.... nowadays it takes 30 minutes to drive down the strip with nonstop traffic and gridlock around the clock. Was I the only guy who enjoyed Vegas during the recession when it was less hyped up?

THE TOWER
Have to mention this - I try to force myself up the tower at least once every few visits to Vegas. It never get old the breathtaking view. I love the speeeeedy elevator up. Its incredibly fast and there is an elevator person there who has a cool elevator speech of fun facts. Dinner at Top of the World is expensive but lunch is a steal. Observation deck is a must. With the altitude the weather feels different way up there. Its a 110 or 100 stories up - something like that... the next closest thing is the kidney bean new Rio tower but that is only a small fraction. Paris is about the same but it is directly across from Bellagio Fountains which adds a certain something.

CONCLUSION
I like to spend 2 days center strip and 2 days downtown on my visits to Vegas. Kinda crazy checking in and checking out for a short 4 day visit but that is my preference. Keep things fresh. If you want to get the best of both worlds and are very price conscious just stay here for the duration of your stay.

So, Our hotel of choice was The Stratosphere Hotel. I wasn't aware it was closer to the Fremont Experience than it is the Strip which, we learned further into the trip, wasn't ideal because the Uber service didn't work so we were forced to take the $25 cab rides everywhere we went, every time we went somewhere, which was multiple times a day. First Impressions were not welcoming or comfortable, the surrounding neighborhood the hotel is in looks very unsafe. The people walking around looked like drug dealers or drug addicts, the houses, the blocks, etc. all looked like ran down. I felt very unsafe driving nearby the hotel leaving or returning. It also seem as though these people in the neighborhood were able to just walk into the casinos & the hotel lobbies, made me very uneasy.

Besides the appearance, Check In took longer than desired. Being that it was Saturday Evening, there should've been more receptionists to check in guests quickly and efficiently but that wasn't the case. After checking in, we walked our way to our designated room which was revealed to be a totally different room from the photo'd one through Orbitz. The room looked like belong to a motel instead of the Stratosphere. I was outraged with a Dinner Reservation in 2 hours. My Wife tried to fix the situation going downstairs to stand on that long "Check-In" again to get a ridiculous quote to change rooms & how we'd be better off staying overnight & changing rooms the next day. Well, the night we checked in was the night that mattered the most (My Birthday) so we decided to stay as we wouldn't be staying in there most of the trip anyway. Everything about the room was outdated and I couldn't stand it. The hotel's amenities were great, the restaurants and late check-out fees were reasonable. The best parts of our hotel stay was the Hotel Rooftop Pool, the WiFi, the convenient Text Messaging directly to Guest Services & the many Food Options. Unfortunately, I probably wouldn't stay here again.

I stayed at this hotel because I went for a friend's birthday and we had a hook up on the rooms and for the night club there Polyesthers. Hotel is on the seedy side of the strip and the neighborhood that surrounds the hotel on adjacent side of the strip emphasizes the word HOOD as we could see police activity pretty much any time of the day or night from our room window. 

Rooms were just ok, and walls are super super thin. My buddy and I went back to the room to take a nap because we were super drunk and then we started to hear the couple next door going at it, headboard banging against our wall and lots of moaning and yelling from the female involved. Well at least she was enjoying herself, for how long? not sure as my friend and I started to bang on the wall yelling stuff like ride her like sea biscuit, hey cmon it's vegas. 

Now for the night club Polyesthers, the plus side to it was we had bottle service and VIP section due to our hook up and the club itself is pretty cool in the sense of the whole retro flashback thing with different rooms like for music of today, 70's and eighties. The downside to this club was that we were there in July and that weekend we were there the air conditioning in that club was literally broken and was a sweat box. I mean they brought in big fans but all did it was blow hot air with all the body heat in the room. To me I just think you should be on top of you A\/C in Vegas and if it breaks you better have someone on call 24-7, just my opinion people. 

To play devil's advocate and say something nice about this place I will say the food and stuff was pretty cheap.

The only way I would stay here again is if it was the same deal where it was a bachelor party or guys trip and we got a hook up.

Horrible horrible horrible.

- dusty room and old heating system
- water sink, bath tub clogged
- other guest room's sinks and toilet clogged led to  somebody calling my room to ask for a permission
- thin wall - could hear noise from hallway, next door room
to come in to my room at 9am while I was sleeping
- front desk doesn't care all sorts of bad experience
 - far away from core $20-25 cab ride one way
- after next door guest room's clogging situation was repaired, all the dirt came to my bathroom so gross

Also I paid $170 per night for this motel like rip off hotel - great! 

Not recommended

Housekeeping started knocking at the door (and entered the room) at 09:08am even though the checkout time was 11:00am. Complained with the manager, who did not help at all. He told me that "this is how they do things"....the shift starts at 9:00am and they start knocking at doors regardless of whether you checked out or not. They need to do so because they have 3000 rooms to clean and they will not make it otherwise. Wow!

I know this is an older strip hotel, so I should give it the benefit of the doubt....but really. I expected better quality than I got. What we got was not what was advertised to us. And the room service food wasn't good- the French Dip Sliders were decent (redeeming qualities were the buns and the dipping sauce) but the Macaroni and Cheese was god-awful! Some of the worst Mac-n-Cheese I have tasted in a while. On top of the fact that they lost my boyfriend's reservation. Also to be noted- for the money you save by staying here, you end up paying in cab fares to and from the strip action. One-way to the airport is $30. Just something to think about before you book your stay.

I've stayed at the Strat at least once a year for the last five years.  This has always been an out of the way hike from the main strip, but it used to be a cheap and fun place to stay.  Sadly I've seen a steady decline at this place.  The closing of the Sahara down the street seems to have hit this place hard.  Five years ago this was a cheap place to stay with a lot of entertainment right in the building.  Now it's only good for a cheap place to stay if you plan to spend your days elsewhere, especially if you have already seen the view from the tower.  The current owners bought this place about five years ago at the height of the real estate bubble.  Since that time they've lost money almost every month and have engaged in some serious cost cutting to try and ride out the recession.  In the last five years they've closed Polyester's nightclub, Lucky's Diner, the celebrity impersonator show, the topless pool on the roof, their steakhouse restaurant and bar,  and most of the live bands that play in the casino.  The impersonator show used to be fun for kids and adults alike.  Now they've got very little in the way of entertainment or dining going on.  

The slot machines used to be among the loosest in Vegas, on my most recent visit I noticed the average payout for a bonus round was about $20.  Yawn.  OK, this is the same story at most of the casinos since the recession hit, but they used to have decent rules blackjack tables with $5 minimums.  On my most recent visit last weekend I was appalled to learn that they now pay 6:5 blackjack on most of their  tables.  They still have a few 3:2 tables, but they have $10 minimums, so of course all the clueless morons flock to the $5 minimum tables with the 6:5 payout.  If you want the 3:2 payout, you'll probably be sitting alone at a table, which I don't like.

On a recent visit I stayed at the Plaza downtown.  Brand new rooms for less that the Stratosphere, the Freemont Street experience and all the entertainment there nightly right outside the front door, and the Golden Nugget right down the street with some of the best blackjack rules in Vegas.  Looks like I'll be spending most of my visits downtown from now on.  So long, Stratosphere.

You get what you pay for, I guess. I thought that I was getting a bargain when I booked a room here for insanely cheap. 

I got to my room and I was pretty disappointed- it was small, the whirlpool tub looked like it had been there since the 80's, and the whole space just seemed...well, old. But let's face it, (most) people don't go to Vegas to spend their time in the hotel room, so it bother me much.

I probably should have done a little more research before booking; the Stratosphere is at the far end of the strip, so girls if you plan on walking to the Vegas club scene, either plan on wearing a pair of flats for the trek or putting some mileage on those high heels.

On the plus side, the view from the top floor of the Stratosphere is breathtaking and the rides on the roof seem like a nice attraction for thrill-seekers.

This Place sucks! Everything their website says they have they don't. I asked for a single room with a king I got a room with two queens. The food is overpriced and mediocre, the revolving restaurant has awful service and the food is served lukewarm and tastes like garlic. I had to pay 12 dollars a day for internet. The pool closes at 7 pm, and the adults-only pool on the 25th floor is closed even though the website and front desk told me in February it would be open in march. The Stratosphere is at the very very end of the strip in a terrible neighborhood so it takes an hour just to get to the middle of the strip. Then there is that pesky 8 dollar resort fee that you must pay for, what's that 8 dollars for the pool closes at 7, there is no continental breakfast, no coin laundry, no comps and only like 4 English speaking non-hotel channels not to mention that you don't even get a damn coffee pot. i hate this place and i'm stuck here until Tuesday.
Like I told those Brits on the bus, it looks a lot nicer than it is.

This place is great when your one a low budget. I paid $29 bucks for a room there, know that I would get the standard room, which cant get any better for a good hotel in Vegas. When I got there, the front desk guy upgraded me to a tower room, which was two upgrades, which was awesome. The 2nd and 3rd time I booked there the same guy upgraded me to a suite. The suite was big, had a living room, dining room, king size bed, walk in closet and a great big bathroom, it had a shower and a jet tub. So after staying there for a few time and only paying $29 for each night, Im totally booking there again.

The hotel has 2 shows, which was great to see, One was Bite(vamps) and the other one was superstar(singing).

2 pool area, level 8 was for anyone that is 21 under\/over and level 25 is an adult pool which clothing was optional and you must be 21 & up.

The tower was amazing, you can see the whole strip at night which was beautiful. There are a couple of rides up there, but they are very scary. You must make reservation to go to the tower restaurant and must try out the stratosphere desert, which was to die for.

1 starbucks, and the lines are crazy long in the mornings.

Valet is free, super awesome

They have a buffet where you pay $25 for all day dining and $19.99 for drinks all day.

Atmosphere was great, everyone is very nice and welcoming.

1 thing that sucked is that the hotel is at the way end of the strip.

So as you're landing at the airport this is one of the first casinos you notice because it's just so darn tall.  It used to be a cool spot for me to check out when I was a child since there are roller coasters at the top.

However, this is an older hotel so they haven't done much renovations.  It's at the far end of the strip so unless you really have to check it out, I would just say skip it.

I stayed here with family November 21-23 and it was awful.

I don't remember how much the rooms were, but it was cheap so I wasn't expecting anything from The Palazzo or anything. But dang this place irritated me. My cousin checked into our room and we're fine with it until we realized how small the counter space was (two girls with that small of a counter just doesn't work). It took about 45 minutes for us to get extra blankets and because we had awful neighbors ( one who almost walked into our room because he was so messed up) we complained and they sent security, but all they did was tell them to keep it down. They were so awful that the hallway reeked of weed the entire time. 

We got "an upgrade" the next day. It was the exact same room with the exact same counter space. We almost fell out of the bath because it was so tall, the vent in there was hanging off, and the room just wouldn't cool down. Takes forever to get anywhere because of how far away it is from anything. I will so not be staying here again.

Rooms are the least impressive and not very clean. We stayed there as a business trip and the company booked there. We were offered to upgrade our room for an extra cost which we did, just to discovered we had exact the same room as the coworkers who did not pay to upgrade. The room smelled like puke so we had to have it wash, hair in the bathtub and dirty bed skirt. But the worst part came after we left the hotel. A computer monitor was forgotten on the room (we had a whole system with multiple monitors and computers), we called about 4:30 and they told us our room wasn't clean and to call in an hour. Iker called before the hour and that office was already closed (close at 5) they told us to call in an hour knowing they would be close. We left a message and receive a call 2 days later (I guess that departments isn't open during the weekend). The lady told us to send an email with the description of the monitor, out photo ID and the name of the person who would pick up. He need to show an iD. We receive a confirmation email back and they say they would I only hold it for 24hrs. (Btw it took hrs for us to get the confirmation email after we send ours). Our contact in vegas showed up with ID to pick up the monitor and the monitor want turned to him because he needed to have a fax\/received... that was never mention to us not on the phone nor on the email. By then the person (of course) in charge of giving that "received" had left. At this point looks like they just don't want to return the monitor. EXTREMELY SKETCHY BAD COSTUMER SERVICE.  I would give minus stars if I could. I just hope we get that monitor back.

Before coming here I was a little nervous because most of the reviews had some very unsettling things to say like: That it was in a horrible neighborhood, that the place smelled like cigarette smoke all over and that the building itself was in poor condition. 

After staying there for six days I can say that it was a lovely experience. We stayed in a Grand Luxory Suite so maybe that had something to do with it but I saw the regular rooms and they were quite spacious and accomidating as well. 

The view is amazing... especially from the tower. You get free enterance when you're a guest at the hotel. 

The staff was efficient and diligent, we ordered room service a couple of times and they came right up. Vallet never had .us waiting (even on the weekend) for more then 6 or 7 minutes. Truly outstanding service on their end. 

The casino is cool... I'm not too much of a gambler but I played the slots a little (how can you come to Vegas and not gamble??) and won a little bit of money, so that was a plus. I didnt eat at the 'Top of the World' restaurant so I cant say how the food\/pricing is but it looked beautiful and the view must be breathtaking at night. 

There is a Fat Tuesdays in the hotel so there are always people walking around with those huge purple tube cups.. its pretty funny. 

All in all I had a great stay here at the Stratosphere. I'd reccomend it to anyone because not only is it a great time but its right between downtown Vegas and the strip. Everything we wanted was a mere 5 minutes away. 

The pool was relaxing and they had a cool D.J. playing party music. I really wanted to go to the topless pool on the 24th floor but with all the sightseeing I never got back in time to go (It closes at 6:00)

Oh and BTW... it is absolutely not in a bad neighborhood. I dont know why anyone would precieve that at all....oh well.

Came here to go to the top of the Stratosphere to look at the beautiful view. $20 is not bad if you are comparing to Seattle space needle or Vancouver BC, harbour lookout. So I went up and was surprised of how beautiful the night view looks. 

Up on the stratosphere top there are rides and these rides are pretty scary and crazy. there is the bungie jump one as well as the elevator ones and one that goes back and forth as if you are going straight down the stratosphere. Very scary.

They also sells food and drinks up on the stratosphere. Its a pretty good atmosphere to eat up there.

I suggest coming here at night because you will get to see more of the pretty light.

I've stayed here several times over the last couple years. 

I can't complain. The rooms are at reasonable rates. If you want a better view, you just have to plan on paying more. The location is great, being right in the middle of everything you can visit the other hotels on the Strip, head out west to the Red Rocks Canyon area for hiking, or southeast to Boulder City. It is also easy to access from the I15 yet far enough north that the traffic that plagues the Strip at all hours usually isn't an issue. 

Given the location, one has to remember that the free stuff (like WiFi) that may go with a Motel 6 elsewhere isn't going to be included. I use my cell phone to tether my iPad. That has always worked well. 

Another thing that I like is the casino level bar will comp drinks with a very low buy in. They are also pretty generous with the comps. Other casinos along the Strip will require a higher buy in, and the drinks are slow in coming.

Great place to stay, clean and friendly. The concierge greets you with a text and you can communicate with them at anytime throughout your stay. The location is good if you want to visit Fremont St. and the Strip, but you will have to drive, not a lot to do around the hotel itself. Would definitely stay again..

I was fortunate enough to stay here on a "FAKE FREE" promotion through "Casa Blanca Vacations." (which they suck btw) It turned out I had to pay a "resort fee" which was about $40. Whatever, that is still a very reasonable price. Just as cheap or cheaper than a roach motel.. Never again did I have to dish out any more money for any "stupidities." I needed to get something faxed to me, sign it and fax it back, and the conciere did it all for me FREE of charge! How awesome is that! (at Kinko's that would've easily been like $10 bucks or so..) Hey, that's two hands of Black Jack right there! Lol.
It being one of the oldest hotels in Vegas, and for the next to nothing price I paid, I did expect the worse. But on the contrary it was pretty well kept. Casino floor, pool, what else can you ask for? 

 http:\/\/m.youtube.com\/watch?v=t6_m_WzKi9g

Went to The Worlds Greatest Rock Show at the Stratosphere last night. Awesome show! So much fun!! Highly recommend it! While a few of the performers weren't as good as others, on a whole, they did a great job impersonating the originals. And the music was on spot!!

The service is great I love that it is open to locals for free even on the Fourth of July. You can tell the water is not heated. So it lost a star for that. But I like most things about it. But some fun new drinks on the menu would be nice for sure!

At 4am this morning my parked car was hit and totaled in a car chase. I have called the hotel 3x to try and cancel my reservations for NYE tonight. I offered my police report, alternate days, they REFUSED to accommodate me in anyway and are charging me $400 for tonight. The manager said it is NYE and they are booked.... Doesn't that mean that they would have no prob booking the room, also that they will be making a ton of $$$ tonight. But still insist on charging me! Poor business acumen stratosphere. I am extremely disappointed and intend NEVER to stay there after feeling like I was robbed today. Lost my car, vaca, and $400.  Happy new year....

Found good prices online for last-minute Vegas trip while in LA over long Memorial weekend to work with a fitness model. Drove rental to Vegas (por fin!) to see that fabled location. Am not a gambler (surviving life challenges is enuff) going just for  area sights, Red Rock Canyon, and night lights. Success in all + walked lots. Reading many hotel reviews, there is more than meets the eye for this hotel.
PROs:
"Great" online prices
at far end of Strip so "quieter"
Free access to Tower for fab views of Vegas 
Free parking
CONs:
NO microwave
NO frig
NO facial tissue
NO hotel room security
NO free wifi
Smoky, smoking tobacco smell everywhere (yuck)

SELF-PARKING is BEST; drive ur car to hotel side (turn 1st LEFT after passing  IHOP), park on 3rd floor where access to the casino is thru a bridge walkway. Once downstairs inside the casino the check-in is located not 4mins from the entrance to the casino. Very stuck-up clerk informed us hotel room rates fluctuate daily (each day) and that the cost for the room I was getting during MY three day stay was over $100. Don't see why as room was NOT very luxurious! After reading a few of the reviews here, expected the worst....  but unfortunately not all was lost. Room was very spacious w\/view fm tower fifth floor of parking garage & roof a\/c units. Particular rooms with a "better view" are offered for extra fee, but spoke to one guest in elevator, and though he paid extra for the view, stated he sees the garage also. Very good water pressure BUT tub wall are very high, and one can slip\/fall getting into the tub\/shower. Thick plastic shower curtain is type seen in hotels decades previous. Be careful! The queen-size beds were very comfortable BUT smoke - even in non-smoking rooms as I had reserved - is still slightly apparent due to the casino below and hotel\/casino guests still smoking though there are areas where smoking is not allowed. Confusing hotel layout puts elevators far from the parking garage entry, but doable though NOT not one luggage cart for hotel guests was seen, nor did I see any hotel employee helping w\/suitcases inside. Also didn't see one room cleaning maid during my 3-day stay, but of course I was gone from dawn to dusk sight-seeing (staying at number of hotels around the world and throughout USA, I have *always* seen cleaners) but not here!! In every hotel I have stayed in, many "luxury" hotels the beds will be turned down at night, and at the very least, the toilet paper in the bathroom will be a fresh room, with a cute fold starting the roll ~ not here! Nice flat-panel tele e BUT ONLY limited channels included 3 hotel channels! Dresser served its purpose better as a support for the television than for clothing: drilled holes on dresser top in my room, plus several of the drawers had loose knobs and dirt inside; looked to be of very thin construction and very old & ill-maintained. Though hair dryer was available in bathroom, several shampoos and soap in the bathroom + iron\/ironing board in "closet" area, there was no security safe nor coffee maker or teas\/coffee available. There was nothing I have had previously in hotels\/motels of less or similar "luxury" status - I've had better service\/room quality in European hostels!! One note of interest is that ALL calls (even local calls) are charged access use "fee", even using a calling card to call home will incur charges! Could easily hear guests next door opening\/closing doors & talking in the hall, but did not hear anything from any rooms at all. Bicycle security guards patrol the various floors of the parking garage, but security for rooms itself seem to be non-existent; nobody checks to ensure ONLY registered guests enter the elevators as on the last two days of my stay, there were external Vegas advertising handouts that were slid into the rooms under the door!! Most of all, I hate the smoking allowed throughout the casino, and as the elevators are located far from the parking garage entry, one must WALK many minutes through the casino to get to the elevators, thus exposing everyone to the tobacco smell. Separate review about the tower observation deck is which great.

if i were you guys i would stay far far away. came her on the weekend of Oct\/18- 0ct\/20. i booked a reservation prio to coming here and paid everything up front. when i checked in the front desk told me that nothing would be taken out of my account. Friday night, i get an alert on my account stating a $100 transaction has posted to my account. called the hotel and they informed me it was a mistake and would release it immediately. bank told me it should be realesed already if not tuesday. Almost 2 weeks later i call back today and tell them i still havnt gotten anything. They dont care. as far as im concerned taking money without authorization is stealing. they try to rip you off. never bak to this hotel AGAINNNNN!!! spare yourself. never had to write  a review but this was absolutely necessary.

Stayed here while we were in town renewing our vows at the Graceland Chapel down the street. Hotel was very clean and nice. The staff was very helpful. The suite was great with a huge tub. The floor we were on seemed to be recently updated.

Main downside is that you're pretty far away from the rest of the action on the strip. You'll end up driving or grabbing a cab if you want to check out the other casinos.

This hotel deserves to have a 4 star because it has nice rooms for very cheap prices. You can enjoy the casino at the first floor and do some shopping at the 2d floor once you are done with the shopping you can go up to the tower which is a great experience I will suggest that go at night that way you can enjoy the brightness beauty of Las Vegas I also recommend you to do the rides they are scary but a unique experience ;)

The stratosphere is the worst casino on the strip!

Let's start with the building, it is old and in disrepair. It is still safe building but the inside and outside are dated and need to be updated. I expected the buffet to be wonderful but when it was all said and done I ate more cold cereal than I did anything else. Not worth the money or your time, you would get better food at a vending machine.

One of the big things that draws people to the stratosphere is the viewing deck and the rise of top however the cost just to get upstairs is astronomical. In less you are going up to ride one of the many amusement rides it is not worth your money.

The only thing that was good at the stratosphere was their show the bite. It had comedy, acrobatic acts, nudity, and magic. It was a pretty neat show other than that stay away from the stratosphere.

Da kann ich leider auch nur zwei Sterne geben. Der Blick vom Turm ist super, leider verstellt ein unbeleuchtetes Hotel völlig den Blick auf die Skyline. Für satte 20$ (5$ wenn man im Hotel gastiert), würde ich es kein zweites Mal machen. Als wir gegen 22:00 Uhr wieder in einen der überfüllten Aufzüge nach unten kamen, waren die Geschäfte dann alle schon geschlossen. Es empfiehlt sich mit dem Auto zu kommen, da sich reichlich seltsame Gestalten um den Turm gruppieren.

I paid up front and was given a total of $203. When we checked in there was an extra $30 daily resort fee. For what, I don't know. The wireless didn't work, pools and fitness center were closed. I argued and lost. So we paid $115 more than we were told. As for the room, I don't know what the pictures on their website are from, but they aren't of this hotel. Extremely misleading. I'm not a princess, but I did expect a newer, at least clean room for what we paid and it was neither of those things. The passes to the tower just gets you up there, like, thanks. Also, when we went to the casino, we were hit up for money multiple times a night. That was a new experience for us and we go to Vegas all the time to see family. My sister in law told us it was in a bad neighborhood and we kinda rolled our eyes about that. We're from Chicago. Those are bad neighborhoods. I had to admit she wasn't totally wrong what with all the panhandling inside of the casino. It's not that we felt unsafe, but it's not something you expect in the type of casino\/hotel the Stratosphere advertised itself to be. We won't stay again. If we want to settle for a casino like that again, we'll just stay downtown and pay much less. I wouldn't recommend this place. We were pretty disappointed.

Could have been 5-stars IF the Wi-Fi were adequate. If cell phones could: text or make\/receive calls! I'm here while my fiance is working. I am 100% unable to message or call him. The internet works in my room only. I don't gamble, no amount of 'blocking' will tempt-me into wasting my money in your casini! 
Make your paying guests comfortable! I'm not returning here because I keep getting lost! 
Wi-Fi is kind of a big deal, huge actually. This review is for us 99% of your dissapointed guests. Way to be inhospitable and create actual problems for your customers!! I always try to make my guests comfortable and the stratosphere should too.

"The definition of a gentleman or a lady is simply someone who goes out of their way, to make sure his guests are comfortable." -Blast From The Past movie

The room is big, clean and new (or remodeled) (Room 24-075), good Vegas view. Great shower. The toilet freaks me out, but works. The lighting in here is either very bright or off. (Bring a colored bulb with you for romance, or just chill lighting). 
Fridge 
NO microwave.
Hairdryer  coffee maker  alarm clock 
Shower: ONLY 2 bath towels (hand towel and washcloth) per ROOMASK for more before going up to your room. 
Ample outlets  
Closet (hangars) 
Beauty products: lotion, shampoo, conditioner, bar soap.
Full length mirror 
'Free' WiFi  (exclusions, blocks & other bs apply) 3 devices only. Room Wi-Fi only, no casino access permitted apparently.
Large screen t.v. 
Sitting area with 1-chair  (a loveseat would fit nicely in here, no romance for me!)
I am unhappy here. I much prefer #AlianteHotel

Not gonna lie - not a place I will ever stay at again.  I bought a "deluxe" room opposed a regular room because of a sale going on.  Paid about $85 a night for a room worth over $200, so it said online.  What a deal - right?  No.  

This room had far less amenities than a $50 a night Days Inn, which I prefer.  Small room, view of parking lot, on the floor of the pool, in which my room must be passed by anyone going there, kicking and screaming as they do all day, starting at 8AM.  No fan in the bathroom to rid it of humidity, disgusting shower curtain that belongs in a prison, shower head that is little better than what you might expect in a prison, the scratchiest TP and tissues in existence, and nothing more than the cheapest hotel soap.    Also - no coffee maker, terrible hair dryer, no microwave, $12 charge for internet for a day, and no mini fridge: these aren't vitals, but adding it all together makes me wonder.

They kept telling me (when I checked in and on the posters hanging around everywhere) that I now have hundreds of dollars in savings because of a coupon book I received.  This is quite  a joke as all the many coupons are 10% off ridiculously expensive purchases.

The noise is terrible.  My first morning I was awoken before sunrise because a woman across the hallway was pounding on the door, repeatedly whisper-shouting, "Danny!  Danny!"  After 10 minutes it stopped.  Ten minutes later it began again with a security guy announcing himself before opening the door for the woman.  Thank God it was over.  New noises began with banging from upstairs and car alarms going off non stop.  Needless to say, I did not sleep well.

On the plus side?  The air conditioning is top notch (no window fan crap here) and the bed sheets are nicer than a typical hotel.  Was this worth it?  NO!  I am very angry I didn't stay at La Quinta, which is cheaper and much, MUCH nicer!

Everything was going fine at first. Nice clean room, ordered room service for breakfast it was alright. we called to have someone pick up the dirty dishes (we called twice) no one ever came to pick it up so we had no choice but leave the dirty dishes in the hallway (unfinished eggs sitting for hours were starting to stink) we called housekeeping again for more towels and new sheets. No one ever came. and then the lights didn't work for about 4 hours I had to pee in the dark. So our second night here the water shuts off around noon. They said it would be about 3 hours before it could be turned on. Something about an "emergency" so everything we had planned and all our reservations\/appointments had to be moved for the next day.. youre better off staying closer to the strip and pay the extra $10-20 for a nicer hotel.

Terrible experience.  The distance from all the good stuff doesnt even have anything to do with my lack of satisfaction here.  The rooms are DISGUSTING!  Staff sucks.   Housekeeping walked in on me.  Water pressure is crap.  I do NOT recommend this to anyone!  Stay clear of this one.  However, the Tower itself is nice to visit :-) HOTEL and SERVICE IS TERRIBLE!

The place is great, but the guests are HORRIBLE! 

I came to the stratosphere for a little vacation time for the weekend. I can not believe how rude the guests\/customers are to the staff working. Not just the casino but within the tower as well. I read these reviews and all I see are complaints about how shitty the employees are. Well let's not be fooled here, the staff is wonderful and they've always been so helpful when I've visited. 

Others don't seem to think so. How do you expect someone to be overly excited about their job when they have FULL GROWN ADULTS  constantly yelling and complaining to them? I wouldn't be nice to you either if you yelled in my face! Screw customer service, you get treated how you treat me! But that's not the case here, the staff are trained to put up with any and every type of situation brought among them. Sure they can't always do something right in that exact instant, but when ever has an issue been taken care of in the snap of your boney ass finger?? 

The rides
- rides are great, I always love going on them they always give me a thrill. I do get the day pass even though sometimes they do shut down for wind. Big deal, weather is weather, guests and employees DO NOT CONTROL THE WEATHER. I wonder if anybody who complains about the weather & rides realizes how ridiculous they sound. Complaining about something you have no control over, give me a break.

The view
- the view is spectacular, I've gotten many panoramas and shots of different parts of the city from above, as stated above I've ridden the thrill rides, one includes big shot which is the highest point of the tower, very nice pictures from up there if I do say so myself, and they do have ride workers who explain where the designated viewing areas are. 

The elevators
- haha ok so I'm not the biggest fan of the elevator myself, but hello, the only other way you're going to get down stairs is the sky jump and god knows I won't mess with that one. Don't complain if the elevator takes too long, it's an ELEVATOR not a mail chute!! It only can go so fast! And yes, it has a capacity! Oh and did I mention there are staff that run the elevators to help MAINTAIN THAT CAPACITY? 10 guests per elevator, that doesn't mean 50+ jam into one, it doesn't work that way, I don't know about anybody else but I would hate to be stuck in an elevator in a tall building all because some idiot customers decided it would be okay so smush 50+ people in to one tiny elevator. 

I always have a great experience when I go to the stratosphere, I always tip when I see an employee struggling, even if they didn't do any service for me, if I see another asshole being rude to them because things didn't go their way, I'll tip just to help them have a better day. Also using kind words instead of cussing and demeaning helps. 

Thank you stratosphere for always providing me with great service, as for others who are more on the rude side, we can only pray for them. Good luck and take care!
Casino is kind of "tight" but the view from the top of the tower is awesome! Highly recommend a tour of the tower at night.

My husband and I stayed here on Thursday and what can I say it was decent for the price. We payed $45 for one night therefore I was not expecting it to be super luxurious. The room was under my husband's name but he was at a conference therefore I asked if I could check in without him. I was expecting them to say no but surprisingly the guy at the front desk was very nice and accommodating and managed to check me in and give me a key to the room without my husband present. It helped that I had the same last name along with the confirmation email for the room. As hotel guests we got unlimited access to the tower which is normally $18 per person. You can have unlimited access for up to four people plus we got 2 for one coupons for the rides. I felt like it was a pretty good value.

one single word: HORRIBLE... We decided to stay only one night on this hotel because my wife would like to see the old part of vegas.. I asked for the new remodeled apartment and I paid an upgrade to be in higher apartments and NON SMOKE... Guess what ? the apartment in fact was NON SMOKE but the HORRIBLE cigarette smells comes from AC making the whole apartment stinks like 50 people smoking inside.. I have allergy to cigarettes and the solution 2AM when we arrive from some shows it was to sleep in MY CAR in the self parking.. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE.. If you are smoker it is ok.. you are not .. dude believe me you will be in trouble...

It was summer 2009.. my 1st time in Vegas.. We stayed in Stratosphere. I like this hotel. Nice rooms, good service and beautiful view. One thing: It's not in the centre and we had to spend a lot of money for the taxi.. my friends stayed in Excalibur and it's worse than Stratosphere. It's a good place, but bad location.

If the Strat maintains it's thrill rides as well as they maintain their casino, I couldn't be physically DRAGGED onto one of those rides!  
What a dirty (and not in the good way I mentioned in my OG review), nasty, smelly casino!
Never seen so many fanny-packs in one place in my life!
Maybe more crazed kids than Circus Circus!
No idea what the rooms are like, and believe me when I tell you I will never find out.
As I attempted to rush Big Jeff out the door, he insisted on sitting down (did I plant my ass next to him? In those filthy chairs? You decide!)  at some penny slot machine just for giggles, immediately hit a $150 jackpot.  Yay!  Enough cab fare to get us far, far away!
Tres bon rapport qualité prix on en a pour son argent avec tout les divertissements. Le menage est bien fait.

Best value for the money. Decent rooms, but a little noisy with doors slamming and people talking in the halls. If you want fancy rooms you may want to go elsewhere. We wanted an inexpensive place to stay with clean rooms and good ratings. We didn't want a fancy high priced hotel, so this was great for our needs. The tower has a great 360 degree view of Vegas too.

If your here in town and have never been to the top and seen the view you really should!  Its easy to do and a easy and fast bus ride to get here from the strip.  The view at any time of the day is spectacular but if you want to see the sunset and the lights of the strip come for the happy hour at the 107 Lounge. Have a few buy one get one free drinks and sit and enjoy the view. Go up to the observation deck from there for free and watch the crazy people jump over the edge or ride the rides, or dare to yourself!  Its a Vegas icon and you really should come take a look.  Why not stop here on the way to or from Fremont Street.

ive stayed here 3 or 4 times now. i really like it. the rooms are very clean and big. i have not had any complaints regarding the room. as for food ive only eaten at the mcds and the diner place. when i stay i usually dont hang out at the casino i go more on the strip as the stratosphere casino area is not all that. when you check in the wait is kind of long. also some of the employess are not that friendly. its not on the strip so the area is a lil shady but it is close to downtown where gambling is cheaper :) i will probably keep on staying at this place every time i go unless i have more money then ill be at the venetian, palazzo or the wynn

When we first arrived, they said we booked a King size bed instead of what we requested which is 2 Queen beds. The receptionist could care less and said she will "reserve a room" for us. She doesn't want to be there and it's written all over her face. After a huge fuss, when we get up to the room, we realized that it's a 2 queen size beds. Basically the receptionist and her computer system is not even accurate. 

The view up on the tower is amazing, day time and night. It's free for hotel guests and the rides are so much fun. For the price of staying in this hotel it's so worth it.

Rooms are decent, clean and just a place to sleep. If you want to party hard inside the room instead of just crashing and showering this is not for you.

The swimming pool is awesome!

Only thing that's kind of annoying is that though it's on the stripe, you can't walk to the main part of the stripe AT ALL. You must take a taxi. Fare to MGM (which is end of the stripe) is around $20. You do the math.

It took a while to check in. The line was pretty long, it was Saturday night and they only had 3 people working on checking people in. I feel like they should have had more people for a Saturday. Finally get a room and was happy to find out our suite was on the top floor. Our room was clean(I was skeptical after I previously read some reviews). I was really unhappy because when I had booked our room, the description said there was an oversized tub in it. There was no tub at all just a shower. Which made me question whether or not I was just in a premier view room(which said no tub).  The door on the bathroom was awful. It was a slider door but poor design. We had trouble shutting and opening it. There was Pepsi and water in the fridge and we had no idea if it was provided by the hotel or left there from a previous person bc there was no sign stating anything about fridge contents. The hotel itself isn't really walking distance to anything so plan on getting a Deuce Bus Pass. Our Wi-Fi didn't work and when asked the front desk they said they didn't know why it wouldn't work and we would have to call tech support to fix it.. I don't know why it would be my job to call Tech support. Walls are pretty thin. The first morning we woke up to some girl crying and yelling at somebody. Could hear every word. Wasn't muffled at all.

This is a generous review and i was debating between 2 and 3 stars. But being that an issue we had at check out (which was caused by them) was resolved, i went with three. Where to start? We the rooms themselves are ok. We had the newly renovated and higer floor room. The view of course is great (21st floor). No amenities whatsoever. No refrigerator, no drinks, no water, no wifi even though we were supposed to have it and it was included. It's there, but doesnt work and only frustrates you. We couldnt get it on the laptop, on 2 mobile phones (worked on one for a day), or on thr camera to transfer photos. Just aggregating and don't expect much help. Anything and everything is an extra charge. Almost anything decent on tv requires more money (whats included overall does not compare to other hotels, borgata in atlantic city for example blows this place away without contest). Water\/tea\/coffee, have to purchase. Room service is expensive. Small breakfast for two with a pitcher of tea ran upwards of $50 for not much at all. Maid doesnt take the food away, you will come back to it unless you take it out of the room and leave it outside on the hallway. The bed sheets, although the bed was made every day, were actually changed only once during a 6 night stay. Other than a place to stay and sleep, this aspect of the stratosphere leaves much to be desired. Before we could even check in they jump on you whem they see you are walking in with luggage and try to solicit packages and services which seemed annoying and not very professional to do in such a manner.

The casino is relatively small and relatively empty. Some places at times get busy but it is more of a walk through and play while waiting for someone than an actual casine. Though there are a few bars with music and tvs there. The breakfast diner is average at best and the buffet is pretty good. Location is the northernmost part of the strip and you liekly wont walk from there to the main parts (mgm grand, mandalay bay, billagio, etc), but honestly everything on the strip is cabs, cabs, cabs. Each place has a constantly moving taxi line and you almost never wait. 

The top of the world restaurant is amazing. It should and will get its own review and its calculation is what raises this to 3 stars. The food is good, not grrat like in SW Steakhouse for example, but very good nonetheless. A respectable fillet mignon, tasty everything else, and (unlike elsewhere at the stratosphere) great service. But the atmosphere and the view make this a must visit. Especially at night time when the restaurant and the outside are dark, the view of the city lights below is amazing. The top slowly  rotates and you get to observe the full 360 degree view of the bright lights. Especially beautiful are the south and north parts as you pass them. Prices are what you would expect such a steakhouse to have and not at all bad in comparison. From time to time you will witness a bungee jumper unexpectedly fly by outside the window. This place gets 5 stars. 

There is a shopping area for those who like that, though we just walked through it once and cant really comment much on it. There were a couple of shows playing there but we did not attend. Their attractions are one of a kind with the roller coasters and all that at the very top, but we didn't get a chance to go there so i cannot comment on that as well. But for those into such things i would inagine it's quiet an experience and view. 

Checking out didnt happen wihtout issues and them trying to,  you guessed it, charge you more for something unexpected via a way of their error. Wanting an express checkout we couldn't get it due to some balance we supposedly had. Standing in line downstairs to deal with it, the guy asking people on line if he can be of quick help was surprisingly rude. And the person at the desk was hesitant to fix the issie though eventually she did. 

There are two pools both of which are on roof tops. Neither have deep ends, both serve drinks and at least one serves food. No complaints as far as those go.

In summary, from people who are low maintenance and do not complain much, this is only good if you're on a budget but still want to stay at a big hotel and casino. It is no "luxury" hotel that's for sure. As mentioned it leaves much to be desired and caused more aggrevation than it should have. It is very unlikely that we would stay there again even if they beat the price of the others.

This hotel is ok, you can't really beat the value.  Several things:

Pros:

Rates are very reasonable, even after adding the resort fees.  Expect around $100+ for weekends and half of that on weekdays.

They did a good job with the renovated select rooms, be sure to pick this out, well worth the upgrade.

Although it's off on the far north side of the Strip, you have very easy access to the I-15 via Sahara, close to Downtown and Chinatown.

Cons:

If you are a light sleeper, be warned!!!  If you get placed in the rooms facing the I-15, you will hear the the railroad horns late at night.  After playing poker all day, I was too tired to notice but that's me.

The neighborhood is let's say, least to be desired.

The select room was good, I would guess that the older rooms would not meet your expectations.

The lines are long at the front desk and moves slowly.  Have to give credit at least the staff was friendly.

Be sure to review your bill, they tried to pull a quick one on me by doubling the resort fee.  I had to call the Accounting Dept and get it cleared.  They didn't believe me until they had to look at the bill one more time and had to explain what I'm seeing.  Looking at the other reviews, this seems to be a distributing pattern.

If i could give no star I would most definitely give no stars ... This is our last stay at stratosphere hotel .... Every year for 2 straight years I have had problems with this hotel .... I usually do my review after my visit but I'm so disgusted by this place I have to do a review now .... First night ... Go to brush my teeth and the sink gets clogged . Tried to call the front desk but the phone didn't work .... Air conditioner goes in and out ... Bathroom is dirty .... And then I called athe house keeping to get the room cleaned at 12pm came back that night at 11pm room still dirty .... Spoke with someone in housekeeping who said a manager would call us back . Then valet at night is horrible .... I waited x15 minutes for someone to park my vehicle . There was a worker that had the worst attitude ( I think his name was romal) the air conditioning vent was so dirty my kids kept sneezing . The bathroom was dirty with dust everywhere.....I will definitely not come back to this establishment anymore . This is my 3rd year staying here and for 2 years back to back there has been so many issues .... I'll just find another hotel for my kids and I on our family vacation .....

I wanted to share my HORRIBLE experience checking into the Stratosphere today.. we arrived around noon and asked if there was early check in avail.and was interested in a view facing the strip. I paid the upgrade and was told the room was not available yet but in hour or so I would get a text to let us know.  No text , so after the hour and half passed I went to desk and was told would not be available until 3 at the normal check in time. I was not feeling well and wanted to take a nap before going to Criss Angels show but was ok with 3 check in time and was told I'd have view facing the strip. At 3 I got the keys and was surprised when my room was facing the back and had parking garage roof view. I went back to see Cesar and he said that the person who gave me keys checked us into a regular room on lower floor! This was not an upgraded room and he said he had an even better upgrade for us but not until 5or 6.. I said ok but I'm leaving for a show and wouldn't be back until 10 or 11.. he did refund me for upgrade and said he reserved it and it could not be taken! I left for the show and came back at 10 to pick up the keys. The girl at desk told me I didn't come by 7 so they gave the room away and hotel was sold out so there was nothing she could do! I told her what happened and that I specifically asked if 10 was ok to come back and was assured it was fine. I asked her if she could compensate me in some way for my inconvenience but was told she couldn't do anything and that I was already compensated for upgrade charge.. something I paid extra for but didn't get! I asked to speak to highest manager available and Laura came to me and I explained everything. She seemed like she didn't believe me but my family told her also what had happened! She said I didn't come in time! She didn't care and was very abrupt telling me there's nothing she could do for me. She was not apologetic and told me to have a good night and walked away. I asked for her highest manager and she told me she was the only manager there tonight and told me I would have to speak to someone tomorrow. I asked for her managers name and she told me Laura and I asked for the phone number and she handed me the brochure with the number at the bottom and I asked her  what was her name and she said her name was Laura and I said I thought your managers name was Laura and she said no her name is Hayley but this is the worst customer service I've ever counted in Vegas and honestly the place is terrible too.! The neighborhood is shady too at night. Oh and I did tip Cesar also in the beginning and still get the worst experience ever at a hotel in Vegas! Don't waste your time or money going to the stratosphere you will be very disappointed! It should have a zero in front of the numbers!

This place is horrible!!  Sink backed up and black mold on the shower curtain!  I called and they fixed the sink but left the mold so I could feel like home in the ghetto!

Be warned... Stay at your own risk!

There is a reason why this hotel is so cheap. It was my first time in Vegas, and I wanted to stay somewhere affordable for a couple nights while waiting for my friends to fly in. I chose Stratosphere based on the price and supposed "3-star" rating. This hotel is definitely 2-stars. 

ROOM:
I was not expecting much when I walked in, but I was floored by the drabbiness of the room and bathrooms. There was not even any hand soap in the bathroom. Also, there was no fresh air in the room. It was completely stagnant, so much so that by the second night I had some minor congestion problems, and this has never happened to me before. 

I spent a great deal of time in the hotel room working. Wi-Fi was alright, but there is no office set-up per se. There is a dirty round table and a chair which I re-purposed to be my office. I had to wipe the table down and I moved it in front of the tiny window which was the size of a cruise ship port hole window.  Surprisingly, it offered a somewhat decent view of the Red Rock Canyon. 

LOCATION:
As for location, this hotel is located at the total north end of the strip away from all of the action. You would definitely need to cab or bus down to the central part of the strip during mid-day due to hot temperatures. More significantly, this area is very poor. I had no idea since I was new, but it did not take me long to find out. I would walk along the street during broad daylight and was honked at.
